The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.     They are very careful with social distancing and we felt completely safe riding the train.  I spoke with a couple of families that had young children and they loved it!   All in all, I would recommend it as a very enjoyable way to spend the day.

reviews.author: Peter D.
reviews.description: I rode the Sunset Express on 5-29-21 with my family, while on a trip to visit Austin. I'm from Southern California (this is important later). The scenery was certainly nice in some spots, but not enough. The sunset was awesome, but the experience wasn't that great. We paid for first class and rode aboard Eagle Cliff. Some basic drinks and snacks were provided, but the train was understaffed. No attendant for our car. One very sweet elderly volunteer was doing her best to handle two cars at once. I decided to offer to help, which she was very appreciative of. She said it was great that I wanted to help and so I did. I helped stock drinks and snacks as well as stocked ice to keep the drinks cold. Later on, a female volunteer who looked to be in her 40s came up to the counter said "Sir, you cannot be back there, what do you need?" I explained the situation, and she kind of had an attitude. I was informed in a rude tone that I had to be a member to help, and was given no thank you. Being that I live in Southern California, there's no way I could really be a member. While all this was happening, the AC in the car was doing a very poor job at keeping the car cold. It was unbearably hot in there, and everyone in the car was complaining. The excuse given was that the car is vintage and has a lot of runtime. The car was very original, and you could tell. That roughly translates to "we don't have the money or people to keep this car in tip top shape, and we don't have the money to upgrade it".  Eventually, my family was re-seated to the Rippling Stream. That was much better, but it didn't change the overall experience. Cherry on top was we were over an hour late returning to the Cedar Park station.   Not worth the money.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: We also did the Xmas Polar Express train ride. Tickets were about $50 each. We also went with a friend and their kids too.   I'll give this train ride 4 stars. The kids were excited to see Santa and the ride was slow at times.   To start, one of the first things was a balloon guy. Ours was awesome. He was funny and overall entertaining. He had me laughing my @ss off.   Next came hot chocolate... it's hot chocolate.   After that was, singing Christmas Carols. They had 2 girls from McNeil high school. I felt sorry for them. They were nice, but they couldn't just get our car interested in singing.  A few of us sang, but overall it was a failure. I'm sure adult beverages if allowed/served would help the spirit. Great job to them but our car was mostly interested. It probably didn't help that they gave us a cookie just before they arrived so everyone was stuffing their face.   After that was story time, the lady reading the Story was animated and funny. Kudos to her.   She visited just before Santa.   Then Santa came. We were in one of the last cars so his visit was a bit rushed. He was nice and gave everyone a wooden train whistle.   ***********The entire operation is run by volunteers. So I'd like to thank all of them for their time!*******  This was he first time my son was not afraid of Santa:-)

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: This was a great little adventure from Cedar Park to Burnet Texas. Super We stayed in the Turquoise Room, which consisted of 2 tables, 8 chairs and two smaller windows. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable...Once the train started the conductor came in to room to announce that there we several open seats in the main car...everyone got up and left leaving the wife and I in peace...Not that we are anti social, but it was peaceful to say the least...Good to catch up with each other, as we both work different hours...Truly not much to see on the way up...but it was a great ride....AC did work, not great but tolerable...I see in other reviews there were issues...You have freedom to roam Car to Car once the train gets rolling...and the train does turn around in Burnet...hard to explain, but it does...and we were able to see the other side of the tracks on the way home...Plenty to see and eat in Burnet...Our Car/cabin also came with free snacks and drinks...which is a great perk..as the snacks in the concession stand were quit expensive...The trip was worth it for us and will do it again next year with the granddaughter..

reviews.author: Liz I.
reviews.description: This review is based on my customer service experience with Zena, not the train ride itself (although I may come back and give an update!)  Zena is a lifesaver. Not literally, but she has made my train experience 2x as good. I bought a Groupon because I didn't even realize there was a train experience in Austin. After the headache of scheduling, our trip got canceled. Zena came in to save the day. She mailed me another gift certificate that expired in a year (vs the next week per my Groupon) AND she gifted us a little extra!  Sounds great, right? Unfortunately, the GC could not be redeemed online. After multiple tries of calling in (and getting a forever ring - no pick up), I was getting irritated.   I emailed Zena back asking for her advice. She wrote back in 24 hours and apologized for their phone service. She even offered to reserve me herself. After a few back-and-forth emails, she answered all my questions and got us all squared away.  Our train ride happens this weekend and I can only hope that the experience is similar to Zena's customer service.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: It's such an adorable idea - volunteers running a historic train line on weekends to give people an authentic experience. But the train is slow - really really slow. The view is simple and unmemorable. The FandB in the first class is simply a cinnamon roll and lemon cake with tea. They do have apples and oranges as well. The trip back was painful - we stood in the concession cart the entire time because the A/Cs didn't work and it was triple-digit hot on a September Saturday. Even my 5-year-old nephew, who is obsessed with trains and knows all there is to know about them, wasn't engaged in this ride much. Thankfully, we had carried board games and our own food so the ride to Burnet was okay but the ride back was really terrible.

reviews.author: James A.
reviews.description: I organized a group from Meetup.com to try this excursion and it was fun!  It's a laid-back trip to the Hill Country. My friends and I were in an Adults-Only car, the Rippling Stream, and we had a great time with each other and looking at the scenery.  I highly recommend this trip!

reviews.author: Katherine V.
reviews.description: The most horrible rip off of an experience I have ever had. I bought 4 tickets for the VIP lounge which included treats and drinks and a nicer car, it was none of those things. The food offered were store bought generic cookies and the drinks were either warm apple juice or water. The car lost the A.C. capacity on the return from the small town with nothing to offer and did not even have the gun fight reenactment due to the extreme heat, now imagine that extreme heat inside a metal sardine box. I invited my 72 year old father and I was genuinely worried we would have to rush him to the emergency room upon arrival. I chewed the place out for their false advertisement and putting the elderly and children at risk in the extreme heat without AC.   In summation, do not buy tickets to any of the events this was a horrible experience. I got my money almost a month later, and I will never return and I will warn anyone thinking about ever going to one of these fiascos.

reviews.author: Tim H.
reviews.description: As recent residents to the Austin area our 15 y/o son wanted to experience a classic train. We fortunately found the Austin Steam Train Association. We booked tickets on the Sunset Express trip. The Staff was all very friendly and knowledgeable.   You are able to bring your own drinks (non alcoholic) and snacks which is a plus. They do have a concessions car which is nice.   To us the trip was not as much about the scenery as it was the experience of a mode of travel long since gone.

reviews.author: Umeko V.
reviews.description: If you are going to the BlueBonnet festival, this is the way to go. Sit back, relax and enjoy the scenery, and when you get to the festival, no looking for parking.  Just jump off the train, and there you are.  Each train car has it's own characteristics, but take my word, spend the extra money for the air conditioned cars.  We had a chance to walk through the other cars, and even on a beautiful spring day, you can tell a big difference walking into the cars without A/C.  We rode on the City of Chicago, in a table for two, which had great views.  There was complimentary water, tea and snacks on our car.  The volunteer, Barbara, was informative about the train, wildflowers, and announced points of interest on the route.

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: My family and I took a ride on the Hill Country Flyer and this a brief overview of our experience and I recommend you heed this review well.  ----------------------------  I visited and rode the September 7th 10:00 am to 5:00 pm ride to Burnett going out of Cedar Park Wirth the Austin Steam Train Association and I'd like to share my experience that day.   To begin the train left 20 minutes late from the terminal when it was communicated the train would be leaving promptly and on time consistently. Which is fine although it did negatively impact the quality of time spent in Burnett and exploring the town which was a key experience in the advertised outing. Another large disappointment was the lack of the advertised western gun fight. We saw no mention of it, nor display of it. Apparently that was another misrepresentation of the trip. It was advertised we would have two hours to explore downtown Burnett and have lunch. This was barely enough time to visit a local restaurant flooding with business from both local lunchtime and other passengers. With barely an hour in Burnett without enough time to eat we actually had to leave the restaurant we were at in a manic frenzy without eating, apologize to the staff at the restaurant for our rush due to this,and return to the train. Then upon returning at the specified time we still not even begin the process of departing until nearly 30 minutes past the time we were told to return! The. On the return trip we didn't even get above 10 mph on the speed making for a grueling and arduous journey back creating an atmosphere on complete misery on the entire train. On top of all of that the trains expected time to return was 5:00 we did not return until after 5:30! This is insane it officially help derail our entire vacation plan and helped out more of a strain on our time off. Meaning we had to rush and adjust our original plans.   Another issue with the experience was there little to no a/c in rear car named Rippling Stream on a day with temperatures rising above 95 degrees! Although the next car over had perfect a/c with a lower priced ticket. Paying for six tickets @55 dollars to sit in the heat in pool of our own sweat was not the idea of a luxury car provided by marketing materials. We actually had to use the pamphlets provided to make fans in order to be comfortable during the ride and continuously go into the other cars for refuge from the sweltering heat. Upon informing staff of the issue we were told once the train is moving we can go to other cars and stand in the cool air to gain some reprise from the heat.This is insane as we bought out the entire private room to have a bonding family experience we certainly were unable to enjoy. Also this car represented itself as a purchase of an adults only car ticket and children were running through the car. We wanted an experience that would supply with a relaxing adult atmosphere that was negatively impacted by this not being enforced.   Another major concern of mine is lack of communication from staff with the private areas of the train. Announcements regarding safety, departure time, arrival, landmarks etc were unheard in the private room and no effort was made by train personnel to inform us of anything. We were left alone with no information about anything given without having to seek out an attendant regularly. To mention with sound there was also an almost constant excessively loud screeching noise as we moved along at a slugs pace that I feel each passenger will hear in their nightmares of this ride for years to come.   This experience wound up being more stressful due to the previously mentioned circumstances causing our trip to be unenjoyable. Due to the dishonest representation of a truly climate controlled car, and times for departure misrepresented. Unfortunately this is not an outing that we would attended again or recommend to others visiting the Austin/Hill Country area. This is not something we would recommend for anyone trying to relax or enjoy a vacation.

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine was a fun experience for my husband and I. As I was reading some of the other reviews, I learned that you could make your own wine. I called ahead to see if there were any open appointments on a Friday afternoon and Jenny answered. She has a very fun, bubbly personality and told us to swing by anytime. We were able to taste several different wines before we decided what we wanted to make. We spent about 1-1.5 hours there. We look forward to designing our own wine bottle labels and returning in 6-8 weeks to bottle the wine.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place. The owner, Jenny, is the best. She's fun, friendly, thoughtful. All the staff are wonderful.   I've made many batches of wine here. The wine making process is really fun from tasting and selecting the wine you want, to making it and, the  funnest part, bottling. You can customize your wine label and they print it for you to put on the bottles.   You can bring your own snacks and get a bottle to enjoy.   I would highly recommend everyone to try making a batch of wine at water to wine. They make great Xmas gifts too.

reviews.author: Neshia R.
reviews.description: Let's start with how cute this place is! I walked in and felt like I had been invited into someone's home the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable im from out of town and im so glad I made the stop here  before heading home! Ambience is nice 3 free wine tasting and the bottle prices are extremely reasonable and you can make your own wine. If you're looking for a place with a good vibe where everyone feels like family this is the place will return every time im in Austin!!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is perfect for so many occasions... date night, girls night, happy hour, a pop-in for a glass of wine, or a night of wine making/bottling with friends. We were sad when the Round Rock location closed down, but found this place to be a million times better. The decor is cute and thematic, with tons of inviting spots for seating, whether you're looking for a romantic spot for two, or some couches for a larger gathering. The best part is the staff - super friendly and helpful while we try to make the tough decision of what to drink or take home. The free samples help too!   Making our own batch of wine is a yearly tradition for us. We get together with friends to start the wine (which of course involves a good time trying the different wines first), design our own labels (or get help from W2W), throw a gathering to bottle the wine, then have bottles to hand out as wedding favors, Christmas gifts, or generic gifts.   We are club members, so we stop by at least monthly for a couple glasses of wine and to pick up our bottles to enjoy at home. Whether you're joining wine club, making a batch, or just stopping in for a glass or two, Water 2 Wine is a fantastic neighborhood gem. I only wish they were in my neighborhood!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is best described (at least as they themselves put it) as 'Build-a-Bear for Adults'!    I visited this establishment thinking it was a simple wine tasting spot.  Actually, they also provide services as your own personal vintner and label maker, where you can taste, create, and label your own wine!  While I have yet to try this full service out, the staff was very friendly, the wine (tried the whites only) was excellent, and you can palpably feel how fun the process is.  Definitely coming back to celebrate good times with a custom-made wine!

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: Ok, but why is this place SO cute?!  I went here for a wine tasting years ago with a girlfriend and as a fun catch up, we decided to meet back here.  What a fun tradition we want to continue!  The staff here is outstanding, they have great thought, and make you feel comfortable.  We had some neighbors at a different table order food in and  thought that was hilariously brilliant!  You are definitely recommended to buy a bottle as all winery's usually do, but this spot doesn't make you feel pushed to - which makes me want to buy another bottle.  I love that this is tucked away in the city and you don't have to go to the city limits to do a wine tasting.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to any and all of you!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Came here with friends who decided they wanted a wine baby and we tagged along to help them taste wines. It is a very laid-back tasting room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and tasting is free. You can even make your own wine, which is exactly what we tagged along to do and that gets you 28-30 bottles. Highly recommend this place - Cheri and Jenny are so knowledgeable and make the whole process so easy and fun!  Only downside, no Texas wines... but this isn't necessarily a con -  all their wines are made on-site with grapes from various vineyards.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: The wine they make is so tasty. They let you have three samples so that you can find the wine you would enjoy.  When I come here I always take home a bottle.  The staff is veery knowledgeable and friendly.  They also do custom labels if you buy I case I believe.

reviews.author: Maria G.
reviews.description: What a lovely place to sip some wine and worth doing the wine club membership if you like wine in the slightest even.  The staff are awesome. They make excellent suggestions whether you know what you're looking for or not. They can get you going in the right direction.  Sulfite free wine? Is my understanding. I don't know a lot about wine, but know that's a good thing to be free of. I can say the ports and fruity wines are a good dessert. My family and friends love the other wines.

reviews.author: Natasha C.
reviews.description: I just love this place !! They are so friendly and even if you are new they treat you like family. The wine is good and the cheese platter is huge ! One of my absolute favorite places I've discovered since moving to Austin !

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Went in not knowing what to expect from the store front but was pleasantly surprised. Personable and knowledgeable stuff and many wines to try! Your first 3 wine tastings are free and then a dollar per tasting after that. Additionally you can make you own wine which is a unique experience!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: If you are a young couple, or an old couple, or an odd couple, and you decide you want a wine baby, you may be a bit worried about where, when and how to do that.  It's a big step and you should have nothing but the best for your Vino Bambino, so please look no further than Water 2 Wine, and Jenny in particular.  She is the BEST midwife for your wine labor.    We just had the best experience making, bottling and labeling our wine baby.  It was smoooooth sailing and immediately made me want another :)  When you decide to make your own wine, first, you'll get to sample the wines, ALL of them if you so wish.  I spent two afternoons sampling bunches of them and all the staff were generous and enthusiastic in helping me find which wine I wanted.  Then, you make an appt for conception.  It's fairly simple  and pleasurable.  Again, you can grab a glass of wine as you work, mixing the juice and water and yeast in a giant white bucket (Carboy), churning away for about 10 minutes and then your part is done for about 6 weeks!  The rest of the staff will ensure that your baby gestates comfortably and appropriately, testing its ph and sugars until its ready to be born.  Then the magic happens.  As the parent, you'll have full creativity in naming your baby.  In which case, you can pick any 3 images you like, decide the wording and color scheme and font of the label, email all that to Jenny and she'll print out the most perfect labels.  You can then invite a bunch of friends to witness and help in the birthing.  You can bring in all kinds of snack ems and the fine ladies at Water 2 Wine will immediately ply your guests with tastings of their wine and you can buy bottles (and bottles) to facilitate in the birthing process.  Everyone in your party can try their hand at filling bottles, corking bottles, melting the lid foils, and sticking on labels.  In the end, you'll have about 30 bottles of fantastic wine ( I recommend the Gruner!) to share and take home.    They make for fantastic house warming, business, wedding, new baby, Christmas, Hanukkah, etc gifts.  In fact, if you decide last minute you'd like to adopt a wine baby for Christmas, they keep a bunch already made and ready to label for your Christmas party or gifts.    Best thing was, our friends had so much fun and it was such a new experience for all of us that we WIN again as the hostess with the mostest.  And, even though I had grand plans of using this wine at our housewarming party, I doubt it'll last another 8-10 months so we may indeed make another baby next year.    Jenny and the rest of the staff really made this so much fun and interesting with all their cool contraptions and accomodated me with the music I wanted (got to have appropriate Edith Piaf wine birthing music!) and never left a wine glass dry in my group.    So grab your partner, in life, in business, in crime, and get to makin that baby! They're the best kind of babies, they don't puke or shit or cry and instead of causing you stress, they relieve it.  And in the end you'll have the coolest collectible bottles.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love this place! My husband and I come regularly, and  from the minute we walk in the door, it feels like we're visiting old friends. Jenny, Dustin and Cheri are knowledgeable, friendly and so much fun. Every visit is a good visit.

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: Jenny was fantastic! First time here and we had a great time. Wine was amazing and the service was incredible.  Between my in laws and my husband we took a a few bottles home with us. We will be back for sure and would love a Cedar Park location!

reviews.author: Robert W.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great place to stop for a glass of wine and taste a few more after a long day of work!

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.description: Visited Water2Wine for my birthday this past December. LOVED IT! Cute, cute tasting room with tons of puzzles and activities, plus adorable furnishings. The menu was huge and the options would suit almost every taste. You can also print out custom labels for your bottles! TONS of fun for a big group, or an intimate outing. You can also bring your own appetizers to come sit and enjoy while tasting some delicious wines.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine has taken your normal wine drinking experience and given it a unique spin by providing you the keys to the winery and letting you become the vintner. You make your own batch of wine, create custom labels, bottle it, and best of all, taste the fruits of your labor. By having you do this work on site they are able circumvent certain regulations resulting in less sulfites and other chemicals than store bought wines.  I have been visiting Water 2 Wine for about five years and actually created a batch with my wife and we gave the custom bottles of wine away as gifts at our wedding. The gifts were a hit.   Water 2 Wine imports their grapes and juices from other vineyards. This is not uncommon for vineyards in Texas as most don't grow enough grapes, if any, to meet their own demand. When you decide to make a batch this is where you will start. You will mix the juice, and depending on the type of wine you are making will add flavors like oak.  After you make the wine it will go in the back room for fermentation where the staff will guide the wine along over the next six to eight weeks changing containers around six times.  About two months later you will come back and bottle your wine. You add your label, fill the bottle, cork it and shrink wrap foil around the top. Like a good chef test tasting food a lot of quality assurance goes on during this process. This is a perfect event to bring along a group of friends. Hopefully you end up bottling more wine than you drink.   You don't have to make wine. Water 2 Wine is also a spacious wine bar, with a large selection of wine, where you can stop in just to drink some wine. All of the wine is made on site by the employees. They don't sell food but you are welcome to bring in food to eat with your wine. There are plenty of tasting options or you can buy by the glass or bottle. The staff is very friendly and have been one of my favorite aspects of every visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Very friendly, exuberant staff.....check. Interesting concept (make your own wine!) and fun factor....sure, check. Free wine tasting (5 tastes offered).....check. Their "ready made" wines.....uh well, let's just say I do not believe you can make decent wine out of water; and from the wines I sampled it seems that's just what they are trying to do.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Attended a fun wine pairing class (groupon deal) -- a great time and highly recommended! I have an alcohol allergy (it's an Asian thing! ;-), so it's awesome to learn about and try some low sulfite wines. I'm not really a fan of wine (or alcoholic beverages in general) for obvious reasons, but if I were, I'd buy it all here! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Carie H.
reviews.description: The team at W2W knows their stuff. I'm only disappointed I didn't visit here earlier in life. The crew is helpful, knowledgeable and always friendly.   Whether it's a glass of vino after work, a place to gather on weekends with friends or a fun place to work remote during the week W2W has it all.   I always thought you could only make wine here and was surprised to learn it's also a wine bar and retail destination.   Stop by and challenge the team to find you the perfect glass- they won't disappoint.

reviews.author: Jackson J.
reviews.description: There bus was great the driver was even better and we had a all around great time I highly recccomend this company if you are looking for a party.

reviews.author: William O.
reviews.description: Complete waste of money. To start they were over a half hour late. Then when they finally arrived the bus was dirty, falling apart and no A/C so it felt like we were in a sauna the whole time. Go somewhere else... anywhere else.

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend Austin Party Bus if you're looking for a party bus in Austin! Our group rented the 18 passenger bus for 13 people so we'd have a little extra space. Bus was on time and communication before hand was clear. Bus was clean and they had water and ice available when we got on.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: We rented from these guys for a Bachelor Party and they were absolutely wonderful. It was a last-minute decision to book a bus so we ended up having two drivers, because they had to scheduled something at the last minute, and both were entirely friendly, professional and helpful. We wanted to find a bar with a mechanical bull and they helped us track one down. There communication was perfect, it was always easy to reach them and they were super flexible at the end of the night, allowing us to extend our trip for as many hours as we wanted for an hourly rate. In the end we only stayed out another hour, and they gave us the extra hour for free. Also, because it was a late booking, they offered us their 25 person bus for the 20 person bus rate.  The sound system was enough to give everyone permanent hearing loss and the dancing pole and hand holds proved to be incredibly robust and secure!  These guys are AWESOME, and I would DEFINITELY book from them again in a heartbeat.

reviews.author: Candyce W.
reviews.description: I booked this company for a surprise birthday celebration and I am so happy I did! Diana helped coordinate the stops and was patient in answering all my questions regarding planning. Kathy, the driver, was so sweet, great with communication, and being on time picking us up and dropping us off. The bus was super nice and everyone had a blast! I would recommend this company to anyone!

reviews.author: Philiph S.
reviews.description: My gf booked this bus for my birthday and we had an amazing time. The bus had great amenities and the driver was awesome! The kicker subwoofer and sound system was incredible. We had a blast and will definitely use this company again!!

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: THESE GUYS ARE AWESOME! The bus arrived 15 minutes early and Peter answered all my questions every time I called. My bus driver was great and kept in touch with me through out the night. And, the bus was great! Good stereo system, cool lighting, and lots of ice and cups and all that good stuff. I will definitely be using these guys again for my next big event! They made my 22nd birthday a huge success (they did all of this on Halloween night!).

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Do not book with this Bus Company. They are a scam. We booked a bus and they never showed up. They have terrible communication for THEIR mistakes! Very disappointing and terrible service. Christopher is extremely rude and unprofessional. Do not waste your money or your time. If I could give them 0 stars I would.

reviews.author: Gillian G.
reviews.description: This company WILL rip you off. Terrible costumer service and refuses to give refunds for a bus that never showed up. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE. I would give 0 stars if I could. Just horrible.

reviews.author: Brooke D.
reviews.description: SO MUCH FUN! Our group requested a bus for a river float birthday party! Our driver was extremely nice and funny. He actually gave us his cell number to call at anytime for pickup. We were able to dance and play music as loud as we wanted! The cooler was filled with tons of water and ice. They had Vegas style lights and a dance pole. It was so much fun that I will be booking for my bachelorette party!

reviews.author: randy e.
reviews.description: Terrible communications.  I sent in a request for more info but they never contacted me.  I replied to the email requesting a Yelp review with me telling me them that they never responded to my inquiry and that they didn't want me to post a review.  Now I've received two more requests to review them, so here's their review.

reviews.author: Annessa A.
reviews.description: We took a party bus this weekend to San Marcos for a river float and I am just blown away by how great this company was! Our driver was so accommodating and great. The bus itself was roomy and nice. They also provided ice, cups and water for the bus ride. Overall - everyone in my party was extremely pleased with our trip and experience with Austin Party Bus. We will definitely be using this company again next time we are in Austin! Thanks for making our Labor Day weekend an unforgettable one!

reviews.author: Vanessa M.
reviews.description: DO NOT hire this bus company. They will rip you off. Christopher needs to learn how to run a business and he needs to learn about customer service. He took our money and left us stranded because he never showed up to pick us up. Completely unprofessional and rude!

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I called this business to inquire about a party bus rental. When I started to ask general questions, the man on the phone (unfortunately I did not get his name), kept telling me to refer to the website. When i asked him if he could please tell me his thoughts on how long the bus was needed for, etc over the phone because it was easier for me to do as I could not look at my phone at the time, he very rudely said "I just don't understand why you can't just look this up on our website."   I do not think it is too much to ask to provide basic information over the phone, and the snarky, rude comment was completely uncalled for and one of the more unprofessional customer service experiences I have had. Needless to say, I will not be using Austin Party Bus for my transportation.

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Booked a limo bus to take 23 people to float the Guadalupe River in New Braunfels, six hours round trip.    Bus: The rate was so much better than every other place I found that I worried the bus would be shabby.  Not so.  Bench-style limo seating, hardwood floors, good sound system, and a pole for dancing.  My birthday guests were all impressed.   Service: Our driver Mike quickly answered every question I had in the weeks leading up to the event (and I had a lot).  He gave us an excellent rate, arrived on time, and was very polite and accommodating.  We were a loud, rowdy birthday crew, but he never seemed to mind.  The first toob place we visited was sold out, so he called another and even got us a group rate!    Overall: Very happy, no complaints.  I plan a few different party buses every year, and I will be using Sixth Street Rides from now on.

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: My last memory of this bus involved a loud rendition of Wilson Phillips "Hold On" while grow-ups swung around the "dance pole." Indeed, this party bus was an excellent party on wheels.

reviews.author: Ari E.
reviews.description: I haven't even used the bus yet, but I've already had an excellent experience in customer service. Mike was incredibly accommodating for me and my group! I'll update my review in a few days once we actually use the bus, but I can definitely speak on the customer service being on point.

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: We purchased a MooLaLa deal for a 5hr wine tour from Sixth Street Rides for up to 15 people.  The deal was supposed to end before we were able to get the group together but Sixth Street Rides was very accommodating on extending our deal to March (2 months after the deal was supposed to expire).  Mike handled our requests including moving the date and giving us suggestions on where to go with complete respect and professionalism.  I received a confirmation the day before as well as our driver, Chris,  called us 20 mins before our pick up time.  We had a couple hiccups (including running late - as 15 girls tend to do - as well as running late at our last winery stop) but Chris handled it with the utmost patience and ease.    Honestly I couldn't have asked for a better company to use for our wine tour.  I highly recommend Chris and Matt over at Sixth Street Rides.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: "I had such an amazing 21st birthday party with Austin Party Bus. It's almost a year later and my friends still talk about how much fun they had. They all want party busses for their birthdays/graduation parties. My only complaint was the A/C did not work from the get go of the ride, my birthday was in May so it was pretty hot on that 22 person bus, but no one had a stroke so it was still a good time. Just make sure you get a bus with an A/C. Other than that, no complaints about this company. Driver was on time (11:00), and took us wherever we wanted to go. We had the bus for 4 hours which was more than enough time. Spent an hour or so on the bus, got dropped off down town for 2 hours, then rode it for the last hour and dropped people off back in west campus. It was perfect!"

reviews.author: Zachary P.
reviews.description: The driver was punctual and very accommodating.  This is the first time I have ever rented a party bus but when I need one again, Austin Party Bus will be the first place I look.

reviews.author: Dean L.
reviews.description: So many good things to say. I first and foremost am not a cider guy. Came in here on a referral from a friend and was surprisingly impressed with the operation. The cider was good they had some crisp ciders that came off more like a beer if that's what you need. My favorite was the blood orange or the pear. Still a toss up between the two. Also this place has some crazy good wines. They are cheap for a much better quality compared to the ones you get in most stores. They had football running great AC for that Texas heat. Best of all they allow dogs! When I came in my novice skills when drinking wine and ciders were put aside by the owner who gave me a great understanding and tour of his selections. The staff are all super friendly too!  There are no downsides to this place. Except for the hangovers. (Mostly self inflicted) I recommend Sundays. For your visit. There is a cool little coffee shop inside too. Nervous Charlie's was serving up brunch. Soo many good combinations outside of your regular mimosa routine. Do yourself a favor. You are not too cool to break away from your traditions to try this place.  In regards to the cider snobs leaving bad reviews. They obviously didn't come here for something new. Why would you want to go somewhere that copied someone else? Boring.... wish they could get more stars.

reviews.author: Sarah T.
reviews.description: Hate cider. I come here for the wine and ambiance. Both so funky. Also, Spokesman Coffee.

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: We bought a couple ciders to try. They were so god awful that my buddy secretly poured them out in the bathroom. It tasted like i was drinking a funky armpit wine. Gooooooooooooo

reviews.author: Khloe P.
reviews.description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! First of all, these people are assholes. Came here for a bachelorette party and their beer sucked! The manager was rude and I had a bug in my beer! No refund, no apologies and not a sorry member from anyone from the staff!!!! Stay away from this crap shoot!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Support. Your. Local. Cideries.  I'm not even that gung ho about ciders, but a lot of my girlfriends are. I'm so glad we stopped by Fairweather. It's very laid back, intimate, and relaxing with its clean aesthetic. Down in South Atx, we have Texas Keeper (awesome cidery, very different fireflies-on-the-porch and farmside vibes), so it was nice to see a completely different cidery with literally garage-space, elevated, and hipster vibes.   We both got cider flights, and loved the diversity of selections. Their ciders are all hilariously named (Fuccboisen is my favorite...I should've ordered that). I enjoyed their Smell the Van and EZ Tea (it truly tastes like tea!). The EZ tea was so delicious. Quenches thirst, subtle, and very honey-like. Their ciders aren't sickeningly sweet, and the flights give you a great little taste of all of the ciders that you're curious about but are unsure about getting a whole pint of. Their inventory has a clean design too. Their tees are super adorable, as well as their BEVERAGES sweaters. Tempting.  Service was wonderful. Our cider taptender was a wonderful man who was very sweet, knowledgeable and welcoming. The space is small, so it's not recommended you come here with a huge group (unless you plan on taking up the entire space. They have strong wifi, serve-yourself water, and different styles of seating from regular tables to taller barstools. They have little succulents on the table along with a well-designed menu for their "specials" deals. I would usually go to 4th Tap next door, but why not do both and hit up Fairweather too?

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Love this cider taproom! Try the rose cider-it's perfect. Tables are spaced 6 feet apart and it's open air so very safe for Covid. Cute decor and fun, upbeat music. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: Frozen Rose "Frozè" is super delicious!   Currently,  they have "PowerFade" as the frosty frozen drink! Super good, kind of like a frozen margarita. This cidery has really good drinks and hosts Austin FC watch parties. Fairweather also has partnered with Spokesman Coffee if someone in your group wants a coffee! If you're here at 11am, which would you pick? Why not both? Good vibes, good music, and a great atmosphere.  Bartenders are super friendly. I like it here! Check out 4th Tap and the pizza truck outside as well!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Accompanied my cider-loving friends as the only non cider lover and was delighted to not only see a couple of The Austin Winery staples on the menu but also a fridge full of multiple natural wines that the host warmly introduced us to, from sparkling moscato to skin contact. The pet nat was INSANE. Seriously gorgeous, open, airy space with beautiful murals that instantly put you in a good mood

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I usually am not a fan of cider...at all! But, after some friends who are also beerdrinkers suggested this place and that it wasn't your typically overly-sweet cider (which is what I have the aversion to) suggested this place, I decided "why not?".  The vibe here is super chill and the cider-barista was super nice and everyone there chimed in when I asked about the diff ciders they were offering.   So I will say, while I am still not on the cider bandwagon (I mean beer will always be my first love), the ciders here were actually drinkable! I enjoyed that they were on the drier side so your mouth isn't annihilated by chocolate and you can actually appreciate the different flavor components of each one! I will also give them kudos for actually packing a little bit of a punch w/the abv, which you don't usually see with ciders either!  Definitely enjoyed the vibe and the concept here!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: I was going from brewery to brewery when I noticed Fairweather Cider company and immediately knew I had to stop by and give it a try. Great ciders in a cute little shop. If you live in North Austin and are a cider enthusiast, this is a good spot to stop by on a Friday night!

reviews.author: Gina M.
reviews.description: Liked how chill this place was! Huge screen for sports. Bench seats with high table and a bar. Some doggos were there and you can bring your own food in.  I think a coffee shop was attached too but it was closed at night. We got two samplers and honestly it's hard to pick a fave and the flavors were fun!   Great place to hang out and have some drinks. *went in the fall! Plan to be be back this spring since the doors will be open * fingers crossed**

reviews.author: Vik M.
reviews.description: First ACTUALLY dry cider I have had while in Texas. Please do yourself a favor and visit this tap room.  It all started with a long wait for barbecue and a guy wearing a cidery shirt/hat. A quick google search later I dragged my family to this tap room so I could get a cider fix (having spent five years in the PNW it is a tough itch to scratch here in TX). The bartender/coowner was extremely friendly and ready to answer all questions. He was adorable and alone was reason enough for a follow up visit.  My sister and I had a flight of their four ciders on tap. Currently:  Common: base for all other cider, ACTUALLY DRY. In lurv Tejano dreams: green chile cider, bomb af. Strong pepper aroma and beautiful subtle Chile flavor. Nelson sauvin (I think).... very strong hop flavor forward with sweet cider finish. A good balance for people seeking hop flavor while trying to expand to cider. huell melon: hop flavor is SO subtle that it almost tastes like sour fruit flavor. I LOVED this cider. I can't wait to try it again.  Opens only Fri-Sun this is definitely a stop to add to your weekend plans. There are big things coming for this cidery. I can't wait to watch them grow.  I loved this cidery and cider and definitely recommend to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Amber K.
reviews.description: I really love Fairweather's concept and having a new addition to Metric Row that isn't another brewery! (Love to y'all breweries, though.)  I came here the day after opening day with a few friends who love cider (I'm indifferent) to try out their brews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!  We each ordered a flight of their four ciders on tap. One was the Common, which is the base for all their ciders. Another was one of my favorites even though it involved a little heat from some peppers! The last two were hopped ciders, and the bartender/co-owner told us if we tried them first in different orders, we may like one over the other. He was right, both both were delightful.  I want to give a five-star review to support a new business, but my only tiny complaint would be the fruit flies. Some kept buzzing about here and there, but you can only imagine they want to get a taste of this dry cider sweetness!  If you're a beer person like me, you may have found a new hangout for your friends who don't love beer as much as you. But you'll still enjoy what Fairweather has to offer -- so much so, I ordered a 12-oz pour of my favorite hopped cider after my flight!  Good luck, guys, and congrats on your opening!

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: This cider is heavenly! If you like dry, innovative ciders (think boysenberry, blood orange + hops, cider with electrolytes) you've got to check out Fairweather. It's well-priced, and the tap room is spacious and bright. You can even take a crowler home!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Fairweather was a surprise find for me thanks to the wise owner of Sunrise Mini Mart.  That guy knows SO much about all different types of distilled liquids, I wish I had a brain that could store that much knowledge.   I digress, this review is about the awesome family who started Fairweather (super friendly and knowledgeable).  I bought their cans of Common and was blown away.  Cideries claim to have dry cider all the time, but it's not TRULY dry.  Common though was legit.  These guys are making a truly BONE DRY English style cider from apples sourced from the PNW.   It's not perfect yet, but you can taste the potential. It reminds me of Shacksbury.  The fun artwork on the can intrigued me to go check out this spot that was just a few minutes drive away.  The tasting room is TINY! Start small and dream big! Kuddos to them for turning a cold warehouse space into a fun modern hipster community watering hole.  On a Friday night, get here early to even find a spot to sit!  I arrived around 5:30pm and sat at a high table outside and had no line.  By 7pm, people were crowded elbow to elbow, with a long line.  There also is very limited parking.  Be prepared to take time to find a spot and walk.  When they state they are pet friendly they mean it. Not only was my furry friend chilling with others, we were soon joined by a parrot!  I had a great time. I had come by myself, but ended up having several great conversations with people I had never met before.  Truly this place is only months old, and has quickly become a new neighborhood hang out.  The ciders are all 6.5%.  You can enjoy a flight of 4x4OZ for $10, enjoy a glass, or enjoy a guest cider or something from Austin Winery. I love the local support for other local liquid makers. There is a wide range of ciders to choose from.  They have some fun experimental ciders that were not like anything I have tried before.  It's hard to choose just four for a flight.  They have their staples- Common, EZ TEA, and Tejano Dreams, but also some Dry Hopped Ciders, and fruit ciders. My favorites were Tejano Dreams (nice kick), Gin Bot, and Dr. Rudi.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Fairwheather cider was definitely a surprise and a hidden gem. It's a very small location but it is in the burnet brewing scene, as it's located right next to 4th tap. Their cider is so amazing with fusions with sweet tea, gin, wine and different fruits, it'll definitely give you a pleasant experience you may not have been expecting. They also have so many more flavor options than what they offer in the store so id go to the cider for more options. You can also take pictures in front of the interesting wall art with the unicorn things going on.

reviews.author: Elyse Z.
reviews.description: If you like dry ciders, this place is for you. The Tejano Dreams is my favorite. They also have wine if you are not into cider.   Place is a little small. You can get a flight or by the glass. If you are usually a beer drinker or new to ciders, they will definitely let you try a few so you can find your favorite.   If you are hungry, there are usually food trucks at 4th tap and they let you bring food in. It is not officially dog friendly but sometimes they have a table outside when the garage is open.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Great local cider, in the "brewery area" of north Austin. They're got cute merch and you must try the jalapeño cider!

reviews.author: Angel L.
reviews.description: This taproom has a very minimalistic and industrial aesthetic that makes it a perfect place to catch up with a friend. It's quite small, but there was ample seating when I was there. Their cider is different from most of the dry ones I've had before - my favorite was the common with citrus-y flavors. The Apple flavor wasn't as strong as I was expecting (or used to with other ciders), and maybe that's just the case with a "true" dry cider. It tasted almost like a wine, which is great if you're a wine lover, I suppose!

reviews.author: Leslie V.
reviews.description: Love this place! I had a cider flight and loved all four selections. The vibe is really cool I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lisa N.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!! We had a group of 11 people going to the wineries in Dripping Springs and Johnson City. Driver was rude from the start and then left us at the winery. Just left us stranded!!! There were no Ubers or Taxis so we had to call friends to come pick us up.  Police came and we filed a report. Stay far away from this limo service as they may leave you stranded too!!

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Express Limo bailed me out on my mid-pandemic wedding.  I needed a last second bus to take groomsmen from Airbnb to venue in Dripping Springs.  They responded immediately and after a few texts and a call, driver was sitting at our door in an awesome party bus.   Really great experience.

reviews.author: Blair N.
reviews.description: Would give 0/5 stars if I could. The guy was rude from the second he picked us up when we asked him to help us set up the Bluetooth. He then refused to take us home from the second winery which was an hour and a half away from where we live?? He said we were drunk even though 1. We hadn't even had 2 regular sized glasses of wine total and 2. Isn't that why you hire a driver?? So you don't drink and drive? He put his finger in my mom's face so close it was basically touching her nose. When my brother tried to calmly speak to him, the driver dramatically told him to back up because he was "dangerous" and started filming. The video he took will clearly show that no one was threatening him. The other people at the winery came up to us after and could not believe how he acted and that he just left us in the middle of no where. He also called the cops on us and then drove away laughing. What if one of us had a medical condition and needed to get home to take medicine? We had to call all of our friends to see if one of our friends could pick us up since there were no ubers / Lyfts. DO NOT EVER USE THIS COMPANY!!

reviews.author: Kaet S.
reviews.description: Absolutely disappointed in this company. The driver was dismissive of us from the start, we needed help setting up the Bluetooth speakers but he was clearly trying to rush us from the moment we got in the bus. At what was supposed to be the halfway point of our trip, the driver came into the winery and told the owner we were 'running late' and they needed to rush us out. This company had over booked themselves and instead of calmly talking to us to resolve the situation, they decided that abandoning a group of people - an hour and a half away from our destination - was the best course of action. The driver had also called the police after escalating the situation himself which was both unprofessional and a waste of the officers time. To add insult to injury, the driver was laughing while he drove away without us. We were lucky enough to have friends drive out and get us, but it was a terrible end to what was supposed to a fun experience. I would not recommend this company if you expect transport to be completed both to and from your destination.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I was very pleased with the service.  They were prompt and confirmed pick up details along with ice needs a couple of times before service in case any changes were needed.

reviews.author: Pegah E.
reviews.description: Drivers are always courteous and on time, the cars are gorgeous and well maintained. Our driver was mike ; he had great defensive driving skills and quick reactions when needed. My friends and I would definitely choose this Express limo company again, for business or recreation. Thank you mike.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: Two years in a row now, me and my peeps have used this company to chauffeur us around the hill country wineries.  Beautiful idea, that.  Depending on how many people you have and what kinda of car you want, they will tote you around in a shuttle bus, a limo, or even a stretch hummer.    What is sooo cool about this company, is that they are so laid back about every event you schedule with them.  They will let you bring ungodly amounts of food and booze on the bus or limo and you can get as loud and unruly as you want, as long as you don't puke in the vehicle.  Last year  got a little rowdy and alll the girls ended up pole dancing in the shuttle bus!    We always bring party trays of sammiches, cheese n crackers, and lots of easy to drink beverages, like box wine or premade mixed drinks. We have them pick us up at my house at 10 am and they bring us back at 6.  And in that time we are usually able to visit 5 wineries.  When you call to set this up, talk to Bob.  He will visit with you on the phone for a long time, finding out where you want to go and making recommendations on new places.  He is a real sweetheart.  The drivers have always been very helpful also in recommending places and in general by putting up with our drunken behavior i.e. pulling the limo into a convenience store to pee several times in route......  One more kindness they extended to me this year.  We had reserved the airport shuttle style bus again as we had 10 people on our tour and low and behold pulling up in front of my house was the stretch hummer.  I was a little nervous about a mixup but they said not to worry, the bus had a flat that morning so we just got upgraded....now that thing was pimped out!  Blue running lights inside, nice stereo system (I bring my own cd's), and glasses and cups lining the backs of the seats.  Only problem with the hummer is it is kinda difficult to get in and out of for older people or anyone with a gimpy leg.  Only 2 back doors and a steep step down.  Gotta crab walk if you are sitting near the front.  Small regrets compared to a great day of hangin with my peeps, sampling wine and enjoying our hill country.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Driver tried to scam us for an extra hour.  My girlfriend and I went on a Monday and got Will as a driver of a sedan.  Everything went pretty well for the trip.  Will was polite and professional and helped us pick out wineries to go to.  We went to five wineries and my girlfriend and I were a little drunk by the end.  We had booked five hours (12pm-5pm) but knew we had gone over that by 30 minutes and were fine with that.  When the driver wanted us to pay for the extra time he said "Well, you went an hour and half over but I'll put it down as an hour and fifteen".  I called him on it and said it was only thirty minutes.  He showed me his watch and for some unknown reason his watch showed 6:30pm.  My girlfriend and I both got out our cell phones and showed him that it was in fact 5:30pm.  He then backed down and charged us for thirty minutes.  At the time, I let it pass and even tipped him quite well cause his service had been good.  Later, when I was more sober, I realized that it was extremely peculiar for his watch to be an hour *ahead*.  I am pretty certain he was actively trying to scam us for an extra hour and don't appreciate someone trying to take advantage of me when I've had some to drink.

reviews.author: Kara E.
reviews.description: Booked a hummer limo for my best friend's bachelorette party--it was fantastic!   We had a white hummer limo pick us up from the home we rented in Austin to take us to four wineries. The driver was super friendly, and even gave us more time at the end of our trip to fit in one more winery.   10 of us fit comfortably in the limo. It was a great experience, I highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: A G.
reviews.description: I wanted to do a wine tour for my birthday and after reading all of these awesome reviews for Bluebonnet, I decided to give Bob a call.   He recommended the 9 passenger limo and 4 of the favorite wineries- Becker, Massina Hof, 4 points and Mendelbaum   Becker was our favorite! The guys working were so fun and the place had delicious nuts, chocolate and live music. The wine was good, too ;)  Our driver, Eric, was awesome and we got upgraded to a hummer limo for free!  Don't forget to bring lots of snacks!

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: Found this company on Yelp. Last Sunday, I booked their party shuttle to take 9 women on wine tours for my sister's birthday. Their pricing is dramatically better than all the other companies I researched.  When they showed up, they arrived with the stretch hummer limo - free upgrade due to an issue with the shuttle radio from the party the day before.  Drive showed up almost right on time. Our driver was nice, knowledgeable and all the part-goers were very pleased.    I highly recommend you visit the wineries n a Sunday instead of a Saturday. We visited 6 wineries and had the place to ourselves at most wineries. In contrast, when I've gone on a Saturday, the wineries were overwhelmed, which meant you received no personal service and had to wait in lines - and thus you visit less wineries. Sundays and Bluebonnet Wine Tours are the way to go.

reviews.author: Stacey K.
reviews.description: If you are looking to reserve transportation for a wine tour, look no further!!  I reserved a party bus for last Saturday to take some girlfriends on a wine tour to celebrate my 25th birthday.  Everything was fantastic from beginning to end!  They were at least a hundred dollars cheaper than any other place I called, and I feel like we could not have gotten better service.    When I made the reservation, I estimated that we would have around 15 girls and Bob reserved the 16 passenger bus for us.  However, a few days before the event I realized that we actually had 17 people.  I called Bob (slightly panicking that he wouldn't have a solution) and was pleasantly surprised that he offered to upgrade us to a larger bus for no additional charge!  Happy birthday to me!  Our driver (Justin or Jason... I think his name was Jason) arrived 15 minutes early and was extremely patient with us the entire time.  I mean, what other guy could put up with that many screaming, dancing, drunk 20-somethings on a long car ride??  Jason was very professional but also very personable.  He even suggested a winery (Woodrose) that was not on our original tour - and I'm so glad he did!  Woodrose was very low-key and had some great live music (it was perfect for our first stop).    We ended up only going to three wineries on our tour (we were slated to go to four) but that was completely our fault - we just spent wayyyy too much time at each stop.  All in all, this was the perfect way to celebrate my birthday!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: I decided on Bluebonnet because of the price.  It was a mistake, the bus was late, it was dirty and I wish I would have spent the money on a better company.  Next time I will ask the venues for a recommendation.  If the venue has a problem with the transportation company it's a bad sign.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: My friend is using Bluebonnet Limo's for her wedding next Sat. so we decided to check their availability for her bachelorette party.  They were available, super nice, and prompt.  We had a hummer limo pick us up Friday night, take us to dinner, and pick us up on West 6th at 1:30AM.  We were staying about 30 minutes away, so it was great to have a ride for all of us girls.  We decided on Sat. to call them again for another night on the town and they accomodated.   A driver picked us up in a party bus and again, the drivers were top notch.  Great price and exceptional service. I highly recommend this for all your transportation needs

reviews.author: Tara F.
reviews.description: the one star goes for the guy that helped me on the phone. he was excellent. however the driver was horrible and when i called to complain come to find out it was the owner. i dont care if you have 1-2 people or 20 in the back of your car. when you pay for something you should get respect. not being told to get out of a limo while your gathering your things. and this was after he started texting an hour before pickup time asking if we were ready. it was obvious he was not happy we paid for pick up and drop off. but bottom line is we paid. the owner of blue bonnet limo turned our new years into a nightmare. NEVER AGAIN. im now scheduling our next limo service by asking first if they are associated with blue bonnet. HORRIBLE SERVICE! small parties beware!

reviews.author: Jo S.
reviews.description: Ordered the 4 passenger hummer and a 15 passenger stretch hummer showed up!  What an awesome surprise!!  Keith was a great driver and knew exactly which Hill Country wineries to visit.  Even though we only scheduled a 1/2 day, we did not feel rushed at all.  Becker and Grape Creek were our favorites.  Can't wait to do go on our next wine tour!

reviews.author: Suzanne P.
reviews.description: Amber Ale is amazing! IPA is good.  Very friendly staff and customers.  Price is now $5 per pour - 16 oz pours. The place is very small and in a warehouse area, hard to find. Hope they make more stouts and porters. Great place to stop.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: We had heard about Bluebonnet for a while and finally decided to check them out on a Friday evening. We were shocked to find a packed house! The picnic tables outside are plentiful but were all full when we arrived. Luckily two guys let us join them. I had the Raspberry Berliner Weisse and it quickly became my new favorite. It is sweet and crisp without being overly sweet. Our friends both got the Cream Ale and loved it. We all walked out with growlers. Everyone there is super friendly and very welcoming. We had the baby with us which was fine (there were a few kids there)...but every time a car was exiting we would have to wrangle him down (minor downfall of basically sitting alongside the parking lot). We are looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Nice little brewery in a warehouse. Seating is all outside in the parking lot. Regulars bring lawn chairs. Beer was okay. Food was meh. Plastic cups are a turn off. I'd stop in again if thirsty and in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to get here...

reviews.author: John R.
reviews.description: Good variety of tasty beers on tap, and they run true to form. We prefer a selection like this vs say five different IPAs. Good seasonal beers. Food truck on site. Decent seating for a smaller brewery. Lots of parking. The Tap Room is only open Thur-Saturday, so if we find ourselves on a Sunday beer drive, we have to pass.

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet Beer Company is simply amazing. They are a little difficult to find, look for the side street behind the post office and you should notice it on the right.  Their beers are super delicious, I had the wit, pecan brown ale , cream ale and hef. Out of all of them, the cream ale and wit come highly recommended. They are so smooth and drinkable.  There is a schnitzel food trailer that serves some pretty decent food. The place is small but all of the employees I encountered were nice and friendly. For seating, there is only plastic benches avaliable located in the front of the brewery. Not really any kind  of shade or landacaping but this is expected since it is such a small brewery.  It may not have all of the amenities and backyard space that other larger breweries in Austin have. But if you love beer and want to interact with some awesome, friendly people then Bluebonnet Beer Company is the way to go. Everything is tasty and pints are currently at $5 each, you can't beat that price.

reviews.author: Isabel R.
reviews.description: If there was a zero I would not give this establishment any stars. We go when it's raining and all tables are outside for the exception of the owners table that was inside. We asked if we could move our table in and was rejected instantly because "there was no room" (there was enough). Hospitality was at a negative and we were highly considering the beer mug club but the lost a customer and a loyaled customer.  Bluebonnet Brewery you all need to focus on customer Hospitality and not just your sales.

reviews.author: Sereena J.
reviews.description: Great little brewery in my hometown of Round Rock!  My family and I came here on a Friday around 6:30 to grab a few beers and relax. If it's cold outside, I highly recommend bringing a layer or two as there is only a bit of seating inside but about four picnic tables outside. Also, wait to grab dinner at the brewery as they have rotating food trucks Thursday-Saturdays. When we went, they had a lobster roll truck that served amazing rolls.   I started out with their Oktoberfest beer, which was very good! My mom, who is not a big beer drinker, got their shandy and thought it would be great for a hot day. The beers are $5 a pint, and I thought it was really cool they have a series related to the Immortal 10.   Parking is not a hassle, the beer is very good, the people are friendly, and your hardest job will be finding a seat. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: Hello there, Bluebonnet Beer Company! Delighted to make your acquaintance! I don't know why I am just now discovering this treasure trove of highest quality local craft brews, but I'm so glad I'm educated now. Brewmaster David Hulama and his partner Clare have something special going on here, and yes, dirty hippies, it's up in Wilco off a toll road - don't worry, you'll love it!  Opening up special to host a local running group for #globalrunningday? + 1 star Serving 10 different varieties of delicious beer for all palates and ABV levels? + 1 star Evening shade to cool the outdoor picnic table seating? +1 star Friendly and knowledgeable staff taking orders/payments and serving patrons? + 1 star Discounts for American Homebrewers Association members + 1 star  During my visit on a Wednesday evening for a special event, the available beers (from highest to lowest ABV) were: Immortal Ten Castellaw Quadrupel (10%) Immortal Ten Kelley Imperial Stout (10%) India Pale Ale (7%) American Amber Ale (6.5%) Vienna Lager (5.5%) Cream Ale (5.5%) Texas Pecan Brown (5.5%) Bluebonnet Wit (5.4%) German Pilsner American Amber Ale (5.3%) Texas Summer Blonde Ale (5.2%)  Other good stuff to know: + Pints are just $4. Flights (4x 6oz pours of your choice) $10. + Located just east of Cedar Ridge High School in an industrial park behind a post office. Waze knows the way. + Tap room generally open only Fri-Sat 5-8p, but check Twitter and FB for special events. + Rotating variety of food trucks usually parked during open hours + Single stall restroom is in the back, next to the small air-conditioned tasting room + Venue available for parties + Kegs available for purchase + Find their beers served at area restaurants and bars, including The Dig Pub, Cover 3 RR, Greenhouse Craft Food, and more.

reviews.author: Chad T.
reviews.description: This is the best beer in Texas!  I've been coming to Bluebonnet since 2103 and its amazing!

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We love blue bonnet. It's really the only brewery in the area and we are used to living in the domain where there are like a million options.   Beer is tasteful and I don't always love IPA. Their indoor seating is limited by this isn't normally a problem in Texas. They have plenty of tables outside and also have tents in the summer. No food but there is always a food truck - if you follow them on Facebook you can see what it is ahead of time.   Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Plenty of space for puppies here too.   They are only open Friday evenings and Saturday! I wish they had some openings on Sunday.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Try the Amber, pecan brown or Irish dry stout Fantastic beer. Great off track location.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Great beer and great people. I only wish they had more seating. They have a loyal customer base which speaks to the way they treat there patrons but also means the little seating they have is always full. If this place would just expand, they could run the Round Rock beer scene!

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Middle of the road Brewery. Simple and plan. Nothing crazy. Probably following German Purity Laws. If you're looking for basic styles of beers here is your spot. The IPA is nice classic take. $4 all pints. Can't beat that

reviews.author: Eric J.
reviews.description: Prior to coming here, had heard consistent HIGH positives on this place...  Firstly, Marga (aka the Beer Snob), and I checked out a Pale...and their Pale was Very Good...asked for a sample of their IPA,...and before even drinking it....getting the nose of the beer -- already knew that it was -- Spot On and the-way-it-should-be!  Their Cream Ale was a new beer idea to me...tried that and WOW, creamy and light...Very Good.  What a Great Place and Team!!!  Thank You soo Much!!!  Eric and Marga  p.s., when it finally gets a bit cooler, we will be by with Kodiak, "The WunderMutt"

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: This a Hidden event pastors please have a new brewery was there Oktoberfest was a good idea the Oktoberfest was fun Had a chance to experience great good different types of German beers and bratwursts it was a lot of fun for family and friends

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: I'm rating Blue Bonnet 3 stars because while we love their beer and have enjoyed it the very much during their Oktoberfest, we were pretty bummed when we went on a Saturday night. We know that they are popular and were even excited to try Jimmy Vega's Smokehouse but when we arrived half of the available tables were set as reserved. There was literally no where to sit. Every table was packed. We had our 3 yr old son with us, so standing wasn't an option, especially since we wanted to eat too. We asked anyway if any of the tables were available and was told no, they are all reserved for 5pm, but you could squeeze in anywhere else. In the end, we left irritated and disappointed, while I understand reserving tables, but when you only have 10 tables and you reserve 5 of them, that doesn't leave much room for anyone else.

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: Bluebonnet is a great craft brewery with an outstanding lineup of ales, seasonal lagers, and wheat beers. I really enjoyed the Vienna lager. The owners run a hands on, customer friendly business that is a real pleasure to visit. The perfect place to relax with friends and enjoy some really good beer!

reviews.author: Katie K.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the beer here. My favorites were the Hefeweizen and the Summer Wit.   The guy at the counter was very friendly and went through a description of all the beers. Good place to get a flight to try multiple beers.  There was a food truck present, too. I didn't get any food, but maybe next time!

reviews.author: Melody B.
reviews.description: Beer is good. Great to sit outside and have conversation but the noise from the food truck generator made it hard to have hear.

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Locally owned family run business that has delicious beer. They always have at least 6-8 beers on tap and a couple seasonal favorites. They have a solid line up across a wide style of beers. The summer wit is a favorite along with the Kolsch styles they release during the fall. I would love to see them expand to a new location  with a climate controlled tasting room which I think would bring in a lot more clientele.

name: The Brass Tap - Round Rock
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in for a drink or two and a bite to eat. We ordered chips and salsa as an appetizer. It was meh but it filled our bellies so in that aspect it got the job done.   The drinks are where it is at here. My husband ordered a flight of beer. Tons of options to choose from. I ordered Bishop cider on draft. I got the strawberry (my favorite) and also the apple pineapple. All the drinks were good.  We noticed that staff attention to customers had been a little lacking and very slow. I think this has more to do with our crappy country and COVID. But who am I to judge? We just made sure to grab our check before I was even close to being done with my second glass.

reviews.author: Raven I.
reviews.description: What a great place in downtown Round Rock! We met a friend here for drinks late, and the wait staff was wonderful! I don't think I've ever been in a bar with such nice and professional staff. They have an epic beer selection. Though beer isn't my thing, the selection still impressed me! They helped me select a beer, as I said, beer isn't my thing. They were patient and actually found me an option to "get me through the night". I did move on to margaritas though, and were these delicious! So why the 4 starts, well, they kept running out of things. For instance, my margarita went skinny when they ran out of the regular mix they use. Then, they ran out of limes! The margaritas, even the skinny ones, were fantastic! They use A LOT of ice, but still tasted delicious. Decor was wonderful for Christmas. It was just a warm and inviting space. We will definitely go back if we are ever back in that area! Parking was sufficient, as it was a weeknight. I'm sure that helped for it not to be too crowded. Everything was very clean also. Just a great place to go and meet with friends over drinks. If you're expecting tapas, call ahead to see when the kitchen closes. The kitchen had closed shortly after we got there, which was a bummer. Regardless, check this place out if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: I've been coming to The Brass Tap for a few years now and love it! The back courtyard has giant Jenga and other games and there are plenty of seating options both indoors and outdoors. Just recently tried their food and the loaded fries were pretty good! I was looking around at surrounding tables and their food all looked great. Can't wait to try more here in the future. Tons of beer on tap and very knowledgeable bartenders who make great recommendations. I will say that their cocktail availability is slim but definitely a good spot for beer.

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: One of the best bars in Round Rock, TX. Plenty of space and always something fun going on. Look out for employees Angel, Rachel, and Mike. They're very helpful and always super positive / Friendly...  :p

reviews.author: Susan S.
reviews.description: Jeff is the bomb!!!  You are always know  what we want or what to recommend before we do!  I'm so glad you joined the Brass Tap team!!!!

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Monday 4pm.  Only 4 people inside the bar.  Again had to walk down to actually request a beer from the tender.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Thankful that the brass tap is open and serving food and drink. Service is outstanding, they always have A great selection of beer on tap and if you are confused or just can't decide, ask, staff is great and matching your preferences to their current selections. Over the last couple weeks my friends and I have enjoyed flatbreads and sandwiches - Tasty and fresh. The options these days in this area, post Covid, are rather slim - But it is definitely worth you stopping in and staying for a while... They have a nice sitting area out back when it's not too warm outside.

reviews.author: Sterling P.
reviews.description: Came with my best friend tonight and seriously amazing  Michael and Sarah did a PHENOMENAL JOB. They checked on us numerous times, made the drinks to perfection, and were a pleasure to talk to!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND. THEY ARE THE BEST EVER!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I have been to this bar many times and every time I am here, I forget to write a review because I get too hammered after the visits there.   The highlights of the establishment are as follows:   1- Conveniently located close to a lot of parking in downtown Round Rock that is free  2- Mixed drinks are on-point  3- Bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable about beer  4- This establishment is dog-friendly  5- The Brasstap uses toast for their Brew Crew "Drink Beer. Earn Rewards. Become a Beer Guru."

reviews.author: Mary D.
reviews.description: Dropped by late and Elvis was in the building. A lot of fun. Great atmosphere. Had some tasty treats from the late menu: pretzels and mustard and chips and queso. Selected our own drinks for the first round, then went with our server, Tanya's, recommendations for our 2nd round. Particularly enjoyed The Princess Kiss.  Hadn't been there in awhile.
