The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Theresa S.
reviews.description: We like IPAs and we were  able to get a beer flight with 6 IPAs - they were all delicious!  Able to take advantage of happy hour which apparently starts at 2pm.  Seems to be a very popular spot!  Love the beer names too.  Lovely Day IPA and Ray Ray hazy IPA were some of our favorites!

reviews.author: Bob L.
reviews.description: Austin is rich with craft breweries and 4th Tap is an excellent addition to the mix. I went there recently with my son and DIL to enjoy their beer and treat ourselves to some outstanding Laotian street for from the SXSE food truck. My favorite was the coffee stout but the amber ale was worthy of another taste.   Located in the obligatory warehouse area the facilities encourage family and pet attendance. Inside seating has a wide variety of games for those at  a loss for words. Outside seating is ample with umbrellaed picnic tables.   Also, it's within walking distance of Q2 Stadium.   Will I be back?  Youbetcha.

reviews.author: Melanie H.
reviews.description: Not only does it have good beer, friendly staff, and a good vibe, 4th Tap also has the most well-supplied (and clean) women's bathrooms of any of the Austin breweries. It may be random, but I'm just so appreciative of any business that thoughtfully provides quality sanitary supplies and handy stuff like hair ties and bobby pins. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This was our favorite of the breweries in the area. We tried a handful of their beers across the spectrum of styles (everything from a pumpkin beer to a porter to a sour). They hit the mark in every category. We loved every beer we tried and the staff were super friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: 4th Tap perfectly brewed beers definitely helped me get through this past year. Now that businesses are starting to reopen they've begun reintroducing some of their staple events like Good Set. Love seeing local comedians while enjoying a delicious flight. Happy that they still have a great food truck available. 4th Tap is such a wonderful addition to our community.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: First, I must profess.  As much as I love my hometown of San Antonio, Austin really has it going on regarding the microbrewery/brewpub scene.   There are so many options in the ATX and 4th Tap Brewing should NOT be overlooked. From their awesome craft beers, to their homemade pizzas, this place has it going on!  Beer - they have precanned beers, crowlers and growlers to go, as well as a handful of fresh beer on tap if you want to hang out in this cool joint/  On my visit, they had nine beers on tap, and I settled on the "Can You Dig It" amber ale.  It was definitely good, and I would get it again the next time I visit, but it was pretty similar to an amber ale you can find anywhere else. A little sweet, a little caramel taste to it, and just the right amount of hops - but not too much!  I didn't sample them, but they also have a could of IPAs, a sour, and a couple of different stout types.  Now, let's talk about the food! The pizza is SUPERB! They have several pizzas geared toward carnivores and herbivores alike.  If you don't see a prebuilt pizza that appeals to you, you can always build your own custom pizza.  They also have a handful of salads.  My friends from the ATX shared the 12" "Backdraft" pizza for $12.99 with me.  It was LOADED with huge slices of pepperoni, jalapenos, and house made spicy Italian style sausage. The crust was thin and crispy.  Even if you don't like beer, I recommend stopping by here for a pizza - it.was.that.good!

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Wow 4th Tap was amazing tonight.  I love craft beer but was skeptical with covid. I was so surprised when I saw that I could book an outdoor seating table in advance. We booked a table a couple hours before we were planning to meet up.  Staff was super friendly. Beer was great...loved the Running Man, didn't really care for the gingerbread. Outdoor space was nice and spacious. Definitely felt safe during covid times. Food from the truck was delicious. Props to SXSE because their food is absolutely delicious. I had the beef skewers and upgraded to crispy rice. It was so flavorful and delicious.  Thanks 4th tap for the ease of booking a table, keeping things safe during covid, serving delicious beer and having such a great food truck.

reviews.author: Alysa L.
reviews.description: Here's why I luv 4th Tap  1.) Great drinkable, delicious beer!  My current favs are: ALL OF THEM!  haha I'm kidding.  Try Stay Gold and Kung Fu Robot.  They're so good you will want more.    2.) Great staff.  Really nice, accommodating, and they keep everyone's safety in mind by wearing masks and sanitizing ALL THE TIME!  So no CardiB, I won't get Corona virus here!   3.) Great vibe.  As a woman, I often think of, "is it safe for me to drink here alone?"  when out at bars.  I've never had this concern at 4th Tap.  4th Tap is open and bright and has lots of space to be alone or hang with guests.   As I mentioned the staff are great and wear masks and they look out for their guests in other ways, too.    4.) Great bar seats. Great bar seats are an unrated variable and let me tell y'all, I don't slide off these seats!  They're comfy and allow me to drink more beer.  Cause it's all about the beer!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Pretty basic tap room and smallish brewery, but LOVE the fact they're a co-op! Putting out some decent IPAs and stouts. Offering eight taps to choose from at any given time, including their four core beers and four orbitals. Can order by pint, half pint, and/or flight. Very reasonably priced... and several little options for self entertainment including board games, a TV, and a piano. A must stop if visiting the now named "Austin Craft Beer Corridor" (i.e., there are several breweries in the adjacent area). Support local! Cheers to the shared love of good beers!

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: I typically like IPAs but 4th Tap has a great blonde ale! The tap room has long tables with a large assortment of board games available. You can also sit in the production area as long as you follow the rules such as "1. Be Cool" and of course, others like don't touch the equipment. The parking area is very limited but the location can be accessed by public transportation. Outside they also had a pizza food truck.    Fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: 4th Tap? Well it happened to be the 4th brewery I went to on this lovely Friday Evening. Lots of seating area with lots of great beers to sample. They had quite a few decent beers. But for me, what made 4th two truly memorable was the little gaming area they had. Truly unique and super awesome

reviews.author: Scyenna B.
reviews.description: Got this place confused with another.  There are so many Breweries in Austin, it is too much fun. The 4th tap offered a quaint space that wasn't too busy but offered plenty of seating and a great menu.

reviews.author: Doug B.
reviews.description: The beers are well crafted. The IPA is fantastic. Kung Fu Robot is a well-balanced and sophisticated IPA. Great afternoon.Oh yeah and they're totally kid friendly.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker at all but I love and appreciate this brewery!! They are a part of our Divine Canine "Barks for Beers" and with their wonderful support we are able to provide free therapy dog service in Central Texas. Purchase a pint glass and get free pours at many Austin and area breweries!  The general manager, Erin, is amazing and strongly supports us. Look for us here every May for the entire month. We bring our amazing therapy pups to the brewery to love on everyone.

reviews.author: Lanie L.
reviews.description: Solid brewery, but I wish there was more varieties of beer offered.  I opted for the flight, which is 5 for $12, but you have to go for the 3 core and can only choose 2 orbitals. It's a shame because I didn't care for 1 of the core items, a really fruity gluten-free beer. (I had a sample and didn't really like it).  Fortunately, I asked really nicely if I could swap it out for an orbital, and the employee said she could. But when my cousin tried the same, she was denied.  +2 Vitality (Core): Spring Ale-and their lightest beer they offer. Smooth and good flavor. Perfect for if you're looking for a light beer.  Zephyr (Core): American Pale Ale-A little more hop to it, but still a smooth and light option.   Long Walk-Grapefruit IPA-Light notes of citrus, hoppy, and refreshing. But in an increasingly crowded market of grapefruit beers, this one gets lost.  Mega-Citrus One-Double IPA-Basically a stronger version of Long Walk. To me, it tasted almost identical, which makes me wonder with such a limited menu, this one is offered. (But then again, why did I choose to sample it? Not too sure myself.)  Brick Top-Robust Porter. I'm not a porter drinker. At all. But once I started sipping, I really enjoyed it. This is a popular and enjoyable one.  Sample cup pours are generous and the prices are really good for the amount you get. (I couldn't finish my entire sample flight!). There indoor seating as well as seating 'outside' in the brewery area. There is a ping-pong table, plenty of board games, and apparently, rambunctious wrestling matches that happening quarterly that brings the whole neighborhood out.  I didn't get to see any wrestling happen this time around, so all in all 4th Tap offers good beer at good prices, but I'm looking for something more to wow.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Was happy to discover this place so close to where I live. Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was moderately full. The space is nice and the AC was turned up, so it was a great respite from the heat. Got a flight of their beers and not a bad one in the bunch! The bartenders were very friendly and knowledgeable and were able to make some solid and informed beer recs for my date who had no idea what beer he wanted.   There is even a piano randomly sitting amongst the tables and a random patron got up from his table, chugged the rest of his pint, waltzed over the piano, took a seat and then started playing and belting out Billy's Joel's "Pianoman". A pint w/free entertainment is always a plus!   Can see myself coming back in periodically to check out the new stuff on the rotation

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: I love these beers more than any other brewery in the area. +2 to Vitality is my goto favorite! The Suneater is also a crowd pleaser! The current sixer pickup procedures are quick and easy. I like the way they bring your orders out to you! We bike over there or swing by on the way home! Easy and effortless!

reviews.author: Angie W.
reviews.description: Great little brewery tucked away from the crowds up north.  Beer was on point.  Service was stellar with friendly bartenders and servers.  We at around playing games, drinking beer, and enjoying the company.  Food truck out front if you want something to nosh on.  Check this place out!

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Great beer and a different vibe/scene than most other places! Hoping to come back the next time we're in town!

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Another unassuming microbrewery in a warehouse that opens into a glorious playground for adults. I wish I had gotten the names of the bartenders because they were so sweet to my mother, who is a lightweight and does not drink alcohol, but was feeling adventurous :) They even went out of their way to grab a beer they were out of on tap, but had a can of it in the back for her to try. She loved it, so she got it on the house. Incredible customer service.   There are plenty of large picnic tables in the taproom, and a whole shelf of board games to keep you and guests entertained. There is a grand piano off to the side of the room, so you know fun times are had here.   In the brew house, there is more seating, a wrestling ring (not sure I get it?), and a ping pong table! Game on.   I really enjoyed the grapefruit hints of the Longwalk as well as the tamarind acidity of the Renewal. Tasting is highly encouraged here as well. My family and I enjoyed ourselves immensely. At the end of the night, I paid a $12 tab! Great drinkin' to do on a budget!  Thanks for taking care of us and for being awesome at life!   -xoxo

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: My first time at this spot. You walk in and it's an open space well developed. Bench seating isn't comfy but allows large groups to fit together. You get to taste before you buy. Then there is the back area where they brew. Ping pong, bean bag toss and a wrestling ring. Yep. We ordered pizza and they brought it right in.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Finally made it to trying out the infamous Cuban Quesadilla and some local craft beer. Both did not disappoint, very tasty and satisfying. The Verde salsa and the guacamole were nice addition to the flavor profile of my appetizer smorgasbord.  It's a little off the beaten path but worth the journey. Check them out.

reviews.author: George D.
reviews.description: Update?  There's nothing to update, just get here it's awesome! Tonight is "Burger Night"!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Such a cute spot!!! Indoor and outdoor seating that's dog friendly. There's a gravel area with some games. Tables over a shaded grassy area are also available. Mostly hard seltzer's on tap, but fun flavors. Beer selection was small but covered all the bases. The food they have is small portions but soooo good! Not your traditional pupusa or cortido, but I still enjoyed it. The flour tortillas were really good. Cubano is the perfect beer food though. Such a great brewery and I love that it's in Pflugerville. TVs with sports  and a projector playing a movie we're on the inside.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: Great beers, great hard seltzer, and burger night is phenomenal. Cool staff, decent prices, what more do you want? I will be back on the regular.

reviews.author: Travis P.
reviews.description: Great place! Outdoor area is a lot of nice space. Food is a little pricey for how much you get.   Beer is tasty with a nice variety.   A perfect small brewery vibe.

reviews.author: Caroline M.
reviews.description: Great environment, welcoming (and mask wearing) staff, dog friendly, delicious food, great assortment of beverages (beers and tasty seltzer's-- like coconut papaya). Plenty of tables and areas to social distance, while supporting a local business!   While we only visited during the soft opening, we know that Willards will be a fantastic addition to the Pflugerville area!   Willards Brewery features the Mojo Austin Food Truck!! (Separate IG accounts by the way) The Cubano Quesadilla, Braised Beef Taco, and Beef and Cheese Pupusa are allllll a must have!!  I recommend the green salsa since it's nice and hot, as well!

reviews.author: Erin P.
reviews.description: We wanted to check out one of the new breweries in town. The atmosphere here was awesome. Open air tasting room with projector plus great beer garden area. Lots of little games and lighting. I love a place that offers 4oz pours so you can buy ole your own flights. The food was good and fast. Will be back!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Willards is my new favorite neighborhood brewery. Their beers are all solid and the taproom is a great place to get out of the house safely during covid. I really appreciate that they have a menu that caters to everyone, not just beer drinkers. I love their hard seltzer cocktails and they also have mead and a few guest taps from other breweries. The Mojo food truck is amazing - their pork tacos are to die for!  As far as the physical space goes, the patio is gorgeous and they have campfires going at night to keep you cozy. Everything is very well spaced out, too.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: Willard's is right around the corner from our home, but we tried it for the first time last night (it won't be the last). The first thing you notice as you walk into the beer garden is the nice outdoor space with a pleasant ambiance. They have picnic style tables in and outside, they keep the indoor space very open (making us feel safer during COVID era). The lights outside provide a nice touch, as well as the music- played at a low enough volume that we don't have to raise our voices to hear one another.   Now as for the drinks: their stout is amazing and smooth and very chocolatey. Their seltzers all have such unique taste combinations and are NOT overly sweet, like some of the big name brands. The strawberry tangerine reminded me of a Haribo gummy bear! The coconut papaya was delicious and I went back and forth between tasting the coconut and the papaya most. They even have cocktail like drinks that are good for those who don't enjoy beer or seltzer. My partner ordered the Hazy IPA and liked it enough to buy a six-pack to take home. George was our bartender. He has such a calm and respectful demeanor. He was really great and made the experience of tasting some of the drinks for the first time so pleasant.   The food truck is so reasonable in price and was delicious! It was so nice to have something other than typical bar food. Austin (chef) brings out the orders so quickly and is super kind! Their guacamole is really interesting and we all devoured it, their salsas are spicy and fresh, and they even have a mushroom taco with a black bean puree for those of us who don't eat meat. Everyone at our table enjoyed the food (other items ordered were pork nachos, Cuban quesadilla, and the pupusa).   Overall we loved our experience, and will definitely be back to visit this hidden treasure.

reviews.author: TD C.
reviews.description: We had never been and had been looking for pooch friendly places and that sealed our decision. Tried the place on a Sunday afternoon and expected more patrons there were only 3 other tables. Great service from the employees offering tasting of different beers and seltzer's and you've got to try the Mojo Cuban food truck - can recommend the quesadilla for sure. Look for us on a Sunday with our Am Staf puppy named Daisy.

reviews.author: Zane Z.
reviews.description: Super cool place in an upcoming area. Great drink selections and a really good happy hour. Had the Fistfull of Fury and October Fest while my wife had the Jenny Lane Seltzer. We both really enjoyed our drinks. They have food too which is an added bonus. Definitely check this neighborhood brewery out!

reviews.author: Jerry H.
reviews.description: I love this place nice  and layed back and my dog she loves it there good brew good food great scene  and great service !

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Willard's Brewery has some of the best beer I've ever had! Right now they're selling 3 beers that you can order online or in the brewery for pick-up - a Helles lager, pale ale and hazy IPA. They are absolutely delicious and the can designs are awesome too. The brewery will be opening up their taproom and beer garden in September...can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Dave L.
reviews.description: The little brewery I'll definitely go back wonderful stouts and porters  just waiting on barley wine

reviews.author: Kaitlyn A.
reviews.description: Great new brewery in north Austin!  Had a sneak peak at their offerings and all three beer styles were amazing.  Very excited to try the food truck - Mojo, which is opening for business this weekend.  Can't go wrong with great beer and tacos along with a beautiful beer garden. I'm in!

name: The Growler Bar and Kitchen
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: A revisit to one of my favorite spots in Texas, the Growler Bar - 2022 review.   I love coming here when it's not busy, which I'm finding is becoming more and more difficult as time passes. The place has built up a solid base of loyal customers that seem to return week after week and I can't blame them. There is consistency at work here, the staff is always excellent - they make great recommendations to the ever-changing list of beers on tap, the selection of beers is constantly rotating, and best of all - the food is delicious. We often consider ordering take-out for only the pizza/pizza rolls here.   This place has adapted to changing times, they have more outdoor seating so we're able to socially distance ourselves most of the time and feel safe during our visit. I'm happy to see this place thrive.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Very disappointing.    Phone order was ready 20 minutes early, so by the time I got there the pizzas had been waiting. BUT, the wings were not ready and had to wait longer. By the time I got the phone order home, the pizza and pizza rolls were cold, tasted very average and doughy.   I hope the high rating is for the beer, because the pizza and service was far below any one else....

reviews.author: Laura B.
reviews.description: We got take out and it was exceptional.  So happy to find quality pizza and salad in Pflugerville on par with a couple of premium pizza places in Austin.  Very delicious, black olive and artichoke toppings were generous. The balsamic dressing was good, too.  Check it out!

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Popped in on a Sat around noon. Inside seating was nearly full but we managed to snag the last table. There's also plenty of tables outside with umbrellas for those with dogs or don't mind the scorching Texas heat.  The pizza is delicious. I can't remember the name of it but it had Canadian bacon, bacon and a sriracha bbq drizzle on it. Crust was delicious, the bottom wasn't soggy near the center.  Also tried the pretzels with beer cheese. Mmmmmm.   A really big beer selection available as well.   Service was great. You order at the bar, get a number and they bring to your table.   Def worth a visit if you're nearby.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: In my previous review, I neglected to mention something important. This is one of those businesses which require you to pay first and they hit you with the gratuity percentage upfront before you receive your food and service.  The gratuity should come at the end of the meal and service, not at the beginning and I have found this practice puts more money in the business' pocket at your expense.  Now with that said, their pizza, wings and pizza rolls are quite exceptional. they have an extensive beer selection which is always changing around to keep up with the seasons. So if paying upfront along with the gratuity doesn't bother you then we do recommend the fare, however I find it a turn off. Especially since they forgot half of our order and didn't get it to us until we were ready to leave. So basically, one star for the payment practice, but four stars for the food and beer.

reviews.author: Jonathan R.
reviews.description: Fun local watering hole with an incredible beer selection.   Their pizzas are good, albeit a bit on the doughy side. Wings and other bar food options are surprisingly good as well.   Very popular local spot so this place can get packed. Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating.   No happy hour which is a bummer.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: The pizza here was fabulous! It reminded us of a place we go in college. The system to get the menu up on my phone hated me so had to get a paper menu from them.  We had a beer called Nola- next time we go I'll get a growler but since we weren't going straight home and forgot a cooler that had to wait. Their beer cheese looks like gravy.. it doesn't taste like gravy though- highly suggest! We will definitely be back next time he visits. Nice large patio and clean bathrooms as well.

reviews.author: Eva S.
reviews.description: Oh where do I begin... GREAT PIZZA!!! Also great for beer fans, clearly. Amazing number of choices. The environment is loud but in the good way that makes you feel comfortable and relaxed. I saw numerous kids here as well so I guess if you have children you don't have to leave them at home for this one. I have to point out, staff wears no masks and they aren't required if you're into that thing.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: Lots of brews on tap. Food is okay, nothing special. Staff is usually great. I personally wouldn't let kids in a bar/kitchen, but that's me. They have video games for the kids.

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Decent selection of craft beers, but one thing unique about this bar is that they do not allow customers to sample any beers, unlike most of their competitors.  I undetstand the policy to a certain extent, especially if you had very knowledgeable bartenders, but that is not the case here.  During my most recent visit, one person I was with asked for an IPA that was very hoppy, But instead got something but was very sour and totally did not like the taste of the beer. She was stuck with paying for the pint, despite the bartender's error.  The pizza (bbq chicken) was decent, but pretty bready - took away from the tasty toppings - left me feeling like we were served a glorified frozen pizza - we were hungry so we devoured the pizza, but we were disappointed and will thing twice before  ordering it again.  They had some live music, a young man with the guitar singing cover songs, did a very decent job. It helped make the dying experience enjoyable.  It was a great night to sit on the patio, with a nice breeze, some decent music being played, and the company of good friends.  Perhaps they could think about modifying their policy so that you're entitled to one beer sample, as long as you order a full beer.  The bartender stated the reason for the no sample policy was because of Covid... I just do not buy it, given the fact that None of the bars/restaurants that I have gone to the last couple of months have this type of policy.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: So found this pizza joint in Pflugerville and it did not let me down. Unfortunately I didn't get a pic of the wall of beers since I ate outside to enjoy the cool Texas breeze. The pretzel sticks were hot from the oven. The carnivore pizza had enough meat for four pizzas so come ready to eat. I must say the Hefeweizen was very good and close enough to remind you of Germany if you've been. They have have local bands playing nightly so there's also entertainment. The locals know and if you ever take a trip to the area now you do too.

reviews.author: Wendy T.
reviews.description: Great pizza and bar! Lots of outside seating and lots of options on tap for beers and ciders. I really enjoy their pepperoni rolls.   First time coming here - you order at the bar, they give you a number, and then you take it to whatever table is available and that you choose. Look at the food menu before you come because the food menu is only visible at the counter/bar that you order from. The only bummer to the whole experience was that the number they gave us was not the number they gave the kitchen so the food got lost for a little bit because they were looking for a different number. We got it figured out and it was still delicious!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: Service was awesome. Beers were delicious. We ordered Hawaiian pizza rolls and a carnivore calzone. They split the calzone so it was two separate smaller calzones instead which was awesome. The only thing we recommend is the calzone and pizza rolls might have been slightly over cooked as the top of the crusts were very dark and tough. Probably because they cooked it in the same oven and temperature as the pizzas which makes sense. But this wasn't an issue and the food was still great. Loved our experience

reviews.author: Ruth L.
reviews.description: Well the last time we were here October 13, we did not have good service ... we never got our wings and the young lady who took our payment was rude and judgmental... she accused our son of being "sexist " because he ask her about her drinking preference which she responded as wine rather then beer and he simply made the comment ... women generally prefer wine and she accused him of being sexist... very unprofessional but we decided we would give it another try the food was delicious but we again had to ask for our wings... good potential here but they need to make some adjustments to their customer service

reviews.author: Selena V.
reviews.description: LET ME START THIS OFF BY SAYING I AM A FOODIE and HAVE EXPECTATIONS THAT I AM NOT PROUD OF BUT I COME FROM A CULINARY BACKGROUND...  This is my favorite place to come with my fiancé. We bring all of our friends here. Holly is a delightful bartender who has gone above and beyond for us.   Wonderful selections of beer, cider, wine, kombucha, etc..  For food, go with any flavor the wings (lemon pepper and garlic parm are my favorite). The pizza rolls are divine and freshly made. You also can't go wrong with the pizza.   They also have live music and outside seating. Perfect place for date night or to chill with friends. I HIGHLY recommend it.

reviews.author: General Z.
reviews.description: Love the bar haven't tried the food yet but I love their drinks. I always bring my growler to fill it up and sometimes They have different flavors of cider and I'd only drink cider I'm still trying to find my beer That I like. Definitely would go again. hopefully I can try the food when I have the time to stop by and eat. I definitely recommend to people to come here and enjoy the food and the drinks and have good company and A good time

reviews.author: Janice J.
reviews.description: The beer selection here is unmatched in the area....and they have tons of cider, seltzer, wine, and non-alcoholic selections too! The pizza is actually quite good (and I'm a midwestern pizza snob) and the service honestly really makes it. Their servers are so friendly and all throughout the COVID restrictions, they followed the protocols and managed to still make it a fun place to go to. We even hit up a couple of Trivia nights with friends on accident and scored some gift cards and had a blast. My only reason for taking a star off were the wings. We tried them a couple of times but the thick, rubbery fat and lack of crispiness were big turnoffs - seemed like they weren't fried but maybe baked? In any case not good. We've got plenty of other deliciousness there, though, so we just order everything else!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: They have a great assortment of beer, wine and ciders to offer, as well as delicious pizza! The establishment is always clean and a really nice hangout. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable too!

reviews.author: Jennifer K.
reviews.description: We visited here 3 times before posting this review. Underwhelmed is my best description. All times, the beertenders have not been very friendly. This last time, the beertender sat taking our order (yes, he was sitting behind the bar) and had no suggestions or enthusiasm.  There is no way to order without going inside the bar. During covid, there should be options for this!  The pizza is okay. If you are looking for pepperoni rolls, Pinthouse are much better in my opinion.  We may return for specific beers, but it won't be on our regular rotation with other options in the area.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: The pizza here is so good. It's always a hit with the family. This is visit #2 for us and we'll be back again.    During CoVid, you can opt for curbside contactless pickup to make things easy.   You can get 32 or 64 oz growlers along with some delicious food. Pizza and wings were a hit for the family tonight.

name: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: A.J. T.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while walking the area as my car was being worked on across the way. Walking in gave me comforting coffeeshop vibes, with mostly tables of small parties 2-3 drinking beer and socializing.  Having no idea what to order, staff made some recommendations for a flight that were all fantastic. My favorites were the Cuerno Rojo (lightly carbonated and very smooth) and the Continental Breakfast (heavier stout but tastes just like French Toast and Maple syrup). I had to do a double take that I wasn't just drinking syrup but the flavors were spot on!  I'll be back again with friends/family and hopefully get to enjoy the great coffee I was smelling as well!

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Not sure where to fault this place, honestly. First time here and the three beers we tried were excellent: a nitro double IPA, an black ale, and a Czech pilz. The interior ambiance was dark, cozy, and perfect for an intimate convo, remote work, or even games with friends. I have two small children so helped myself to the outdoor covered and heated patio. The kids enjoyed the chips and salsa while we sipped our stellar brews. Excited to try the Leander location that is actually closer to us. 10/10 plan to come back, especially to try the coffee.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Just wanted to update this one. Red Horn just gets better and better with age and has really turned into a community institution - especially during the pandemic when they switched to "to go" beers that we could all take out to the parking lot and drink while socially distanced. Fortunately those days are past us but I think I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place that was a little bit of sanity amidst all the insanity.   As for the fare itself? The beers rotate and you can't  go wrong because they will always let you sample (I'm a strawberry pop-tart ravioli fan - and yes that's a beer). Pair that beer (or wine) with a meat and cheese tray or maybe a panini and you have absolutely nothing to complain about. They even have food trucks on most days...  Thanks for being here Red Horn.

reviews.author: Gerald C.
reviews.description: very cool atmosphere with both a brewery and coffee shop vibe mashed together without clashing. I got the Gordon Ramsey coffee and it was obviously made by someone who knows how to craft a latte. I do wish the flavor complimented the espresso more or punched above the espresso. It was too balanced, if that's even a thing. I will definitely return next time i'm in town to see what pieces of coffee art they come up with next!

reviews.author: Mert S.
reviews.description: I liked the ambience, coffee was good. Outdoors seating is great but the generator of the food truck next door was unbearably too loud to enjoy outside, we did not even bother trying. I did not care about the live music either, we were yelling at each other to get our word across the table. We ended up leaving 30 mins after the live music started. That was a Friday night.

reviews.author: Garrett N.
reviews.description: Love me some Red Horn coffee!   The atmosphere and service are both outstanding.  Any questions I had about coffee were answered, the help was super helpful.  Really appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating.  Really live the tables and decor, rustic hand built feel but comfortable.  Snack food is overpriced but everything else is top notch.

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: We chose Red Horn Coffee after perusing local coffee spots for some good coffee. Red Horn was very highly rated and the photos looked like they offered genuine espresso beverages. Red Horn offered a number of non-dairy options so I would not destroy my stomach on my pending road trip. We ordered Americans with a half inch of steamed oat milk. The coffee was very smooth. The espresso taste was still solid enough that I knew I was drinking espresso. I.e. Not watered down at all. All-in-all a great cup of coffee that hit the spot.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: Superb beer bat and coffee roastery in Cedar Park.  Convenient to HEB and Walmart.    Great service and great coffee!  We will return.

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I'll be back soon!! One of the best coffees I've had, so good I had two during my short stay here. It's hard to find decaf that isn't boring and the decaf here is strong and full of flavor! I even purchased a pound of decaf beans to take home.   I pulled up and my first thought was that the vibe was more brewery than coffee shop and I was right, but I was wrong that the coffee would just be an afterthought. When I went on a Saturday early afternoon, there was a taco truck and people hanging out in the beer garden. Lots of bicyclists and not sure if it's a popular rest stop or because there's a bike shop in the same parking lot or both or something else. Once you step inside there is a giant section of beer taps and beer menu, and a small coffee and pastry menu. They also sell ice cream here which was tempting but I stuck to my americano and later a vanilla latte.   The inside has plenty of socially distanced seating as does the outside and I lucked out with a parking spot right out front. There's a large lot of shared parking for the businesses.   I want to come back to check out their beers!!

reviews.author: Ann Marie M.
reviews.description: Best coffee house in town. Great coffee and they also have beer on tap. Very laid back atmosphere and nice people. No snotty hipsters. Cheese boards, sandwiches are good.

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places to grab a few beer. They always excellent elections, we love the space and the people. So beer....good; but man their roasted coffee! We love using their Roadhouse in our French press.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: Sometime I struggle to decide if I want coffee or beer here, and at happy hour I am definitely know to order both! You will not be disappointed. An excellent coffee shop in the morning to meet with co-workers to do some brainstorming with excellent coffee or a wonder patio for a chill evening and great beer or wine. They have a great menu to pick from too, so you not stuck with just pretzels. I personally like the vegetable panini, and my husband like the cheese board.

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: Fantastic coffee house and brewery with inside and outside space located at parmer and 1431. You can get coffee, lattes, and cappuccino served anytime or also buy their beans to go.   They usually have 30+ taps of delicious craft beer which 10-15 being their beers with other guest beers also. They normally have cans to go and they will do growler fills as well. Its unusual to find a place that has both really good beer and great coffee but Red Horn is just that. There are a few slightly more secluded tables where I'll see people working remotely quite often. Most weekends you can find a local artist performing live music too.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: I have been going to Red Horn for the past few years and don't know how I've forgotten to give them the credit they deserve! Not only is their coffee delicious they have a great variety of beers to choose from. They have recently expanded their outdoor seating which is covered so great for all hours of the day. Parking is sometimes limited but it speaks for its self on how many people love coming here. It's a great place to study, relax, and meet up with friends but get there before rush hour if you wanna snag a good seat inside. Clean environment and staff is very friendly! Also, great music

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Sat outside on their extended patio that goes onto the parking lot so tables can be socially distanced. Dog friendly and gave water bowls to the pups. Had a pretty solid number of beers on tap! Didn't have coffee but it smelt good. Salads, sandwiches, and snacks are available. We just had chips and salsa and it was decent. Restrooms were super clean! Huge win for me.   I'd come back for beers if I'm the area.

reviews.author: Cindy D.
reviews.description: We used to stop in here almost every weekend to have coffee before my granddaughters soccer game. And today we came in order to 2 hot cup of coffees and they were Luke warm cups. And unfavorable to say the least we have had better.

reviews.author: Preetesh V.
reviews.description: I love the chilled back vibe and the fact that it is so close to my neighborhood. We typically invite our friends to this place if we are looking for a venue closer to our home to hang out and catch up over few drinks. Their options for in house brews is fairly decent. They have decent size indoor seating available where in live music is performed from time to time. Additionally they have small outdoor seating area. During the pandemic, they stood up temporary outdoor tents to accommodate people who wish to seat outside. The food option is decent and limited to few comfort food options.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: This is a great place to go for coffee - their nitro is great and it's a nice atmosphere with a lot of outdoor seating!

reviews.author: Mitsy V.
reviews.description: Since our move to the Round Rock area, we discovered a hidden treasure of Coffee and libations nestled behind a Brushy Creek corner-- Great Coffee but a fun vibe to stimulate mood beyond caffeine.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: When we first moved here, the lady was super nice to my daughter. Weeks later, I walked in with our service tiny chihuahua dog (since there's a sign that says "we welcome service dogs" so I went in and ordered coffee and as soon as I began to wait for my coffee to be ready so I could take it to go there is this man that was very abrasive behind the counter and I miss felt like I was in the principals office and he said that dogs are not allowed in the facility.  He was very abrasive embarrassing and in my face. I personally think if you don't allow dogs at all then take the service sign dog off the window. It's a shame because that's very close place for us to get coffee but I don't want to have that feeling again.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

name: Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: This place is a ton bigger than I expected! Picnic style seating on the inside and a great, comfortable bar area. There's TVs all around the restaurant, so you can catch all the football games! Beer selection covers something for everyone and they had frozen wine drinks that looked good. Half off beer pitchers on Thursday's and half off sangria on sundays.   I've never been one to rave about a salad, but omg the dressing on the Greek salad was out of this world. Even my man was in love and ended up hogging it from me.   I was there to kill time before a baseball, but will most definitely be back for pizza and game watching!

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.description: We have been to Tony's C for several years now at the Cedar Park location so when they opened up this one , we were we excited because we only live about 6 minutes away .   Unfortunately our to go order was very disappointing. We order a LG Mama Mia and a $9.99 Caesar salad , when we got home " 6 mins drive " the pizza was cold , and the salad was wilted, looked old . It's a shame because we love this place so much . At almost $40 ? Definitely not worth it .

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: The garlic rolls were burnt. I threw the Pizza away it was RAW!  Called manager for a refund she said I had to deal with Uber Eats.  It's was Tony's Pizza that burnt the rolls ( tasted like rubber) and served up raw Pizza.   Will never go back!!!

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have eaten here a few times and always an excellent dining experience at Tony C's Pizza and Beer Garden. Super friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and all public areas are spotlessly clean! This visit The Mr. ordered a small house side salad, which was was a very generous size. He ordered Build Your Own Pizza: pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and red onions. I ordered the meat lasagna...large enough portion to feed two people. Love the marinara used in the lasagna. It was very light, fresh, and not sweet. (Some places add a lot of sugar to their pasta sauce not Tony C's). Not ordered this visit, but make sure you get the mozzarella sticks, made fresh in house, not Sysco Foods frozen. Photos of those beauties are in my previous review.

reviews.author: J C.
reviews.description: Their pizza is delicious! Be careful because the delivery fee is very high during the checkout.  That aside we love there food. One day we will dine in to see what else they got.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: We used Door Dash. I added a note to modify my order and they did it exactly the way I asked. Excellent customer service.   The pizza was very different than anything I've had in Austin. Excellent crust, quality toppings and definitely all fresh ingredients. The Carnivore was just spicy enough to make you want to keep going back for more and the Truffle was not your average fake truffle oil flavored pizza. The mild hints of blue cheese and fontina took this over the top!    Support local and eat their pizza - it's delicious!

reviews.author: Felicia L.
reviews.description: I really do enjoy this place and the atmosphere (solid jams happens and my little family loves to sing and dance to them).  I absolutely am in love with the truffle pizza and their pepperoni rolls! Why they have four stars...I hate on the app if you want ranch instead of red sauce it doesn't allow you to adjust and if I'm ordering a family size pepperoni roll dish (which is over 12 rolls) I get two or three small ranches, and any additional I have to pay for (.50 a piece). I wish they would fix the issue or relax on the ranch.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Loved popping in to this spot for a quick drink at the bar while we waited for out of town family to arrive. We're from Houston, but have been here to visit several times and...THEIR PIZZA IS BOMB!   Great family place-covers all bases and tastes. Friendly, fun atmosphere with 50's and 69's music playing often. Pizza is even good for takeout, which is quite popular, as well! They also offer salads and LASAGNA! (Marinara or Alfredo sauces) - see my photo of the menu for details!  TONS of seating - long tables for large groups. Nearby, newly-opened LaQuinta Hotel's guests , including sports teams, families, conference attendees, and other large parties, will love coming here, not just for the seating and atmosphere, BUT FOR THE PIZZA!!!  We visit Austin regularly, and always make it a point to visit-whether we dine in, or bring it back with us-that is, provided it makes it back...whole, lol.

reviews.author: Oscar R.
reviews.description: Absolutely phenomenal pizza!!! The wifey and I arrived 30 minutes after they opened, we were the second customers there. We ordered the chicken Parmesan pizza as recommended by our cashier and an order of garlic knots. It was a great recommendation.   The garlic knots came out first. They were so warm, soft and garlic buttery! They came with their house made marinara, which was sooo good! Those poor garlic knots were gone just as quick as they arrived.  When the pizza came out, it looked amazing but I was a little concerned the chicken Parmesan might be a bit dry because it kind of looked that way. Let me tell you, the pizza was spot on! The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, definitely not dry. The crust on the pizza was amazing!!! I'm craving it again as I write this review!  The atmosphere was also laid back. They had beautiful wood bench seating, which could accommodate a large party/gathering if the place is not to busy. Service was also excellent.  Honestly, the best pizza I've had in a while! I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for delicious pizza!

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: Delicious!!! We finally got a chance to try this place out. It definitely looks nice from the outside. Beer garden in Round Rock? Yes please! Ordering online and pick up is easy! I scheduled my pick up order in advance so I wouldn't forget.  Food was delicious. No complaints. Really enjoyed the sauce that came with the garlic knots and calamari. Gelato was satisfying. Looking forward to trying another pizza soon!

reviews.author: Braden W.
reviews.description: Service was A+ and the food was even better!!!!  We went here after all the Kalahari restaurants were booked, highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: Amazing pizza if you are nervous about trying new pizza don't. This place is amazing. perfect amount of sauce. Honestly everything was amazing about these pizzas! Going back every tuesday!! When you walk in you order before you sit down so be prepared for that if you have ordering anxiety but 10 out of 10 recommended!!!

reviews.author: Carol N.
reviews.description: My husband is a pizza snob. Seriously. The staff here recognizes us now. I would say that's a pretty good sign that we go here often.  Here's what I don't like about this place: cheap, thin napkins and stingy thin plates. Also, If you have unwrapped straws, please buy a dispenser for it. It's really not sanitary in the first place, but with COVID, can you purchase wrapped straws please? I do appreciate the conscious effort to recycle. Please ditch the cheap paper goods and maybe use reusable metal pizza pans for plates or something. Also, I don't think I ever see lids for the cups. Again, perhaps consider plastic reusable cups.  What we do like: mozzarella sticks, pizza rolls, THE PIZZA, did I mention the mozzarella sticks ;) I don't like them trying to upsell ranch, but I get it. Also like the availability of pizza boxes for leftover pizza and lids for sauces.  We'll be back. Don't worry about my 4 star rating and comments about the paper goods. If we lived closer, I wouldn't insist on dining in.

reviews.author: Metra J.
reviews.description: I'm not from TX but when I'm here I love to stop in here and get some great pizza and beer.  Pepperoni is my fav but I had to get the motz, basil and tomato on the margarita pizza.  Manager Shanna came by to check on us which was great, she is super sweet and took the time to have a conversation with my toddler as he told her how many rocks he found and how much he loves pizza.

reviews.author: Rhea S.
reviews.description: We were starving so the pizza isn't full and a picture of the fried ravioli is absent. My boyfriend and I had a great time at the the new local pizza joint. We shared the largest size pizza, split a fried ravioli app, and gelato. We also enjoyed a few drinks on HH.  We usually go to slapbox for local pizza, but dare I say it, this place has better pizza in my opinion! Not as greasy and it's closer to us. Their HH runs from 5-7. My boyfriend got 2 October fest beers and I had a glass of PG, a frozen bellini and a sangria, which were all $2-3 off depending on the drink. The frozen bellini was very good and I don't normally drink frozen drinks. I did not care for the sangria at all, though.   Everyone was very friendly. In regards to COVID, everything was very clean from what I saw.   Shoutout to the manager, Catalina! She was very genuine in her table checks and we both believe she's a great asset to their team in QC.

reviews.author: DeAnna H.
reviews.description: Yum yum yum! My family of four shared a 12" pepperoni pizza and it was sooo good! We also orders the garlic knots which were also fantastic but look more like cinnamon rolls than garlic knots. Then, we tried the vanilla, chocolate and strawberry gelato. The vanilla is more of a rich vanilla bean flavor so it's an acquired taste (my husband loved it, I didn't care for it)  my daughter loved the chocolate (said it was better than Baskin-Robbins) and I had the strawberry. The strawberry was so delicious. Sweet, soft and airy with the perfect amount of tart to it. The restaurant was industrial looking, open concept and very clean. All the staff were friendly and attentive. Wish we had one of these where we live!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Stopped for lunch here today. This has kind of a Pinthouse Pizza vibe (but more sterile/family oriented and less Austin-ie). Service was great, place was clean, and they seem to be taking COVID restrictions seriously.   The pizza was pretty good. Not as good as Slapbox/600 Degrees but just a notch below (on par with Pinthouse). Came out quick and was hot. Beer selection was pretty good - had a local brewery Oktoberfest.   All in all, worth returning and will try to nudge my kids into agreeing to go here instead of Hat Creek next door.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Made our way in last weekend to give this place a try. The restaurant was extremely clean and nicely decorated.   Food: we tried the toasted ravioli, garlic knots, Italian chopped salad and pizza. The food came out quickly and was very tasty. While the prices were not cheap, I do think you get a good value for what you pay for.   The only improvement we'd suggest is letting customers open a tab and be able to order both food and drinks on it. We were told they're already working on this though!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: What's the best food when you're lazy and it's cold outside? Takeout pizza! I placed the order Saturday morning for an afternoon pickup. I ordered the 12" carnivore pizza and it definitely satisfied my cravings. The carnivore has salami, pepperoni, sausage, meatballs, pizza sauce, mozzarella, and calabrian peppers. There were a lot of spices, which made it quite flavorful. If you like meat on meat on meat...this pizza is for you!   Service was great! I went inside, instead of using the curbside option, to pickup the pizza from their takeout counter. They greeted me right away and had my pizza ready on time. I appreciated their organization. The inside of the restaurant looks really cute with long family style tables, TVs, and a warm atmosphere. I look forward to dining in the restaurant next time.

reviews.author: Cindy B.
reviews.description: I'll take everything to-go ! I was here for there opening week . Then I got hooked and I visit once weekly. There's lasagna, salads and PIZZA! Also beer if your slightly into that.  Great place for takeout, not sure if they have delivery?  I usually order ahead and pick up curbside now during covid. However, still have gone inside for a sangria or two and wait on my order.

name: URBAN Eat.Drink
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick Sunday brunch with some girl friends! We made a reservation and the put our name on the table which made it feel personalized.   Everyone got pitchers of mimosas but I'm pregnant so not drinking. They all enjoyed them!   All the food that came out looked amazing. I wasn't really feeling anything crazy but the items i got were delicious! The biscuit was fluffy and flakey and everything i wanted.   The sausages were actually huge and so filling. There was a nice flakey crunch to the outside of them which i wasn't expecting but enjoyed. The service was great and so were the portion to cost ratios! Well worth it!

reviews.author: Edward A.
reviews.description: My wife and I were looking for a new place to eat on Saturday after a long day of running around. We found this place on Yelp.  The staff was not friendly.  They were not outright rude, but not very hospitable. Nobody smiled throughout the evening. Definetly did not feel welcome.   I ordered the burger and fries.  It was probably one of the worst burgers I've had.   There needs to be a balance between meat, bread, and veggies.  The burger was under cooked and  too big for the bun.  The veggies were minimal and soaked in blood from the burger.    My wife had the hot chicken sandwich.  That was better, but a mess to eat.    My son had the Mac n cheese with fruit.  The Mac was a thick gooey mess with large elbow pasta. Very hard to spoon out.  Not easy for a 3 year old to eat.  Also, quite salty.   We don't plan on returning.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Saw really great reviews for this place so we decided to check it out for brunch! They had live music in the outside area.  The brunch food was just average, I think this might be a better spot for dinner. I had a Bloody Mary and it tasted like watery tomato juice with no spice or horseradish. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits - he really liked the shrimp on it but the grits didn't have much flavor. The best item that we had was the appetizer of chips and queso but we subbed fries instead of chips - SO yummy. The queso was spicy and the fries were so crispy.   We would probably go back for dinner and drinks to see if it's better!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: This place was okay. Had live music which was the best part. This location is only on the ground, no cool rooftop view. The food was okay. The service was slow, I assume understaffed. The drinks were overpriced.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here only once before and it wasn't too too great. I decided to give it another try and I am amazed! One of the best burgers that I've had in a while! The fries paired perfectly with the ranch and the sweet tea was so good! I only had to wait 17 minutes for my food to get out. I will definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Adam L.
reviews.description: The folks on staff were all quite nice, but that's about the extent of the good for our experience.  I got a chicken sandwich and my wife got the ribs.  Both were pretty much flavorless and dry, even with sauce.  All in with 2 drinks, soups and meals it was $100 before tip.  The fries were great, but otherwise I don't think I'll bother visiting again.  I wish them the best and may make a trip again just to check in and see if they've sorted stuff out.

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: This place is cool! The vibe is fun and they have a fair selection of foods. The bacon wrapped quail is to die for!   Our service was a little slow when we ate here. My BLT also had a weird herb flavor to it that I wasn't fond of, others may enjoy it. I personally felt it was a little overpowering.   I recommend eating outdoors as it is in a nice part of downtown round rock

reviews.author: Kevin E.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and our sever was amazing! That's were the good in this breakfast putting with my daughter ends.  Highly disappointed in our actual meal. I ordered Shrimp and Grits and she ordered the Full Monty (American sampler)  Our food was all cold nothing hot or remotely warm. They didn't seem too busy so maybe they are working out some expediting issues. My grits were mediocre at best maybe if they were warm that would be different and the shrimp was fishy and rubbery. I've never had grits that were like a smear on the bottom of the bowl/plate but that's exactly what this was.  My daughter said her eggs tasted off and her fruit was clearly on the brink of, if not already spoiled. The best thing on the plate was the potatoes  I'd give them another shot just maybe not for brunch this time.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We hadn't been by here in a little while and we're looking to go somewhere different than "the usual".   The good: We were seated quickly and there were quite a few staff in the restaurant to help so we didn't have to really wait that long for anything. In fact, once's we're done my wife said, "we should start looking for the bill" and here comes the waitress with the bill. This is really surprising in light of the challenges that other restaurants are having with staffing.   I like that this place is in downtown round rock and I like the overall aesthetic with wood beams on the ceilings and the house converted to restaurant feel.   I got a special off of their hatch chili menu and it was very tasty and a pretty decent sized piece of fish.   The not so good: While the food was tasty, I was missing some of the expected hatch chili flavor that I would expect to find when ordering something off a hatch chili menu  My wife's fish was a little tough, but again the flavor was good  If you get cold easily, make sure to bring a sweater. The temperature was pretty frigid and because of the small floor for the restaurant there wasn't really a way to find a spot where the you don't get blown on by the AC.   Wrap-up: All in all the food and service were good. A few tweaks and I think this could be a 5-star review.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now I really like the atmosphere it's really calming every time I come.  The customer service to outstanding food and let me not forget the drinks yum.  - happy hour here is a must I paid $6 for my tequila ole fashion yes you heard me right.  It was the most unique drink I've had by far I really appreciate the bar tender going out of her way to make the most delicious drink. FYI I had to have two lmao the ice cube was crystal clear made the drink even more interesting to drink  - overall I always have a great time here whether it's brunch , lunch or a date night great place to a have a good time ( no I did not get drunk lmao )

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: Came for brunch with few friends on a random Saturday and thank goodness we came to round rock. What a charming downtown they have and this place we perfect. Heaters for the fall outdoor seating, amazing entertainment and the food and bev were great.

reviews.author: Paulette A.
reviews.description: Charmingly rustic interior and good food but overpriced for the portion size and mediocre service.    Staff were friendly but noticeably uninterested as some were preoccupied scrolling on their phones and others even hanging out at the bar. Our waitress was at least attentive.   For food I ordered the salmon frittata, and the hubs got the pork belly hash and a $5 orange juice that was clearly brand made and from a bottle that probably cost just as much as the charge of the 8oz we were served. Flavor wise, my food was delicious tho slightly salty. However upon arriving to the table, the pork belly hash looked smaller than my entree. For $16 you'd expect strips of pork belly on top of the sweet potato hash - what you really get is 10% protein, 20% dry biscuit, 30% hash, and 40% arugula garnish. Redeeming quality was the perfectly poached egg.   Definitely a happy hour/small bites spot but wouldn't recommend for brunch or a full meal. For $50, much left to be desired

reviews.author: Madi T.
reviews.description: Here's the Tea. Everyone else's meal looked great. Lots of food everyone seemed to love it. That said, I ordered the eggs Benedict and let me Tell you. What a let down. It was like one thin deli sliced ham on and English muffin with an underdone poached egg and barely any hollandaise. It was more like eating eggs on toast. Now the potatoes; they could've been great. They were fine. But the peppers with the potatoes were not cooked and more thrown in just because. Not only that the music outside was too loud to have a conversation. I wish my experience was better, but mayyyybe I'll try it again with something else on the menu? I don't know.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: My fiancé, baby and I came here for a nice Friday night on the town. We had heard how great it was and was anxious to check it out for ourselves. Upon checking in we were told there was a 45 minute wait...fair enough. We walked to Finley's to grab a quick drink. We were both surprised when we got a text only within 20 mins! When we came back we were greeted by the hostess who was an absolute doll and showed to our table up front. Let me just say - customer service was top notch. Exactly was we hoped for. Our waiter Chandler was amazing! For an appetizer we ordered the bacon wrapped quail. It was superb. We both enjoyed it very much. For our entrees I had a side Caesar salad and the Dry Aged Ribeye (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake), my fiancé had the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop (with asparagus and a cheddar potato cake) and for our 2 year old we ordered a kids meal with Mac and Cheese and Fries.  Let's start with the Pecan Smoked Pork Chop. While it was the tastiest of our entrees it was just a bit slightly overcooked...but delicious despite that. Okay on to the ribeye. I get this is not a steakhouse so I probably shouldn't have ordered it, but I had a craving. For the $45 price tag we were very disappointed. The thin cut steak very under-seasoned. The "cheddar potato cake" was just okay...its basically a mound of mashed potatoes with a cheddar crisp on top. The asparagus was okay but I like the small asparagus better and these were ginormous.  I noticed the baby wasn't eating his mac and cheese and wondered why. It looked like it came from a generic box and once I tasted it I learned why. Oddly enough the dish tasted like it had vinegar in it!! My fiancé tasted it and said the same thing. We even let Chandler know when we were leaving.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: We were Celebrating my daughters both getting new great jobs this week. We wanted a special dinner and we selected this great place. Reservations for 10 were easy as we called first thing today. They save a great table for us. Very nice touch.   We started with a few apps that was great. The chips and dip was perfect.
