Everyone loved the main courses and the plates were cleared.   We ate inside but went outside after to listen to the singer for a few songs. We love live music and it is so great to have it back.   Great night with family.

reviews.author: Tia R.
reviews.description: First time visiting Urban but decided to check it out on a whim because I was nearby. When I arrived it was happy hour so ordered a cocktail. Called the Passion Project which was delightfully delicious! A bit on the sweet side but yummy nonetheless. It was a cold day so decided on a cup of tortilla soup... unfortunately I was accidentally bought the tomato soup which is pictured as well... I didn't taste it but it smelled delicious. The waitress was kind when I let her know the incorrect soup was brought and quickly brought out the tortilla soup. The soup seasoned well and perfectly warmed however tasted liked chicken soup with tortilla strips. I also ordered the Urban chopped salad with salmon... it was huge! Lol! The salmon was a bit dry and not really flavorful but once chopped over the salad all of the the flavors blended well together. All in all I enjoyed  my time at Urban... the service was fast, staff was friendly, and the overall ambiance was nice! I'd definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter and I enjoyed a Saturday brunch at Urban to celebrate her Halloween birthday. We arrived a few minutes ahead of our noon reservation but were seated promptly outdoors and were told our server would be there soon. Then we waited...and waited.    Once our server arrived with waters in hand, things ran more smoothly. My daughter had a full Monte and I had shrimp and grits. The food was attractively plated and tasted great. My shrimp was spicy, and there was plenty of bacon in the dish. The only thing that seemed out of place was the redeye gravy around the edge of the cheesy grits. It really added nothing.   There are plenty of menu choices, including vegetarian and gluten free items. Prices are a bit on the high side for some things and reasonable on others. But the food was good for us so I'd definitely return. This would have been a 5 star review had we not waited so long before a waitperson visited.

reviews.author: Yolanda R.
reviews.description: The food was great! Live music was amazing. The waiter was okay ( not too good) but Toya the girl walking around asking people if we needed anything made up for the waiter. Toya was great, she was happy, friendly and had great customer service.  We definitely recommend this place. Toya and the food deserve the 5 star! Thank you Toya!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Food was pretty decent, service was great, nice outdoor patio, menu had a lot of options and the bartender was squeezing fresh fruit juice for the cocktails. Happy hour has $8 bar bites and drink specials. Would visit again! We got the chicken fried steak, pork chop and fried chicken hot sandwich. The hot honey sauce was AMAZING - spice only hits you at the end, and the dishes had the right level of crisp.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: My wife and along with some friends went to Urban Eats for the first time in a couple years and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. This s not a fancy place but very welcoming and casual. We decided to try the covered outside area and even though it was pretty hot, the fans and breeze made it very comfortable.  We discovered they have a happy hour Tuesday-Saturday which is pretty unusual in my experience. The menu is creative and utilizes locally sourced suppliers and though it is not a huge selection, it is varied, offering some seafood, steak, pork chop, salads, soups and starters. We had  grilled shrimp, quinoa salad, tortilla soup and side salads. Service was very attentive without making us feel rushed. Live music started at 7 which was another pleasant surprise.  We were amazed how much this part of downtown Round Rock has really developed. Parking was easy, the area is very walkable and Main Street entertainment district nearby.  Urban Eats is definitely a repeater for us! Give it a try and support a great local business.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: This is such a cool place! I planned an outing in Cedar Park with a group of my girlfriends. After our outing at the Ecuadorian chocolate factory, we needed a place that could accommodate a fairly large group of friends during lunch time on a Friday (a task that seemed.... yikes). I am very thankful I stumbled across The Good Lot on Yelp! I reached out to make sure The Good Lot could accommodate us, and they said "Of Course" and let me know that all of the trucks would be out on Friday.    When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find several open food trucks and a large building (see, beer bar). People had their dogs outside and everyone seemed to be having a good time.   Between all of us, we tried every food truck. I personally got Four Brothers Venezuelan Kitchen. I am a sucker for good Venezuelan food. I got a Pulled pork Bowl with extra garlic sauce, black beans, avocado, sweet plantains, and all the fixings. I would definitely eat here again. I tried a few samples from other food trucks as well.   Everyone left super happy. This is a great place to go if you have a casual group looking for a quick bite and place to hang out.    The next day (Saturday), I swung by the dog park across the street and stopped by again for lunch on my way home. They have trivia nights, live music over the weekends, and happy hour all day on Monday. Please build another location close to Fort Hood. A copy and paste of exactly what you already created would be great. ;). I promise to stop by weekly.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: I made the drive up to Cedar Park and my friend was excited to take me here as it had just opened up and seemed to add a streak of cool to my friend's new neighborhood. So, it was midweek around 8pm and while the patio had plenty of folks and there was music going the food trucks were done and they weren't too courteous about letting it be known they were closed or out of food or closing up.   So, the taps were open which allowed me to try out a beer. The staff pouring were definitely friendly, letting me know some of their personal favorites on tap as well as letting me try some out. I did also appreciate that they had some NA options as well and I liked the kombucha they had on tap so much I had two more of those instead of the more adult beverage options they had.  If there was a way to have some of the bar staff cross train with the food truck staff it would make a huge improvement.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is pretty cool.   They have a partial circle of food trucks about 5 or 5.  Various choices of food trucks that all serve really damn good food.  We ordered from 3 of the trucks and everything was awesome. Each trucks menu is limited but they do it well!  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is a wonderful addition to the CP area. Bring your kiddos and your hounds sit outside under the shade or on their covered patio.    Cocktails anyone? I was surprised at their expansive craft beer options. Check out their rotating taps at: https://thegoodlotcp.com/beergarden/drinks/  There are wine, seltzer, and non-acholohol options as well.  When we visited there were 3 food truck options; Yard Bird, Oink, and our favorite The Rice is Right.    Be aware on weekends and when there is live music parking will be a challenge. This has been a point of contention with the neighbors and according to the Good Lot, they are looking to expand the parking area.    Pro tip: Don't park in the adjoining neighborhood park 5 minutes away at the Veterans Memorial Park. Stretch your legs on the way there and work off that beer on the way back.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Food trucks are delicious. Wish there was one or two more but that will come with time. The beer selection is great, mimosas as well. Outside area is clean, and safe for kids. Glad this place opened up! It's a little gem!!

reviews.author: Oak Z.
reviews.description: As far as I can tell, The Good Lot only has 5 star reviews and for good reason.  It is a great beer garden with plenty of non-beer options as well.  I have always passed by the place and noticed how busy it is most weeknights and especially weekends, but I am certainly pleased with what it brings to the community.  Generally it gets pretty busy after 6PM until close, and parking can be difficult to find.  Carpooling or taking a rideshare would be the best way to do it in my opinion as I would hate to park in front of someone else's house in the nice neighborhoods nearby.  Certainly a parking lot expansion is something the owners are considering as that is my only issue with the place especially when it gets busy.  That being said, it is always a great atmosphere with a variety of food and drink options.  There are also always lots of dogs in the grassy area by the patio and it is nice to see how family-friendly the place is.  I will certainly be back and bring some friends in the future!

reviews.author: Rain S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place and plan on visiting more in the future. They have a great beer selection, multiple food trucks and decent amount of seating! I happened to visit on a Tuesday and to my delight, they had trivia. I think this place is a great option if you are hoping to grab a beer and chill!

reviews.author: Dane S.
reviews.description: My daughter and I visited The Good Lot yesterday (8/8/21).  It's the new and hot food truck and bar spot in Cedar Park TX (2500 W New Hope). The Good Lot has a main building with a large dining area enclosed by glass garage doors that open and a bar that has numerous beers, ales, ciders, and craft sodas.  It's nestled among the oak trees. There is a nice amount of paved parking and gravel lot parking.   The Good Lot also has dining areas under the oaks along with a game area (corn hole) and a playground for the kids with a large wooden teepee for climbing.  They are dog friendly.   The Good Lot had 4 food trucks.  We chose The Rice Is Right that serves Korean inspired rice boxes and other items.  We ordered the crispy chicken box and the cauliflower box.  Both items were perfectly fried and coated in a sweet and spicy Korean sauce.  Flavor was amazing.  The boxes came with steamed white rice and a purple cabbage slaw.  The portions were large and more than enough food for us. There were other food trucks that served Mediterranean, Pork, and Chicken.  The menus look good and I will explore those in the future.  The Good Lot and The Rice Is Right are on 'My Keepers List'.

reviews.author: Jay Z.
reviews.description: This is a neighborhood friendly indoor/outdoor bar with several food trucks and live music. We came upon it by an invitation from a friend to meet them for a drink. What a wonderful experience. There was a variety of beers on tap and nice small selection of wine by the glass. The food was outstanding. Most importantly the environment and the friendliness of the staff was exceptional.   During our visit we met the owners and their family and it was truly an enjoyable experience. Playing corn hole and chatting with the family was outstanding. Neil and his wife are fantastic.  Do yourself a favor and enjoy and afternoon or evening there. I think you will enjoy it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Good Lot is the new spot to hit up in Cedar Park off New Hope. Food trailers here, beer on tap, covered patio, great outdoor seats and space, place for kids and pets. It has only been open for 3 weeks and the word is getting out. As we were leaving tonight, the park lot was pretty full. Great place to relax with buddies after work or with the family with a wooden teepee for the kids to climb and corn hole. Head over to The Good Lot and get some food from The Rice is Right and Oink Mobile.

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: After we took our dogs to the dog park nearby, we noticed that the Good Lot had finally opened! The beer selection was great, lots of locals including Whitestone, Hedgehog, Red Horn, Family Brewing and (of course) some lovely PHP Jellyfish on tap.  We decided to tried Yaadbird, since we hadn't had any fried chicken in a while. The lemon pepper chicken was on point, crispy, juicy, peppery, a 'lil salty, and everything you need in your fried chicken!  The property is beautiful and well landscaped. The lawn was amazing! It was so fluffy! When we first arrived we just admired the live oak trees and the quality of the grass.. Lawn lovers, you will understand...  The bartenders were very nice and very excited to introduce so many new people to the Good Lot. The owner was all over the bar, pouring drinks, helping staff, and checking with guests, seeming to have time for everyone.  We are looking forward to coming back here and trying the 3 other food trucks, along with the rotating beer menu. Hope they are planning to host more events, as we would love to do an anniversary party here at some point!

reviews.author: Ben F.
reviews.description: Finally, a really great beer garden in Cedar Park. I came on their first "soft public open" day and I'm so glad I did. I've been to about 20 pubs and bars in CP and this one stands head and shoulders above the rest. It's an open air (no AC but there is heat in the winter) with big garage doors that were open and a huge ceiling fan so it was comfortable. There were about 20 taps and 3 of them were not filled yet. I chatted with the owner and she said she was looking for ideas so my friend Greg gave her some. :)  There is plenty of indoor seating. Plus, there is a huge grassy area with picnic tables and even a fire pit. It's family-friendly so no smoking.  There is a playground for the kids and spots for four food trucks although only two were filled.   Beer was about $6 on average so not cheap but not expensive either. $1 off all day on Mondays.   It was an enjoyable experience and a really great ambience. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go since this place opened and we finally got the chance today. No disappointments here! This place is non-smoking, dog-friendly (leashed) and kid-friendly, with a unique play area, six sets of cornhole, and plenty of shaded grassy area to run around in. Tables are wide and comfortable, and the entire patio was open-air, so social distancing is a breeze. We ate at the Oinkmobile truck (delicious) and grabbed local beers and ciders at the patio desk. We walked the fifteen minutes from our house, but it looks like they have a decent-sized parking lot and are working on creating more space. The only downside is that there's no ramp down to the grass/play area, but hopefully they'll make it more accessible in the future. Staff was super friendly, and I can't wait to come back for open mic night. Because yes, we'll be back!!

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Oh my! Visited the Good Lot for the first time on a cool Saturday night in October and was very happy I did. Let's start with the atmosphere - fantastic. Huge outdoor space with picnic tables plastic chairs or plenty of room to bring your own (even saw someone bring their own folding table). Live music was at just the right volume playing just the right kind of classic rock that doesn't offend and always pleases. Beer selection was generous and reasonably priced (not to mention $5 glasses of wine). Had a 50/50 burger at Oink and was BLOWN away. It's half bacon and half beef and all good. Loved it. The bacon Mac and cheese was also delicious but the portion was a little small for $9 (my only complaint of the night). Do yourself a favor and if you're up in the 613 check this place out!!!

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Found out The Good Lot opened last Saturday so we had to head over. We arrived and got in line to get a beer (lots of local options which you love to see!). Once we got a drink, we were lucky enough to snag a table under the fans and the breeze was so nice. They had live music while we were there, which I believe will continue on weekends so that's fun. The lawn looked so nice, chairs to sit in, trees for shade, lawn games for entertainment! There were 4 or 5 food truck options while we were there and while we didn't get any food, all the food we saw coming out looked so good! Definitely recommend stopping by and checking it out!

reviews.author: Anastasia P.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Great service, clean and overall just very nice. Love the live music, dog friendly and outside activities

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Great beer selection! They really should get penny bags hung out because there are SO many flies. They would get 5 stars if there weren't so many flies.  For the owners- they may have different names other places- it's a ziploc bag with water and you put coins in and hang them. If you Google penny bag it will tell you they avoid them because it's bright (thanks Matt for googling!) but I like to think it looks like a spider web to fly eyeballs so they are trying to stay away from a web. Flies probably aren't that smart.. it's probably the light part.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: What a fun local spot here in the CP! Been wanting to come check out for awhile now and finally drive out last night and closed the place down!!! (sorry guys, we were the last ones to leave)  Parking is nuts so plan ahead and maybe carpool... We drive a jeep so we had no issues ... live music and plenty of smiling faces.. service was great, bathrooms were clean... dogs welcome! Plenty of good beers, wines and ciders... gals were so nice behind the bar.. offered samples and were super sweet... good folks, good music and good grub.... my son joined us and grabbed some food from the food trucks... cauliflower wings, shrimp fried rice and macaroni and cheese... so so good.... bring your chairs/ blanket to sit on because tables and chairs are hard to snag... the lines are long for drinks but they go fast.... We will be back for sure! We feel right at home here. If you like fresh air and freedom... come here.. if you are afraid of fresh air and human contact, probably should go to Austin and be amongst others who feel that way... Merica!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: This place is cute and super family friendly. There are adequate food truck options and beer selections. I enjoyed the openness of this place -- there was a lot of seating that was not in the immediate proximity of others which was great. My only issue is the pricing -- I cannot pay over $5 for a Kung Fu Robot IPA when I can get it for $3 near my apartment. $8.25 for an Electric Jellyfish? I can't but I understand.

reviews.author: Maris M.
reviews.description: We're so glad the good lot opened near us! It's the perfect place to relax with the kids, enjoy a variety of good food, and hang out for a while. It gets crowded on Friday and Saturday nights when there's live music and it can be hard to find parking, so recommend showing up in the late afternoon if you want a good spot.

name: Salt Traders Coastal Cooking
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Saturday

reviews.author: Krasti Q.
reviews.description: This restaurant is a 5 out of 5 for me. I absolutely enjoy eating here. The raw oysters are always my favorite to snack on (tip: on Mondays, their gulf oysters are only $1). I've also tried their chowda fries which are delicious. It's everything you would expect with chowder but better because you also get fries (this dish itself can be heavy and filling). Definitely one to try if you're looking for something to warm your soul. Their lobster roll is good too. I love the lobster meat but I wish they served it as a warm, hot sandwich rather than the chilled one. Nonetheless, still delicious!   Now don't get me started on their dessert which is also worth noting here. All their desserts are made in-house but there is one that really hits the spot. This dessert has a warm chocolate brownie topped with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream and drizzled with caramel. If heaven was a dish, that would be it because it just transports you into another world. Worth saving some room in your stomach for!

reviews.author: Thomas S.
reviews.description: Good vibes and atmosphere and hard to beat the happy hour prices. The wine list was pretty lacking... I mean throw 1-2 nice options on there... it's oysters after all.   Oysters were fresh but not great. The sushi rice was made out of a home rice cooker... come on y'all... gotta step up your game there. Food is a bit salty but overall decent. Worth a try if you live in Round Rock otherwise probably not worth stopping by for.

reviews.author: Jim C.
reviews.description: I mean the food was OK but was a) very very rich, and b) everything was very salty.  I had a half-dozen gulf oysters which were very small, and also had the shrimp and grits which was just over complicated. The shrimp was overcooked as you would expect someplace hundreds of miles from the coast where no one knows anything about seafood, and the dish was overall just rich and higher-flown than necessary.  D had something else for a main dish that neither of us even remembers, and she also had the mac and cheese which was tasty but also a little over-produced.  Neither of us would consider returning. Third star is because the service was good - Kevin was our server - otherwise, and this this is just OUR opinion as lifetime gulf coast residents, maybe two stars.

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: Always a great visit! The chowda fries are one of my favorite things on the menu. That has a crispy shrimp bowl as a special and I hope they bring it back! The shrimp were luscious and delicious and it was a huge portion. Service is always amazing and they've upgraded their HVAC system so I feel comfortable dining here.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: Good oysters and the half chicken plate is amazing.  Just a quiet laid back seafood joint yes it's expensive but good

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: We found ourselves in Round Rock, TX on a recent Saturday, early evening, so we decided to stop by Salt Traders Costal Cooking on IH 35.  We found a couple of open seats at the bar.  Our first orders were a couple of craft cocktails, the Gin and Housemaid Tonic and The Rum Around.  Both were good, but upon reflection, for the price, regular cocktails would have sufficed.    We kind of went crazy on appetizers, having Gulf oysters, grilled oysters, crab fingers, and the crudo plate, which was yellowfin.  All of those dishes were "off the chart" crazy good, with the exception of the crudo ... the white sauce used was way too sweet for the awesome fish.    When we finally ended up at the main section of the menu, we ordered the fried oyster lettuce wraps and the simply grilled fish of the day, which was redfish.  The tartar sauce served with the lettuce wraps was delicious, but a bit too much was slathered on the wraps.  IMHO put a dash on the lettuce leaves and let the patron add as desired from the small cup of tartar sauce that comes with the dish.  The redfish was terrific, but no one knew why the place would have farm-raised redfish from the Indian Ocean when we have fresh redfish 200 miles away in the Gulf of Mexico?    Keeping it local, we ordered the Becker Vineyard Reserve Viognier, and it was delicious.  In closing, a special shout out to our waiter Nathan behind the bar, service was attentive but not intrusive, so nice to have a great waiter with a great attitude!

reviews.author: Brian O.
reviews.description: We've been a fan of Salt Trader's Costal Cooking in RR since their opening five years ago and not surprisingly we dine there 2-1 over Jack Allen's, our previous go-to place. We've never had a less than wonderful experience there with the diverse menu and bold bright flavors and textures of amazingly prepared seafood and American cuisine and wonderful drinks.  The newly transformed Flat Top Fish Tacos are unbelievably good as the two hearty tacos are prepared Birria style with caramelized cheese crust on the flour tortilla and with substantial amount of grilled black drum with a street corn filling along with the cup of aromatic tomato-shrimp soppin broth and tomatillo-lime rice with pickled chilis.   Other favorites include Grilled Oysters and Fried Oyster Lettuce Wraps for Starters and the  Fish Enchiladas and of course fresh Oysters and Daily Specials and Seasonal Deserts.  FLAT TOP FISH TACOS 17 crispy cheese flour tortilla, street corn,  tomatillo lime rice, pickled chilis,  charred tomato-shrimp soppin' broth

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We love everything about Salt Trader's.  First and foremost the 512 Cocktail. It is perfection. Sometimes I crave it and we go just so I can grab that drink. Haha! The food is outstanding. Every single thing. We've never made a bad selection. Their crudo of the day is always a favorite.  Dang now I'm craving Salt Trader's again. Haha!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Hannah made my experience great! She went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied during my time here!  Parking: there is a parking lot Reservations: im not sure if you can make reservations but I would suggest it. Although, the wait isn't too bad  Food: I got a very basic meal( lol), I got the the fried fish and shrimp and was not disappointed  Honorable mention: tried the New Orleans bbq shrimp and the pasta- i wasn't a huge fan- my taste buds said it was too salty foe me- but my friend enjoyed them  Drinks: i really wanted a spicy margarita and Hannah made sure that she got it to my liking, which I truly appreciated!

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Salt Traders might be my favorite upscale casual restaurant in Round Rock. The vibe here is similar to Jack Allen's, but with a nautical twist. 100% the kind of place where you'll find at least one dude rocking salmon colored shorts and boat shoes. No shade, just facts.  I particularly love their happy hour. All the appetizers are hits (especially the chowder fries), and that $4 discount on apps is really nice. I may be wrong, but I think on either Monday or Tuesday, happy hour is basically all day. If you've never been and want to sample a bunch of things, definitely take advantage of this.  My favorite entree by far is the shrimp and grits. It comes with a savory sauce on top that really sets it apart from other places. The bowl is also huge, and so the price is more than justified. I'm particularly fond of the Bonnabel -- one of my favorite whiskey cocktails ever. Just sweet enough for a guy like me who can't drive a manual, but just whiskey forward enough that it doesn't look like I own a Fiat.   The place gets super busy at the usual dinner times and all times during the weekend. Be a pro and hit them up during slow hours for the best experience!

reviews.author: Jerry J.
reviews.description: Have been going here for many many years. I would say the best seafood place around. Very friendly staff and professional. It's a sister restaurant from Jack Allen's. So you know it's great quality. Enjoy the dishes all the time :). My family and I come here frequently. Best oysters in town!

reviews.author: Big W.
reviews.description: I dunno why i gave this place only 4 stars on my 1st review?! I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Whenever my wife asks me where i want to go for fathers day, birthday etc... it's ALWAYS Salt Traders, and I always get the salad which is amazing and the simple grilled fish.. AMAZING TOO!! I LOVE THIS PLACE, SEAFOOD...AND SALAD.. Dont get better than this!!!

reviews.author: Jack K.
reviews.description: Dining in has never felt so good. After a lengthy hiatus we spun the wheel and what a meal. The service was outstanding as was the food. Fresh and ginormous shrimp on the Cobb salad!! The fish enchiladas and corn are amazing. Make sure you save room for dessert. We had drinks instead. Very refreshing!

reviews.author: Dylan K.
reviews.description: Really high end modern cuisine in an unexpected area. North Round Rock really isn't the place you'd think of for high quality seafood and a great classy bar scene, but that's exactly what this place had.  My wife had the scallops and they were seared perfectly and tender in the middle. Couldn't ask for better.  I had a fish sandwich, but I'm picky so I did it without the slaw, which was a mistake because it needed the crunch and the sauce. I'm sure it would be a 10/10 with that.  Definitely go to this place. We were treated like gold and the food was excellent!

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: This is my second time here in the last couple years. I started with the gumbo. In my personal opinion it was under seasoned. Kind of bland. I then had the New Orleans Shrimp. Very nice. You can tell the shrimp are fresh. I then proceeded on to the Shrimp and Lobster roll. The roll was fantastic! Warm, fresh, toast yet pillowy on the inside. The Shrimp and Lobster salad was nice and cold. The shrimp burst with flavor and freshness.  My server, (Scott) was elusive to say the least. The other waiters attended to me a lot more than he did. I probably waited 8-10 minutes before he took my order. The restaraunt was probably at 30% capacity at most. I had multiple managers see me looking for my waiter and just walked on by.   Overall, the food is good and they can definitely improve on service. I understand being shorthanded, but some things are inexcusable.

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: For my birthday, I chose to visit Salt Traders. We hadn't been there in a little while, and good seafood is always a treat.   My husband and I arrived in the early side, during happy hour (3:30-6:30 on a Thursday), so we could enjoy a leisurely meal. We started with drinks. I had the frozen grapefruit margarita, which tasted like a regular margarita. I loved that the salt on the glass also had citrus peel.  Our appetizer ($5 off during happy hour) was pot stickers. They were excellent, and the portion size (6) just right for sharing. The sauce was wonderful.   I ordered one of the day's specials for dinner, seared monkfish. It was served over fingerling potatoes and topped with a great salsa. The monkfish was tasty  but a bit on the chewy side... and the potatoes were barely undercooked. My husband had fish and chips, always a good choice at Salt Traders.  Dessert was vanilla creme brulee topped with peach sorbet. Excellent!   Service was excellent. We enjoyed Patrick's sense of humor and the stories he told.   We will be back again, without a doubt!

reviews.author: Tee C.
reviews.description: This was by far one of the best dining experiences we have had in a long time! Kenneth is an exceptional server! His knowledge of the menu, and every detail of the dishes was impressive to say the least. He can describe a salad and make it sound magical! We were too full to want to order dessert, but after he described each one we went home with almost all of them to go! We had an exceptional first visit! Thanks for the great food and service we can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Angela W.
reviews.description: Super yummy food by the people of Jack Allen's Kitchen. Given that it's by the people behind Jack Allen's, Salt Trader typically gives you a small portion of their Salmon dip to welcome you.   This place is always packed, especially on Mondays when it's all day HH. If you plan on coming on Monday, definitely get a reservation or you might be waiting ~1 hour.   I've had a number of their appetizers and they're all super tasty. My favorite is definitely the fish collar. Nicely seasoned with Cajun spice and the perfect amount of crisp. You can't really go wrong with any of their entree either.   All in all, solid restaurant that I would go to again and again.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Since this is one of our local favorites, we brought out of state family for another GREAT dinner.  We enjoyed a variety of fresh oysters as an appetizer and then ordered a second round! Super selection so we had to try most all of them  Entrees included the fabulous monkfish special and my absolute favorite, the ciopino! I thought about the monkfish but just had to stay with my favorite, which was soooo yummy as always.  I have to give a shout out to our server, 'Hanna from Louisiana.' She was SUPER! Kept us entertained and was a great representative of the Jack Allen family-knowledgeable, super friendly and totally dedicated to delivering an exceptional guest experience. She is 5 stars for sure.  In summary, we just love love love Salt Traders!!

reviews.author: Cristal Y.
reviews.description: We were in town for a wedding and this was a great in between place from Georgetown to Austin. Make sure to make your reservation online! We made our reservation a couple of days in advance and the only available time slots left were 4:30 and 8:30pm. We decided to do an early dinner and IT. WAS. SO. GOOD.   We got the 2 dozen chargrilled oysters, 2 dozen seasonal oysters, chowder fries. Presentation, portion, and service was great! Our waitress Hannah was attentive and very sweet! I'm not a huge oyster fan, but these were phenomenal! Between the four of us, we cleaned house and walked out with our appetites satisfied. Afterwards, we walked off our fully bellies at the outlet mall!

name: Slap Box Pizzicheria
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Perhaps one of the best local pizza places in Round Rock.  Their menu is definitely creative, they have a lot of amazing pizza combinations or you can always create your own.  You can also order a whole pizza or order by the slice which my wife loved since she usually doesn't eat too much.   We ordered the Orig Mama Gallo and it came with sliced meatballs and pepperoni. The combination of meats were great. The crust and dough were amazing and so soft. Their beer selection is quite extensive, I found a local beer from a small brewery I had never heard of before. I loved it so much that I ended up visiting the local brewery in Pflugerville.  Definitely give it a shot if you are a pizza lover like I am.

reviews.author: Liz Z.
reviews.description: Bought some wings this weekend.  Tried out the:  Kentucky Bourbon - Amazing! Right level of heat, smoke, and sweetness  Teriyaki- Sweet and tasted exactly how teriyaki sauce should taste. Deep notes of ginger which was amazing  Lemon pepper- could have been a lot better. It was almost as if they just sprinkled a little bit of essence of the seasoning.  Honestly couldn't tell the difference between the lemon pepper and the following wings.  Taco- I could see the seasoning but they were basically naked wings. The only flavor I could sort of taste was cumin, which was kinda blah. I wouldn't call these Taco Flavor. A good idea to market these as taco flavor would be to market the as "carnita wings" fry them up until they are super crunchy like chicharrón crunchy then serve them with side of salsa. If you use this please credit me! Lol free wings with a year would be nice too lol ;)

reviews.author: Davidm A.
reviews.description: I highly enjoyed this pizza and the atmosphere of this place. I have been around so much I hadn't left a review for them. If you cone her and eat make sure and try there Thai hotwings... OMG so delicious I had to order another round of them. High fluffy crust and just walked out completely satisfied with this place. All around great. T.vs and games playing full bar and delicious food!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: I honestly do not know where to begin with this review......I get it, possibly short staffed, since I did see a sign out front, but management should adjust how many patrons are seated if that's the case. 1. We signed up for space available seating for six people, mind you, two were planning to order single slices. We get to the restaurant and the first thing that strikes four of us as odd is the fact that the "greeter" had the emotions of Wednesday Addams...zero expressions nor cordiality. Did not see a smile one from this person. She should reconsider her position, but I'd suggest she work BOH the way she appeared.  2. Our waiter/order taker person, whatever the pronoun is today was flat out.....Terrible! His name was AJ, AJ was not attentive, didn't write ANYTHING down, did not take our drink orders(he was reminded by the bar staff). After he "mental" took our order down l noticed the "I got you look", AJ did not have us. Nope, ordered sweet tea, got unsweetened, came back with an excuse, we brushed it off. Ten minutes later, came back and asked my wife and I what pizza we ordered(again, he wrote it down mentally), I asked him to guess...when I told him a number 12 he replied, "I knew it, was just checking." I honestly could keep going on number two, as the service was just that....shit.  3. Nothing, I mean nothing arrived on time. My Brother received his pizza before ANY of the the reheat and serve slices came out. My wife and I got ours after he'd finished half of the pizza. After the complete shit show for service, as soon as our pizza came out we got a to-go box. I could expound on every one of these points, but I won't.   All in all the bill was $145, only one beer was ordered. I was "fine" with leaving a $20 tip for the service we received, but was talked into being generous. My old self would not have been so nice. Maybe folks are used to this service at this establishment, but for the money we paid I would have been happier with a PJ pizza and some good garlic butter sauce! Oh, I attached a pic of my pizza from last night....

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: Hands down the best pizza I've had. The Pirate pizza is a family favorite in our house! We also enjoy the chicken wings.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: The pizza is delicious and my husband agrees. The parking is awful. One time we ordered it for delivery and were charged mega bucks by the delivery service, so we'll never do that again.  Another time I placed an order over the phone to go and had to wait outside for about 15-20 minutes past the pickup time because there were so many people in line.

reviews.author: Seon B.
reviews.description: Slap Box is an interesting name for a Pizzaria with an included drafthouse. I stumbled upon this spot after Google searching "pizza near me". I was sawyer by the 4 star Yelp reviews, I had detour from my original plan to visit Pinthouse Pizza.   There's plenty of parking in fact there's an indoor covered parking lot on the same block around the corner. Upon entry the ambiance is well wonderful. There's enough tables and an ample amount of TV's to watch any of your heart's desire for sports.  I proceeded directly to the bar to order my pizza and beer to go.  When I sat down at the bar I ordered a pepperoni pizza and some water. After the pizza arrived after about 15 minutes or so I decided to sample a couple of ciders. I tried the Meridian Hive Cherry and the Meridian Hive Rhapsody. I ended up buying the Meridian Hive Cherry. It was on the sweeter side think like a wine.  When I finally tried the pizza it was pretty good. It was above average and I would try it again. The wings were really good. The sauce was flavorful and robust. The chicken was very good too. I definitely recommend Slap Box!

reviews.author: Glenn L.
reviews.description: Everything was great, the service was top notch - honestly the waitstaff was on top of their game!  First time in and can't wait to go back to try some different t combinations. We had the hot wings, by the slice and the garlic parmesan fries.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: Located in downtown Round Rock, this pizza place is right next to the Main Street plaza.  During CoVid times, we ordered to-go and ate in the plaza next door since it was a lovely afternoon.   Be forewarned, if you get a slice... it is a BIG slice!  See the La Jolla slice picture. It's huge!  The kids loved their pizza. Not a surprise there since it was your typical pepperoni.   I had a GF, vegan pizza for the first time and it was pretty good. I'm so glad they had this option on the menu so I didn't have to order a salad.   They had lots of beer options on tap but we didn't partake this time. Next time, we will. Give them a try!

reviews.author: Mallori B.
reviews.description: Seems like a neat place to hang out. Pretty good pizza... which is HUGE by the way. 2 people could definitely eat on one slice! Service was fast and friendly. Pizza could've had more toppings and cheese. Cheese bread was good. Ranch was homemade and very good.

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to hang out and enjoy delicious pizza! The slices are HUGE! We had a great experience and our server was awesome!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great place for a quick lunch and beer. Good selection of brews, and some tasty pizza choices. Extra credit to our server, Valaree, knew her beers, spot on advice on their IPAs on tap. Excellent service, will be back!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: 1. Let me just start off by saying, I grew up in a small town in Chicago Illinois so you could say pizza is my thing, and quite frankly slapbox pizzacheria or whatever the pronoun for this place is today has just that(pizza) 2. My experience at the slap was quite literally the reason I am willing to go back. Although it is clear to me that they are fairly understaffed the staff that work there currently are quite a joy. When you walk in you are greeted by a very interesting fellow that has the likes of Wednesday Adams from the Adams family, aswell as the door swinging wide open. Luckily for me I really enjoyed Wednesday Adams in the movie as she was my favorite character. Also I think people should be less hard on her at the slap because she seems to be doing good at her job as a greeter. 3. Our order taker person or whatever was also a very pleasant person. When we were seated by the greeter our order taker person named I believe adam was extremely nice and energetic,it was a damn shame my friends and I did not grab his number because he was looking extra fine the day we came in. Other than that he was still very nice and made sure our food was out on time. 4. To wrap up my essay on the slap I think it would be nice for me to talk about our experience with the food. Putting my Chicago ego aside my friends and I decided to order pizza here. I ordered the El Camino and let me tell you it might have been a fan favorite of mine, heck I could go for a slice right now while writing this review. 5. In conclusion I think slapbox pizzacheria is a great place to hangout and eat some pizza with friends and family. I also think that other reviewers shouldn't set a 4 star restaurant at such a high standard the place is ran aswell as it can be with the amount of staff they are given. My friends and I will most definitely be coming back to the slap as we enjoyed our stay

reviews.author: Misty D.
reviews.description: We visited on a Tuesday for dinner. There was no wait and the place is clean. The host and server were very nice. We got the Pirate pizza, and it was bomb. The garlic knots were fresh, but not extremely exciting. They did have a wide selection of beer. Hubby got the True Vine Daddy's Juice Box DIPA and loved it. Needless to say, we will be back.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: One of the best pizza restaurants around. I've been to Slapbox a number of times and it never disappoints. The menu is basically the same as 600 degrees in Georgetown. HUGE slices! Lots of variety and interesting toppings. AND this is a pizza restaurant but do not overlook the wings. They are sooo good. I love the dry rub ranch and recently tried the bourbon glaze which was super tasty. They have a great variety of beers on tap and attentive service. Also, a great place for take away. Slapbox is a fantastic addition to downtown Round Rock.

reviews.author: Peggie E.
reviews.description: I'm shocked this is a sister restaurant to the excellent 600 Degrees in Georgetown. I love 600 Degrees pizza! Slap Box has mediocre pizza, at best, IMO. Slap Box has a lot to learn from 600 Degrees. I wish it success.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Good spot for a slice of pizza, drinks, watch a game, with a cool sports bar atmosphere. This joint is family friendly too. I ordered a slice of Canadian bacon and pineapple. This slice was huge!!! Good chew and flavor in the crust. The toppings, cheese, and sauce were good. I like a little more sauce but it is good pizza. I recommend stopping by this joint for some good pizza.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Same menu/food as 600 degrees in Georgetown. This is some of the best pizza in the area. The wings are also legit and there's an extensive beer selection. What's not to like?

reviews.author: Cassandra P.
reviews.description: First time in * grabbed some takeout. In DT RR for work and ordered the 600 grinder to go with salt pepper fries. Sandwich was phenomenal. So tasty and full of flavor and the bread was money. Love the little bit of kick in it. Got mine minus onions and oregano and it was perfect. Will def be back! Only negative is that they had just run out of the most amazing looking cheesecake. Next time.

reviews.author: Ray M.
reviews.description: Great beer and pizza. Its too bad their pork shanks are off the menu. Round rock location always had a great atmosphere and the staff is amazing!

reviews.author: Andy S.
reviews.description: We make it a point to stop for either lunch or dinner at 600 Degrees on our regular travels between Bryan/College Station and Lake LBJ. Good pizza and a great selection of draft beer is why we stop. But tonight, Sunday evening, January 2, was a disappointment. We agreed to the 30 minute wait that we were told it would take for our group of five to be seated. What we were not told after we were seated was that we would have to wait more than an hour to receive our two-pizza order. An hour and twenty minutes to be exact. It seemed a great number of take-out orders were being filled that night and after an hour our waiter assured us our order had not been lost but there was a long line ahead of us. The staff knew of the pending delay when we were seated and we should have been informed so we could decide if we wanted to invent that amount of time. The bill was $88 and some change. I left a $5 tip and a note expressing my disappointment. I signed my name and left my phone number on the ticket should the owners like a more detailed explanation of our experience. We will go back to 600 Degrees but we know now to ask what the wait time will be after we are seated.

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: It wasn't pizza.  It was something very surprising and I had to share.  I don't know what happened.  I went downtown to pay my tax bill.  I thought about a nearby place that has a great beer selection and pizza.  So, I went there.  But I went in a different direction. Hot wings.  I asked about them.  The servers were attentive and described everything.  Even the bartender came over to check and make sure I was OK after I ordered and suggested beers and said it will be worth the wait.    Then the wings came to my table. They glistened in sauce and fat and were luscious.  Even the shiny foil underneath made them look like a gift   And then I ate.    Tender, juicy, the perfect spice.  The heat and meat!  Sooo good!!  The perfect chili/orange/Buffalo sauce color was gorgeous but tasted even better.  My palate was singing! My hands were messy. But, I ignored napkins, my friends!  I licked my fingers instead.  I don't regret it!   I thought at first the size of the wings order would be too much. It. Was. Not.   The server asked if I wanted a pizza. But, no, I ordered another beer and wings.  I don't want the pizza. I want the wings!!!!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place was recommended by a family member. The interior was small And packed so we sat outside on a brisk night. They should have some outdoor heaters and covering from the on/off drizzle.  We ordered a pizza and wings. The pizza names were curious as I'm from the area these towns are located in. I ordered my birthplace pizza (San Jose). The Lemmon pepper wings came out about 20 minutes before the pizza. The wings were PERFECT! I mean damn they were good! The pizza came out and it's a spicy one. The pizza was bigger than I expected and is made for at least two people. Flavor was good but it had a bit too much of some sort of creamy white sauce on top. The beers were on point as I tried out several local ones.  I will definitely come back and try more of their delicious menu!

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Best pizza ever!  If they weren't always so busy and if parking was easier, we'd probably make the trek from Round Rock to eat there more often.   I always get a slice of the basil pesto and it is absolutely delicious. And very filling. My husband and daughter like the pepperoni, and we usually get a side salad that's good too.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: That's not a slice..This is a slice! References aside if you want giant slices of pizza this is the place. Think as large a slice that you have to fold like a sandwich to eat. Perfect for any pizza or cheese cravings.   Atmosphere: Had the chance to dine outside of here. Given the location within Georgetown, you get the feeling of a family pizzeria. A place one would bring their friends for a casual dine out. Complete with patio.  Food: As mentioned above, big big slices. Perfect for any pizza lover of all sorts. I ended up going with the Pirate which is one of their speciality slices that comes as pictured below with a pickle too. The only complaint I'd have is that since the pizza's come out so fresh they also come out very hot. I unashamedly had to eat the pizza with a knife and fork as I just couldn't wait for such a prize to just sit there.   Service: Friendly service, given the significant amount of speciality slices I had a few questions and the server was happily able to answer any I had. Especially if you are unsure of what pizza slice you may want.  Overall: Now that I've tasted whenever I have pizza cravings I just want to return here to try all their other speciality slices. Give this place a try, and have a slice day!

reviews.author: Tammy A.
reviews.description: The extra cheese pizza was delicious and we loved the garlic barbecue chicken wings!!

reviews.author: Courtney T.
reviews.description: Eating my way through Austin and the suburbs.  Pizza I love it.  My go to.    Interesting spot!   You can do pizza by the slice and customize it with your own toppings much like a whole pizza except it's a slice, a slice that is the size of a small pizza or Texas? Go figure.   Everything is bigger.   Just cheese pizza would be rather bland here add your toppings and go with it.  Everyone gets what they want and it's fast.   Good stuff.  The garlic knots need some more garlic too them that's just me.   Definite unique spot to get that pizza fix.

reviews.author: Tim L.
reviews.description: Drove up to Georgetown with my girlfriend to take some pictures with the Christmas lights and explore the square. We popped in to 600 degrees after talking about needing to try it for months and it did NOT disappoint.  We were going to try a traditional pie, but ended up branching out to try the Royale with Cheese and we are so glad we did! The pizza was incredible, we split it and still had a few slices left over. We did it with the additional mustard and pickles, which is an absolute must.  The crust was to die for, and I say this as a person who normally throws crust away. It was so fluffy and soft, truly a 10/10 dough experience.  They had Maine Root soda on the fountain and a ton of beers on tap that they are more than willing to let you sample.   It isn't a big place and it can get pretty packed. There was a 25 minute wait when we arrived, but we ended up just sitting at the bar.  The service was great, the food was phenomenal, and the atmosphere was fun and friendly.

reviews.author: Kenny G.
reviews.description: You wait 20 minutes plus for a single slice. Can it really be that good??? I think not keep it. I'll pay for my drink and leave.

reviews.author: Hilary S.
reviews.description: Tried out for a later lunch/early dinner so got here about 330.  (Passing through to San Antonio but was starving)   It's in downtown/on the square so has the old build vibe. The side we sat on was little and faced the bar.   Definitely has the college town feel.   ***Didn't see any actual menus so be prepared to use your camera on your phone to look at the menu.   Service: Food was slow to come out. I didn't time it but we were there about an hour.  Our waitress was nice and did come by and check on us a couple times.   Food: Ordered the Caesar salad to start and it was tasty. The size for the salad was big enough you could share if you are looking for a smaller side salad.   I will say if the time it took to get our slices it was worth no sharing.  We ordered #6 pirate and #23 number 23 as slices and shared them.  Oh my!! They were both delicious and honestly for us worth the wait.   Even with the little bit of the wait I think still worth the 5 stars.   ** please forgive my pictures, I got so excited about them I ate the point of the slices. And we sliced them in half after we got them so they would be entire piece if when you get them.    ENJOY

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: First time trying out this place, almost no wait on a Sunday around 445p, so that was nice. We tried the garlic knots and each had a slice of pizza. The slices are very big and one was plenty, hand in pic for reference of size. We didn't try any of the craft beers but their selection is quite large if that's your thing. Easy to find parking and a nice chill vibe.

reviews.author: Jaclyn A.
reviews.description: I have always loved coming here. Service is hit or miss but such is life. I've told so many people about this place because they have a decent beer selection and decent pizza.   I'm a simple girl. I love a hoppy beer and a slice of cheese pizza, so that's generally what I come here for.  I'm always respectful, nice, I tip well and have a cheerful disposition. That's just my vibe. I've also been a server for many many years so I'm generally pretty patient with bad/moody service or off experiences.  I loved this place so much that I used to always go to the one in N. Austin slash Cedar park for lunch because it was close to my work and I'm a loyal customer. At that location, I always order a slice of cheese pizza. One time I asked for a bit of seasoning, chef's choice, and it was so damn good I never ordered regular cheese pizza again. It's a beautiful thing and I was so thankful.  I can drink a beer and make something tasty at home; all day every day, but tonight I decided to come to 600 degrees because I love supporting local businesses and servers in general.   I order my go to; the hoppiest beer and a slice of cheese pizza with any seasoning.   She said "we only offer cheese pizza or pepperoni"  I was like, "cool, I just want a slice of cheese pizza but with a touch of seasoning, any seasoning really, chef's choice."  She appears to be really put out, not the least bit subtle and perhaps internalizing this because she's outwardly angry. "I can give you Parmesan or red peppers as seasoning." She picks up both and throws them like I've hit a nerve.   Sips beer. Ok, fine, whatever. ‍   It's a slow Sunday night, there's 3 other people at the bar. It's approx 8:30pm and apparently seasoning is a touchy subject around here so I let it go for now, but the fear of my slice lacking flavor was making me rethink my dinner choices. I hadn't had a proper meal all day, just scraps of snacky stuff. I was really hungry, but not so hungry I would eat something just shy of delicious.   I take a few sips of my beer and the bad vibes are so thick I could cut right through them.  Being steps away from the BOH, I ask, "hey can I get a little bit of seasoning on my slice of cheese pizza?"  To which he responds; "you have to ask your server. Its up to them, if they order it I'll make it. I can't make it if they don't order it". The loyalty coupled with toxicity was blowing my mind.   Apparently it's a whole thing, because the staff starts gathering to watch the showdown. Girl who wants a slice of seasoned cheese pizza against the world. It's riveting.   OMG you guys, this woman wants seasoning!!! Can you believe it!!!?   It's to a point that it's kinda hilarious and I'm just like, these people have big feelings about seasoning.   She steps in, heroically in her eyes I'm sure and says "I'll do it for you but just this one time." I mean, total saint right?   Oh my! I'm touched. Thank you! My cup runneth over!   I go back to my seat and watch the drama unfold over a bit of seasoning on a slice of cheese pizza. It's something to behold folks.   At this point I don't like my tasty beer so much that I'm willing to subject myself to this level of toxicity so I left because I prefer my pizza sans the needless drama and hostility.   I kinda think this has nothing to do with seasoning.

reviews.author: Oliver W.
reviews.description: We mostly only do takeout from 600. I upped the rating to 5 star from 3 star because takeout pizza is all about timing. 600 has taken steps to separate the "I just want a beer" line from the "hey, I'm here to pick up an order" line. Getting home with a hot pizza = a great pizza. Getting stuck in a long checkout line and ending up with a cold pizza = a horrible pizza.   Great job 600 on stepping up and making the takeout experience better for all.

reviews.author: Kassidy D.
reviews.description: Super delicious. The crust was perfectly crisp but not too chewy. The table shared the Thai wings. The wings were really crispy and not too spicy. Really solid pizza place. Only issue was one item didn't make it to the table and had to be taken off of the bill and there was a bit of a wait for the food, other than that everything was great.

reviews.author: Ross P.
reviews.description: So I was across the street at the new Austin Title office picking something up.   The pizzeria across the street looked good (and smelled good) so I dropped in.  Their pizza was made-to-order, and their staff is friendly and communicative.   Let me tell ya...it was the best pizza I've had in Texas.  My wife loved it so much she told me to hide it from her :)  So good.  Next time I get pizza, I might just drive all the way to Georgetown just to get it.  So good.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: We drive from Austin to come here - it is highly recommended and great pizza, with local craft beer on tap. Be ready for a wait, probably any hour they are open. They do have a local market around the corner that offers Togo only.   If they don't have a pizza you like you Dan make your own. They also offer wings, knots and salads. Honestly you cannot go wrong and it's all locally owned.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: We came to this place on a Saturday night and it was busy. We put our name on the list and were told it was a 50 minute wait. We walked around the quaint shops of the square while we waited. When it was our turn, we were really hungry! Our friendly  server was Michael and he was really friendly. He brought us a few samples of local beer and my husband and I were happy to get to choose our favorites. I can't remember what we got but it was good. We ordered garlic knots but they were out. We choose cheesy bread for our 2nd choice appetizer. We ordered one city pie, one margarita pizza, and one cheese pizza. Michael recommended the gluten free, which made our portions a little smaller and also less of that bloated feeling. The hubby and I are trying to eat healthier so I said yes to gluten free. We ate almost all of our pizzas, while sitting on the patio enjoying our beer.  This restaurant is just one more reason that I'm falling in love with Georgetown. We will be back.

reviews.author: Shelli S.
reviews.description: Love this place!  We always go when we are in the area!  We have slices of pizza and Caesar salad!  All great! Service is always in point also! We will return!

reviews.author: S. F.
reviews.description: I'm sad to update my review for the worst. This is the only place we would go for pizza. Not sure if there's a new chef or what's up, but the last several times the pizza was not good. The very last time, the pizza was burned so badly we couldn't eat it. So we're sadly looking for another pizza place. The wings are still very good here, but overall the food quality has definitely declined.

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: Stopped by for lunch on a gloomy Saturday and surprised that the wait time was relatively short for a packed restaurant! Since its located downtown Georgetown there is a bunch of street parking and a few lots located a block or two away so not too terrible of a walk.  After reading a few reviews I was sold on the pizza by the slice especially if you are able to customize it however you want or from their list at dinner (5PM) it is only cheese or pepperoni. To start we had the sweet chili wings and they were delicious, had a nice crisp/crunch! Pizza was amazing and worth the wait, I had the pirate and the garlic on top just made the pizza even more amazing.  Service lacked a bit, but I can understand everyone has their off days and with the pandemic contact should be at a minimum. All in all, I will be back especially during lunch hours for more pizza by the slice.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: I went to this Gastro pub while visiting a friend in the Austin Texas area. I think it's really cool that they have merchandise and a fully running bar and restaurant in the same space. I felt it was very cozy and interesting aesthetically with all of the taxidermy on the walls. I really enjoyed grabbing a drink here with a friend and I would definitely come back to shop or drink in the future.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: We became members here about four months ago. It's perfect because my wife and I will grab two beers to go, drop a tip, and walk the square/walking trail up the street to get our steps in on our Fitbit. It's always exciting because the beers change daily to weekly. We've hung out inside on occasion which is perfect for card games and relaxing. The apparel for sale is typical of a REI/Bass Pro Shop. Expensive but quality.   Bar: rotating beer, wine, white claws  Bonus: Very dog friendly! And one of the only places open late.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: I have had mostly positive experiences here. I like the beer selection and the bartenders are always happy to suggest something that fits the profile I want.  I have been here about 5 times and am likely to return.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Always great beer, great service, great people watching outside. A favorite.  Also check out the fine sportswear.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: Awesome little place in the square! Very knowledgeable and friendly staff! They have some great beers on tap, some that I would have otherwise never tried! The Eastciders blood orange is awesome! They also have great apparel and accessories. Also, we got a small hint that they love our military and veterans!

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: While many businesses have found ways to make shopping, eating, and drinking safer and in line with state guidelines, there are places that have found their niche catering to the denial or anti-mask crowd. You can make up your own mind based on the trolling I've received from their clientele from my previous review, and the continued crowding on their sidewalk outside with unmasked folks not socially distanced.

reviews.author: Kiva C.
reviews.description: This place has a great atmosphere. They are family and dog friendly. The merchandise is high quality (outdoor gear) and they are open late. They usually have sports on their TVs. Whether you're shopping during the day or stopping in for a drink in the evening. The crowd range is vast. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and the taps are rotating. They even have water bowls outside for your dog. They serve beer, wine, and select seltzer's in cans. It's a great place to kill a few hours in the heart of downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: This place is always SUPER packed on weekends, it can be near impossible to find a seat. Luckily there are a few outdoor tables and chairs for overflow but even the sidewalks get crowded with people just standing around drinking. One evening we managed to make it in and see what all the excitement was about and it's a cute little beer and wine bar/outdoors gear store. Cute merchandise but pretty pricey. The bartender told us occasionally a food truck will park behind their store so you can enjoy yummy eats with your drinks, otherwise no food menu. I liked the atmosphere of this place... cute little date night drink spot on the square. But I am a little confused by why it's so crowded all the time. The beer and wine list is good, but not anything spectacular. I don't get it. I'm sure we'll be back at some point if we can find a place to sit.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Had a great time here. Beer and atmosphere was great. Would love to come back to shop around sometime.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I never feel welcomed at MSO. The workers are borderline rude and  act put out with each order. I'll spend my dough elsewhere.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Short review time kids!  A close friend and local resident dragged us here and promised we would enjoy ourselves! He was so spot on the get a coveted 5 star review!   Atmosphere is casual, relaxed and inviting. Great selection of beers on tap.  Go for a brew,meet some cool people, and get a shirt before you depart!

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: Good selection of outdoor/fishing clothes combined with a great selection of beer. Live music  on certain nights. Very nice staff.  Excellent place to go on the square.

reviews.author: Archie L.
reviews.description: Spent the Sunday afternoon on the square. This is a must stop when visiting the shops on the square in Georgetown. Great selection of beer, wine, cider. Nice clothing. The selection is somewhat limited but quality. Friendly staff!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Sunday night in the  square. Strolled in and got a tasty brew and some pimento cheese. Then bought a shirt and some shoes. What a great space and friendly service. Thanks!

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: Went there on Saturday to watch the UT game. Not a sports bar, but they did have it on one TV. Lots of fans watching, so the atmosphere was great. They have a good selection of draft beer that changes from time to time. Mostly local. I went back the very next day for the Dallas Cowboys game. Very friendly staff. The next day I sat in a comfortable leather chair. They also have a lot of nice clothing for men. A little too pricey for me, but I understand they have some deals from time to time. I will definitely be going there every time I'm in downtown Georgetown.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Love this place!! So, for food offerings, you can order online. The dudes 2doors down will deliver. Lots of awesome beers and wine available here. Those of you who  follow the mask rules (which effectiveness is anecdotal at best....and not scientific), you will be comfortable here. High ceilings, fans, etc.  Tables far apart.  Or drink outside. I'm here for the beer. The people are cool and the staff AWESOME!!

reviews.author: Regine M.
reviews.description: An interesting spot in the Georgetown square. Mesquite Creek is half bar, half clothing and apparel shop. They've got a good selection of beers and wines and are one of the only places around here that stays open late. There's a variety of clothes for men and women however many of their items are overpriced, but I assume most people come here to drink, not shop.

reviews.author: Faith B.
reviews.description: Nice seating area outside. Got the blueberry blonde beer and super good! Bartenders all super friendly as well. :)

reviews.author: Zoe T.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday to buy a hat for me and walked out with a hat and two shirts for my teenage sons. I didn't try the beer, so I can't comment on that, but the clothing selection was good. They carry Howler Brothers apparel, which is a company out of Austin that my fisherman husband likes, and Texas Standard clothing, which is a TX-based brand with cool (not kitschy) Texas-themed clothing that gives back to Texas non-profs. They also carry another local brand - Kermode Outdoors - which is new to me, but evidently founded by Georgetown residents. The store has a great vibe and the bar is a place I could see spending a few hours on a Saturday afternoon. Stores like this are what I look for whenever I shop local - a place that sells unique, cool stuff that someone has spent time thinking about.   4 not 5 stars because I didn't try the beer. Next time....

reviews.author: Jordyn T.
reviews.description: Great place to have a beer/wine in beautiful downtown Georgetown! Very friendly staff and great selection of drinks.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: first of all the food truck on site Bonita Los 3 Reyes is delicious as all tacos I've come to love, I can put this truck on the top favorite spots. get food for sure. next the brewery- huge open space outside with plenty of seating. I wont lie to you yelp, I am not much for drinking beers but for this brewery, I might knock one beer out and enjoy the patio more than anything. shout out to the staff for being awesome and helping me find the right beer for me.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Like the space like the amenities like the food trucks like the peeps. The beer not so much. We did two flights. Eight beers. A couple were good. A couple were bad. The rest were just mediocre.  Dog friendly. Plenty of seating inside and out. Good prices. What does this place do for parking?

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My friend's band was playing for free here as a pre Austin FC party. I was the only person here not wearing green, it seemed. Had 2 beers, 1 was really good and 1 was eh. They had a Mexican food truck in the back and it was meh, I wouldn't recommend. Line inside to get a beer was ridiculous... I would have had more if it wasn't such a wait. Seems they could use a bit of logistical help.

reviews.author: Mr. S.
reviews.description: The beer was not good. 2 of the flight beers were offensively bad. And a couple were okay...Would not return under any circumstances.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: Went here on a sunny afternoon with Kelly L. She had been, but it was my first time - although I'd been eyeing Hopsquad as it was building up and it had been on my list to visit. The parking is limited, so plan ahead. The space is bigger than it looks from the outside - as it has an indoor bar as well as an outdoor picnic table area. I tried two beers (can't remember which ones) and they were both very good. The menu had good variety, so I feel like it's a good spot to bring a group that could have diverse beer tastes. The staff was friendly and seemed to be happy working there. I would definitely visit again!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a very wide-open brewery with plenty of places to sit, stand, chill out, hang out, etc.  I had the Cowboy Bevo (which is a brown ale).  I usually love the sweet, malty taste of a brown ale, but the IBU rating on this one was a little high for my tastes.  Not terrible, mind you, and I would consider it again. Just a little hoppy for my tastes.    It's in an industrial park, like many breweries are, but it was a nice, spacious, and clean set up. Service was quick too - so was parking.  On my last visit, they even had a local band playing from within one of the loading dock doors.   Bottom line, great tastes, services, parking easy, and some good live tunes.  Check them out!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: My dog hopped up on the counter to demand a winter porter, but was immediately met with a dog biscuit.  Meanehile, my wife ordered a dunkelweizen whilI ste thw winterbrew and proceeded to a Murcielago.  I loved the later on nitro.  Friendly staff, counter service, plenty of room inside open to air and outside in the sun.  It's my 2nd visit.  We enjoyed the food from Tsuke Hoten and there's a pizza truck too.  We'll be back for more.

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: What a cute brewery!  They have a decent selection of brews and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a big screen tv good for watching sporting games, and they have a food truck for munchies.   I was impressed by the women's restrooms as it had tampons, pads, and lotion.  How thoughtful!  Good mix of clientele too.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Huge open inside area where you can see the e brewing section. Also large screens for watching sports. Great place to work or for a large gathering. Plenty of tasty brews for any of your tastes.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Design aesthetic on fleek. Open ro ALL customers--dog and kid-friendly! Strong wifi and food truck supported, Hopsquad is going places.  We walked in excited to try their beers. We heard about this spot and it was so easy to find off the main road. It's connected to Circle Brewing and separated by an easily-crossed chain fence. UGH! How convenient. Beer nerds unite! The mural art is very instagrammable and the interior is even more of a design paradise. The chairs, tables, succulents, artwork and all-around ambiance is so calming, zen and open. It's the perfect place to get work done or enjoy a sunny day with your furry friends. We were a group of four, and all of us loved the space. They also have strong wifi, so y'all know this girl would rather get studying/work done with a beer over cafe drinks any day.  The restrooms are also very clean and GET THIS...they have tampons, pads and AVEENO LOTION IN THE WOMENS' RESTROOM. Yee-haw! They have flights of four for the typical Austin price of $10. Everything is wonderful about this place. They also have a little strip of grass for dogs to do their business--and they have a poop bag station too. The food truck looks like omakase (I'm not entirely sure), but they have so many outdoor games/picnic tables as well as indoor activities like fooseball and dog treats.  The aspects that could be improved are parking. Yes, they have additional parking that's a few lots away...but immediate parking is a drag. We got lucky and squeezed in on the side by the large trash receptacles. The beers also weren't everybody's favorites. They did have a selection, but they only have a few beers on tap. However, Hopsquad is so very green still...that variety will take time. GREAT new brewery providing a hip space for all folks!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really chill place with cool murals, lots of natural light, nice summer selection (the only hazy was fantastic), lots of good dogs.

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: We chanced upon Hopsquad recently, and I don't think I've ever been more comfortable at any other brewery in Austin. I do agree that their beer is still probably finding its footing (Austin does have a competitive craft beer scene, after all), but I don't think other places can hold a candle to Hopsquad's absolutely chilled out homey vibes.   I'll do a pros and cons list.   Pros:  - I can bring my human +canine children and seat them indoors.  - the staff actually don't mind human children.  -cider and wine available for non-beer drinkers   -the staff like my canine child (and there are plenty of other dog parents who visit which means you can play "I pet that dog!")  - board games  - foosball table  - plenty of space   Cons  - I truly believe there are better beers out there.  - cider portions are small - from a can and a little steep , price wise  So when you weigh the two, the pros beat the cons by a mile. As for the beer- give them time. I mean, no one really cared about a few other noted breweries 5 years ago but look how popular they've become now ! Here's to Hopsquad becoming Austin's next too brewery.   - food truck outside  - plenty of parking

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Came here on a trip to Austin. After going to a couple breweries prior to this and I was suggested to come here based on the quality of beers. As the name suggests they are very much hops forward. I am not. I came in and asked the woman about non-hop forward beers. She suggested one and I tried it. It was very hop forward. The bar, if you call it that, is very pretentious. Would not come here again if traveling through Austin.

reviews.author: Shveta M.
reviews.description: Hot dang this new brewery is beautiful! It's soooo colorful inside and they've got so much seating that is very comfortable! Bring your pups along too. They're welcome!  We enjoyed the ambiance, hubs enjoyed the beer (I'm doing dry January) and they've got an amazing Japanese food truck out front (Tsuken Hoten) and their shiitake and avocado bowl was fantastic! They'll be serving a limited seating omakase very soon and it'll be reasonably priced!   We've got tons of greta breweries in austin but I think this one is in my top 5 for ambiance, dog-friendly, great grub, plenty of power outlets if you want to work, and friendly staff! I'll be sure to taste their beers myself and update this review accordingly.  Plenty of parking, and you can park in the lot by Circle if you can't find one in their lot. Head on over ASAP (Wed-Sun) only for now.

reviews.author: Kasy S.
reviews.description: I stopped in this past Friday for some crowlers to-go. As this was my first visit, I tried three different offerings. First off, their online ordering is slick and seamless. Secondly, they seem to have adapted well to the pandemic with adequate spacing between their outdoor tables. I would definitely feel comfortable having some pints in their beer-garden. If you are as excited about Austin FC (soon-to-be season ticket holder) these guys are within easy walking distance to the gorgeous new stadium. I can see myself having pre-match beers here before taking the short walk to the stadium.  Now on to the important stuff: the beer!  I opted for their Kate la Quimica SMaSH IPA, Professor Pleasant pale ale, and my personal favorite style Sir Winsor ESB. I found the SMaSH to be my favorite, it was a fantastic representation of the style, 9/10. My second favorite was the ESB, major kudos for carrying this style that is far too rare state-side. It was delicious and my second favorite of that style in town 8/10 (bonus point for a well-done obscure style). I thought the pale ale was fair, I found it to be a bit one-note.
