Though pleasant on the nose, it lacked a similar nuance on the palate 6/10. All said, I will definitely be back to try their extensive and varied roster of brews. As a bonus, the staff I spoke with were extremely friendly and happy to talk about both their brews and Austin FC. Keep up the great work!

reviews.author: Beth E.
reviews.description: They have great beers! They have a great selection from lagers to ipa's. It is right across the street from the soccer stadium so in game days it's crazy busy. They have a couple of food trucks in the back and just FYI they have no AC.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: Great beer, great atmosphere, nice outdoor seating as well as open air "indoor" seating (which is key these days with covid), and they had food trucks available for nosh. Will be going back!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Open, bright, colourful, not too loud, outdoor seating and 2 food trucks, fantastic Pennybacker if you like hazies. Tropical fruity deliciousness, the perfect summer bevvy. Love this spot

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: From the second we walked in I liked the vibes of this place. It is very open and clean, but still warm and cozy. There is a decent amount of space both indoors and out, but I could still see how this place could get packed.   We went around 5 on a Friday and it wasn't empty but also wasn't too crowded. It was nice out so we sat outside. I got a flight which was only $10 for 4 smaller beers and I could pick any of the options on tap.   I'm not a big beer drinker so I don't know that it's fair for me to detailed review each beer, but from the variety I'm sure any one that likes beer could find something they enjoy.   Great place to bring a group! They also have a little food truck/ restaurant out back that looked really good but I haven't tried yet.

reviews.author: TheoHuxtable X.
reviews.description: A decent brewery very similar to all the others in the area. The problem is that it takes longer to get a beer here on Austin FC game days than any of the other places. I know there's a big crowd on game day, but how dumb not to anticipate that and bring in more staff. A brewery exists to sell beer. And you'll wait 45 minutes in line to get one here. Hopsquad just hasn't figured out how to serve beer at a reasonable speed so they are selling half as many as they could while inconveniencing everyone.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Elaziel R.
reviews.description: Hiding gem in the area, the food is surprisingly really good. They have very unique combinations for most of their meals like spicy ranch and the ambience is great. I will say the staff needs a little bit more guidance because they always look lost or confused about their duties. Beside that it's a great small bar with food options for everyone!

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Carrie Q.
reviews.description: This was our first time here and we will definitely be back. The queso was delicious and unique, the entrees were very good, and the wine on tap was great! I had the special (shrimp linguine in a pesto sauce) and my husband had the chicken sandwich. Everything seemed scratch made, which we really appreciated!

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fiancé the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fiancé's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: I finally tried this place and so glad I did! Went with some girlfriends for some much needed quality girl time. This was the perfect place to sit back, chill and enjoy great food and company. I really like the ambience of this restaurant. It boasts a laid back feel with the dim lighting, yet has an open atmosphere. I ordered the Grilled Atlantic Salmon and everything was cooked to perfection. The salmon was cooked on the medium side to my liking and request to the server. We also ordered the James Bowie Nachos. Keep in mind these are not the typical Tex-Mex nachos, but they were still delicious and flavorful with a hint of robust BBQ flavor. There is an option to add chicken or steak and we opted for the chicken...great choice! If you love spicy (I sure do), they have a kick to them, as they are topped with freshly sliced jalapenos. Our server was excellent! She was so friendly, accommodating and checked on us frequently. She alone deserves a 5-star recognition! Try this place that offers locally-sourced, high quality food with its own, unique flavor.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Republic Kitchen + Bar is a great place in Leander off Parmer/Ronald Reagan. It has been around for about a year and I'm mad that this was my first trip. I guess that means I'll have to make up for lost time. We got the Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer. There was a sweetness to it with the apples and honey and candied pecans. So good! For dinner, I got the Pan-Seared Chicken and had to say yes to that when I saw that the chicken was on top of risotto, my favorite. The chicken was a small piece but very flavorful. I got the tots and also some chili which was spicy! Thanks The Republic, great place. I gotta get one of your large cocktails next time too.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Oh mannnn I thought I took a picture of my drink! Darn it. Get the Pineapple Express! It was taco Tuesday, the shrimp taco was fabulous. They were out of fried salmon (odd bc they had the other way?) or I would have gotten that since you can basically get a shrimp taco anywhere. I'll definitely be back for taco Tuesday again. It was a little cold, I like my food room temperature so it was perfect for me, but I could see someone being disappointed in the temperature of the food. But I'm not knocking off any stars for that since that's how I like my food.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came here for dinner on Tuesday night 6/15/21 with some family. I ordered the El Cesar Chavez salad with salmon and when they food came out the first bite I took I was fishing a bone out of my mouth from the salmon. So I started to inspect the rest of the fish and found 3 more bones. I informed our waitress and she kindly had it re made but when the second salmon came out I once again found 2 more fish bones inside.   At this point I did not receive an apology nor did a manager come by to check in to if everything was okay so I asked to speak to one and inform him. The gentlemen came over and apologized but really did not seem genuine about it after I explained how dangerous it was that I found a total of 6 fish bones that I could have choked on. He also attempted to blame the chef for not cleaning it right and saying "I always tell him to make sure all the bones are out."   Coming from the restaurant business myself and having my husband be on the corporate side of a big restaurant chain - I was very disappointed in how this place dealt with the issue.   Please check your seafood at this place - they clearly are not ordering boneless seafood or properly cleaning they're fish.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Went there last night, the place is awesome! Currently they don't have their own beer, supply issues but they have some amazing Austin, Texas and other craft beers. Family friendly spot (a kids play area with kitchen and all!!),good music playlist and eventually some live music. They just have snacks right now but eventually said they'll have a menu. Oh yah and coffee too. We got to meet Derek and his wife, the owners. This is such a great spot to go and work or to relax at after work! Will definitely be back and can't wait to watch this business grow.  We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures! I'll update with pictures next time I go.

reviews.author: Justin H.
reviews.description: Ordered a few pizzas over the weekend, and thoroughly enjoyed them!  If you like pizzas that are lighter and refreshing, then this is a place to try. My favorites were the Twisted Rita and Sweet Sow. The Shrooms to the Moon had some good umami to it -- it's the most flavorful, but a bit heavier than the first two. Also -- if you like pizza rolls, then I would definitely try the Rollin' Ronies.  I will definitely be ordering these again in the near future.  Note about ordering: I ordered online and picked up the food. I will say, however, that the order was not ready by the estimated time. Instead, you can wait for a text notification to pick up the order. I didn't know that, but now I do!

reviews.author: Virginia R.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place... we live really close by. I didn't want to make dinner and my husband suggested that we try BackDraft.  It took over an hour to get our order. The brewery was having trivia night so maybe they were swamped with orders? Regardless, while the food tasted great, the portions (pizza and pizza rolls) were pricey for what we got. Paid over $50 for dinner (one salad, one small pizza, 3 very small pizza rolls and one dessert.)

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love getting a pizza from here while enjoying some craft beer at Celis. You do have to order thru the app, you can't just walk up and order. I've had a few different pizzas from them, and they are all good. Definitely one of my go to's.

reviews.author: Ashlynd B.
reviews.description: The food itself was really good. My only gripe is that the photo for the pizza rolls shows 6 of them, and there's nothing in the description to tell you otherwise, but you only get 3. I was quite disappointed to pay almost $8 for 3 pizza rolls.

reviews.author: Marcia L.
reviews.description: This is the 3rd time they canceled!!!!! Horrible service. Don't act like you're taking orders when you can't! Total BS!!!! I will never again try here.

reviews.author: Olivia H.
reviews.description: BackDraft keeps switching up their home on us, but we will follow them all over Metric. Our favorites are the Shrooms to the Moon (Mushrooms, Caramelized Onions, Sausage) and the Backdraft (Sausage, Pepperoni, Jalapeños) pizzas.   They are the perfect accompaniment to a pint of draft beer from whichever brewery is housing them at the moment. But if you're looking to just bring their pizza home, you can also order online ahead of time to skip that 20 min wait on site.

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.description: I ordered using Yelp grub hub for my very first time , apparently they never got my the order. I went to them and made me pizza  on the spot I ordered around 6:30 finally getting my pizza at 9:16 and had to pick it up myself  tried to cancel my order and they never picked up the phone . I dnt know where there was a disconnect but it needs to be fixed . Delivery was trash but also no communication with the customers.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: I know this review will never make it on the board. The pizza was average at best with no significant flavors, crust or sauce components.  Maybe I have Covid (been vaccinated), but can't agree with all the great reviews about this place.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Looking at recent Yelp reviews, I was nervous about how this place would turn out. BackDraft did NOT disappoint.   First off, where is it? There is conflicting info on Yelp and their website. I called ahead because going to the wrong pickup spot would turn me into a hangry rage. They did not answer the phone but the host breweries did. CONFIRMED: They are currently located at Celis brewery.   We ordered 2 pizzas for pickup on Grubhub on a Friday night. BackDraft and pepperoni. They were ready in about 30 minutes. CONFIRMED: The pizzas were AMAZING. Like... hands down some of the best pizza I've ever had. Their homemade sausage and humongous thin pepperoni slices were phenomenal.  I can't speak for anyone else's experiences recently. It sounds like delivery may be questionable? But as of April 2021, if you can drive to pick up a pie, this is the place you need to go.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Really nice Naples style pizza with quality mozzarella. Nice crust and supplied parmesan and red pepper. Cute lil baby in the truck.

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Oh man.  The pizza here is fire.    It's located right in front of 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op  which is a perfect pair.  We ordered their signature pizza, The Backdraft.  It's topped with House Made Spicy Sausage, Pepperoni, Fresh Jalapeños, but we also added mushrooms on ours.  It's a thin crust style pizza that is PACKED with flavor.  Our buddy ordered the Kale Yeah Caesar salad which he was very pleased with.  The guys that run this truck are really cool and definitely dedicated to their craft.  Backdraft Pizzeria is definitely up there on the short list of Austin's best pizza.  I'd be surprised if they didn't branch out and open up another location in the near future, especially in the downtown Austin area.  I would highly recommend giving them a visit and try their food.  How can you say no to a fantastic pizza and a frothy craft beer to go with it?

reviews.author: Danny H.
reviews.description: I ordered on Yelp App to delivery.  2 pizza and a salad, but I just got 2 pizza. where is the salad.  I called to the restaurant but didn't answer.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for a good cheese pizza, and this place has it. I was super impressed by the dough, tangy sauce, and the perfect amount of cheese. I do wish there were a few more options to kick off the meal but hey, when I'm craving cheese pizza, this is the only place to curve that craving.

reviews.author: Jeannie L.
reviews.description: At noon on a Friday, it only took 13 minutes to get my food. I got pizza and wings to go. This is one of the best pizzas I have had in Austin so far. The crust was very thin and had a good crunch to it. The sauce for the wings had a slight sweetness and wasn't too hot. I also appreciate that they put the buffalo sauce for my wings on the side, so that they wouldn't get soggy before I got home.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: TLDR: BackDraft is back, and they're better than ev-VAH!  I'm a longtime fan of BackDraft, even once calling it 'the best pizza you can get off a truck'.  That's damning with faint praise, as this is some of the best pizza in all of Austin.    Back when I first tried them, the food truck was parked down on 360 near Bee Cave.  But now that both I and they have moved to the north quadrant of Austin, and they're attached to an excellent brewery to boot!  By far, my favorite is a slightly altered 'Shrooms to the Moon', which is a triple-whammy combo of homemade spicy sausage, mushrooms, and carmelized onion. If you look at the picture, you'll see that the crust has the  right amount of 'char' or 'leoparding' as some call it.   Whoever's doing the pizza-slinging at BackDraft knows their stuff. Get down here when they're open, grab a brewski, and you're in for one of the best lunch combos that Austin can serve up!  Some Tips:  1) I said 'best lunch', but be sure to check their hours before you come. I'm pretty sure they just do lunch Friday and Saturday.  Otherwise, they follow brewery peak hours and just do evenings.  2) Try the Shrooms to the Moon but ask them to hold the caramelized onions.  Without the onions, you get a spicier, hotter pizza which goes perfectly with a pale ale beer to wash it down.  You'll end up with a pizza-nirvana feeling of a warm glow in your tummy.  This place scores a 5 out of 5 on the 'CTJ Scale', as noted below.  5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing away after finishing a plate here. 4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary. 3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad. 2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here. 1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

reviews.author: Terry S.
reviews.description: Pizza very good.  Friendly and responsive staff.  However be prepared to be patient if ordering during peak hours. We ordered at 7 on a Friday night and they were backed up by over an hour which was not represented on the online ordering app.  Info on backup was communicated by staff verbally and understandable, just know you'll need to coordinate in person for true wait time during busy periods.

reviews.author: Uksang Y.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere to enjoy a pint of beer from the brewery and pizza! The outdoor seating was also socially distanced and I felt safe. Too bad the wait for the pizza was over an hour. The crust was good and the topping combinations were fun but probably not worth the wait.

reviews.author: Frank Z.
reviews.description: I've been known to enjoy eating a cold slice of pizza for breakfast. Assuming, of course, that it was leftover from the night before. But this pie from BackDraft pizza ARRIVED cold.  The fact that it was skimpy for the cost pretty much assured that there weren't going to be any leftovers. From one perspective; that could be a blessing. Because while it wasn't the worst pie I've eaten; it would easily place among the bottom three. Two stars is more generous than this deserves.

reviews.author: Gary O.
reviews.description: You owe it to yourself! Great pizza! My new favorite! Great people! Local! What more could you want?

reviews.author: Bob S.
reviews.description: The pizza is truly amazing.  Great crust, fresh ingredients and even better service.  There's a huge beer selection and some unique mixed drinks.  The restaurant and bathrooms were very clean.  I highly suggest you take time to visit here.

name: Oz. Tap House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: VP Membership H.
reviews.description: Excellent beverages, food and service! We love this place! The staff is so helpful, always going above and beyond. If you haven't been, get up and go! You can thank me later

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Oz. Taphouse (pronounced Ounce) is my most favorite neighborhood place to go for a quick bite, a variety of drinks, a place for my kids to play, and the most friendly service. They have a shuffleboard and foosball table inside, a playground and outdoor games like corn hole and hook and ring toss outside, AND live music on Wednesday nights.  We have a big family, a complicated order and the people at Oz. TH make us feel like family. The food is excellent (burgers, tacos, salads, fish and chips, and more). We never have to wait too long. If there is ever an issue they are always quick to make it right.  The adult beverages are on a self-serve system and you pay by the ounce. You can get a flight of beer or wine, but I prefer the Fuzzy Navel Hard Seltzer. Yum! We have loved their commitment to the community and love supporting a local business we believe in. Thank you Oz. Taphouse for being a great place to take my family!!!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for the weekend and found this place a short walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bourbon Berry Cocktail was my favorite! We also enjoyed sampling many different beers and wines on tap. Their crispy chicken sandwich was delicious! Very crispy on the outside and moist on in the inside.   They have crowlers and growlers for 25% off everyday. I really wish they had a smaller to go container as I would've loved to have taken some of the Berry cocktail home - I can't justify the cost of it to take home a crowler or growler. We would definitely go back if we were in the area again.

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this place which was an accidental find on our way back from one of our activities in Austin. It is a self-serve concept, so basically you are given a card to scan anytime you want to order a wine, beer, or a cocktail from one of their many taps. You also place your food order at the counter and they bring it out to you.   The fried avocado tacos were amazing and my significant other really enjoyed whatever tacos he had, which I believe were the Carnitas. Why four stars then? Two reasons. One is I was really confused on how much I should tip. I usually don't struggle with this being a bartender, but since we had to pour our own drinks and order food at the counter , I wasn't comfortable leaving a full 20%. Second, when you are pouring your beer, the price adds up very quick. There was one point my boyfriend poured a pint glass and the beer ended up being $22. That was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise the staff is VERY friendly and welcoming -they run a very tight ship. The bathrooms were exceptionally clean and the layout with a big outdoor patio is a bonus. Highly recommend, just watch the higher ABV beers because they add up fast!

reviews.author: Traci P.
reviews.description: I've ordered from Oz many times! Today I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with slaw on the side and sweet potato fries.  The fries were cold, the slaw was literally purple cabbage not dressed and there were 15 huge jalapeños on my sandwich! Will have to rethink about ordering again.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Stopped by Oz. Tap House for the first time after a Vandegrift H.S. football game, recommended to us by a family member.  "Go to Oz (pronounced Oz, like wizard of Oz) Tap House, is great.  First things first, we realized later it's not Oz it's Oz.  Notice the period after the z.  Oz. = ounce!  Makes perfect sense when you see the concept.  Dozens of self-serve taps, pouring cocktails, beer, wine, etc.  Way cool!  We couldn't tell how much vodka was actually in the Cosmos we had, but they were tasty!  The Community brand ice tea off the charts too.  Any place serving Community products knows their stuff ... oh yeah, the food.  Definitely "gotta go back for more" fare.  Fried cauliflower and jalapeños, nice ranch sauce.  Our server, unprompted, brought some buffalo wing sauce, "dip a little in here, then the ranch."  Awesomeness!  House tacos and cod tacos were delicious, depths of sublime flavors layered into top shelf flour tortillas.  Our only observation was using the house taco slaw on the cod tacos may be a better pairing than the sautéed cabbage... at any rate, the tacos were outstanding.  We'll definitely be back, lots more on the menu to explore.  And a special shout out to James working the register.  Explained the concept, led us through the process, and answered quite a few "newbie" questions.  He was great, no need to hire more employees, clone James!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: The uniqueness of this place really sets it apart. You are given a card to pour any of the beers on top yourself, which I had seen before and always love. What I hadn't seen was also you can pour wine or cocktails! This experience is perfect for all of those people crawling out of quarantine and not knowing what to do when they cant pour their own drinks. But now you can! And despite the setup involving many hands, Oz. keeps the place sparkling clean.  I can't speak much to the food menu. It's mostly a meat-forward fare. They have a vegan burger patty, but I was told neither of the buns are vegan. Since the patty was really soft, I am not sure it would work as a lettuce wrap. It seems weird to have a vegan patty when you can't have a full vegan burger, but at least there is a vegetarian option.  My mom liked her fish and chips.   I am really just here for the taps though!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: How lucky are we to arrive in Texas and meet this amazing place! It was like stepping in paradise. Delicious food and a whole variety of beers.   We tried a few of the beers and had some Tex-Mex.   I tried the sangria beer. I believe it was number 32 on the panel. If you like sangria and bubbles go for it, It's like sangria with bubbles (GF)  Husband had a few other kinds of beers which I tried and oh Man, It was very good! Nothing like I ever had before.   I also had the house tacos (3) with chicken, steak and fried avocado. The fried avocado was definitely a hit for me. It was full of flavor, creamy and crunchy at the same time.   If you are visiting Austin like us and want to drive away from the city you won't regret going to Oz Tap House.   Also, one of the owners is supper friendly we had the pleasure to speak with Sean briefly. Staff is also very nice, patiently explained to us how tap works.   Thanks Oz Tap House for such a memorable welcome!   I recommend this place to everyone!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place being so close to home and having a huge selection of beers with some wine. The food was average but the outdoor area was super fun for my kiddos.

reviews.author: Kerri A.
reviews.description: I just ordered lunch from Oz tap house. We got fish and chips, fried pickles,  a baked pretzel, a Caesar salad and a cheesesteak.   The pro's: The ranch dressing that came with the fried pickles was pretty good, As was the coleslaw.   The cons:  The fish and chips portion was small and soggy. It was two pieces of greasy fish, that iterally had no flavor. Fish and Chips is one of my favorite foods and I've had it all over the world. Never had I gotten it without flavor. How do you make something taste like nothing? Granted. I asked that the fish and chips have no hot pepper on it. Unfortunately, Hot pepper is the only spice Oz uses.  The fries were cold inside - clearly not hand-cut. The Caesar salad, was spicy in a weird way. It was not good.  The Philly Cheesesteak was very very spicy and greasy.  The Baked Pretzel - Auntie Ann's does a better job, this was a VERY basic, previously frozen pretzel. Nothing special and not worth the price.  The fried pickles - under seasoned and instead of crisp, they were chewy. Again not good.    Everything was extremely spicy, from the fish and chips to the Caesar salad. Food items that traditionally aren't spicy, were all grossly over spiced with hot peppers. Oz Tap House needs to learn how to use spices without making things spicy. Go back to cooking school - Spiced and Spicy! There is a difference! One more thing,  Read dietary notes. There's a reason why people write them.

reviews.author: Katy D.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. Fun for parents and kiddos! The staff is super welcoming and accommodating. Not to mention the owners are awesome as well. Try the tacos or the crispy chicken sandwich. So good!

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Ya know what, I loved this place. We came for the patio,but it was kind of crowded so we sat inside. We were greeted when we walked in,had the process explained etc.  Beers, a couple of ciders,and wines on tap. Pretty cool. I did semi accidentally pour myself 9 oz of wine, so it was a $12 glass, not what I'd typically spend on a glass of wine, but I also typically wouldn't be served 9 oz.  Our food came out quickly and it was really good!  I don't know much it was (folks mentioned auomatic gratuity) bc my husband paid, but it was great and we will definitely come back. They had a playground in the back that we saw,which would be great to come to with our lil people.

reviews.author: Beth L.
reviews.description: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Variety of options.  What really stuck out to us last night was customer service - from the front order person to the in-house table bussers, and the "tap Bosses" or so to speak.  They pay attention to what's going on. They make you feel like you are the most important person that has come in all day... and it was great to see lots of customers supporting this small business.  Plus, of course, there are MANY drink choices to sample and enjoy!!

reviews.author: Lea S.
reviews.description: Pretzel charcuterie board is amazing! Great place for families and they also have most sports games on the televisions as well. You can't go wrong with the selection of beers and wine.

reviews.author: Spencer C.
reviews.description: The idea is great, it's a self pour bar, they charge by ounce, only thing they did was bring out my order. Didn't check or see if we were all right. Overall everything is a little over priced. Food was sub par. Even happy hour there was only 5 cents off the beer. Expect around $8-9 for a 14 oz beer, and $15+ for mediocre food. And when I went to go tip, they looked at me confused as to why I didn't give them a big tip. Well the answer is simple. I did everything myself while all the workers sat on their phone talking in a booth.

reviews.author: Allison R.
reviews.description: I got the Brie berry burger. Everything tasted really good and I was so impressed that the burger was actually medium rare and was very pink and juicy! The onion rings were just okay. The breading wasn't very flavorful and kept falling off and the onions were not crispy. We also got the house tacos and the beef was good, and the fried avocado was amazing! Really liked the sauce they used!

reviews.author: Jack B.
reviews.description: Pretty good food and interesting beverage system. Great bar. Overall great place to have a small meal and a beer.

reviews.author: Stacy C.
reviews.description: Cool concept pay by the ounce tap house. Gives you plenty of opportunity to try all types of beers without having to get a full pint.  Food is good too, the ahi salad is delicious and the aren't skimpy with the ahi :).

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Way overrated. Gave this place a second chance today. Ordered delivery: 1/2 bbq chicken salad and Kieran's chicken sandwich. Both portions were inadequate and flavor terrible.  Salad smelled like b.o. and sandwich was one of the worst chicken sandwiches I have had. Quality nonexistent. Taking my business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Rosaura A.
reviews.description: Looooved it, absolutely!  Taking my California family there, when they come out for a visit, from Santa Barbara.    Great concept with "brew tastings."  Food was scrumptious!!!  Going back for date night soon!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: One of the closest breweries, in North Austin, to the Austin FC Q Stadium Oskar Blues Brewery is the best spots to stop and have some pre-game beers all in the air conditioning!  Plenty of space to come in with a large group of peeps and even catch some live music on a fantastic and great sounding stage!   My best friend and I came in on a busy Saturday afternoon on a game day so there were plenty of people enjoying beer by the pints and all dressed up in their verde gear. We ended up finding a cool spot near the stage to partake in the flight of beers we ordered.  I couldn't decide on what to get so we opted for the flights to get us started.    Beers - boy oh boy I have never had a smoothie hard seltzer beer ever and Oskar Blues knocked my socks off when I tried their L.A.B. Juice which was super refreshing and looked like a smoothie I make at home. Unsure what was in it but I bet strawberries, banana, and maybe some seltzer apple juice? Either way do not sleep on any of the beers they have on tap that are special to Austin as I am finding out that the beers on tap here differ from their other taprooms in Colorado!  What a special thing for Austin!  One of the biggest perks of Oskar Blues is the space, the live music, and the air conditioning! Texas has at least 9 months out of the year where it is consistently over 89 degrees even in the Fall. Oskar Blues has the air pumping on hot days like when we visited and had plenty of games and shade outside for us to hang under.   We will definitely be back especially to see some live music again. The stage is super professional, large, and the sound man was doing an excellent job for the acoustic performer we saw play that day. I am sure they have epic great shows here.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: decent beer options with a relaxed atmosphere.  I came through here this past weekend. First thing that stood out to me was how quiet everything was. it was early afternoon, and the place was relatively empty. it does have an extremely large open room, which lends itself to this. if you are looking for a more laid back experience, this place is probably a good bet. the beer itself was good. there wasn't anything that really stood out as fantastic, but nothing that really stood out as bad either. Overall, 3/5.

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: Oskar Blues is a great brewery in North Austin. Located close to the Domain, they offer a wide variety of beers. As a first timer, the bar tender gave me several samples to try. I went with the Dallas Blonde Ale and was not disappointed... it was actually very good.   There were plenty of hightops indoors for seating and the place was packed on a Thursday afternoon (5pm happy hour). I chose to sit on the patio outside where there were more picnic tables, tents, and even cornhole!   Fair warning, the parking lot is a bunch of rocks and dirt, so expect your car to be dirty when you leave. It also looks like a giant warehouse from the outside, but the entrance is along the far right side.  Definitely try Oskar Blues if you're in the area. One of my favorite breweries so far!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: This regional brewery has a spacious indoor area with a formidable stage space for local talent to perform on and a projector screen for game nights. They have an outdoor space as well with minimal shade. They are pet friendly outdoors. Friendly staff and average Untapped rated brews. I enjoyed my flight here, everything was OK. With all the other spots in town, this is not top of my list, but wouldn't refuse to go here either. If they opened up the fences between properties they could build a direct walking path to the stadium.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Compared to other breweries in the area I feel like Oskar Blues doesn't get a ton of love but I've really enjoyed my experiences when coming here! They do a great job of utilizing their massive space, they're one of the few breweries with tvs (when indoor dining/drinking is available) and they have a massive stage for live music (again when indoor is a viable option).   I recommend trying more of their seasonal or offshoot beers if you visit than their staples. For one, their flagship beers are available nationwide and I haven't found any of them to be particularly noteworthy.   The seasonal beers cast a really wide net and have had more hits than misses in my experience. Their Death by Coconut Porter and Slow Chill Dunkel were both fantastic and they do a pretty good job with their various juicy IPAs.   The food truck has some really tasty tacos and I like that they've partnered with the brewery to give 4$ off a food order for every full pour of beer you order. This does come with the caveat that the prices are kind of outrageous if you don't utilize this option, but it becomes a pretty good deal with it. The tacos are more traditional street taco style, so if that's not your thing they do have some more typical bar fare like burgers, fries, and nachos.   Overall, I think it's a great hang out spot. They are reliably not super packed, they have a wide variety of mostly good beers, and have a food truck that will keep you satisfied while you hang out. I don't think any of the other breweries in this part of Austin can boast all three of those, so I highly recommend!

reviews.author: Justyna B.
reviews.description: Love this place!  My only 'complaint' if you can even call it that is they don't have a fenced in playground.  Most of the breweries coming up are realizing that fenced in playground help bring in us family people who can't afford sitters all the time.   Lol.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Stopped in April 2021. Love Oskar Blues. Had a taster of a new sour, guava sour- excellent. Bought a crawler of barrel aged Ten Fidy- not cheap but god stuff. Great brew, nice staff.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: You can never go wrong here, but it was PAcKEd! With the pandemic decided to do To go order. I did try sample if Guava Rodeo, wow delicious! But ended up taking bourbon barrel aged beer home. That is even better!

reviews.author: Jingyan Y.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with plenty of outdoor seating. Staff wearing masks and seating all far apart - def covid friendly! Hand sanitizer for use available. Dog friendly outdoors. Lots of beer choices available for ~$5 per pint. Because of COVID they added an extra $5 charge to our tab, but we could use that credit at the food truck. Gives free bag of chips with the beer. Good music. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: This is a fun Brewery that we go to frequently.  Not only is the beer tasty but they have a large stage with live music throughout the week.  There are plenty of tables and even a few very comfy high-backed vinyl booths.   Also, the typical beer garden area outside with strung lights, roomy tables and corn hole games.   The bands that play are varied with an emphasis to blues and rock. We have discovered a few local bands we like just from going for a beer on a Friday evening.  For certain bands, they will clear a small area in front of the stage for dancing.  The beers they offer are good, but its a smaller selection than some breweries. They stick to a few classics like several IPAs, a couple stouts, a pilsner. Have yet to seen any kind of sours offered. Would love to see a specialty sour.  There is a Wunderpig barbecue truck on site with very tasty sandwiches. Be sure and grab napkins!  Large clean bathrooms, friendly bartenders, and plenty of parking too. Can't go wrong here.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: I've officially been to Oscar Blues a handful of times and I love it! Out of the 3 or 4 Breweries that I've been to in the area, this one is my favorite!   They have free, live music very frequently with a great stage and sound set up.   The staff is awesome and to say that they are friendly would be an understatement. A couple of occasions I've been here with my boyfriend's band and they treated the members and their guests with top notch service.   Last but not least, their beer is awesome! My go-to is always the Rose for Dayz just because I'm a fruity/citrusy kind of girl haha.   This has definitely turned into a regular hangout place.

reviews.author: Gabriel G.
reviews.description: Looking for a local brewery to grab a drink and have good barbecue, I picked this place because it was close to the office and hotel and it had a decent ranking on everyone's favorite food app, "Yelp".  Arriving to the site, I was a little concerned that I may have read the Yelp review wrong. The opening is a driveway to a parking lot behind an industrial warehouse. So you might find it a little disconcerting as you drive over 100 feet of driveway and then cross into a chain-link surrounded dirt parking lot.   What hit me in the face was the taproom essence, which smelled of old beer and sanitizer fluid. Not a big fan of the smell. Then the décor of the taproom reminded me of a mix of a 1970's New Year's party and a crushed velvet weekend band cave. (Lol, I don't know how good the bands are that play there but they had it set up like it.) What I thought was strange was the noise level which was almost whisper-like and the lack of any music playing over the speakers. I may have gone at an off time but still, there should have been some music playing in the background.  The beer was tasty. I had the Can-O-Bliss Citra and the G-Knight. The bouquet off the Can-O-Bliss was amazing but lamentably, the flavor wasn't there to back it up. I preferred the G-Knight much more. It was good go-to IPA.   Sitting there I was hungry and asked to see the menu. They handed me a short menu and told me that I had to order outside at a food truck that was parked in the parking lot. It was raining and I wasn't too keen on ordering outside but I was hungry so I sucked it up and did it. You can see my review at Wunder Pig Barbecue - Yelp. But the long and short of it is the food was a big disappointment. And there was no bar food available. No finger foods! Bummer.   I realize you aren't a restaurant but please kick that food truck off the parking lot and get one that serves bar/finger food and better barbecue.

reviews.author: Angel D.
reviews.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is located in Austin, TX right next to Caliber Collision on Metric Blvd. Luckily-- my father in law works right next door to this Brewery. He was the very one that introduced us to this place. I love craft beer and I must say I love Oskar Blue's beers!!! What I enjoy the most about this place is that they offer beer-flights! My top favs has got to be Mamas Little Yella Pils and Can-O-Bliss IPA!  I love that they also have live music here. I believe when a band is performing, that's the only time they won't be able to sell you a beer flight.. Music could get super loud so luckily they have outside seating as well. It's crazy how busy they could get! Lol. All the tables inside fill up super quickly because of the live music.  Overall experience: fantastic. I love the atmosphere, also this brewery is clean and spacious. The workers are very friendly and I always have a good time conversing with them. Great music and even better beers! Until next time

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Beer is tasty and the place is huge. Indoors looks kind of like an intimate concert venue--they have a stage so I assume they have some events. Lots of outdoor space with corn hole. Shaded picnic tables so you're not roasting in the sun.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This place is a great place to hang out! My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday and it was really nice outside and they have inside and outside seating. They have a stage for music and a wide variety of beers to choose from. The service was great and they sell some cool swag as well. I will definitely be going back!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Out of the handful of breweries I've visited in the ATX, this one is hands down my favorite!  It's VERY spacious, and has plenty of room to sit at the large bar, or one of the many tables in the venue.    They have a decent size stage for live music, but I was there on an early evening, so nothing was going on at that time.  There was a decent sized crowd in the place, but it wasn't too loud and it didn't make you feel cramped.  I mentioned the spacious seating area - they have quite a few long tables that are great for group get togethers.   Nice apparel shop with brewery t-shirts, hats, koozies, stickers, and more.  They have 16 beers on tap.  You can get a sampler flight of four beers for eight bucks - you just can't beat that with a stick!  They have six choices of non alcoholic soda and a sparkling water option.  Nice sized patio with a covered tarp to keep the sun off of you and keep you out of the rain.  Giant Jenga and other games to play out on the patio - it's really a fun place to hang out.''  There's usually a food truck parked outside - I was told it's a permanent fixture and their "home base", so check them out.  It's called  "Cluck n Burger" and it was awesome.  Look for my review for that one coming soon.  The beers I had inside were Mama's Little Yella Pils (I've had it before and it's OK).  But the one that blew my socks off was the the Old Chub Scotch Ale.  This really surprised me, because I'm not usually into the heavier flavored beers.  But this one was just so divine and delectable.  I'm gonna have to begin a search for this one in my local beer joints in SA.  They're open from noon to 8pm Sunday and Monday and from noon to 10pm every other day of the week.  Wi-Fi password is Oskarblues

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great find! Driving there at night, you might think you are driving into a forbidden, industrial area but turning on the street where the brewery is, you will see the lights.  I happened to come on a night where there was live music. The stage is in a great location and there are table and chairs for people to sit and enjoy the show. The decor is very unique and you can tell you are in a brewery.   The staff was very nice and I truly enjoyed talking to the friendly bartenders. The outside area has long picnic type tables were a large party or group of friends can come and hang.  I went alone, but a cute programmer by the name of Daniel came and chat to keep me company!  I will definitely visit this location again for a beer!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The first time I tried Oskar Blues beer was the Can-O-Bliss hazy IPA from HEB. It was pretty good, so I knew one day I would make the trip up north. And it was definitely worthwhile.  The beautiful thing about Oskar Blues is the accessibility. Everybody knows about Dale's Pale Ale Walk into any bar, dive or elevated, and you'll probably see DPA on their draft pours selection. Also, the Austin Costco sells the variety pack of canned beers, which is how I also got to know their "Canarchy Collective"--is what they call it. In the taproom, both of us had their taster flight, which was four beers for $8. It's pretty standard flight pricing in Austin. I had a hard time choosing what to taste because everything looked so good. However, I chose the Guayabera PA, Jai Alai IPA, Rose for Daze and their Can-O-Bliss (because why not choose something you already love?). I enjoyed all of them pretty much, and I love that their flight rack isn't one of those "drag and hold" types. THANK YOU. We all know the drag-type rack causes spillage. Which means less. beer. Boom.  We sat inside because...Austin summer heat. There were annoying slow phat flies that kept on bothering us, which was a bummer. However, everything else was great. Our taptender was very chill as there were basically only a few other people in the taproom that afternoon with us. They also have phone chargers WITH the cables just in case your phone is dying! Amazing. Plus their wifi is strong and restrooms clean. They have plenty of outdoor and indoor seating (think college mess hall size), and a merch corner if you are in the mood to get some of their swag. I also enjoyed how their brewing room is open for onlookers to peer through. There is tons of space and even a stage for live music, it seems. Google maps didn't take us to the front parking area, however there are signs amongst the industrial businesses there (the best microbrews are always hidden in the industrial businesses!) for "back parking."

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Great spot- live music, lots of seating options, food truck. I only tried two of their beers and they were pretty good but I would like to go back and try the others!

reviews.author: Kate M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a great size, has tours, a taco truck, huge patio and is dog-friendly! My friends loved the unique beer options with flavors like coconut, pine and grapefruit. Only downside is no gluten-free options besides sparkling water. Would be nice if they had soda or white claw cans for purchase.

reviews.author: Wanda C.
reviews.description: I spent my Christmas Eve here. I did not feel lonely for one moment because Yvonne was my bartender and she was so much fun to talk with! Hi Yvonne! She helped me with the menu and was very knowledgeable on all the choices.  I had the Cuban Nachos and Mionetto Prosecco during the 3pm to 6pm happy hour and both were absolutely delish at a great price! I will be going back.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: On a particularly busy day at another nearby restaurant, we opted to forego the hour long wait and wound up at Hard Count. My boyfriend was pleased with the abundance of sports on the many large screen TVs.   The food was good, especially his chicken enchiladas, which had a nice little bite. I opted for the seared salmon Caesar which was recommended by our server. The salmon was fresh, they have seafood shipped in fresh never frozen, but was a little bland. I enjoyed the salad all the same. It was a nice alternative on a day where we were unwilling to wait.

reviews.author: Mary O.
reviews.description: This is one of the newer Georgetown spots and we finally made it out for a late lunch. I've been craving fish and chips - which I've heard is one of their specialties.    We started with the Calamari Diablo - it wasn't as spicy as I expected, but it was delish! The calamari pieces were sliced thinner and crispy.  Peppered thru the dish were fried pickles and shaved Parmesan that complemented the appetizer nicely!  The dip was "marinara-ish" with sliced onions - Yummy!   The menu had plenty of great options but we both got fish and chips.  The plate was loaded with 3 large battered/fried cod pieces.   The crunch to fish ratio was on point!  The dish came with a unique slaw made from cabbage, apple slices and apple cider Vinegar- I couldn't place my finger on the spices but it was very tasty!  The thin sliced apples popped in the slaw.   The waffle fries were crunchy (I normally don't like waffle fries but these were thinner and possibly light battered/double fried with perfect seasoning.   We will definitely return ~ looking forward to trying more options from the menu and bringing friends with us next time.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: Never been to this location before but let me just say it is worth a visit.  I enjoy fish and chips and found that they do it just right here!  In my opinion the only thing I did not like was the waffle fries were crunchy, mainly because there's some weird additives they added to them, looks like some kind of sesame seeds or something.  Waffle fries are just fine by themselves with great seasoning no need to add weird crunchy stuff, I literally thought I was going to check my teeth only reason why I didn't go five stars here.  My wife got the blackened salmon Caesar salad which I must say was above and beyond with a ton of flavor! I will probably get this next time.  On another note their coleslaw is unlike anything I've had before some kind of a cilantro vinaigrette highbred but I must say I do anything to learn this recipe!  Decent draft beer selection and a handful of wines this place is worth a visit especially if it's game day and you're looking for a good game there's TVs in every direction you look pretty good sports bar especially at an upscale level I would recommend it definitely give this place a shot!

reviews.author: Blackmoorbz ..
reviews.description: I have been to this restaurant twice and it is my new favorite and I'm very picky the steak special is delicious  and the fried shrooms are Amazing!! I wouldn't order the burger again it was nothing special but everything else has been delicious

reviews.author: Chase D.
reviews.description: This place has great food, a wonderful bar, great drink selections and a lot of TVs. My only criticism here would to improve their marketing campaign and they would blow the doors off. You don't see them on social media or really anything.

reviews.author: Marilyn W.
reviews.description: We found this restaurant in a portion of Georgetown that we had never been in before.  We felt like we were in a different country or state... maybe Florida. And the restaurant was also a new dining experience. We ordered "regular" food including a hamburger and fish dinner.  But they were very good. The waiter was outstanding and made us feel like we got special service.  We will go there again soon.

reviews.author: Josh J.
reviews.description: Wow. Amazing spot, really. Server Gaby was wonderful. We were at the bar of 2020 Scratch and saw this place across the street so searched it. I would HIGHLY recommend to management to change your classification to include restaurant as well because when searching for that this place won't pop up. BUT the fish and chips is killer, very crispy and great flavor. The slaw on the side is some of the best slaw I've had. Also love all the sauces it comes with. Will def be back.

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: Great food, drinks, and service. Amazing atmosphere and live music in the courtyard Tuesday nights. New fav spot

reviews.author: Nichole E.
reviews.description: This is a true hidden gem in Georgetown and I'm so glad we found it! We came here for a late lunch today. I got the Joey's el Classico margarita and my fiancé got the roadrunner. Unfortunately my margarita was way too sour for me and I hate to be this person, but I asked if I could trade it out. Our waitress said yes and I got the jalapeño martini which was way more enjoyable. For an appetizer we got the Cuban nachos, which was basically the fillings of a Cuban sandwich served over a bed of homemade chips with a swiss queso. I'm salivating just writing this because it was so good we cleaned the plate!  For my meal I ordered the chicken fried steak that came with mashed potatoes, bacon green beans and Texas toast. Y'all....as a southern girl I consider myself a chicken fried steak aficionado, and they know what they're doing. The serving was huge, the breading  flavorful and crispy, and the gravy was so good I wanted to dip everything in it. You can also really tell that their sides are not an afterthought because the green beans were so good I couldn't stop eating them even well after I was full. My fiancé got the fish and chips and while I didn't personally try it he said it was delicious, and again, the portions were huge! You definitely get your money's worth here. Along with the great food we also had great service so next time we're in Georgetown we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kalee M.
reviews.description: INCREDIBLE! Amazing service, beautiful atmosphere, everything tasted amazing! Drinks were a little strong but most people prefer that! We sat outside and it was beautiful

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Food is amazing! Their outdoor set up desperately needs fans. Service was great for our large group for my birthday dinner! The hot chicken club is HUGE and delish!!!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: Wow! What an amazing meal. I stumbled upon this hidden gem while in the area grabbing thing at a near by Home Depot. I was hungry and had already tried some near by restaurants. This place was not busy and the ambiance seemed nice.  My friends and I were a starving and boy did we come to the right place. We started with cooked oysters that were absolutely mouth watering. One of my friends had never had oysters so I was excited that he enjoyed them. We also got the pork belly queso, it was a bit thick but full of flavor. The chips were crispy and seasoned which helped with the thick cheese. One friend got the Buffalo chicken sandwich, the biggest juiciest chicken breast I'd ever seen. He left nothing on his plate! My other friend go the fish and chips, he does not like coleslaw but this was no ordinary slaw. The head chef explained they don't use vinegar and they do add celery seed. I was the big girl and ordered the pork chop, large portion but I ate it down to the bone. I wish I had another option besides mashed potatoes but overall it was awesome. We did order cocktails, peach martini and margaritas. Our server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. We were immediately greeted and seated. Our food was fresh and hot and the wait wasn't long at all. I can't wait to go back and try desserts.

reviews.author: Rise L.
reviews.description: Cold beer. A good old fashioned for my husband. Lots of menu options. And yummy eats. The atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for on a Football Saturday and the food was SO good and filling. My husband enjoyed their chicken fried steak and their chicken piccata pasta was oh so good. Not too hard on the wallet either! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Charmayne J.
reviews.description: This was my second time coming here. First time I got food to go and it was delish. I was told appetizers were half off during happy hour. Two weeks later, I'm two days short of the half off apps. Ok cool. I wanted the shrimp and lobster roll. No longer on the not updated menu. Ok cool. I got the tiny flavorless not seasoned at all salmon and salad, grilled oysters which were excellent( they didn't last) and side stale waffle fries....... I get more fries for cheaper at McDonald. That are fresh. I pay $14/ 3-4 pieces of fresh salmon at heb. Sooooo this salmon has got to be bomb to justify this size for $18 w salad. All in all, not pleased w my second shot at this establishment.

reviews.author: Ashley E.
reviews.description: Love this new hidden gem! Really nice upscale sports bar with farm to table food. The service is amazing and the food is even better! I got the salmon Cesar and it was to die for! So fresh and flavorful. Definitely my new favorite spot!

reviews.author: Rigo G.
reviews.description: An upscale sports bar and grill, this restaurant has some amazing dishes. We've come by twice now and both times have left very satisfied. Will keep coming back to try the different dishes and superb customer service. Oh yeah, they make some killer cocktails too... Spicy Margaritas by Linda...

reviews.author: Christian F.
reviews.description: Food was cold and we spent long periods of time waiting for our server while the restaurant was pretty much empty

reviews.author: Theresa H.
reviews.description: Had brunch this morning.  Adam our server, was very attentive, friendly and provided fantastic service.  This place has a great staff starting with the hostess and continuing with our server.  The food is always good and hot.  We will be visiting again in the near future.  Kudos to management.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: Spent a girls evening at Hard count   I personally prefer beer which they have plenty of  My friends loveeeeee Fancy! and prefer pretty cocktails.   We decided to meet and have a girls night for appetizers.  However after looking over the menu which is AMAZING !!! we each ordered dinner and also appetizers.   Our 1 hour let's catchup girl time. Ended 5 hours later having the best time.  (Casual yet classy)Our New favorite place to meet in Georgetown.  We have officially tried everything on the menu and consider ourselves... seasoned professionals at this point!!! Love this place and the staff on point and know their food. Recommend for lunch, Dinner or fancy cocktails... or beer

reviews.author: Priscila M.
reviews.description: First time at Slab BBQ and it's already our go to bbq in the area. First, all meats are gluten free! Yay!!!! Second, their meats are delicious! I had the chicken and the brisket and both were really good , seasoned well and very moist - cooked to perfection. I couldn't finish my salad and took maybe half of it home. So, portion wise, this is also a win. My daughter had the 1/2 ribs and we were all taken by surprise on the flavor. Seriously, TRY their RIBS!!!  They have a selection of different sauces, including a strawberry one that came with the ribs. I was very skeptical at first, but it worked pretty well. However, their mustard based one is my favorite.  We can't wait to be back!

reviews.author: Kara M.
reviews.description: Great BBQ for an even greater price! I was really impressed with everything we tried, and for it all being just under $50, it was worth it. It's not your "traditional" BBQ stop - the menu is really fun and there are some pretty creative treats to try, from Texas-sized sandwiches to habanero strawberry glazed ribs. The meats were tender as could be, the flavor was incredible, and the sauces were amazing. Will definitely be visiting again!   Service: 5/5 Food: 5/5  Individual food ratings: - Habanero Strawberry Glazed ribs (5/5): sweet and spicy (but more sweet), these ribs were perfectly tender and had really great flavor! You can get them without the glaze, or get the glaze on the side. - Smoked Gouda Mac'n'cheese (4/5): pretty tasty mac, very cheesy and creamy, would be great with hot sauce or meat. - BBQ nachos w/brisket (5/5): super loaded, huge shareable portion, and great flavors! Add extra sauces on top to get saucy. - El Jefe sammie (5/5): brisket, onions, peppers, and Fritos for some crunch, this was a great sandwich and super filling! - Twice baked potato casserole (3/5): needed a kick or maybe some more salt/pepper, but was good overall with the dank white sauce on top.

reviews.author: Rose J.
reviews.description: Finally a barbecue joint worth raving about. When you enter you are met with the smooth sounds of  music. Very chill vibe!!!   The menu pretty easy to survey and food comes out quick fresh and hot! Those are the things I love quick fresh and hot. The prices are appropriate and the sides are reasonably priced. Also the baked beans was the business. Oh, yeah the nortorious BIG was delicious! It's topped with Cole slaw and piled with brisket very tender meat!   I love this place and it was a short drive from the hotel.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Good stuff! I was very hungry in the late afternoon and heading to play many competitive games of ping pong, so I stopped here. The food was yummy. The pulled pork sandwich had very good flavor and the Mac and cheese was fabulous. They also serve beer which complements BBQ , IMHO. The service was courteous and prompt. The dining area was clean, though we opted to sit in their temporary outdoor seating area because it was a beautiful day. Check it out as an alternative fast food option.

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: Umm YUM! Checked Slab out for lunch mid week and it was SO good! I crave bbq every once in a while and this spot was nearby so I gave it a chance. The have 4 types of sauces, I sampled them all and my fav has to be the backyard red sauce. We ordered the Texas OG on a tortilla and the Tony Montana. The brisket was meaty and fatty. The Tony Montana could have had more queso on it for sure. We also tried the gouda Mac and cheese amd twice baked potato and it was creamy and pretty good. The potato was just ok according to my boyfriend. They are located in a strip mall with lots of parking.

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: This is an easy to find place that gives you a feel of a comfortable locals/neighborhood place. Lots of TVs and some covered outside seating as well.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal! Our party of three started with the double meat bbq brisket nachos, then we shared 1/2 # of ribs, a Texas Tornado wrap with double brisket (absolutely LOVE their brisket) then added an extra large order of the smoked Gouda Mac and cheese, green bean casserole and finished up with a banana pudding .  Gotta say I haven't eaten such great bbq for years AND took home enough for another meal.  This is my new go-to for Austin BBQ! They have a nice selection of regular and craft beers as well.  Definitely a repeater!!

reviews.author: Lorri P.
reviews.description: We hadn't had any bbq since we arrived in Austin for our vacation. We found Slab on Yelp and we were impressed! The sliders, brisket nachos and chicken sandwich were all delicious. The max n cheese was good, it had a smoky flavor, like it was cooked on the grill. The potato salad didn't have any flavor but we just know not to order it, it was a side and not the star of the show like the meats. The music was great! If I lived here, I would definitely be here once a week! Great food and vibe!

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by for the Yelp Texas Trending Machine today around 11:30 and it was clear that this plce already has a place in the heart of locals. The line was long, but luckily I was able to head to the to-go desk and place my order fairly quickly...Brisket Nachos packaged with all the ingredients separated so as not to get soggy. They easily survived the drive home to Cedar Park and were super delicious and unique! Like a chopped brisket sandwich on tortilla chips with queso. Um, yes, please.  This barbecue place has a vibe like no other. The walls and music combine hip hop with classic Texas in a way I would not have dreamed possible, but it works. Pretty trendy spot. I really appreciated the clear partitions separating tables as a covid precaution.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: There were brisket nachos involved too but I only got a photo of the ribs as the nachos were halfway gone by then  they were excellent and a generous portion. The St. Louis ribs are some of the most tender I've had.  I wasn't a huge fan of the bbq sauce that came with the ribs but it's on the side and they have other sauces available as well- the one it came with was a little sweet for me. Planning on bringing my small rib aficionado this weekend after the pumpkin patch.  One complaint... the kids meal ribs says it comes with two.. TWO. Mine will be asking where the rest are if I ordered him a kids meal  they do have a great amount of meat on them but I have a 3 year old that eats like a teenager when he has ribs in front of him so these kids meals won't work for us  we will be getting a whole rack and I'll be lucky if *I* get to have two.

reviews.author: LaPeshaa C.
reviews.description: SLAB is one of my favorite bbq joints and that's based off those good ole tender fall off the bone ribs! Ohhh how I love those ribs! Their chicken is good, the brisket is great, but BOY them ribs! Whew! They've got great sandwiches too if that's more your thing. I really like their green bean casserole as well. If you haven't gone yet, GO!

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: There's a reason this place has 1.8k reviews on Google. It's outstanding and the vibe is everything you want in a BBQ spot in Austin.   Slider Trio was great, be aware the the third sandwich is chicken, although, still excellent.   Brisket Nachos were a surprise. Probably Top 3 Nachos I've ever had.

reviews.author: Alysia G.
reviews.description: Brisket Nachos are a must!!! Would like to come back and try the sides, everything looks delicious and staff are super friendly. If it's crowded you may have to eat outdoors, but there is shade at least and they have comfortable seating.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: I don't know why I haven't already been eating at Slab BBQ, but I'm definitely going to become a regular customer now! Right when you walk in, the smell hits you, and you know you've picked the right place.  Not only do they have great food, they have a bar with beer, several flat screen TVs and a nice-sized patio area. I had the BBQ nachos with extra queso and rib meat; it had jalapeños, diced onions and pickles and one of their signature bbq sauces drizzled on top. My meal was so amazing, and the portion size was enough to get full and still have half of the plate to take home(which is equally amazing after reheating in the oven).

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Hands down. Get down. Low down. They are on the finest point you'll ever hope to find in a BBQ joint. Stop wasting your time scrolling through reviews and check out Slab.

reviews.author: AJ B.
reviews.description: Came for the trending machines and got a bandanna and candle ! We were not golden ticket winners but we did get the complimentary nachos which were super good! We also had a great time playing galaga inside the Pac-Man machine for free!!! Definitely would recommend and return for more nachos!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: We found Slab via an Eater list and Yelp reviews and it was pretty good! We knocked off a star bc some of the meat was dry, the smoked mac was very runny and the coleslaw wasn't too good but overall enjoyed our meal. We allotted more time here for lunch bc we assumed there'd be a lunch rush and orders would be slower if meats were being smoked throughout the day but our meal came out almost instantly so stuff was ready to go / could have contributed to some of the meat being dry....  * Slab slider trio - sliders of Notorious PIG, Texas OG and Chicken WA. Notorious was very good flavor and pulled pork was still nicely moist. The Texas OG was kind of a let down bc the brisket was dry and there wasn't a lot of sauce on the sandwich to keep it moist and flavorful. The chicken WA was actually pretty good and the chicken surprisingly stayed moist * El Jefe - hubby got this was and liked it.. the brisket wasn't as dried as it was on my Texas OG * Smoke gouda mac - I love macs and this was way too runny, wish the sauce was more creamy * Cole slaw - my hubby is a cole slaw snob and he thought this didn't really have enough flavor  They had outdoor seating so we got to people watch but it is in a strip mall, so not too much to see.  Woman at the counter was very nice and gave recos for us while we were ordering.

reviews.author: Lisa O.
