reviews.description: Food is great, but they need to update their information. Phone number rings off the hook without an answer, and kitchen times are WAY OFF. Menu shows breakfast available at 630am, but when I went in to get food...they said their kitchen doesn't open until 11am...seems pretty counter intuitive when serving breakfast items...

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: My wife loved her taco and I enjoyed my broken yolk BLT with unlimited Katz coffee from Houston.  They have an amazing selection of beers and wine.  The Katz coffee was superb and they have a selection of three different roasts to choose from, me likey!

reviews.author: Joseph S.
reviews.description: The "pancakes" that come with the pancake breakfast are actually closer to silver dollar pancakes, and they don't have ANYTHING to put on the toast   I asked for butter for the SINGLE thinnest piece of Texas toast I've ever seen, and they didn't have that or any jelly or cream cheese or ANY topping to put on this.  3 eggs, half a potato, two strips of bacon and a single slice of dried toast are not worth $8. Save your money and

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: This is food in a gas station and it taste like it. The food is not worth even a drive around the corner.  There are too many great places around to waste your time or money.  Staff is not friendly.

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: What a great place for a beer and good food!!  If you haven't come here yet I highly recommend it for, if nothing else, their beer selection! They have the coolest draft beers on tap of just about any place I have been! And they do not cost a ton either!  I got the temptress mole and at 13% alcohol it was only 6$!!!! WOWZERS!  They constantly roll in and out different beers on tap and have a large cooler filled with other interesting types too... just can't go wrong!  Their wine selection is something to be cherished too... seriously... you have got to try this place!  Since the last time I was here it does seem to have slipped a bit in maintenance... light in hall way not working, icee machines down... cooler for sodas really low... and the extra TVs in eating area are off... I think we need to rally for this establishment!  For a gas station restaurant it is really so very very cool! You can't beat the selection! I don't want to see this place fold up... it truly is a coo cool coo place!

reviews.author: Terry K.
reviews.description: This is a great local gem but everyone in the Austin area should know about it and stop by for their amazing wine selection!!! amazing pizza (crazy incredible ingredients) and great service to boot. Join their wine club, pick up a pizza pack to make at home and stop by to say hi to the owner Zahir. You will make this a great destination to meet friend, take you family and just have fun.

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: hey my first time,here very impressive little store. It has,wine,beer and other knickknacks. It's also part diner, friendly courteous service and pretty good coffee. A new stop on my morning walk,when in Round Rock.I deafly will stop again and enjoy some of the other offerings of this store

reviews.author: Gabrielle F.
reviews.description: The food was amazing! That rosemary truffle ketchup is what's up. Only thing I'd say is for to go orders maybe use better packaging cause all the juices from burger kiiiinda spilled lol but It wasn't crazy..definitely going again

reviews.author: Sarah N.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this place. It's a hidden gem with great food, great beer, and great service!  Definitely opt for the rosemary ketchup. It's legit.  Their pizza is bomb. Their fries are great. Burgers are just okay, but I guess you can't have it all, right?  Go there - you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Penny J.
reviews.description: I'm puzzled after my last visit.  My Son ordered a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon and they said they didn't have any.  So we ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and they said they didn't have that either.  My Son came and asked me what else I wanted since they didn't have either so I walked up and asked what they had.  The guy brings a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon and said I have this. I laughed and said ok let me get a glass please. So if you specialize in wine, why not educate your bartenders on wine. There seemed to be only 3 bottles out of wine they were pouring.  Pizza was good. It was a busy Friday and everyone just seemed too busy and not customer friendly at all. I guess you have to be a regular and sit at the bar to get smiles.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great- its a bar with munchies NOT a restaurant- pretty drinks exceptional service - clean, nice, comfy - whats not to love - just don't go expecting to eat a meal :-)

reviews.author: Cameron D.
reviews.description: Found this bar via reviews when doing an online search. Don't let the fact that it is a hotel bar fool you. Tony is an expert in making drinks. He is super cool and really everyone here is at the hotel as well. We live in the area and will come back for the famous brown sugar old fashioned and margaritas!

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Come see Tony - had the brown sugar Old Fashioned. Yum!  Cool little place. Have some sweet and savory bites.

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Was welcomed immediately. Friendly, attractive bartender. And most importantly, a good drink!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in Cedar Park. Tony the bartender is great. A real mixologist.  You MUST try this out.

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeño margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Samantha L.
reviews.description: This is one of the biggest bar/restaurants I've ever been to in America! They have indoor seating and half outdoor seating (it's "outside" of the restaurant but still covered on all sides - great for when it's cold out!   It's a cool bar with live music and games but my favorite part is the food!   We got the cheese fondue that came with a bowl of pretzels and it was nothing I expected at all - pretzels are okay at best usually and most places has cheese that taste gross but this was the best pretzel/cheese combo I've ever had!! The pretzel balls were pretty big in size from what I was expecting, they were warm and perfectly seasoned and delicious! And then the cheese - wow I could literally drink a jar of it if I wasn't my age and getting heartburn everyday as is. I haven't stopped thinking about the pretzels and cheese since my first bite! I definitely want to go back to Austin just for this dish.   And then for entree my boyfriend and I split the butternut lasagna and they were so nice enough to split the dish for us without us having to ask.   Oh yeah and for drinks (I forgot to take a pic) but we got the Smashed Irishman and it was so good we ordered 5 through out dinner.   The staff was really nice and the place was super busy so some things took a little longer to come out and we were forewarned before ordering anyway.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: Wow - this place is SO good. We were in town for the weekend and decided to eat here because it's dog friendly and right near our hotel. Place was very busy on a Saturday night - multiple parties out on the porch.   I still dream about their chopped chicken salad! - so good!    They have a big drink menu with cute cocktails. Staff was so nice and my dog loved all the loving he got from everyone there.   It's definitely a casual/loud/fun ambiance!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Katelyn W.
reviews.description: Me and my friend wanted to go somewhere to have a drink and visit. This place had the best outdoor area and so we have them a chance. I love Brussels so I had to try their Brussels sprouts. They are delicious and super spicy. Next we ordered some pork belly nachos which were so tasty. However it was too much food for the both of us. You definitely need a large group for them to be worth it. Overall would go back to this place.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I've been here a couple times now. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the outdoor patio area! It's open and airy but nice and shaded too. I've been here for brunch and got the breakfast burrito. It is huge and it's pretty good! I'd have to say my favorite menu item so far is the fried chicken! The breading is crispy and the meat juicy. The portion is pretty large so you get to take some home! Overall this place is a good go-to spot!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Nelli S.
reviews.description: Really good food, really hip atmosphere. My family enjoyed watching the food be prepared through the glass. We tried the burgers, the pork nachos, the salmon, and the kale salad. The Kale salad was incredible. I would have given a higher rating accept that it seemed our waiter forgot about us and we waited over 45 minutes for our food and appetizer. Otherwise, I think it is worth a try and the whole area of downtown Austin is great for kids.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-25-21  Quality/Quantity - Gochujang Brussels Sprout - I would have preferred the brussel sprouts to have been a little more crispy. Could not really taste the gochujang flavor, not spicy at all. Kurobuta Pork Ribs - My favorite, good flavor. Would have preferred more fries though. Spicy Vegan Curry - My daughter's choice, I guess it was good, but not something I would have ordered. Had a hint of lemon grass after taste, which is a little different from Indian or Thai Curry. Separated rice versus rice combined in the sauce is also preferred, so we can control the flavor.  Atmosphere - This is a very good spot. I like both the indoor and outdoor space. There were a few activities (cornhole, etc) for the guests. I like the choices of seating - regular tables, high top tables, bar seating, couches, etc. Additionally, your huge wrap around bar was nice. Lastly, I am always a fan of an open kitchen concept.  Service - Julia did a good job; she came back and refilled our water often. It was really busy and the entire team seemed to be working hard. I also noticed 2 employees picking up garbage as they walked back and forth serving customers, this is always a positive plus.  Price - $49.80 + tip  Owner Suggestion - Seems like you are very successful, owning quite a few restaurants. Congrats on all your success, and wish you many more. I look forward to trying your other restaurants in the future.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Candace S.
reviews.description: Our experience eating at Culinary Dropout was nothing short of perfection. We went on a Monday night with all three of our very young kids. It was busy but there wasn't a wait if we wanted to sit outside. I was concerned because of how cold it was outside, but they assured us that the heating lamps outside kept it pretty comfortable so we could check and feel it out if we wanted. They were correct; between the heat lamps and the heated seating (amazing!), we faired well.   Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. He recommended his favorites to us and we took him up on them. I ordered the Spicy Korean Skirt Steak and my husband ordered the Prime Rib sandwich. They were both absolutely delicious. Like finger-licking good. I seriously can't wait to go back. I also love that they have a kids menu and are more than willing to bring the kids food out first if you ask! We will be returning to try the ribs soon!

reviews.author: Darris J.
reviews.description: This muthafucka is LOUD. You literally have to shout at a person 12 inches away from you. Just ridiculous. Food is alright nothing spectacular, can't comment on cocktails or mixed drinks. Wine and whiskey list is serviceable.   If invited again I'm definitely making up some sort of excuse to not go.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: This place was such a good vibe. We came for brunch, and it would have been an hour wait but open seating at the bar. To my husband and my luck there were 2 seats open.  It was Sunday around 2ish and there was a guy singing with his guitar.  The speakers were amazing you can hear him inside and out on the patio.  Friendly staff. The food was so good. My husband and I are some carnivores but today we both ordered vegetarian options  Don't let that fool you. Both dishes were packed with flavor. My favorite was the vegetarian spicy curry. Holy cow was it good. So good. Would definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: With its large patio, good food, and extensive drink selection, Culinary Dropout is a great place to come relax with friends. The restaurant is large and has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I arrived at around 5:45 on a weekday and did not have to wait to be seated.   I ordered the Fried Chicken and Between You and Me to drink. Both were delicious and definitely recommended. The portion sizes are large enough that I had leftovers. My friend ordered the Monkey Bread for dessert. It smelled delicious (and according to him tasted delicious) but I was too full for even another bite.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: The food at Culinary Drop Out never disappoints. Brunch or dinner, they have great options. I especially love the build your own charcuterie option. I recently went for brunch and we had cheeses, meat, and Brussels sprouts on ours. The Gochujang sauce on the Brussels is amazing. It's sweet and a little spicy. I could have eaten a whole order to myself, they were that good. I also loved the Wellness Retreat cocktail. It has a slight spice and it's a change up from just getting a mimosa.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: It's something about the atmosphere that continue to have my attention. The service is attentive and coming to CD for a good piece of fried anything works for me.   At this point I just need to wait for the games to return. The waitress shared that before Covid they had games for adults like png pong.  I'm ready!!

reviews.author: Alexis W.
reviews.description: The aura was nice. The salmon was meh. You really gotta be in the mood for that. The wedge was good just know that when they say maple glazed bacon, they mean it. It's really sweet. Chopped salad was great! As was "yesterday's soup". I sat outside on the long button tufted couch (very restoration hardware-ish) Favorite part about this place was definitely the energy, sitting outside in dim light, space heaters tufted sofas? Yes please!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've heard great things about this place and decided to give it a try for brunch. Made a reservation. Glad we did, as it filled up fast soon after we were seated.   This is a great place for large groups. More bar than restaurant.   Cocktails were tasty and reasonably priced. Large selection of beer on tap. The menu is a little thin, and our brunch items weren't anything special.   Service was top notch. We'd come back for happy hour, but probably not for a meal.

reviews.author: Tara N.
reviews.description: We had been trying to get here for a while and we're excited to finally make it in. Unfortunately, we probably won't be returning.   Food: We ordered the pretzel fondue, the breakfast sandwich, the breakfast burrito, and the hash.   The pretzel fondue was 'meh' at best. The bread that came with it didn't really have that pretzel texture and very little salt. Provolone cheese is a pretty light tasty cheese so it didn't taste great as a fondue.   The other food items were great but all came out lukewarm or cold. Which, relates to the...  Service: It took a long time for the food to come out and my guess is that's why it was cold. Because it has taken so long to get there, we were too hungry to send it back.   The server was forgetful and/ or missed the details. For example, we had to ask three times for a bowl for the dog. Many servers just bring one out automatically when they see a doggo but, even if they don't, it doesn't take three reminders.   Overall, service was slow and not, well, service-oriented. For example, my friend and I both had coffee and my friend asked for a refill. The waitress stepped away and I assumed she was getting the pot for a refill. Nope. She came back with a new cup for my friend and took off. So, I'm sitting there looking at my bear empty cup. As someone who was a server for many years, it seems so obvious to me that you should ask the other person if they'd like coffee as well especially when it's near empty. That's just one example of the just miss when it comes to great service.   Other details: - The ambiance and big open patio was great which *may* pull me back for a drink or something. Then again, you can get the same at other places in the domain.  - They didn't offer corn tortillas which I feel is really strange. My friend has celiac's and can't do gluten but corn tortillas are fine. Since they didn't have corn tortillas (or a gluten free bread option) it limited her options significantly. Granted, they said they could do lettuce wraps but let's not pretend like that's the same.   I don't think I'll be returning to Culinary Dropout.

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Popular restaurant located in the domain! They are usually pretty busy during the nighttime but not too crowded during lunchtime. They had one vegan option - the spicy vegan curry which tasted like Thai curry. It was pretty yummy but the portion was not super filling for the price in my opinion, so my only wish is that there was more! Overall solid place for vegans and non vegans to enjoy a meal in the domain!

name: Yard House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Tiara P.
reviews.description: I'm a pretty big fan of yard house... Or used to be. But what I'm not a fan of is not cooking my pork burger all the way through. I have not had time to contact or go up to the establishment in regards to this matter but WTF... Y'all are aware that it's a pork burger right?? Make it a point to ask people how we like our burgers because I don't like this... I couldn't even eat the burger.. Just looking at this makes me sick.... I'm so pissed I don't think Ima ever go back to that yard house again.

reviews.author: Manuel C.
reviews.description: Been here a few times. I must say that the waiters and waitresses here are phenomenal. During my most recent experience our waitress was Karisha.  Late 30s early 40s generation like me will LOVE the music selection here - I felt like they were playing my old playlists from high school or something!   (And they actually have a barcode to listen to their playlist on Spotify which I thought was cool)  I ordered the 20 oz ribeye. (I had a very paltry breakfast and had recently worked out so my body was lusting for some bovine carnage)  My better half ordered truffle fries and the Gardein Buffalo chicken - which she absolutely loved - and trust me that's a rare sight - so Thank You Yard House!  Meanwhile, this steak had everything I hoped for - it was bone-in, juicy and cooked to perfection. The server even asked me to cut into it to ensure it was to my liking - I had to ask her to repeat herself because I've never had someone ask me before.. how thoughtful! And cut into it I did, again and again until all that was left was the bone.   The Parmesan mashed potatoes were also scrumptious! Just the right texture and not too cheesy at all, the right touch of Parmesan.   Oh and there was also the healthy baby broccoli. The heads were very good, the stem was a little tough for me to chew but that's probably because they are grilled (as opposed to steamed) but that's fine because I usually only eat the heads anyways.   I don't usually drink but they are supposed to have a large selection on tap as well as bottled beers. I had the Heineken 0 (0% alcohol) and for those who used to drink Heineken I recommend it because it tastes exactly like the real thing! I was amazed they had it, so I guess there's something for everyone here.  I think this place is a keeper and I will return to see what other delicious adventures are lurking inside that menu. I've had the steak bowl before and it always hits the spot! The burgers are also delicious - though sadly I'm watching my carb intake recently.   In the end, you can't go wrong with this place! It can get pretty busy but all you have to do is give your name and number and they text you when your table is ready! Just go walk to Restoration Hardware and look at extremely expensive furniture you'll never buy in the meantime or stroll on over to Amazon books and play with their toys :) the possibilities are endless

reviews.author: Bruce S.
reviews.description: We've come here almost every week, sometimes multiple times a week since we moved to Austin 3 months ago. The hours are great and the food has always been good, you get a full menu and happy hour specials. I'm not sure if we've been here any other Sunday but this past Sunday the food was absolutely awful. I'm not sure if the head chef, kitchen manager, etc. is off or what but both our meals and appetizer tasted like they were microwaved leftovers.   We got the ahi tuna and it was very strange this time, so strange I didn't want to really eat it but the portion was so small this time we just ate it. I guess that kind of shows we're really not picky so when I say something was terrible it's really-really bad. I know anyone reading this will say that's your fault for getting ahi tuna from a sports bar but we've got it dozens of times and it was always surprisingly good. The tuna sandwich and poke nachos are great as well, but we didn't get them this time. We did get the fish and chips and the hot chicken sandwich. The fish was 100% microwaved, it was rubbery and had no crisp to the breading so they're dead giveaways. Also, the coleslaw was brown so that was nice. The chicken sandwich tasted nothing like the chicken sandwiches we've had from there before, and the taste of this one was not pleasant. We still ate most of our food so I wasn't going to complain that it was terrible unless our waitress asked and to my surprise she never did. lol. I think she knew so she avoided that question.   The cocktails and beer selection is great from here and they make great drinks for a sports bar. During happy hour they have small discounts on drinks and larger discounts on food. I don't remember what they all are but I know the cocktails are 2 dollars off, nothing crazy but hey I'll take it. I ordered my first cocktail during happy hour and about 30-40 minutes later another. The waitress took my order for the drink and came back later maybe 10-15 minutes and asked if I still want the drink I ordered. I was confused and said yeah so another 10 minutes or so I got my drink. My girlfriend was on her phone and noticed she came back to ask right after 11 PM when happy hour is done. So I was charged 2 dollars extra for one drink, I could care less. But it was really weird for her to do that.   I don't think we'll stop coming here because of our bad experience. I figured I would take my time to at least let the establishment know of our experience. So they can improve - if they want to. I know a lot of restaurants have staffing issues and there is a massive amount of competition in Austin. A bad meal isn't the end of the world by any means.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: A Must Go!!!... Every time we come visit close to the Domain , we have to come to YARD HOUSE! THE ATMOSPHERE is nice.  Very spacious.  The staff is Amazing and professional but not so much where they're snobby.  Just a kick back place.  While my husband and I sat down at the bar there was a guy watching a game..GO DODGERS!! To our left.. a couple to our right and a blind date across the way. I feeds everyone's needs.   Our bartender KEITH was fantastic...  if your ever so luck for him to make you a drink... you'll be in mixer heaven. He recommended a beer to my hubby some kind of blonde.  Jez I wish I can remember the name... any who, he's gave himself a sample and that was the end of that.  Also, we ordered shots and I ordered a dirty martini.  EVERY.  SINGLE.  DRINK.  Was delicious haha. But also, he was  good company and made sure we're taken care of.   Pros: EVERYTHING!!!! FOOD IS ON ANOTHER LEVEL.  CHEERS TO THE KITCHEN  Cons: nothing. And I always find something that can be

reviews.author: Zoly N.
reviews.description: Me and a friend just having our lunch today and i am in love with their drinks, foods is fantastic! Coming back for our lunch next time!

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: What a great surprise!  I have passed the Yard House several times since I moved to Austin, and never eaten there.  Finally, last night I had dinner at the Yard, and was so pleased.  First, Miguel, our  young wonderful Server who was just the BESTEST-helpful, kind and patient.  You couldn't ask for more.  Second, the food, the appetizers, buffalo wings and Sushi Nachos were so impressive, fresh and tasty.  The bacon cheese burger were amazing.  Good beef, and delicious fries.  Of course the Beer was good too, and cold.  All in all I am already planning my return until I sampled everything on the menu that appeals to me.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Yard House in my opinion, is a chain that is highly underrated especially when it comes to their happy hour. In case you didn't know, during happy hour all their apps are half off.! Unfortunately I only took pictures of the calamari and nachos, however some of my appetizer favorites are the ahi sashimi, poke nachos, fried calamari, and the chicken lettuce wraps. I also like the chicken nachos, classic sliders, and have heard great things about the cheese curds. Often times, I come here for the happy hour and don't even end up ordering an entre just get a few half priced apps!

reviews.author: Angel C.
reviews.description: Exceptional service(two waiters were both checking on our tables and made sure we had everything we needed!) and pretty solid food! I got the KBBQ Cheesesteak sandwich, which had decent flavors and nice presentation. I would personally have preferred a stronger tasting gochujang sauce, but it was still tasty as is. My friend got the whiskey salmon, which had great sauce! The sweetness and whisky flavors mixed very well. I had a pretty good experience overall and was really happy with the atmosphere and waiters! Tim and Noah, you guys were cool!  I also had Yard House in the past once at maybe 1am and ordered their pepperoni mushroom pizza and Margherita pizza, both which tasted great! Definitely a great meal after being out with friends. Would recommend as a fun, laidback place to eat and drink!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: This place lends itself to whatever mood you're in whether that is bar, indoor more personal dining or outside patio. The drinks were pretty and tasty cocktails, the poke nachos are always delicious and we went w our usual favorites there, mine was the carnivore pizza and his was the spicy jambalaya. Overall a nice chill vibe and atmosphere and nice little stop in the domain.

reviews.author: Tangela C.
reviews.description: I've been here one time years ago and I had a nice experience that time. I had a good experience this time as well. The front staff and my waitress were nice. The waitress that assisted me was attentive, knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. My order came out in a timely manner. I ordered blackened shrimp tacos that came with rice and beans. The sauce that is on the tacos is spicy. For my drink I ordered a Sangria. The food and drink were great!   I sat outside on the patio because it was a nice day outside. The patio is a nice size that has a lot of tables. The restrooms were clean and they are unisex. It's a parking garage across from Yard House which is convenient.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: When it comes to brews and good food, you just can't beat Yard House. Such good wings and the ipa white cheddar beer sauce complemented the Bavarian pretzel so well. Loved the mew offshoot ipa!

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: I live for these nachos. They're SO good and cheap! It's technically an appetizer but I get it as a main dish and it's so filling. Huge plate!  The pineapple Maui chicken was tasty! Broccolini is the BEST vegetable. Period.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: So this is my second visit to the yard house. I enjoy coming here because they remind me I'm home except for the beach is missing. The one I attended back home in California was on the Long Beach Beach sure.   I do enjoy coming here because of the bomb vampire tacos and the atmosphere. I also enjoy coming here and hanging out with my girlfriend. It's been one of our spots!

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: It's spacious. Our server Jess was attentive. 9 oz pour of wines are $3 off during late night happy hour. Some appetizers are also half off including the onion ring tower. I found a really good mushroom pasta dish that two others ended up getting as well. the check out system is manual at the table. so that's nice.

reviews.author: Kacey C.
reviews.description: So so yummy! The customer service was great. Several servers waited on us and made sure we were taken care of in every way (including complimentary dessert for our bachelorette party!). This was a great experience with delicious food! (The magic margarita doesn't change colors like you think it will and is STRONG). The Mac n cheese is the perfect guilty pleasure food. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went for a casual Date night with the hubby!  Let's talk FEWDS!   Feel- late 80s music playing which we loved. Great spots for drinks after work, happy hour, dinner etc   Eats- we started with the spicy tuna roll but was told it was not sushi! Glad they said something! Was very tasty and without the guilt of the rice!   I got the Baja fish tacos (white fish) it was lightly fried with a nice sauce and slaw on it. I wrapped it in lettuce to lighten it up a bit. However it was delicious! Would 100% recommend this! I also ordered brussel sprouts instead of the rice and beans and they were deliciously fried !   My husband got the Nashville hot chicken sandwich with fries! This was delicious and not super spicy, filled with flavor! Fries were good too! Would recommend this as well.   Worth- the whole check was about $100 after tip. We did get a few drinks as well so that added up. However the portions were large and we felt that it was worth the amount of food and quality of food as well.   Drinks- i got a couple vodka sodas and my husband got the half yard of the left hand milk stout. He loved it !   Services - our waiter was very nice. He checked on us multiple times and refilled waters promptly, he also guided us through the extensive menu and helped us narrow down our choices. Loved that!   Would def come here again! I might bring the pups next time and sit on the patio(when it's warmer)!

reviews.author: Nikki G.
reviews.description: Delicious food, horrible service. This was my first experience at yard house and I have heard nothing but great things! We ordered waters and beers, which they were out of all the beers we wanted to try. Our waitress didn't bring us water for 25 minutes! We had our appetizers basically finished by the time we even had a drink. The poke nachos and cheese curds were awesome and really large. The waitress barely checked on us, and when she did the one time we asked her for sauce and she just never returned for over 15 min. We paid and left without ever getting our sauce. Food and atmosphere were amazing but our waitress truly ruined the experience for us.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We absolutely love yard houses HH! We have tried bunch of there appetizers and they are all pretty good, and most of there appetizers are 50% off and pizzas too. But if it's outside the HH time, I this it's bit pricey.  Chicken nachos: skimpy on the chicken and too much of sour cream.  Korean chicken wings: it was pretty good, it had a nice hint with a hint of sweetness and our kiddo loved it.  Onion rings: I mostly don't like onion rings because it's greasy and feels heavy, but at the YH, it's light, crispy and non greasy.  Chicken strips: chicken strips comes with the small basket of fries, chicken stripes itself doesn't have much flavors or seasoning, but it's good if you dip it in some sauce.  They don't have online reservations, so that sucks. Ordering and paying is with the tablet they have on the table and that's not convenient either, we had to try atleast 4-5 times for payment to go through and it's so confusing, otherwise everything else is good.

reviews.author: Mariah H.
reviews.description: I eat here often and have tried almost everything on the menu, I've never been disappointed, always busy but def worth the wait.

reviews.author: Mai L.
reviews.description: Okay Yard House, I see you! It's a chain restaurant but the food kind. Come here for happy hour. I would recommend the pizzas and poke nachos, but everything seems pretty yummy. Service is great and efficient. This is a nice place to grab a bite with a friend or coworkers - there's something for everyone's taste.

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: Came to this spot right before an Austin FC game! Grabbed a beer and the service was great! This is a really great spot to pre game before the GAME   It also seemed like the food looked amazing!

reviews.author: Tristán Ô.
reviews.description: Aka for Matt.   Came in at 11:30pm on a Saturday night, server Matt was a real f*** boss. Extra cool, hard worker, and sickest service I've had. This is coming from a Californian. Screw downtown Austin pop into Brass Tap w/MATT as ur server n you'll be ready to crush the night.   Ps: most beer ive ever seen available in my life, breweries suck,  Brass Tap the future bb.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: I was impressed at first but then things went downhill. I don't have time for an eloquent review, so here's the quick and dirty...  The good:  Happy Hour deals. The hh burger was good for $7 in my opinion.  Good atmosphere, in and out.  Friendly service.  Live music.  Wide menu.  Kid-friendly until 9. Close parking.  Good place to stay for hours and hours.  Generous cheap side salads.  Pretzel appetizer.   Cookie skillet with ice cream.   The bad: Poisoned my friend by serving her a known allergen.  Forgetful service.  Mushy fries. Did they boil them?! Bland house-made tater tots. Frozen tots would have been better.  Ruined my salad by drenching it with dressing.  Other friends didn't like the burger.  Added things to the wrong tab.

reviews.author: Ruth Y.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I were looking to have lunch at the Domain and happened to see this place close to where we parked. The main reason he wanted to try it was to watch hockey.  We were immediately greeted and told to take a seat anywhere we wanted, a precursor to the excellent service that we received the entire time we were there.  The place is very spacious with a bunch of tables and bar seating, as well as plenty of outdoor seating, and a bunch of TVs. There is also what appears to be a stage space, most likely for their events like trivia and bingo. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. It was a Sunday early afternoon so it was pretty quiet. We ordered a side of Buffalo roasted cauliflower per recommendation. My fiancé got the impossible burger with a side Caesar salad and I got the smoked pork quesadilla also with a side Caesar salad.  All the food came out relatively quickly and pretty much all at once. I obviously was too excited for the food because I forgot to take pictures of them! The portions were the perfect size and the side salads were not sad like some other watery small portions that you might get elsewhere. My fiancé enjoyed his burger and my quesadilla had a great texture and came with pickled onions, sour cream, jalapeño slices, and shredded lettuce.  Shout out to the service for being extremely friendly and fast, constantly checking in on us. We definitely want to come back to this place!

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: Just can't get beyond these pretzel bites SOAKED in oil. Squishy.... you could pinch them and drip the oil out. I'm at a loss for words in regard to the preparation of this. Check the oil pools in the pictures. I wouldn't recommend this appetizer at all.   - PRETZELS - $10 Fresh baked pieces with white queso and spicy brown mustard (680 CAL.) -   Sooo..... Baked and then dipped in Oil? Also, avoid that queso. As far as ambiance... It was noticeably hard to ignore a certain mildew type odor while sitting. Sit outside if you must! But, plenty of other places you can go instead in that area.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: With a large group. Spot on service - Sam did a great job managing our rambunctious crew! Great selection of beer, full bar. Management should spend a couple bucks to update the menus. Food was okay but not the primary reason we were here.

reviews.author: Bryan D.
reviews.description: For our anniversary we were excited about the other Yelp! Reviews. The queso looked amazing in the pictures.   First off, the service was nice and attentive.  The chips were warm and the queso was fine but not the start we expected. Disappointing.  We were hoping to try several of their beers but since the appetizer was less than average, we had a beer each. The Lagunitas Sumpin Sumpin was nice and the 512 IPA was wonderful.   One of the best IPAs hands down.   We each had a beverage, ate our chips and moved on.

reviews.author: Diego M.
reviews.description: I wanted to grab a quick brew with my boy from college and this place was the perfect spot for that.   The beer here was really good! Come during happy hour where flights are $7. You really can't beat that since they're heavy pours. I'd highly recommend the Texas flight.  The atmosphere and vibe was dope. They had live music and she sang EVERYTHING under the sun.. from 70s to Michael Jackson to The Weeknd. Definitely made the place awesome.   Our server was great too! Highly recommend to stop by and grab a beer.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stopped by the Brass Tap on a Wednesday night after getting our nails done across the street. Cool vibe, big tables, seat yourself social distancing, and quite a few TVs. Servers kind of rotate between tables to make sure everyone is taken care of so they're super attentive. We had one main server though and she was sweet and personable. They had three different menus, which was kind of confusing, but we realized one was their main menu, the second was someone they partnered with, and the third was for their Smokehouse BBQ only served on Wednesday nights.   Go for the bbq! I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the bbq was. I got the two meat plate that came with two sides. The sweet potato fries and brussel sprouts were both delicious. My friend got the loaded sweet potatoes and really enjoyed it. Overall, we had a good time with some good eats! Would definitely go back again!

reviews.author: Aleta N.
reviews.description: I have come here a couple times now and I absolutely love it here! Good drinks and great service.   The patio is really nice and well lit. Good amount of tables and social distancing is very easy on the patio.   I love the servers here. In particular Janson was great! Super kind and approachable, very attentive. Super great service.   The food is good I've gotten the jalapeño poppers and the fried pickles. Both were really good  The drinks are phenomenal and I love how much variety there is with the beer.   Overall a great time.

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: This is a difficult review of the Brass Tap Beer and Food restaurant at the Domain. Why you say?  I am getting out more and the Domain is one of my favorite places to shop(carefully), eat and people watch! Sunday I met my two adult grandchildren at the awesome Domain Shopping Center. After completing our initial agenda of a haircut and some shopping we were starving. When the three of us get together and we're going to eat 99% of the time we choose a place we haven't tried before.  There sat the Brass Tap Tavern.  As always, I took a look at yelp for reviews and the majority were very positive-always a good sign! We've gone to a small handful of restaurants that are available at the Domain but in the spirit of adventure we decided to try The Brass Tap.  It was a Sunday afternoon around 430 ... so absolutely not what I would consider prime time for eating. The Decor was beautiful. The interior huge, lots of brass which is beautiful, and a very smart, but earthy feel. A large screen TV on the wall which is standard these days but often takes away from the beauty of an establishment. They also have a decent size patio available and since the tavern is on a corner it wraps around it. At that time of the day on a Sunday there was one table inside that was occupied, and probably about eight tables occupied outside where we sat down. It took us a bit to see our waiter approaching with a huge front and back beer menu, along with a very cool looking food menu. It was obvious that he was feeling rushed however he did take the time to answer a couple of questions we had about the beer menu and he took our order. I let him know we would be eating also as he was already rushing off and said he would be right back to take it. 20+ minutes later he stopped back after delivering beer to at least two tables on that trip. We decided to order an appetizer to share. Due to our elevated hunger level everything sounded delicious so we opted to get the combo platter. It consisted of Boom Boom Shrimp, House-Made Tots with beer cheese or jalapeño beer cheese and Chicken Tenders with BBQ sauce on a bed of House-Made Angry Onion Straws - $15 this was an average size appetizer. I personally ate a couple tater tot's and some onion strings. There were also three different dipping sauces, one a barbecue sauce, one a queso cheese sauce and one that was kind of tangy with a little bit of heat. My grands polished off everything else that was on the platter. Our main dishes arrived shortly after we had gotten our appetizer. My grandson ordered a half pound Angus burger called The Pub it was  Jalapeño cream cheese, smoked Gouda, Applewood bacon, lettuce, tomato, cowboy sauce on a butter brioche bun - 11it came with french fries. The fries looked great as was the construction of the burger and toppings. Sadly the burger was requested medium rare and arrived medium to well done. After waiting on our food over 1/2 hr. the grandson decided not to request it be redone. My granddaughter ordered the PERI PERI GRILLED CHICKEN PANINI with Goat cheese, hummus on grilled Ciabatta bread - 10. It also came with fries. It looked good and my granddaughter really enjoyed it. When I asked her what "Peri Peri sauce was She couldn't explain. Since I didn't want something that heavy(The Panini) but I wanted to know what that sauce was I ordered  the 3 BEER BATTERED COD  Tacos. They were dressed with lettuce , cheddar jack and pepper jack cheeses, Peppadew peppers and drizzled with Peri Peri aioli - 8.5 ,my tacos were served with some chips and tiny salsa on the side. I was glad the Peri Peri was only drizzled over my fish tacos as I didn't care for it. To each his own! So our tab for our appetizer,meal, one nonalcoholic bottled beer one draft beer and one beer described as more like wine was $61.86. For us the food rang out at about a 3.9 (out of 5.0), the beverages, we really didn't think my granddaughter would like the nonalcoholic beer but she tried it and as it turns out she doesn't like it. I ordered what was described to me as NOT tasting like a beer at all but like a sweet wine (I guess I must've missed the wine list because the website says they offer it)-after two sips that was enough of that. This is definitely not the Brass Taps fault as I am not a beer drinker but since I said that out loud before ordering off a two sided menu that looks like all beer I would've wished our waiter would have advised me that they did serve wine. All  of us rated the service a 1.5 out of 5.0.    I am not mentioning the name of the server purposefully. Although he could have told me they had wine that really is all I can say related to him.  The major faux pas for us was how long it took to get anything to eat or drink.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Jake, Holliday, and Robbie were superb. Absolute blast to have tending bar. They made me feel welcome, were supernknowledge about drinks and made me want to stay  forever. Such a great experience.

reviews.author: E H.
reviews.description: Good variety of beers. I wouldn't bother much with the food. I ordered the appetizer combo, it was overpriced and underwhelming.

reviews.author: Don R.
reviews.description: So beer is good but you can get that anywhere. We had the pretzel bites. Worst thing ever. Love pretzels but they seemed to be from the freezer to being cut up and dipped in oil. Inside was mush we told the server and he just let us know how much he loved them. Although we did not eat but 3 still charged.  Bartenders behind bar vaping, not professional.  I would avoid this spot.

reviews.author: A. N.
reviews.description: Came in on a Sunday night as we're staying at the Domain. Place was empty. Two dozen big screens showing the Simpsons. Ordered an app and a flight with the intention of having dinner and watching the NFL game. Asked if the football game would be on and the server said sure. A few minutes later the screens tuned to a soccer game. Funny. We didn't stay. Upside - they had all the beers in the flight.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: I've been sitting here for 30 minutes with only getting my beer. The service sucks. It's terrible because they have a fantastic beer selection and they lost my business

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: We chose to celebrate our New Year's Eve at the Brass Tap after snagging a few tickets for the 'Silent Rave' being hosted there that night. Since it was our first time attending such an event, going into it we thought things were going to be awkward, when in fact it was the complete opposite. Everyone had their headphones on, singing and dancing to one of three DJ's that were playing simultaneously on different radio channels. Even on this special night, the drinks were priced normally so kudos to that. This event turned out to be a very social affair.   If you're planning on going to an event like this, especially at the Brass Tap (Domain), I would recommend coming earlier than most to 1) grab a table to have a place to set drinks, otherwise how are you going to dance the way you want to dance? and 2) the line to get event headphones gets decently long and checking out the devices isn't a quick process.   5/5 for a fun organized event, clean venue, friendly bartenders, and a great night out.

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: I stopped in while shopping and waiting for folks.  I live in Round Rock so been to that (older) location many times.  The atmosphere is quite different in each location with the RR one being more cozy and pub like.  This is more open and like a sports bar.   Now, on to the pricing.  This location seems more expensive than the RR one.  Other than Happy Hour and Friday fun day when beers and some cocktails are cheaper, the prices were high.  A well bourbon (Evan Williams) and diet was $7.50.  A draft beer was $7.50.  A Bulliet old fashioned was $16.50 (charged as a double). RIDICULOUS for a mid level sports bar (no NFL ticket)!!  So be prepared to help pay their rent at the Domain (which I understand is high).  Overall I like it as I like the one in RR. Different vibe but great selection of beer and cocktails. Great old school video games to play (Galaga, ms pacman, Dig Dug, etc).   The environment is nice and I think they have a DJ on certain nights.  Food seems like high end bar food which is as it should be.  I will definitely come back but it will be for happy hour or some other special.  #discountdave

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: We came for Happy Hour and will likely be back!  I am not a huge fan of the staff here, always seem like they have something better to do. The happy hour started at 4pm and provides lots of tasty options.   We've been into wine lately, so we got the house red and sangria. They offered $4 shots and $7 drink of the day. The food options are priced at $5,6,7 and $8. We ended up getting the 3 Korean BBQ Pork Sliders with fries and 2 chicken tacos with chips and salsa. We were both dumbfounded by how much food you get with the happy hour specials.   Despite the lacking service at this location, we still had a okay time. Go in expecting lackluster and you won't get disappointed. ‍ They have a wonderful selection of beers as well, and a full menu. I provided the happy hour selections in my photos!

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Great service and a great selection of beers. Rotating taps so there is always something new week to week. I've been frequenting this location every Monday evening for the last 6 months and has yet to be disappointed. Great environment

name: Leander Beer Market
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Kimberly H.
reviews.description: Amazing Food! I highly recommend the pizza, fried pickles and wings! Normal prices and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Plenty of on street parking. The location is great in the middle of old Leander!

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: It's a local watering watering hole in "downtown" Leander. Why the double quotes around downtown - because there isn't much happening in downtown Leander.   Anyway, cannot comment too much on food as we only had an appetizer and it was alright.   Beer and wine are served in a plastic now which is less than desirable. Not sure how it was pre-Covid.   Staff was fast and efficient but I don't think I could describe them as warm or friendly.  They weren't rude either.   Decent amount of variety. It's charm is that is local and has the hole in the wall personality.   We plan on returning.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My review is mostly based on service.  I came here with the husband on a Monday night because I wanted a post-dinner beer. I marked this place in my bookmarks as a place I wanted to try based off the reviews. I generally try to be open-minded about my experiences at new places, but honestly I was just rubbed the wrong way here. We walked inside around 7 pm and I only noticed the list of cocktails on the wall behind the bar. I looked at the tap handles to see if I could tell what they had and the bartender finally came over. I figured I'd ask for something easy and see if they had Dos Equis on draft and was told they didn't with a snarky attitude that I guess he thought was witty or funny. I asked where the list of beers was and he stared at me and just pointed up...ok where am I supposed to be looking? OH. Apparently I'm supposed to know there are individual beer names hanging not only above the bar seats, but also sticking out slightly over the seating where you have to get up to see them. I tell him I haven't been there before and wouldn't know those were there. I order the beer he suggested (Alstadt Kölsch) based off of me asking for Dos Equis. He asks if I want to open a tab and I say no. His response: "Only one beer?" with what may as well have been an eye roll. You would think with me telling someone that I'm a new patron the attitude would be better. He probably doesn't care since A) it probably isn't his business, B) I'm sure they have regulars and C) he was probably in a hurry to come outside to vape with his friends on the patio that says "No Smoking".  Side note: if you want to sit outside be prepared to listen to cornhole games underneath the same covering as the seating which causes it to echo so loud you can't hear your own conversation.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: On this past Saturday, we made the adult decision to venture out as LB was open. We decided to visit as they were not busy and were following the separation guidelines. The service is always friendly and it was even better on this visit. Our guest puppy was treated to snacks and fresh water. We sat on the covered patio and watched rerun sporting events and just enjoyed being outside.   I've been an LB patron since day 1 and I remember when it was difficult to find a local venue that offered a large variety of craft beer options.  LB has changed a lot of the years as they now serve cocktails and their patio has been expanded. Venues come and go (see Sheas and AJs across the street) but LB has a loyal following and has remained our go-to venue to have a brew or two and some pub grub.   It's a misnomer to call their food pub grub as you can order a pretty darn good pizza, meatball casserole, fried calamari, artichoke dip, or our favorite their homemade fried pickles. Yes, they pickle on site!   Nice folks, great beer, good cocktails (check out their specials), and food.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Amazing food, staff, and regular customer group. The food is fantastic and the pizza is by far the best in Leander. The owners are locals in Leander and always strive to provide a fun environment

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: Owner harasses people online about politics. He's displayed his misogynistic attitude while bullying of his female staff during meal service. No Covid-safety protocols at all. I miss the sweet bakery that was there before.

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is great! The prices are set and easy to determine, the staff is helpful and friendly, the food is way better than I expected.  Only draw back is if you go on trivia night seating may be a touch difficult to find, but save that I love this place.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: I don't see the appeal of this place but it was busy.   1 bathroom, that smelled like pee and had no paper towels.   The hurricane that I order that was off of there board on drinks that they made was not a good drink.   The garlic bread we ordered was overdone and almost fully burnt on the bottom.   We ordered pizza also. One side was barely done while the other side was burnt. They put a lot of Italian season on top the pizza after it was cooked. Some times you just get a bite full of seasoning, not good.  First bits we thought the pizza had a good flavor but the more you ate the pizza the less tasty it was.

reviews.author: Madi U.
reviews.description: We visited on a Friday night after some late evening tennis because we literally couldn't find a restaurant that's kitchen was open past 10pm. Of course we know that's what to expect from Georgetown lol, but they're kitchen is open until like 11:30 which is fire honestly. Fried pickles were amazing, very nice patio, the music was a little loud but it was busy. Loved that they're dog friendly

reviews.author: Kali H.
reviews.description: Went yesterday for the first time for happy hour. We sat outside had some beers and ordered pizza and mushrooms and the food was fantastic. I will go back

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: The beer selection is always fantastic. The food options are limited, but tasty. I made the mistake of getting an old fashioned here one night-- meh-- but come for the beer and the vibes, and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Landon O.
reviews.description: I had to post something about their food after all the negative reviews I read before going. We got a pizza, wings, the meatball casserole and a Greek salad. Everything was really good, came out quick and didn't seem like "frozen" meat at all. The meatball casserole was probably the best. The food won't blow you away, but it's great for bar munchies. A solid 4 stars   If they realigned their pool table and got some better sticks it wouldn't hurt.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Artichoke dip was great, pizza was just ok.  Nice outdoor area, nice bar.  Would go back again.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Seek and ye shall find. This tiny hidden spot in old Leander checks off lots of my boxes - but doesn't impress. First off. This is a nice place dont get me wrong. I have been 3 times now just to see maybe it was an OFF day. Good menu , sports , decent tunes. So - those are pretty solid. Let me start with the menu. Pub grub for the most part with $10 pizzas unlimited toppings. So- naturally this is what i ordered each time. Each time it comes out it looks amazing and I'm excited. Like a Pointer Sister ( I 'm so excited ) . But the pizza never tastes cooked. The dough is mushy. Not a big deal. NExt time around I tell them to leave it in a bit longer for me. Comes out -- same. Not a deal breaker. Just need to change what I am eating. My belly prob says same thing. Next lets move onto the staff. For the most part the lady running the joint is on point. Friendly- helpful and witty. The remainder of the staff is quite the opposite. I have noticed this during a lunch visit with us being one of 2 people in the place, and in the evenings like during the sports games and crowds. Just abrasive . Again- I'm not there to make friends. I'm there to have a cold beer ( maybe 3) watch baseball or the slew of people who still have to think if they need to be wearing a mask when they enter an establishment( smh). So - The beer. They have a pretty typical tap list with 1-2 silver and gold medal choices. I saw Aldelberts there last night.. sweet!. But behind the bar is a ghostbuster lunchbox treasure chest of cans and bottles. WARNING! don't try to figure out what's in there. Hard to see them all... and after learning  how friendly the bar staff(see above ) is - I gave up asking and went with an IPA. The crowds are not bad and for the most part follow distancing rules.. but - nothing enforced. This scares me. While I know its MY choice to patron , I would still like to see ppl adhere to the 6ft. Outside- good seating - tv;s good parking and over all fantastic. I will prob go back, just not order the pizza and maybe try and get a spy camera behind the bar to see the other options as -- that's what life is all about. Options. Thanks for eating with me today, and I'll see you next time.  -M

reviews.author: Stephen H.
reviews.description: Fantastic service. Great beer selection draft and cans/bottles. Also have liquor and Red Bull. Lots of TV's and also play sound for the big games. Great food also. Mary is a rock star. TouchTunes could be a bit louder at times but that's probably a good thing based on some of the music selections I've heard. Also have golden tee. Quaint little bookstore next door too. Easy parking.

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: Good place fun atmosphere it's like you neighborhood bar with good food good prices too

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: Wow I'm pretty upset. First game of the season and I was so excited to support my favorite local business. We got here before opening so we were the first to arrive. Sat down at the bar and asked to move because a regular sits there. Ok fine. Told the game was on a certain TV. Once people started arriving the manager said she didn't have enough boxes to play the game I wanted all of a sudden. We had ubered to the bar and now are forced to leave. I guess there is a hierarchy in customers and you have to be important to be treated well. I'm baffled.

reviews.author: Marcus G.
reviews.description: Owner is a jackass who thrives on bullying his staff and customer personnel; have gone a few times to this bar to see him disrespect his female bartenders as well as her clientele while being 'on the job'. A real shame because the place has incredible potential that's obviously being held back

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: This has been a local fav of mine for some years now. The owner is extremely active in the community. The food is great and priced well. Something changed at the spot and for me no longer has that comfortable feel. Seems has if over serving is not monitored as you will have several loud and obnoxious folks who aren't being controlled.   This was the second night in a row that I was ignored while sitting at the bar and watching the bar tender hang at the end of the bar with is buddies.   What was once a nice calm place to eat and enjoy some craft beers is now a place for the high volume drinking and the vocally high volume people.  Bring back Luigi's for the food and leave everything else.

reviews.author: Carly T.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place in Leander.  My husband and I started going every Friday and then our teenagers wanted to join us one night and they love it.  On Fridays everyone in the house is excited for LBM night.  The food is good, the atmosphere is fun, the TouchTunes are fun.  The service is great! We will be regulars for a longtime.

name: Cover 2
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My husband and I go here pretty often as it is super close to our place and we love their food! They have a great menu and our favorite thing is the fried pickles! They have rotating specials, soups and flatbreads. The servers and staff are all very friendly and hard workers. I also bring friends here and they have all loved it as well! They have great deals on their happy hour and a good variety of beers and wine that are not crazy overpriced. I have loved everything I have ordered and they have great portion sizes! We usually come for lunch or dinner, but we recently had brunch which was also fabulous. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! The portions are also super generous so I've left with leftovers multiple times. If you're a sports person, they have a ton of really nice TVs and always have games on. I am honestly so happy this place is close by and will continue giving them my business! I would also like to add that like many places these days, they have also experienced shortages with staff and when that happens, we have seen the managers out on the floor helping out and also working their butte off! This restaurant has amazing food, service and is such a great place to have a nice dinner, go hang with friends or just pop by for a drink! Thanks for rocking it Cover 2! Oh and the Round Rock location is also awesome as I went their with a group of work friends once they also had excellent service and the food was equally as delicious!!!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: When Chief was here bar service was stellar. I have been coming here since it opened. Now bar service is lackadaisical, inattentive, distracted and sub standard.   I like this place. The food is good the beer selection is passable and I can watch any sporting event live or read a book or both. But these two are killing the place for me. Ordered a beer and sat for 20 minutes with no one asking me if I might like to order food. Had to literally flag someone down to order a meal. That is not how this business works.   Wearing a mask under your chin until you walk up to a customer is not how this works either. And the tall one did that all night long. Now looking for a different place to spend an evening eating a meal and enjoying a beer.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Horrible service today.  Sat in a booth for over 15 minutes while others came in after me and got their orders taken. Person who had seated me brought me a drink then nothing. Though a minimum of 5 different servers were standing right next to my booth.  I understand a restaurant may be short staffed but limit your seating if you cannot handle it.  I've had the similar experience here multiple times.  Last time I patron any of the restaurants in this local chain.  And "the remedy" after speaking to a manager when I asked for the check for my half drank coke...oh no need to pay for the coke.  FAIL ALL AROUND!

reviews.author: Asha T.
reviews.description: Literally the first visit we had and this last visit were like night and day.   If I EVER come back here it's gonna have to be at the bar. Apparently you get service that way.   Literally just walked in and got sat, was busy due to a UT game no problem. And then we just sit and wait and wait and wait. The supposed waiter for our area literally helped everyone around us and kept skipping us. Idk if it was because we didn't have UT gear on or I was basically the only black person there at the time but ppl that just walked in the door got greeted before we did.   We just got up and left. There's no way the dude in the area didn't know we had not been helped as he purposely kept ignoring the table and was serving EVERYONE around us.   Terrible service.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love this place! They are so accommodating, even in football Sunday!!! The servers are polite and the manger runs around and works just as hard (love seeing that) all the food I've had is amazing. Great specials daily and weekly, worth a stop anytime but especially for football!  Not pictured but worth it: chili and eggs, giant pretzels, wings and shrimp pasta!!!

reviews.author: Colette B.
reviews.description: I never thought I would describe a restaurant as "disgusting", I have a lot of respect for food .... But our experience was just that! We fancied burgers and thought that a sports bar would serve delicious burgers! What a mistaken idea!! We started with a cup of onion soup: it was edible, not delicious, a little strong on the acid side, but ok. Then came the burgers: a 3mm leather sole burnt to death!! Awful! Horrible!! My husband had to leave the restaurant and was sick in the car park!! The fries were smothered in fat... yak! The waiter on the other hand was a sweetheart!! VERY professional! When I mentioned it wasn't good, he immediately offered to comp them, which he did! I am tempted to say that he had been through a similar situation before, maybe several times!!! He didn't hesitate and didn't offer an alternative: he KNEW the food was bad! Shame on management to allow this to happen! It's a Burger after all, and we are in Texas!! Land of Beef!! Cover 2, I'm afraid you will not see us again!!

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We've lived by cover 2 going on 2 years now and decided Saturday to finally check it out. (Previously came here and was seated but waitress seemed like she was just so busy she couldnt get to us and the vibe was just off? so we walked out) but let me tell you I sure am glad we gave it a second shot because the food was absolutely amazing and service was even better! Can't remember our waiters name but he was above and beyond. Everything came out quickly and tasted perfect... the environment was a plus! We willl back yall :)

reviews.author: Bonsai B.
reviews.description: If I could do 0 stars I would... Sunday at 1500 and it's not too busy.. not sure who out waiters name was because he didn't introduce himself, so we will call him island boy.. black island boy hair cut doesn't give a care in the world...He ignores the tables, continually walking by spaced out.. didn't get any service unless i asked. I even had to ask for the check! Why does he even work, just go home and live off unemployment.. he is the face of this bar/restaurant and I won't be back.. good riddance!

reviews.author: Caryn C.
reviews.description: Horrible service and even worse food. The only thing half way decent were the fries and they were cold. The hostess was condescending and sat us in a high traffic area in front on a tv that a group of 6 were watching and yelling. We had to ask to be moved. We had to ask for our waiter to serve us. We went at a time that was not considered busy or I would've understood. We had to ask multiple times for drink refills. We will not be back.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Goofy loser waiter ignored us because he's racist. Type who says "canadians". You're black and racist toward other black people. Living like that's not good for your soul you rotten little jerk.  Decent game bar if you sit at the bar. Wings were aight

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: We always have a good time here, especially during football season. The food is above average. Bar seating can be limited since everyone wants to sit up there.

reviews.author: Robert F.
reviews.description: Cover 2 off research always hits the spot it's got the best shoe string fries I can't seem to find anywhere else in Austin . Even though they may just be French fries and not a main course there is something so satisfying about them . My favorite dish is the buffalo chicken sliders , I personally get the blue cheese on the side with ranch to dip . These are amazing and have the perfect thin not to thick cut of chicken that's battered nice and crispy but stays juicy tossed in tangy but not spicy buffalo sauce. The bread doesn't take over the sandwich so that's not all you get full on and is super soft . They also have a buffalo chicken salad that has a good amount of chicken if your not wanting a sandwich but need to cure that buffalo craving . I've only had the burgers other than that and they are equally delicious again especially with those shoe string fries that are always crispy .  This place is relaxed and a good place to have a beer while you cool off after a long day or just dining with the family.  The staff is pleasant and the deserts are huge . Well at least the brownie is . If you like bars and burgers are in the area and don't know what to eat stop in and try the buffalo sandwich it's my go to and recommendation for cover 2 . If not that than at least grab a beer and some shoe string fries and relax a minute .

reviews.author: Joan B.
reviews.description: It had been awhile since I'd been at this location. While I love the Cover 3 locations on Anderson Lane and Round Rock, this one has never really measured up. Today I stopped in for lunch and ordered the flat top cheeseburger that comes with Parmesan fries. Should have been a safe bet, right? It came out DRIPPING in grease that tasted truly awful. Even the fries, which are always good, no matter the location, were inedible, as they tasted like they were fried in oil that should have changed long ago. It pains me to leave food that I paid good money for, but that's just what I did after trying to force down a couple more bites I shouldn't have taken. I left 2/3 of the burger and most of the fries on the table. Considered complaining, and might have if the server had even asked how the food was, but she didn't ask, and she had to have noticed how little I had eaten. She just left the check by the barely eaten food.  I rarely send food back to the kitchen, and since this wasn't exactly fine dining, I let it go today. But tonight I'm regretting eating those two or three additional bites I shouldn't have taken. It truly wasn't fit for consumption.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visit this place the other day and wow! It was so good- we got the giant pretzel to start. When they say giant- boy do they mean it. They're drinks are also very very good and the server was very polite as well.

reviews.author: Robby T.
reviews.description: Normally this place is one of my favorites.   Today come I. At 220pm.  Semi full, wait up front for 5 mins to be greeted.    Then wait 15 mins for a drink.   Only ordered 2 appetizers and wait 35 mins for those.   Mention this to the server and she has a near come apart about being short staffed and it is what it is.     Very disappointing, until manager comes by.   Would give Miranda a raise.   Very nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: So today was my first day in Austin. I searched Yelp. I drove by a number of joints. I even walked through Whole Foods. Alas nothing struck my fancy. Heading back, I swung into Cover2. I'm glad I did.  The greeting, Silvana as server, and the whole support staff weekend terrific.  I started with a cup of French onion soup. It was just a tad too sweet for my taste. I'm also a purist in looking for a single crouton under the  hood (of cheese).   The fries and prime rib sandwich were a pleasant surprise. I will typically keg wrestle you to keep the horseradish sauce off the plate. The sauce here actually was mellowed very nicely and didn't fight the meat. The fries were great! Nothing more need be said.   This was a terrific first meal in a new town. This might become my extended kitchen it was that solid of aa performance!

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Would have been nice to actually eat. Ordered our drinks then watched as our server waited on everyone (even those seated after us) without taking our order. I try to give servers the benefit of the doubt cause maybe they're short staffed but after multiple issues with the same server and seeing tables sat after us putting their orders in and getting their food, I'm getting disappointed with the downhill service at Cover 2.   We received our drinks at 6:45 pm. Left money on the table for the drinks and left the establishment at 7:20 pm after our server ghosted us with empty drinks and no food order placed.

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: Great place to come watch sports, drink, and eat some food.  Staff here was nice and friendly. food was hot and fresh, I had the franks red hot chicken sliders that they had as a special and was good.  Flatbreads were split between the table and were good as well.   Drink prices are not that bad.  Nice walk to our room from here and was convenient.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: I stopped by after reading a few Yelp reviews and what a great choice that was. I had the good fortune to sit at the bar and have Miranda take care of me. If I started a bar or a restaurant she would be my first hire (better give her a raise, Doug)!  She's friendly, professional and makes a great martini. The hospitality industry needs more Miranda's!    Now to the place itself. Cover 2 has a nice, open concept with the ubiquitous flat screens located around the bar and restaurant - it is a sports bar, after all.  The people working there are friendly and attentive while the noise level is energetic but not overly loud.    The food.  The Reuben was honestly just okay. The corned beef to Swiss cheese to kraut ratio is off (not enough kraut) and the bread was cooked to the point where it was as stiff as a board.  It tastes okay but the potential for a better sandwich is definitely there.  Ask for fries - they don't automatically come with it.   The fries were good and - just to see for myself - I ate half the Reuben and then ordered the wings.  The buffalo wings are tasty - not the best I've ever had but certainly worth sampling. Pair it with the 512 IPA and you have a winning combination.  Overall I would give Cover 2 a solid 8 on a 1-10 scale. The kitchen gets a 7, the bar an 8 and Miranda a 1o I think my math is right). If you're looking for a good sports bar that's not too sporty this is a solid choice.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Had a very bad experience last night. We ordered apps that were extremely salty and were told they would come soon as we ordered drinks. The apps came at the same time as our dinner. I ordered crawfish special and let me tell you the worst crawfish I ever had. No flavor in the boil and they gave some sauce on the side which was horrible.

name: Hideout Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Trinity T.
reviews.description: The hideout is my favorite place to get a cheap drink and good food. The burgers are bomb

reviews.author: Jen S.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood dive bar around, hands down. The bartenders are all friendly and personable and the food and drinks always hit the spot.

reviews.author: Joshua T.
