reviews.description: Great pull off when coming through or stayin a wee bit.  Wednesday night 10:15 seems chill indoor and out. Barsky pours a decent JamoGing. Bet this place is hopping in the summer. Needs cornhole.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love that I can come here with a large group and have no problem outside taking over multiple tables.  I have no complaints about prices or service.  This is a good neighborhood bar, and those things will ebb and flow.  Nothing has happened to make me decide to go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Trey D.
reviews.description: Used to be good, which is a shame since I used to love coming here over the past few years. It seems to have gone downhill a bit it seems. First noticed the harsh increase in wing prices (before the shortage) a couple years ago. I understand prices increase, inflation blah blah.   But they used to advertise it as wing Wednesday, and they were cheaper that day. And it was fun. Now, the overpriced wings come out with very little sauce, and the sauce tastes/looks different than what it used to?(referring to blazing sauce, my fav.) Meh, guess the crowd is changing.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: When you're here, you're home. Love this place. Cheap drinks and greatest staff in Austin.

reviews.author: Julius A C.
reviews.description: If I could leave zero I would.. , overpriced, if you're looking for a rip off go somewhere fun at least

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I finally got a chance to checkout Cat's infamous hideout, and it did not disappoint. It's the typical neighborhood dive bar that I expected it to be, but that's not a bad thing.  Some of the best things happen in a place like this!  TRUST me, it's nothing but fun, fun, fun, with a capital F-U-N!  It's a good place to do some day drinking, or hang out until the wee hours of the morn'.  As Tina R said in her review, lots of interesting characters lurk in this place.  Including "that" guy who likes to butt into your conversation, and then carry the conversation and not give anyone else a chance to talk.  But I won't dock 'em a star for that.  Every neighborhood bar has "that" guy in it.  It's a package deal.  Inside is kind of dark and it takes a minute for your eyeballs to adjust if you enter during the daytime. But after a few minutes, all is well and you'll soon be jamming out to the old school jukebox. You won't find any Touch Tunes here folks - yes, it still uses CDs (who would have imagined CDs would ever be considered old school?).  Here's the most important part of this review before I blather on with all of the interesting factoids:  If you learn nothing else this year, learn this my young Padawans: Many people say it's hard to find, so here's a tip - if you cross the railroad tracks on the access/frontage road, you have just passed it.  Turn right on the last street that you see right BEFORE you get to the tracks, and then take another right turn into the parking lot.  DON'T cross the railroad tracks!  There's a decent outdoor patio with plenty of picnic tables, and a few of them are shaded.  10 dollar minimum for using a credit card (pet peeve of mine).  Wi-Fi password "cheapdr1nks" all in lower case.  12 local and regional craft beers on tap (I counted).  They have about 30 brews in cans and bottles, most of them are from the ATX or at least regional.  The big name brews are only available in bottles and cans, not on tap.  It's a little pricey for a dive bar - pints of Thirsty Goat were 4.50  Full bar - liquor and eraythang!  Six TVs, and a large projector screen (yes I counted).  Yes, they do have food - I didn't partake, but they have tacos, a couple of salads, burgers, sammiches, and the usual bar appetizers.  Every one of the picnic tables on the patio has Cat's name carved in it (she's the current duchess but has fled the city, so it won't last long. Get out there and claim it boys and girls).  Rumor has it that this picnic table vandalism is why she had to leave the ATX, but who knows the real truth?

reviews.author: Nick C.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a great bar in North Austin, this is it. Hideout is spacious and casual, with great drinks and even better food. It's a no frills joint with plenty of room inside and on their patio. Staff are welcoming and the burgers are amazing. Jukebox, TVs, and darts if that's your thing. We'll be making this a regular spot for us!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Great wings--not soggy in sauce, they hold their crisp--and the patio is great!  Honestly, the wings here are better and bigger than Pluckers, and for me that's a good standard--happy hour isgreat here too.  Fall, Spring, Summer--hangin' here for wings and beer outside is hard to beat.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I love wing wednesday! They have great wings and all sorts of flavors. They do charge you for everything, which is quirky. It's not expensive at all, so it's really not upsetting. Just a funny thing I noticed. You're charged for condiments and celery. When you're paying 75 cents for wings and cheap drinks, it's a drop in the bucket.   The patio is great and so lively. It is fairly busy. I would even suggest getting there as early as possible because parking is limited. There is a weird gravelly lot for overflow parking, but I have a little sedan and not a 4-wheeler to get over the ditch that is there.  They do allow smoking outside, so if you're sensitive to that then the patio is not for you. At first it bothered me, but had a great time catching up with friends and eating up those wings!

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: Came here with a coworker to drink some strong cheap dranks and eat some good food. We were NOT disappointed. Its divey dark spot with plenty of room to chill and hang out. The bartenders were cute, funny and poured some very nice drinks. The long island is only 6 bucks and they had a host of cheap drinks but thats what we were drinking. Now...onto the fooood.  The wings...wangs...were delicious! I got the spicy BBQ and my friend got lemon pepper both well done (I hate a soggy wing). The only downside is that for 7 bucks you only get like 5...well damn! However I saw that they have a wing special every wednesday for like 25 cents or something like that so don't quote me.  Will have to come back on a wednesday.

reviews.author: Phillip N.
reviews.description: They have 75cent wings on Wednesdays and they taste great. Their standard wing flavors are solid, and they always have a new weekly special flavor. My personal favorite flavored wings are blazing (not that spicy).

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I came here for a small get together with my other Yelper friends over the weekend. This place is a dive bar plain and simple. I enjoyed the look and feel of the place and the cheap booze. My only gripe is that it is on the North side of Austin for me.   I will note that my husband and I ordered the nachos here. I wasn't impressed with them but honestly you don't come here for the food. You come here for booze and maybe the people if you are feeling up to it.

reviews.author: Sue S.
reviews.description: So we are in Austin for a family holiday because daughter #2 has a home 4x the size of ours (for the same amount of money!) But I digress...  Daughter #1 is here, too. She once lived in in Austin for a minute; but that was five years ago and so much has changed since then.   She asked to go somewhere quintessentially Austin. Not much of that left, especially in the northern parts, but we researched a bit and came up with The Hideout Pub.   Only juke box music during our visit, so not sure if they ever have live music, which we were hoping for. Regardless, the drinks were good and CHEAP. I mean $5.50 for a Moscow Mule cheap. And that's not even Happy Hour price.   We also had burgers. The Austin burger, ($13) with grilled onions, mushrooms and goat cheese, to which I added the sweet and delicious Moonshine BBQ sauce. Big burgers that come with fries, onion rings, tater tots, salad or chips and salsa. I got the onion rings, she ordered the tots. Both delicious. We couldn't finish our meals and brought half of it home.   Atmosphere is strictly dive bar. Love it! But not "biker bar" as I saw it described somewhere. Dark, low lighting, neon, plain seating, wood floors, tv screens all around. There's also an outdoor, multilevel seating area.   Our server was as sweet as pie, with a faint cute accent to boot. Mixed crowd, mostly keeping to themselves.   New neighborhood if this was my permanent neighborhood.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: Great bar, been here a handful times and the bartenders always seem to be in a great mood at all times(positive vibes) good prices and great burgers!

reviews.author: Diana L.
reviews.description: BURGERSSSS!  These burgers are better than any other burger place I've had in Austin, and that includes P Terry's, Shake Shack, In N Out, Dirty Martins (does that still exist?), and scattered places here and there.  I got the hideout burger, and waffle fries.  Those FRIES!!! My goodness, my mouth is watering at the thought of them again.   This place truly is tucked away - making the name completely fitting.  The turn off the main road is INSANELY sharp, so slowwww down.

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Hideout has a personality to fit the name - it is indeed hidden in plain sight right on Mopac, and it provides its own, secluded little space where you can eat, drink, and socialize, with a vibe that seems friendly, welcoming, and inclusive.  So far I've had burgers, grilled chicken sandwiches, and fish-and-chips that were all above average for dive bar fare. Well-made drinks and a good selection of beer round things out.   Plenty of TVs tuned to different games as well as non-sports stuff, so everyone has a corner to gravitate towards if they wish. Servers are smart, friendly, and efficient.  I'd be here more often if they welcomed dogs in their outdoor area, but aside from that gripe there's not too much to find fault with here... cheers, and see you there!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is such a cool spot in Northish austin. The beer is cold and the staff is friendly. I also had a burger that was pretty delicious!! They have an indoor and outdoor space and both have lots of seating. The parking is also very convenient. I will definitely come back when I'm in North Austin.

reviews.author: Hillary K.
reviews.description: Gosh we love this place. I'm from buffalo so I'm pretty darn picky when it comes to wings. Hideout is the closest I have found to quality wings. I always ask for extra crispy and they did not disappoint. We also got a burger with fries and onion rings. Burger was great but huge. The onion rings were so crispy; probably close to the best I've ever had. The place is really dark and play some questionable and loud music though. They do have a large outdoor patio that gets kind of busy when it's warm but there's usually always somewhere to sit! I definitely recommend this place, it's a great option to the trendy touristy places that are all around Austin. True neighborhood bar.

name: El Monumento
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jody D.
reviews.description: Another wonderful and flavorful dinner at El Monumento!  This has become our favorite place.  Their food is just straight up delicious- always. Had the enchilada trio in the suizas sauce; all of them excellent. And the beans cooked with bacon??  Holy hell- AMAZING.  Great sangria- get the carafe- makes sense and you will finish it.   Trevor was our waiter- what a fun guy.  Helpful, attentive and funny - loved him. Also- do yourself a favor and get the chocolate cream pie

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and it's a bit of a mixed bag. The staff is excellent, we were seated quickly and chips and two salsas brought out promptly.  I ordered a specialty margarita on the rocks and it was just ok.  The table ordered the chicken fajitas, enchiladas and carnitas plate. The fajitas were overcooked and dry. The edges were burnt and the onions and peppers were sliced way too thin and were over cooked as well. The portion was very small from my last visit, but shrinkflation huh?? The enchiladas were very good and the carnitas were the favorite. The charro beans were awesome. The rice was bland and one dimensional and the street corn was overly sweet. The salsa was flavorful but at least one needs a little more heat. The restaurant itself is really cool and clean. I will definitely go back but on a different night maybe try a different dish and drink

reviews.author: Gregg M.
reviews.description: Haven't had a chance to return to El Monumento since Covid and didn't know what to expect but the four of us may have had our best meal there ever. We got a reservation a little earlier than normal so we could take in the Christmas lights on the nearby Georgetown square.  Paige was our server and she did a great job. She was very attentive but didn't rush us. We started with chips and salsa, followed closely by the queso flameato, gooey and yummy .  Our meals included tortilla soup, shrimp chili relleno, street tacos and one of the special plates. Needless to say we waddled out... Our experiences in the past were a little inconsistent but this time they were right on point. Looked like there were enough employees to take care of the good crowd they had. It was fairly noisy though. Lots of families and groups.  Thanks Paige, keep up the good work! As I'm prone to say when it's appropriate, this is a repeater! Happy Holidays fellow Yelpers!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: The food I got was not good, and borderline just plain bad. Beans watery, sour cream sauce slimy, rice tasted like cardboard. I liked the Brussels sprouts and the chocolate cake, but why would I go to a Mexican restaurant for those?  I liked our waitress a lot, as we were a big party and she did her best. But I just can't stand it when water isn't refilled timely, especially since I needed to wash down the nasty flavors I was consuming.

reviews.author: David T.
reviews.description: Passed this place a handful of times and decided to try it out. There's plenty of street parking nearby if the lot is full. Seating was quick for a party of three on a Wednesday night. They do take reservations so keep that in mind if you have a larger party.    ORDER  Chicken Flautas (start) Nachos (cut) Chips and Salsa (bench) Tres Leches   Food Flautas were good as were the chips and salsa. Nachos were surprising as the toppings were added to the chips and they're not the style where you can dip the chips. Not the style I'm used to but could be good for anyone trying to portion control.   Overall This would be a great place to take your out-of-town visitors because the service is good and the setting. I'd come back again and check out the bar area.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: The food was okay but the french press coffee was absolutely amazing! Even if Mexican food is not something that you care for just going there for the coffee is worth it.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: El Monumento is always a solid choice for Mexican food and drinks in Georgetown. I love the decor and the beautiful view from the patio. The queso and guacamole are delicious and I've always enjoyed the margaritas. The hours of operation are a little unusual. They open at 3 pm on Sunday and there is normally a line of people waiting to get in so I would recommend getting  reservation.

reviews.author: Heather L.
reviews.description: Just wanted to add another amazing experience. Took my hubby here for the first time the other night and he loved it as much as I did. The food quality was perfection and our waiter Phillip was very considerate of my need to avoid wheat and talked to the kitchen to help me decide on what to eat. Wonderful service. Wonderful food.

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: I can not believe I haven't reviewed this place yet, we used to be frequent flyers here pre covid.   My favorite part about this restaurant is the outdoor seating and ambiance. It's relaxing, quiet shaded, and you can see the water below.   The service has always been pretty good, no complaints there.   The food is very good and the drinks too, their cucumber/jalapeno margaritas are perrrrfecccct.   I agree with many of the other reviews, it's much pricier than its competitors for very comparable tasting food. Post covid, you even have to pay for chips and salsa- which is unusual at a mexican restaurant.

reviews.author: Ron J.
reviews.description: To be honest, I had given up on eating at this place some handful of years ago because I felt that the place was cooking Mexican food for the white-bread taste crowd. The food chronically lacked salt, seasoning or any interesting edge to it. Can you say "Food for the old folks home"?  But last week a friend of mine said to try again. said it had greatly improved, so I took his word for it and reluctantly went in....and can say that I was glad that I did.  They started us off with chips and salsa. Both the green (especially this one) and the red salsas were excellent and actually spicy, thank God.   We also ordered queso flameado with shrimp and chicken tortilla soup, both packed with flavor and quality ingredients.  The guacamole the we got was passable. Not as horrifically bland as is used to be BUT still needs a healthy dose of lime juice and salt which we ordered with it. Even or waiter said that it always needs more lime and salt, so, hey,just fix it already.  Everything else was also very nice, like the great seating outside and the bar drinks. I can see that they finally got some cooks that know this type of food and I am very happy about it. I WILL definitely be back.  My suggestion. You guys are finally on a roll regarding a more authentic taste. Don't rest yet!  You are only a few bold menu changes from being something truly great!

reviews.author: Olivia F.
reviews.description: If you're eating  dinner here Thursday- Sunday you need a reservation... if you don't have one, be prepared to wait atleast an hour. The cucumber margarita is super refreshing, I highly recommend it. The guacamole didn't have much flavor but the blandness of the guac was needed to cool your mouth after eating the salsa. Cool vibe inside, the patio seating is beautiful but will have to wait until it's not 100 degrees out to enjoy the view.

reviews.author: Cindi R.
reviews.description: We have been trying to enjoy this restaurant for years now as it is a georgetown staple and we love to support local businesses.    But I am done with their "we can't seat you here, because we don't serve out here," or "sorry, we can't do that," or " oh, you want salsa for your nachos? That's a $1.50 surcharge...."  Um, Nachos or tacos without salsa??  $ 1.50 to blend up some tomatoes and onions and jalapenos and cilantro??    I am done with this place and I hope that you all have a better experience overall than we have.  And now that you can pay your bill thru an app at your table??  Dont expect your wait person to ever come back.  We will never be back.

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: We love this place for dinner but not happy hour. Went to happy hour at 5 today and hit the bar area. They were out of pacifico, modelo especial and don't carry corona. Opted for 2 margaritas - not bad but not great. Until I went to pay and 2 mediocre margaritas (not even cadillac)  were over $33!!!! What on earth?! Honestly, unacceptable. These are worse than concert prices. Not going back for happy hour ever and may not even eat in the restaurant for a bit.

reviews.author: Laurel W.
reviews.description: Really like the food here. And the service has always been good!  Looking forward to our next visit!

reviews.author: Christine P.
reviews.description: Great Ambiance and Food Love it for Breakfast and Comfort Food The Pies are the Best Our favorite is the Coconut

reviews.author: Dene' H.
reviews.description: We chose El Monumento last night for my daughter's 33rd birthday. Best dining decision that will now become a tradition and a craving.   We started with chips and salsa as well as queso and one of the monthly special cocktails, the smoky jalapeño margarita. We also enjoyed the aqua Fruita non alcoholic beverage as well. Between the 5 of us, we sampled several dinner options including the street tacos, the enchiladas, and the relleno. They were all spectacular and even though I had no space in my tummy to finish it all, I couldn't stop.   Ryan, our server, made the experience even more special. I can always tell if a server is being nice to get a tip, which I can understand, but Ryan was honestly genuine and engaging without being intrusive.   The restaurant itself is beautiful with a generous deck that provides ample room to dine outdoors.   We will be back, sooner rather than later as I am already craving more Chile rellenos. You won't be disappointed!!

reviews.author: Lance L.
reviews.description: My wife have eaten here many times.  This place is very charming and has an interesting menu with terrific cocktails.  Try to sit on the deck if the weather is nice.  The bar is excellent and the ambiance after dark is very special.  Consider an after dinner walk down to the blue hole only steps from the river.

reviews.author: Kaitlin W.
reviews.description: The atmosphere, food and drinks are so good! Great date night place! You're better making a reservation because it gets very busy, but I like that the bar is separate from the main restaurant so you have kind of your own area to get drinks and apps while you wait.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Let's just start by saying this place sucks the waiter had the personality of a melting ice cube no social skills at all the food was just ok it was very hard to eat because we had nothing to drink because after our food arrived,we never saw our waiter again until the bill came  16.00 for two tacos and rice no salad or soup and then what Mexican restaurant charges for chips and salsa what a joke keep your sub par food, crappie service and chips and salsa appetizer..... we will stick to what we know "Mas fajitas" for the win!

reviews.author: Derek R.
reviews.description: Tried the Chili Rellano and Carnitas. Great food, service and location. Margaritas were not that great though. Going to give them another try down the road a bit.

name: Doc B's Restaurant + Bar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: I spent the weekend in Austin to enjoy the holiday experiences that they have to offer. After a long day of exploring my boyfriend and I stopped in for an early dinner. Pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. My boyfriend ordered the bbq ribs which came out absolutely perfect and delicious. I on the other hand orders the chicken parm which came out extra charred however not wanting to be a pest I didn't complain and decided to just work around it. The manager and the server were amazing and even tho I didn't complain they removed the charge for my entree. Overall the restaurant has a great vibe, very clean and the staff are extremely professional. I would most definitely come here again... for a less charred entree of course

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Currently writing with one button of my jeans undone - Doc B's food has me full to the brim.   Not usually a big American-food person but I was curious why this place was so well-rated and wanted to try it for myself.   I asked the server to let me know what are the best things on the menu. She was very familiar with the restaurants' offerings and she killed it with her recommendations. Here's what we got:   For appetizers, Housemade Guac and Oven-roasted Wings are must-gets. The Guac is great because the chips are unique: baked sweet potato chips! I could munch on these all night. Thankfully, the Oven-Roasted Wings stole my attention as soon as it landed on my table. Best. Wings. The Chimichurri sauce is addicting!   For mains, our server mentioned that the West Coast Steak Sandwich is the best. One bite in, I wholeheartedly trusted her. It's cooked to perfection and the bed of greens helps to cut the fattiness of the meat. The Chimichurri Steak was also pretty good but the steak on the West Coast Steak Sandwich was better. The fries were well-seasoned, perfectly thin, and crispy. Oh, we also threw in a Brussel Sprouts Salad, which was needed to balance the heavy meal.   - Our server was knowledgeable about the menu (+1) - Everything came out so quickly, I think in less than 20 minutes (+1) - Our server's recommendations were spot on and the food was great (+1, +1) - Very reasonably-priced for how good this restaurant is (+1)   That's a solid 5-stars in my books. Highly recommend!  p.s. I dined at the bar to skip the wait, which was going to be 45 minutes (7:30 PM on a Wednesday night). Reservations are probably needed because of how busy the Domain gets.

reviews.author: B D.
reviews.description: We were able to get a table right away and our server was really friendly, polite, and smiled a lot.  The food was good, but perhaps a tad overpriced.  I had the chicken parmesan and my husband had a wok bowl.  I felt my meal was good but it didn't wow me for the price.  My husband's meal was slightly oily.  The drinks were priced reasonably.  The decor and ambiance was really nice, and we sat outside which was roomy and cozy.  If back in the area, we'd probably stop in for drinks and maybe an appetizer, but I'm not so sure about paying the asking price for full meals again.

reviews.author: Michelle W.
reviews.description: I fell in love with candied bacon. There I said it. It had the perfect kick to it.   I tried the udon noodles which were great. The server even brought extra sauce without prompting.   My friend had the Cobb salad which looked amazing. Considering she wanted to go mainly for that I'd say it must be good.   We went on a week night which went decently without too much of a crowd.

reviews.author: Andy N.
reviews.description: I came here with some friends, and they surprisingly took us in with mo wait time on a busy Friday night. The food was delicious. It was what I expected, and the service was superb. Although, the small portions with the high prices is something to note. While many of the items were a bit high, the portions were lacking. Besides pricing and portion, the food is what you expect and good.

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: Pretty good experience. Decided to sit outdoors because inside was freezing. Server was pretty friendly and didn't have any problems with the food. I wouldn't call the Cajun turkey sandwich Cajun because nothing about it really tasted Cajun.    Overall, food came out hot and tasty, drinks were great (if you know what I mean), and overall good interaction with everyone.

reviews.author: Veronica R.
reviews.description: Omg, I am a picky eater and decided to step out of my zone and choose the homemade guacamole and sweet potato chips.  Absolutely Devine. So much to the point I bought sweet potatoes to try and recreate. Lol  Next was the chicken kebabs and cucumber and feta salad. Can you say I almost licked the plate!   If you have not eaten here then it's a must. I stretched my neck out for what others were ordering and it all looked so yummy. I'll be a repeat customer for sure.

reviews.author: Kelly L.
reviews.description: my friends and I were in the area and wanted to grab lunch. we wanted to come here because they have a dog friendly patio! huge  plus! they're also conveniently located by two parking garages and very close to many other stores in the domain.   the food was very average though in my opinion for the price we paid. the angry meatball was HUGE but tasted very unimpressive after you get through the initial outer crust that is covered in the sauce. the chimichurri steak lacked flavor and seasoning. the only good part I enjoyed was the fries.   service was a little slow but it was also sunday lunch so understandable.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: I have been to Doc B's numerous times over the past few weeks and I have to say that everything I've had here has been amazing. It's a nice gem at The Domain where no matter what mood you're in / the size of your group, there seems to be something for your appetite. Seriously generous portions of food, and I've not had anything bad yet (and I definitely try and order some variety from the menu when I do visit). Some of my favorites include Grilled Chicken Salad, Carnitas Sandwich, The Number Six (like an upscale Chik-fil-A sandwich!), Chicken Kebabs (enough food to share or have leftovers!), Crispy Jalapeño Potatoes (seriously dream about these!), Homemade Oreo Ice Cream (always go for the larger portion!). They take reservations, which I would recommend, especially on the weekends. The service is always friendly and attentive. It's got a good sized patio and my only complaint is the last time I was there, I had a patio reservation and they told me there were no tables (even though there clearly were, but were being "held for other reservations").

reviews.author: Smitha C.
reviews.description: Love Doc B's! Great food and wonderful service. We hosted a baby shower here and could not have been happier with our experience. We had a group of 15 out on the patio and it was so nice, open, and spacious. Our server was attentive and efficient, able to accommodate all of our various requests. We were corresponding with the manager, John, for the month leading up to the shower and he was so helpful, sending us pictures, answering any questions we had. He checked on us the day of as well and really took care of us. And of course the food was a hit, so delicious- highly recommend the candied bacon. We'll definitely be returning just to eat!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: One of the places we went for my wife's birthday week. She had been hearing good things and saw great reviews, we went with another friend who also has a birthday in June.  The place was very nice, you had indoor and outdoor seating, the staff wore masks. We sat inside as it was hot, there is a parking garage, the purple one, right across the street so that was nice.  Service was great and fast. We started with some drinks and candied bacon and chips and Guac. The bacon was very good, agreed on by all three of us. The water did not come with ice which I found rather weird but maybe it's not but they keep it filled.  Our friend has the Cobb salad, Shana had the Turkey Burger, and I had Chicken. They both liked theirs, my fries were really good but unless you dipped the chicken in one of the sauces they brought it was pretty dry. Good flavor but dry.  The food was good, they raved about the chips but the guac was not as great as they were hoping. Overall it was good but not as good as many review make it sound, I admit I expect more when the food it more expensive and two of the three meals being good is great but while I am glad we went, not going to be on my normal rotation of places to go on date nights.

reviews.author: Joanne L.
reviews.description: I had to do a little shopping and returning up in The Domain again today. We decided to go back to Doc's again. Like always, they are consistent and the food is great. Kiddo friendly and we were seated immediately and within a minute our server Tom greeted us. He was great with Jay Jay, hospitable, quick on our requested and overall just a great server. Food came perfectly cooked and was yummy. We started off with the guacamole, but it was devoured once it hit the table......hence why we never got a picture. All and all, thanks for taking good care of us again. See you again ‍‍ PS-Restaurant and bathrooms were clean

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Went for the first time yesterday for brunch. They don't have a brunch menu, but their regular menu had enough variety. We started with the guacamole and sweet potato chips, which were to die for. I had the chicken Wok bowl with sweet and sour Thai sauce and it was very tasty. I did ask for sriracha to add because it wasn't spicy at all. For dessert we all split the Cinnamon Toast Crunch cheesecake, which was fantastic, although very rich. For the cocktails, I had the Crazy Beautiful, which was perfectly balanced with a little sweetness, nothing crazy. I look forward to going back!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Solid place to eat. Service was great. Sat outside on the patio with my dog, and they brought out a water bowl for him. I ordered the chicken sandwich and fries which were good. Would probably go again.

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: Always great service. Also a place where everything tastes great. If you have room at the end, get the key lime pie.

reviews.author: Traci T.
reviews.description: I meant to post this a couple of weeks ago! Food was simple and yummy. And service was even better! Our server, Gus had such a professional demeanor. You could tell he wanted to be there. More importantly he knew the menu. As a gluten free/friendly patron this is very much appreciated! And one of the menu items that isn't listed on the menu or online is that they have a GF bun option! Much to my delight my meal was fabulous and fresh. Restaurant was clean manager and staff all had great attitudes and atmosphere was fun and welcoming. With all the pretentious restaurants and stores in the domain, that sure makes a difference for me! 5 stars!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: One thing I would probably order as a meal alone, THE IRON SKILLET MAC and CHEESE. Mac and Cheese fans, this one is for you! SO CREAMY, cheesy, rich, savory and ADDICTING. EASY 5 stars for this meal alone!  However, other than the mac and cheese, nothing stands out. Doc B's serves a variety of burgers, chicken meals and woks.  I had the Crispy Chicken Sandwich, but there was not much flavor to it, even with the panko breadcrumbs.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Was super excited to try this place, but ordered the fried chicken with sweet potato fries for $26, and received 2 small pieces of chicken with fries that were undercooked. I think you would have gotten much more food with the chicken burger which is $10 cheaper? Was not impressed especially for the price! :-/ We also didn't get addressed by our server until about 15 minutes after being seated.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Late dinner with Chris at Doc B's in the Domain!  I got the chimichurri steak with a small salad and scrumptious fries and he got the cheeseburger.  Our app of guacamole and sweet potato chips was delicious as well!  @docbsrestaurant #docbsgiveaway #foodie #yum

reviews.author: Quin T.
reviews.description: I used to frequent Doc B.'s in Gold Coast, Chicago, so I was super excited upon discovering that they have a location in Austin. Man, Austin has definitely come a long way!! Doc B.'s stays packed because the food is delicious, they have just enough of a variety that it is not too overwhelming and they have great food options. I am a huge fan of their wok out bowls, the fried chicken sandwich, turkey burger with sweet potato fries and the brussel sprout salad with salmon. Recently, I tried the chimichurri wings and OMG....bomb! Beware, it has tons of garlic and while I love garlic, garlic does not love me, but for these wings, it's worth the night-long burps.

name: Twin Peaks Round Rock
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: Casual atmosphere makes this place welcoming. The food and customer service keeps us coming back.   We have tried:  Triple Play - Served with guacamole, queso and salsa.  All three was great. The queso super creamy, the guacamole perfectly seasoned and the salsa was warm and not too spicy  Steak Salad - A large amount of steak lay on top of a freshly made salad - soo yummy  Beer Battered Fish and Chips - perfectly fried fish along side some seasoned French fries, cannot go wrong with this dish  Turkey Avocado Smash sandwich - Amazing sandwich and a must try  Blacked Fish tacos - There was pineapple in it which threw me off but otherwise, good tacos.  The fish was plentiful and you are served 3 large tacos with this dish along side some chips and that delicious salsa.

reviews.author: Hvnter B.
reviews.description: Been here 3 times and it's a fucking nightmare every time I come. Takes 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge you and then after she takes your order, you don't see her for 20 minutes.  I like Twin Peaks, especially the one in Odessa, but the service at this one just sucks ass.  3rd times the charm, probably won't be coming back to this one  Edit: only reason I'm giving it one extra star is because the jalapeño vinaigrette is fucking good

reviews.author: Matt W.
reviews.description: Food generally decent but unless you are a regular, staff seems to ignore customers.  Recent server  took our order then closed us out as we were getting food ( she was changing sections) and told us someone else would take care of future drink orders which I was clear I would need.  No one ever came back so we left and watched  remainder of playoff football game down the street at a restaurant that wanted our business. Young lady at front desk seemed to think it was no big deal and dismissed it at common practice.  I'm pretty sure this happened to several others in our section as well.

reviews.author: Yusmine V.
reviews.description: Best service!!! I lost my phone the night before. Which one of the servers found it in the toilet. She was kind enough to pull it out of the toilet! where I accidentally dropped it!

reviews.author: R R.
reviews.description: Great chicken wings!!! Great service....most of the gals are very sweet. (The girl at the front door (hostess) is crabby but no biggy.) the bartender is very good with staying on top of her customers needs. I do think there should be an employee bathroom because the gals have to hang out there and are in and out to maintenance their appearance, And as a customer it's not professional to go into a bathroom full of employees, whom are talking about customers, their hair and make up, their boyfriends etc. it makes me think that twin peaks doesn't value their employees enough to even provide them with a break/powder room.

reviews.author: MR M.
reviews.description: Went there last night and ordered the Texas style Philly cheesesteak it was god awful filled with peppers I picked out what little meat was in there and ask for my check and I was out of there

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Jordan was our server, she was great! I don't feel like the servers are usually that attentive or sweet but we still go because we love the beer and nachos!

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: I ordered pickup and was incredibly disappointed with the portion of soup they provided (this is the Bowl, not the cup!)

reviews.author: M P.
reviews.description: Placed an order online and called the restaurant after 15min to check if it's ready. The lady over the phone said it'll be ready in 8min. I walked in after 10min only to find out they are out of all chicken wings and they are going to refund my order. Funny story is I only placed the order for 12pc of chicken wings and she failed to inform me right when I called to check in on my order. It would have been nice to give a customer call if you're out of something rather than giving false information and making me come all the way there.

reviews.author: Emily K.
reviews.description: Armani was a phenomenal server. She is lively and beautiful and has great table etiquette. I cannot get over warming smile and kind words.  Alycia is such a rockstar. She's quick with her service and is so fun to make jokes with and loves to have fun while keeping it totally professional.  Christlynne and Kaylee are the BEST bartenders i've ever had. Their service is fast and quality. I don't recommend anyone else to make your drinks. Their chemistry behind the bar is unbeatable.

reviews.author: Ronny T.
reviews.description: Took forever to be seated and then seated at a table that had to be wiped down for food residue on tabletop.   Server was helpful but overall experience could have been better.  Not sure why it is so difficult for these restaurants (includes Hooters) to keep the place somewhat clean.  Food was okay but not something i long to reorder again.

reviews.author: Shayer S.
reviews.description: Good service. Like the lodge vibe. Lots of TV's around with various sports playing. The nachos are enormous - good enough for 4 people and pretty tasty too! They have a lot of specials during the weekdays, not too much during the weekend when we went though.  Clientele is varied...ranging from dudes by themselves to buddies watching the game to confederate flag t-shirt/jacket wearing fellas.   All in all, not as trashy as I was expecting and it was an interesting experience. The food was actually pretty decent so I may take out in the future but I don't think I'll be back to eat-in anytime soon.

reviews.author: Rueben A.
reviews.description: Twin Peaks Round Rock are thieves. Look out for waitress Rebecca and manager Justin will over charge your debit card extra $100.00. Beware of these employees and make sure you check your receipt.  If you are over charge file a complaint with Federal Trade Commission for fraud. BEWARE of these thieves.

reviews.author: Diego C.
reviews.description: So I'm leaving a second review after coming here fairly regularly over a year or so period.  Im also upgrading my review to 5 stars.  This location provides consistently high quality from the food to the service, and now the environment has been upgraded!  I really enjoy the new look.  The restaurant is more open and some of the tables are cafeteria style which promotes a social atmosphere.  There are still individual tables though.  Hell I usually sit alone.  I just like seeing people having a good time.   There are some stunning as well as super nice servers here but it has pretty much always been that way since I've been coming here.    They offer a variety of food on the menu including healthy choices and a veggie burger that is just fantastic.  Best of all it won't break the bank...unless you go stupid on the tip.  P10 is down the street haha.  But the servers do seem to build rapport with repeat customers.  Overall if you haven't been here in awhile, it's worth another visit.  I suggest Friday during happy hour.  You're welcome!

reviews.author: Sade H.
reviews.description: I came into Twin peaks, my first time since covid and when I say I had a fantastic time that's an understatement! My server Armani was lovely, energetic and very beautiful! Can't wait to come again

reviews.author: Nicki C.
reviews.description: I sure do hope they do reopen instead of deciding to stay closed!  My family and I recently ate here a few Saturdays ago for UFC, and it was awesome! We arrived early to get good seating. We were informed upon arrival (PRIOR TO BEING SEATED) if we stayed past 8PM that we would be charged $5 for the fights. This is nice because we've been places where they try to up charge customers unexpectedly long after the fights have been on.   From the Hostess to our server (Jax) we were given excellent customer service. Watching the fights there was good and the food was even better! You can't go wrong with those burgers!!!   We had our child with us, and it was still a good experience, all the girls were soo sweet and kind to her and she loves the attention! We love coming here with our daughter because they always treat us kindly!  Still recommend!

reviews.author: James L.
reviews.description: Amazing service, cold beer and great food!  Manager should know that Kaylee and Valencia are amazing. Such amazing service!

reviews.author: Connor K.
reviews.description: I know what you're thinking but the waitress Provided better service then any other restaurant I've been to in a long time the level of customer service that was provided was Impeccable I didn't have to get frustrated over waiting for something like the drinks or the appetizer or anything like that and when it came to a question on how something actually good on the menu I got a good straight honest answer so I was more than impressed.  Plus the baby back ribs that I had were probably the best barbecue I've ever had and that's saying something because I am a native Texan.

reviews.author: Elizabeth S.
reviews.description: If I could give 0 stars I would. I always praise this place just to have the worst service. Had the waitress stop by 2 tables and just walk past us like we were not anyone to wait on. I can't believe I wasted the last of my available time trying to eat at a place I enjoyed just to be disappointed.

reviews.author: LaRon E.
reviews.description: came into this establishment on a work visit with a colleague for a nice lunch break...  The waitresses were very friendly and attentive and the restaurant was clean..  Now as for the food thats a different story..I ordered the 10 oz sirloin steak and requested it to be medium rare... Well this steak must've just made parole because it was tougher than a convict who just serve 20 years... The asparagus was not fresh .. So the food gets 2 thumbs down..  This was my first time here.

name: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse- Parmer Lane

reviews.author: Blair V.
reviews.description: First time I ordered from here was through Door Dash and we enjoyed very bite of our order. Second visit we decided to dine in. It was crazy packed on a Friday evening but they had plenty of seating indoors and outdoors!  We ordered the Foccacio cheese sticks (basil, mozzarella and goat cheese) - a hit for us when we ordered to go previously. We also tried something different which was the Monty. We also ordered a Caesar salad- pricey for a salad in my opinion but this is a good option if you feel like you need that balanced meal!  The Monty was the least of my favorite. We have stuck to ordering the Flying Garlic Pizza after our first visit and it never disappoints. It has become a must order for us and will continue to stay that way!

reviews.author: Esther A.
reviews.description: Super family friendly with outside play area for kids.  Lines were a little confusing. I ordered the major tom, pepperoni was very crispy but the veggies were a little undercooked would've preffered them a bit more cooked.  The meat almighty was better, pepperoni was crispy and the cooked ham was very tasty (i dont usually like ham that much!) The dough was doughy, and floppy.

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: This is the worst experience I have had in awhile with management. To begin, with follow my pics.. I ordered a major tom (supreme pizza) with EXTRA sauce thru door dash. At 7:55 within a few min I received notification it was being picked up.  I call store to inquire how is that possible if it was freshly made. The store hung up on me. So, I worked w door dash who asked me to wait for delivery to see if there is a quality issue. I did just that, only to receive a pizza that was warm but based on the cheese amount, semi chilled veggies I knew I wasn't too off base when I had my reservations about it to begin with.  I call store - ask for manager, even though I know door dash will ultimately handle. However, I just wanted to know how you can make a pizza in 5 min and say its fresh. Manager says sorry for the hang up like she's singing to a tune of a tiny violin; then tells me they don't have base pizzas sitting around (kind of like Villa in the mall that adds toppings when u order). I ask why is there so much cheese then and no sauce. Clearly cheese is added and is already rubbered up. Short answer and ultimate answer from her was another unbelivable sorry and to work with door dash.   What's sad here..Villa Pizza (mall pizza) is better than this any day. And I'm kicking myself for not going with Salvation pizza instead. Aviator down south was awesome but this Parmer Lane site is lacking customer skills and good pizza.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Pizza dough was undercooked.   Hefty toppings  $10 for a large sized personal pan pizza  You order straight from your table via your cell phone.   Nothing special worth returning.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love their pizza! Usually get it to go. I've been at other locations in Austin, and they are all good.

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: 2nd favorite pizza in Austin!  I love pizza. If I were choosing my last meal it would be a toss up between pizza and beer or filet mignon and merlot (or Shiraz). I digress...pizza...it must have a great crust-never EVER soggy, a well-balanced sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. Lastly, the maker must not skimp on the chosen toppings.  Well done, Aviator! My friend and I shared the "pizza of the day", and it was fabulous (though I don't remember the name of it). The crust had that initial crunch followed by the perfect chewiness. We each had a light beer with hints of blueberry-um...yummy!  Aviator is new to this location, and still getting established, so it was dead inside. I suspect this will be a popular lunch place for nearby companies such as Apple, Oracle, etc. There is a huge outside play area for those of you who have kiddos-great for birthday parties.  I prefer quieter places, so it misses the mark for me regarding atmosphere. You can see the pizza makers through a glass window, and the kitchen appeared clean. There are ample choices of beer and lots of great food options too. I've been twice and suspect it will be a fav of mine. Give it a try. Let me know what you think.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Currently writing this updated review in my car because for the 2nd time, my curbside pickup was messed up. My pickup time was 6:20 pm, and it's now 6:50 pm.  The 1st time I wrote off because I thought it was a fluke. Also, I know the staff is busy on a Saturday night and it's tough to find staffing these days during COVID. Maybe I'll try eating in store next time.   But cmon now, my wife is pissed off because I convinced her to get Aviator over another pizza shop. Well, whenever I get my order, I'll eat it in the doghouse when I get back.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: Yay, more pizza! I love pizza, and I feel like there's a lot of pizza places popping up in Austin over the years. So many options but I'm not sure if this will be high in my rotation of pizza places.   I do like the restaurant space. The outdoor area is nice and kid friendly with the playground. Aviator has a wide selection of beers (at least from what I could tell). I think the pizza is good but unfortunately I think there are better places for pizza. Weirdly, I think their normal pies (with red sauce) are kind of lackluster. I did enjoy their non-traditional pies. The chicken bacon ranch and the taco pizza were pretty great!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Today, I ordered a to-go order for pick-up so I could do yet ANOTHER lunch and learn... how much learning do I really need to do?????? I ordered two items: the caprese salad and the black olive and caprese pesto grinder.   Caprese-  Caprese salad is a simple Italian salad, made of sliced fresh  mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt, olive oil, or  balsamic vinaigrette. This is a menu item that really can't be 'messed up'. It is simple and to the point. This caprese was accompanied by a side of vinaigrette.  Black Olive and caprese pesto grinder-  This item was unexpectedly good. This meatless Monday treat contained black olives, mozzarella, red onions, baby spinach, and a Roma tomato pesto base. This sandwich provided a balanced mixture of sweet (from the tomatoes and red onions) slightly sour (from the mozzarella) and earthy (from the pesto) bites. Although hearty in its contents, this sandwich was actually very light on the palate.   #supportlocal

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse was busy on a week night and sadly understaffed. The dough was pretty good but I did not like the flavor combination in the South Austin pizza with the vinaigrette and red sauce. I did like the cinnamon and pecan dessert pizza. Large outdoor patio and large beer selection.

reviews.author: Jonathan L.
reviews.description: Happy to see a local pizzeria that's in NW Austin and dare I say better than Pinthouse? Two 14 inch / Large pizzas are enough for 3-4 people which amounts to $50 approximately. Pricing is reasonable. Online ordering is straightforward and pick up time is 20-30 minutes after an order is placed. I noticed they had ample seating both indoors and outdoors.   Our personal favorites include: 1. Flying Garlic: Garlic butter base, fresh baby spinach, roasted garlic, grilled chicken, feta and crushed red peppers. 2. The Greek: Pesto base, kalamata olives, portobella mushrooms, artichoke, feta and fresh basil 3. Spinach and Artichoke: Red sauce base, fresh baby spinach, artichoke, and feta cheese.   Another pizza we tried was called "South Austin" (Red sauce base, prosciutto, goat cheese, wild arugula tossed in our home made honey balsamic wine vinaigrette) was also good but not as tasty as the other three.  The crust was the perfect level of crunchiness without being overly done. Toppings were all fresh and VERY generous. We came back a second time in the same week. It's that good.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: On this deliciously lazy Sunday, the darling husband and I knew that pizza was just the only thing that would do. Jersey Giant Pizza, he suggested? Quick, easy, cheap, and reliably tasty. Closed on Sundays, I lamented. DeSano's, I countered? His eyes lit up, but then I remembered that, although we adore DeSano Pizzeria Napoletana to bloody distraction, we should probably try something brand-new for a little variety...and for me to review! Why not? Enter Aviator Pizza and Drafthouse!  Local? Check! Solid reviews? Check. Hubby's a helicopter pilot and trying out this place is, therefore, too hard to resist? Check. Cute pizza names? Check. Yummy pictures? Check. Let's do this!   (Note: all three are takeout 9-inch pies with no mods, except for hubby's deletion of the green peppers on his Ground Control.)  The Greek: this one was my flavor profile to an ABSOLUTE T! It reminded me a bit of Joe's Pizza at Star Pizza in Houston, but better! A riotous feta, pesto, artichoke, basil, mushroom, and kalamata olive party on a crust! Hugely flavorful! This goes on the culinary Rolodex post-haste!    The Flying Garlic: very garlicky! Shocker, right? Lol! Well, we are garlic people, so we endorse this pie whole-heartedly! The buttery crust, the garlic cloves, and the feta were just unctuous!   Ground Control (minus green peppers): Hubby liked this, but he didn't super-love it. He kept snagging pieces of the Greek and the Flying Garlic. I asked him what his least favorite part was, and he said that it really wasn't fair to judge it on such a small pie. He wants to give it one more shot with a larger pizza! His theory is that small pizzas make the fillings hard to shine. Makes sense!   As I write this, though, he's literally humming Ground Control to Major Tom as he kicks back on the couch playing Call of Duty: Cold War with a warm and happy belly, so I consider this a solid win. We'll definitely be back soon to dine in! Thanks, Aviator!

reviews.author: Glenn W.
reviews.description: Good pizza, if you like it on the sweet side. Today's wasn't quite cooked through, might ask for crispy next time.

reviews.author: Cheyenne H.
reviews.description: I've passed by Aviator several times and finally decided to try it with a friend.  We came at 8pm and the place was fairly busy. Unfortunately, the ordering process itself was very confusing. You can either follow a bunch of arrows to the counter and order (with few menus available), or you can seat yourself and order through a QR code and have someone bring your food to you.  We chose to go to the counter and ordered two Bear King beers that had great flavor- we were allowed to sample before ordering which was a plus. There were 50+ beers/wines to choose from so endless options... you can opt for a flight too. We also ordered two small pizzas (BBQ Chicken and Spinach and Artichoke) that came out in ~10 minutes. The pizzas had a thicker crust and were DELICIOUS! I'd definitely order again.   There were plenty of picnic style tables inside and out, and the outdoor patio had beautiful string lights, a playground, umbrellas, and lots of open space. Parking is easy in and easy out, and the staff were friendly.  Overall, I'd recommend Aviator. Great quality pizza in North Austin.

reviews.author: TJ R.
reviews.description: Ordered a large veggie 'deep' via GrubHub. Arrived early, smelled amazing. Tastes amazing. Very very greasy and heavy and bready. Excellent leftover the next morning. Lotsa flavor and quite filling. Veggies seemed fresh.   Vegans: beware of L-Cysteine.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: Delicious pizza with plenty of options.  Plus they have vegan options too!  I had my favorite type of pizza: jalapeno peppers, banana peppers, and mushrooms, with vegan cheese.  The cashier was warm, enthusiastic, and friendly.    The portions satisfy.  The tap water is delicious.    I don't have kids, but if you have kids, realize they have a huge playground outside.    A delicious meal.  Yum.

reviews.author: Scott Y.
reviews.description: I live on the NW side of Austin, and we don't have a lot of great food places as the South side of Austin has, especially when it comes to pizza. I picked this place solely on my fellow yelpers reviews. They were spot on! I didn't go in as I was in a hurry and opted for curbside. I ordered both the Pepperoni and Basil pizza, as well As the grilled chicken bbq pizza. Both were amazing, especially the pepperoni basil. I now have my go to pizza place for my cheat day when I don't feel like driving all the way down to via 313, pieous, or home slice.

reviews.author: Emily T.
reviews.description: Went here on a friend's recommendation but honestly was a little let down. My husband and mom loved it but I felt they could do morr flavorwise with all the fun ingredients they had going on. The crust was bland and doughy and the brussel sprouts could have been cooked longer. Also their high stools aren't super comfortable so would not recommend sitting on those.

reviews.author: AJ B.
reviews.description: This pizza was very good, but the curbside pick up did not go well. We ordered online a Major Tom, Thin crust cheese pizza, and two sides of ranch. I arrived a little after the estimated pick up time and waited a little over 10 minutes when a waitress came to our window and said they got one of the pizzas wrong and had to remake it. We ended up waiting another 15-20 minutes. Finally we received the pizzas, but they didn't not bring our ranch, which did cost extra so I asked if we could get those. The waitress was obviously annoyed by our request and went to get the then which took another 5 minutes. Pizza was cold by the time we arrived home. Pizza was still very good, but the thin crust was very oddly cut. I would not recommend ordering curbside or online

reviews.author: Mikayla V.
reviews.description: Horrible service. Basically you are your own waitress. After two other parties got their pizza before us after we were first I finally went to the front and complained. My pizza was on the side in a Togo box just sitting there. I said um is that mine cold just sitting there? The girl said oh I'm not sure sorry.    I was also charged a crazy amount for two small pizzas that a five year old could have made better. Don't go here. First and last time for me.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.  The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeños to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montréal aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: Gastropub is what this place is, a place for food beer and good food! The pimento deviled eggs.. oh my were they great and served on a slab of rock, too. I had the beer braised pork and spatzle with a side of coffee rubbed carrots. The food was really good and service was friendly.

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Have been to oasthouse before, but not for brunch and there was something for everyone. The service was really good (and timely/efficient) and we enjoyed the covered seating outside. They had a great beer/cocktail/wine selection and had several drafts i had never seen before. The chicken and waffles were really strong, and the chicken was almost like hot chicken which was a pleasant surprise and carried the dish but no complaints there. The carnitas poutine and the Cubano were certainly enjoyed as well

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: Oasthouse has been my periodic GrubHub treat when my standbys on another delivery service aren't available for several months. What more does one need in life when brie pimento burgers and coffee rubbed carrots with green peppercorn ranch are on the menu? I don't even mind that my average order for one meal is at least 35-40.00 with delivery. Sometimes it's just worth it for something so yummy.   I was excited tonight to share an Oasthouse experience with my daughter and was pretty disappointed at both a mediocre meal and pettiness on my bill. Even though I was happy to spend the 45.00 plus 20.00 delivery charges and tip to reward ourselves after a strenuous and stressful day of work, I felt shortchanged pretty quick when I couldn't even see the pimento on my burger, got an overly dry bun and was charged 2.00 after the fact for some perceived "extra" change to my order.   Whether this was an upcharge because they were out of mashed potatoes (usually substituted for fries since I'm gluten free) and gave me the more expensive brussels sprouts. Or maybe they changed me for the extra pimento I always ask for (#swoon) but didn't get. Since they didn't say what it was for I'm left wondering.   All in all, my highly anticipated Oasthouse indulgence fell kind of flat on a day when I really needed it. I guess nobody's perfect.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriends and I met up here for brunch. They have quite a few patios to choose from, a nice inside section, and a full bar. Cool atmosphere and decent prices for food and drinks. We ordered 2 carafes of mimosas for only $8 each, which I thought was a great deal. They bring out your champagne and orange juice in separate carafes so you can measure out how much you personally want of each, which I appreciated.   I was not blown away by the food, but everything we ordered was still solid. Two of us ordered the all day breakfast plate that came with eggs, uncured bacon, a slice of toast, and breakfast potatoes. Everything was good, simply nothing stood out. The other two people in our party enjoyed their eggs Benedict and strawberries field salad. Good service and she stayed attentive the whole time we were there catching up. Overall, good experience.

reviews.author: Kayla B.
reviews.description: We've eaten here twice for dinner and really enjoyed our meals both times! We also had the same waiter, Henry B., and he was excellent! He was able to give great suggestions for food and drinks. We've had the fried mushrooms (featured) and the Reuben egg rolls for appetizers which were both amazing! For entrees we've had the chicken schnitzel, cheesy meatball sub (featured), and the strawberry fields salad which were really tasty. My personal favorite is the chicken schnitzel. Other reviews mention the drinks being so-so but every drink I've gotten has been quality with the alcohol. The hotter melon was recommended by Henry and was very refreshing. We plan to be back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: First time here and to start we were welcomed with amazing staff members.   Our waitress Kayla really made the ordering experience truly as smooth and delightful as possible!!   The food definitely brought a smile to my face with the Bacon beignets, pancakes, salad and poutine as our entrees.   Can't wait to be back next time in Austin!

reviews.author: Adriana O.
reviews.description: First timer here and everything was great! The bacon beignets are perfect... nice flavor and crispy outside crunch. The mimosa carafes are great to share with friends! I love that the juice and alcohol are separate so you can adjust to your liking. I had the strawberry greens salad with chicken and it was refreshing and delicious.  I would recommend for a chill brunch spot on a Saturday! Not too crowded at all and we were seated right away at 11:30. Our server Kayla was great! Service was prompt and they easily made us a mocktail for our non-drinking guest! Will be back next time I come to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Helisse F.
reviews.description: We love Oasthouse! The food is always excellent and we have tried many items on the menu. Henry B was our server and did a fantastic Job. Come eat here and you will NOT be disappointed, in fact, you will want to make this your night out restaurant.

reviews.author: Joyce B.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place near my house in Four Points. The food is always very good and made to order with great ingredients. The service is always excellent, even when they are packed.   Today our server Kayla was engaging and took great care of us.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Jeanne G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were, once again, delighted with the delicious food and competent service via Megan at a the Oasthouse Kitchen.  I ordered the Truffled Prosciutto Bruschetta, consisting of creamy truffled ricotta, argula, mission figs and local honey topped by a generous dollop of prosciutto.  It was a dreamy combo of textures and flavors.  On the side I had the seasonal tomato soup, thick and creamy.  My husband was briefly disappointed when Megan reported that the ribs were sold out.  However, she recommended the Wagu steak and frites.  The steak arrived warm and beautifully sliced with a giant side of shoestring fries, delicate and just fried to perfection.  We topped off the meal by splitting a peach crumble adorned with vanilla bean ice cream - a desert to die for.

reviews.author: Rachel D.
reviews.description: Typical Lil Woodrow's - lots of beer and sports!   We were here on a Thurs night and it was busy but not crowded. I would give it 5 stars but I can't bc of all the smoking. I smelled like cigarettes when we left after about 2 hours, and no one in my party smoked. This was my first (and unfortunately last) time here, so I was unaware.   Know b4 you go: -Dogs allowed on patio -Smoking allowed -Bring your own food or order from next door   -Great waitstaff   Overall, I won't be back due to the cigs, but that's a personal preference of mine. If you don't mind smoking, this is a good bar.

reviews.author: Nicole L.
reviews.description: Watched as over a dozen unmasked people were served by an unmasked server. You have to be kidding me.

reviews.author: DaLila G.
reviews.description: I really like it here. Every time I go there's live music and I legally like sitting on their patio. It's super chill and always clean. Def a great spot in the neighborhood. Will continue to keep visiting

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: This place is an okay spot for a beer after work.  Cheap drink specials.  You need to get a table near a fan because the AC does not work well.  Also, be warry if you ask the bar mgr dude to turn a game's sound on.  He might tell you "people like you make it hard to be a manager at a sports bar". Overall, on a scale of das to das, it's a little below das.

reviews.author: Shannon O.
reviews.description: I love that this spot is very close...I also enjoy the openness of the joint...they also have decent beers on tap. However..if you want food, you have the option of ordering from a pizza spot a couple of doors down...meh. The biggest thing I don't like is..their mixed drinks are SO watered down!   I've tried at least 4 different ones and the ice and water is the most prominent.   So if you go? Stick to the beer or a shot.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: This bar is down the street from our apartment so it's our local hangout on the weekends! It can get pretty packed on Friday/Saturday nights but the staff is quick as lighting! We never have a bad time here and they host loads of events that make it feel like we are apart of a community. Love Little Woodrow's!

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: Great place to sit and have some beverages.  Spent a lazy Saturday afternoon on the patio...beautiful weather and great people.  It's also a great place to bring your doggies.  Very good beer selection...even had three sours on tap, which is hard to find AND my absolute favorite!

reviews.author: Gilford S.
reviews.description: They claim to be a neighborhood bar but they treat the real neighbors... those who actually live and work right across the street like utter garbage.  On multiple occasions.  Done with these amateurs.  PS. The drinks are weak as can be and the bartenders are lame.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great local hangout always playing whatever game we want to watch. Cold beer, nice patio, decent service and, if you're hungry, Brooklyn pie company a couple doors down will deliver to your table.

reviews.author: Joshua K.
reviews.description: It's always a joy to come here to drink and socialize. Nothing beats beautiful women, alcohol, and excellent customer service! Except for a lack of delicious bar foods!   Although you can bring food into the restaurant, the selection around the area is a bit lackluster. Your only choices are a mediocre pizza place or Mexican cuisine. Brooklyn's pizza will probably be your go to dish if you do decide on italian. Their appetizers are not enjoyable for the value you'll be paying.   All in all, this place has a wide assortment of beverages and a nice place to unwind after a long day of work.

reviews.author: Kenneth B.
reviews.description: I like this place. But I'd like to talk to mr friends without yelling over the loud music. I'm sure the staff rocks out before patrons come in and don't think to turn it down to a reasonable level.  Bad first date spot which is not a good thing to be in the dating app era.

reviews.author: Albert G.
reviews.description: The best neighborhood bar in town. Upon walking in, you immediately feel like you're a part of the family. The management is beyond professional and they take time to hear opinions or just causally chat. The bar tenders are courteous and quick to serve. No matter what day it is, you will always feel like it's a Friday a night when you come here.   P.S.  I highly recommend you get in a game of cornhole! Lots of great players!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: I LOVE this place...great beer selection and dog-friendly...the outdoor patio is shaded, has mistress, and even the bar extends outside to sit at if you don't want a table.  The staff is also a big reason I keep coming back.  I just finished my first run through the Big 50 Club (50 different drafts) and there is more on tap than just those on that list.  Pretty cool!  They don't have food, but the pizza place next door delivers to your table--a slice, whole pie, salads, fries, chips n queso, wings, chicken fingers, subs, etc...so it's not only pizza.  Outstanding!

reviews.author: Christopher S.
reviews.description: Laid back atmosphere. Good beers/drinks. Nothing fancy, doesn't cater to one click or another. This location is new and they have it worked out fairly well. Only minor rub is that the outside patio gets direct sun, which is going to be a bit of bitch in the dead of summer, but for now it's fine. Outdoor bar, plenty of screens.
