"Jukebox" (fancy MP3 player is nice). Allows you to bump something that is playing that isn't quite to your liking. Drink prices are fair for sure considering most watering holes are serving watered down and overpriced cough syrup.  This place is clean and seems well kept. The manager is almost constantly walking the place and fixing things. They went out of there way to find me an outlet to charge my phone.   Note: Pet friendly even having a water bowl for your four legged family as needed. Just please mind the leash, one guys dropped his momentarily to grab a beer and his dog tore through the kitchen/bar area, it was hilarious.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Gave bartender a 5% tip cause of bad service.  She comes outside to chastise me in front of my wife and friends because she expected more. Told her I expected better service and her response was to cut me off. Hey.. already played my tab!  Much better places to have fun in Austin anyhow.

reviews.author: Pam K.
reviews.description: Our first time visiting this venue to see our friends' band play will be our last. It's sad, too, because it doesn't seem like a bad place.  To the juvenile waitress with an attitude: you're in customer service. That means you serve customers WITHOUT the massive chip on your shoulder. If you don't like your job, find something else to do, but DON'T take your mistakes out on your customers.  The waitress got our order wrong and pitched a massive attitude when we kindly asked her to fix it - it was a DIET COKE!!! Slammed the new drink on the table and didn't speak to us the rest of our stay there.  THEN denied it all when approached by my husband, who had to escalate the situation to a manager. Horrible, horrible, horrible. Grow up.

reviews.author: Alyssa D.
reviews.description: I'm biased cos I've worked with them at Brooklyn Pie next door for over a year (they deliver to LW if you call in and the pizza is great) and currently work with LW now. Heads up, you won't be playing on your phone past your first drink. It may as well be Cheers personified. Customers and staff alike are all so friendly and hilarious, you'll get roped into ridiculous convos and debates. It's inevitable. The staff (myself included) will adopt you as our own. 15/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Celeste R.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a total of three times now, I've tried to love it! Claims to be a neighborhood bar but they're everything short of it. Bartenders aren't too worried about giving good customer service, and their drinks are pretty lame as well. Could easily get their "cocktails" at the Bombshells down the road, with more of a kick and better attentiveness and service. The only reason I'm not leaving 1 star instead of 2 is because they don't care if you're drunk- they'll keep serving you! Lmao and the board games are a nice touch!

reviews.author: That G.
reviews.description: We love this place!! Especially the bartender, Marilyn. We came new years eve and she wasn't even working and she remembered us. Austin is a great city! We hope to move here. Thank you for a great experience!!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: Love this place... Except sometimes they play THE WORST MUSIC EVER! Just My opinion, not into it, don't dig it, turn it down or off

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Douglas W.
reviews.description: Movie theatre are banning large bags to stop people from being in their own food...  Good thing I have a few Twix up my sleeve!  I had a pretty eventful day but I knew that I wanted to still go catch a movie. I came to a pretty late showing and yet the service was great. Of course you always expect that the end of someone's shift that they would be low on energy but the service was fast friendly. The movie theater was clean the bathrooms are clean and there was plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were looking forward to our first movie date in two years due to the pandemic. We went to see Ghostbusters Afterlife the Friday night after the premiere. Everything started out fine: we placed our drink and appetizer order before the show started. Got our mozzarella sticks and they were slightly underdone. Eh whatever, not a huge deal. Our beer and Bavarian Pretzel pizza were good, no complaints. However, the service not so much. On top of the fact our waitress took forever, she accused us of smoking in the theatre. I told her there was a vape cloud that came up on the row in front of us and I never saw anyone go talk to them. So maybe make sure you're accusing the right person next time. THEN our popcorn was burnt and we still got charged for it after letting them know. We'll keep going to Moviehouse in the future.

reviews.author: Jamie B.
reviews.description: Went and saw Free Guy tonight. Great movie. My 9year old puked all over the lobby as we left  The employees were so nice about it! They didn't make me feel bad or guilty or make me clean it up. I am so very grateful for tonights Lakeline employees  At least it wasn't poop?

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: My husband and I rented a theater for a special occasion during covid. It wasn't exactly cheap ($150 for the rental, plus tickets and food/drink separately) but we missed movie theaters so much that we sprung for it. It was definitely worth it. The Alamo crew took so many precautions before and during our stay that although I was very anxious about the rental at first, I was able to relax and enjoy the show. Like others have said, all movie theaters are surely suffering right now and we need to support Alamo so that they're here when the pandemic is over. I love this theater chain so much, it'd be devastating for me personally if they were to close.

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: Minus one star for every dollar y'all charge for the "convenience fee"   Before paying online make sure you know about this charge!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The Alamo is awesome, and we've missed it a ton during the pandemic. But now that we have our vax, we decided to risk a super special outing -- we did a Your Own Private Alamo rental to celebrate a milestone birthday in the family. Just our inner circle, all by ourselves ... with a movie! And popcorn! And freakin' amazing buffalo cauliflower! In public, having our first normal-ish outing in over a year! Seriously, it was fun, and the Alamo took good care of us.

reviews.author: Mahlet A.
reviews.description: This spot was super cute and a great date night choice. The staff was super friendly and efficient while moving around throughout the movie. The drinks were tasty and strong enough. I wish I had known that the seats were so tight together, I would have left some space between myself and the occupants next to me. Other than that it was a nice experience!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I'm torn between nostalgia and the elevated level of service (and price) other theatres are offering.  This is classic Alamo.  It's like rediscovering your first car.  Fixed bar-style eating surface in front of the fixed seats, no leg rests or fully reclining seats.  The service was GREAT, albeit we were intentionally at a TERRIBLE horror movie (The Turning) that had maybe 10 people in the cinema with us.  Still, an employee could slack in that situation and they did not.    The screen and sound were good.    There was no lounge in the theater that I saw to relax and have drinks before or after the movie.    And, after many visits to other theatres, it was unusual not to have a button to press for service.  Rather, you physically put your order card up on the table for a server to see when they come by.  I was really concerned about this because I knew how bad the movie was going to be early on and drinks were part of the plan!! lol  But in retrospect, maybe having to physically check on the patrons is what made the service so attentive (I got the drinks I needed to get through the picture -- thank you, Jesus).  So, obviously I'm torn.  It is a retro experience for me having experienced my first dine-in theater at an Alamo. I would go back here again in a heartbeat.  But it is like getting in a classic car and then realizing you actually like modern bucket seats and power steering.  At the same time that classic car was less expensive and still brings a smile to your face.  I'm going to rank based on the model Alamo built and on fulfilling my memories of great service...and I'm looking forward to going back again! :)

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Firstly, we've been coming to this location since it opened, and before that to their old spot off of Lake Creek Pkwy. Secondly, they have the nicest staff, and their food is always delicious! If there's any issue, they handle it quickly and efficiently. They're also super clean, and have been really amazing with COVID protocols. I feel comfortable going back to the movies because of Alamo Drafthouse. Thanks for always going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: This is a review for the family party movies that Alamo does.   We went to a Family Party on Sunday. This is our second time for a family party and they rock! 45 minutes before the movie they have crafts for the kids (seems like usually 3-4 stations) and then they have an interactive dance or activity at the front of the theater immediately before the movie. It makes the movie an event for the kids.   Now if I could somehow watch a movie I want to see while the kids watched their cartoon!

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: My wife and I attended the Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring 3:00 p.m. showing at Lakeline Alamo on Saturday, March 27. It was our first public outing since last year before Covid-19 struck. We were excited and nervous to venture out, but trusted Alamo's protocols.  We walk into the theater and there is just one guy there, sitting a couple rows from the projector, American flag bandana for a mask sitting around his neck not covering his face, scrolling on his phone. He makes a couple calls and talks loudly, checking on his insurance apparently. He continues to do it halfway through the movie previews. My wife and I are already annoyed. Not a good start.  The movie begins and the guy behind us has been quiet for 10 minutes. Things seem to be turning for the better. That is, until a short while into the movie when he starts making comments aloud. "No!" to Gandalf leaving Frodo. "Asshole!" to Saruman betraying Gandalf. I grit my teeth and exchange glances with my wife as it continues, both of us hoping it subsides.  Nope. The loud asshole decides to keep making his commentary like it's his own personal screening. I finally have had enough of it about an hour into the film and place an order card that read "Please tell the guy behind us to stop talking! He keeps doing it!" The server comes five minutes later, takes it and nods. She does nothing.  Another 30 minutes goes by. This guy's behavior continues. He even plays a video on his phone for all to hear at one point. He's all I can focus on now, my enjoyment of the movie totally ruined. I storm out of the theater determined to get someone to kick him out.  I find a young guy with a pony tail who is clearly a server. I plea my case that this guy needs to go. He seems to take my request seriously and I return, hoping the Alamo's well-known policy of kicking out disruptors will finally be used on this guy ruining our movie.  Well, that wasn't the case. 10, then 20 minutes go by. I didn't see anyone come into the theater to handle it. The pest behind us makes comments aloud less frequently, probably because my wife yelled at him to shut up at one point. While I couldn't blame her for taking it into her own hands, I wanted the Alamo staff to do something about it like I know they should.  In retrospect, maybe it wasn't a bad idea because nothing was done to kick him out as I requested. The movie nears its end and the guy shouts again. Finally, we hear someone behind us address him, apparently letting him off with a warning. After all he had done throughout the course of the film to ruin the movie for us, it was far too little, far too late.  Amazingly, it actually worked that someone talked to him. He shut up for the 10 minutes left in the movie and didn't say anything during the cast reunion piece that followed the credits. So had the staff addressed this nuisance earlier like I wanted, perhaps this outing would have been salvagable. Mind you, I first brought it to the attention of the staff an hour into a THREE HOUR MOVIE. They finally say something to him with only 10-15 minutes left. Completely unacceptable, if you ask me.  Our server tells us shortly after one of her staff finally talked to the guy that she told a manager and that she was sorry the loud patron was like this. He seems "a little 'special,' you know what I mean?" is what she says. Whether that's true or not is frankly irrelevant. You have a policy in place that you remind patrons every single time they visit your theaters. No talking, no texting. Problem with a loud table? Raise an order card and a staff member will address it, eventually asking them to leave without a refund. Had this policy been followed as outlined, he should have been given a warning an hour into the movie and then instructed to leave without a refund 30 minutes later when I pleaded to the staff to take care of it. Case closed. The way it was handled in reality was an absolute joke and insult.  We were happy to attend this screening as our first outing. Now, after this incident, we will no longer give Alamo our business.

reviews.author: beep b.
reviews.description: i placed an order for food delivery, put instructions on how i wanted it, and when my food got here all of my instructions were ignored and in my opinion purposefully made wrong. i think if you're not even going to try to make something the way the person wants it, it becomes aggressive and personal. like what is the problem

reviews.author: Jed B.
reviews.description: This location has stadium seating and comfortable chairs with a smart table design. The Alamo Drafthouse has an excellent beer selection and some tasty food options.. Even for a  vegetarian.  The best part of the experience for me is that people are told to turn off phones and be quiet. No one else is doing this and it is a thoughtful reminder.  Although some people don't quite get it and continue to talk, there was enough attention to keep the majority of chatter box's quite:-)

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: I love the Alamo Drafthouse. My go to place to catch a movie. I enjoy the avocado toast and French press coffee when I come to an early movie. Later movies it's the bacon and goat cheese pizza. I appreciate the fact they have beers from local breweries available as well! Of course, who doesn't love the no talking and no texting rule!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Love coming to this location in the midweek afternoons. It's usually not crowded.   Alamo does cinema the right way. Love to get there a half hour early and watch the pre-show entertainment. It's unique, nostalgic, and always funny. None of the advertisement bombardment you get at other theaters.   The food is always excellent   The 2x2 burger is my favorite and I've never been disappointed. It's a 5 star version of the Big Mac. The Colorado steak salad is also a regular favorite.   Drinks are always cold and the buttered popcorn with real butter is ridiculously delicious.   Awesome selection of adult beverages.   Love this place.

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love coming to Alamo Drafthouse! A couple months ago, my husband and I had a bad experience, to which management was quick to reach out to us to resolve. They went above and beyond to make sure that experience was made up for. My husband and I were so happy and will continue coming to our favorite movie theater here at Lakeline.  Staff really do go beyond expectations and are always making sure you are having a good time.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for Dinner and a movie 1/9/19. We were the first in line to get to our seats. It was my first time and my Wife and Sons second time. We were served pretty quickly. We loved the Pizza which was the Meat Pizza. It was hot and fresh. My wife was not a fan of the Chardonnay. My son thought his Pepperoni pizza was great and liked the Milkshake as well. We enjoyed the reserve seating. Just before the movie started we ordered some popcorn and a beer to split.   What cost them a star in my opinion was the Popcorn. It was really cold and without Salt or much Butter and taste like it was made at home. The main thing I like about the Movies is the Popcorn is always unbelievable. This was the opposite and was memorable for the worst reason. The other annoyance was the lack of under the table lighting when the bill arrived during the movie. I tried and quickly gave up so my wife finally figured out what we owed and paid in the dark. Not sure I have a fix just saying this is not good for older people with less then perfect night vision.  Definitely more to like than dislike here. We will be back.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to come see a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse for almost a decade. Lo and behold, I am on production and me and my crew had a private screening. It was kind of a dream come true.  But I must say, the staff absolutely exceeded my expectations. Mainly Laura and Josiah, not only were they both very accommodating, but there are also very genuine.

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: This is our default date night spot for the wife and I. We recently purchased the season pass and love it. Their popcorn is seriously the best we have ever had. It's covered in ghee and we never get an un-popped kernel. It's something we crave and will forever compare every other one to.

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: I used to love coming here, but have realized that it's just overpriced and uncomfortable all around. The food is not that great, the seats are definitely not comfortable and just too close to other people.   While they have a tempting kids menu, the booster seats make for an uncomfortable experience for the littles too.  The tables are not lit underneath like other locations and the theater is just too small, feeling like we are in a living room minus the comfort.   I just can't warrant a minimum $60 experience here..

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The staff always gives a warm welcome when we stop here to eat. There is outside (dogs welcomed) and inside seating.   We have been here a few times and love their food.    My favorite so far is the brisket banh mi and their potato salad. The brisket is smoked perfectly and the bread texture compliments the heartiness of the brisket well.  I love the fresh veggies they put in this!  The potato salad is hands down the best potato salad I have ever had at a restaurant. You have got to try this!!  We have ordered a few drinks in the past - they have a great Happy Hour.  You cant miss it - follow your nose to North Lamar and treat yourself.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty takes the best of both worlds by combining traditional Viet style of cooking with American BBQ to give you a fusion you didn't know you needed... until now. You can find items such as the:  - Brisket Bánh Mì: I enjoy the twist of smokey, fatty flavors from the brisket as well as the creamy cilantro and soy sauce that it comes with. The fries are amazing, too! $13.95 (4.5/5)  - Leaning Tower of Texas: a brunch special that is a stack of 3 hash browns, brisket, jalapeño cheddar sausage, pork belly, sambal hollandaise (sambal is like chile peppers), and bánh mì veggies - this is a lot more filling than it looks, I definitely would suggest you share it. I thought it was pretty good. $23.75 (4/5)  - Pho Queso: you read that right, they take veggie pho broth and mix it in with melted cheese to give you a unique take on queso. The pro here is that it's vegetarian friendly, but the con is that the flavor is a bit faint and I wish they would use a beef pho base instead. It's still good however! $7 (3.5/5)  Overall, this is a great spot to visit if you're craving BBQ, but also want to try something different. They have an outdoor patio if you prefer to sit outside. They also have awesome customer service and the prices are good too. With that said, I give them a 4.25/5.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: This place was everything I had hoped it would be. Now I just wish there was another one in Houston!  This Texas Tower looks intimidating but just roll up your sleeves, topple that thing over, and dive right in. The jalapeño sausage has some sneaky heat. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns with beautifully salted pork belly. Loved every bite.  We also shared the pork belly and brisket banh mi's and smokin fries. Most banh mi places we are quick to grab the Sriracha and Maggie's Sauce but not this time. It didn't even cross my mind until days after.  The brisket has the most amazing flavor and so moist. Almost a shame to lose it into anything else. But a perfect addition to any menu item.  Such warm and friendly owners and staff.   Parking was easy on a Sunday afternoon.  CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK FOR MORE!!!

reviews.author: Kelsi D.
reviews.description: I really wanted this to be a revolutionary experience. The concept is so cool, but their menu is a little repetitive and the food was just good. Not saying that this wasn't an awesome meal, but I really wanted it to be something to write home about. And it just wasn't.   The banh mi sandwiches were very dry but the meat was insanely tender, though   lacking a lot of flavor. The cost is a little higher but the portion sizes are large and generous.   The real show stopper here though, is the bbq sauce. It's the right mix of Asian flavors and classic bbq sweetness.   It's worth the visit to see this take on two fairly different cuisines mashed together. But don't expect to be wowed away. It doesn't scream fusion to me, it just seems like they took some of the most popular parts of each cuisine and put them separately on the plate.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a fusion restaurant that combines Vietnamese and BBQ cuisine. They have lots of indoor and outdoor seating. They even have live music on some weeknights. You order at the bar counter and take your number to the table, and they bring out your food out to you. We sat outside, but the service was slightly lacking as we had go back into the restaurant for multiple items like silverware and napkins. The meat tasted good, I would favor the pork belly over the brisket- the bread was hard and crispy for banh mi. I definitely would view them more as a BBQ joint versus Vietnamese, although they do have some interesting drinks with Viet twists. Overall, a good place to go especially if looking for late night food. They have they own private parking lot as well.

reviews.author: Joel M.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty fuses Texas barbecue with Vietnamese cuisine. I popped in for the Double Fantasy Bahn Mi (brisket and pork belly). Served on a crunchy, fresh baguette, the meats were perfectly smoked and flavorful, and the pickled vegetables were crisp and colorful. If you prefer a bit of added heat, ask for jalapeños and sriracha. I also tried the slaw which was fresh and bright with Asian flavors.  There is plenty of seating outside. The decor inside is plenty nice with dark wood decor. The restaurant sports a full bar. This is such a great little neighborhood spot.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Ordered online. Went to pickup when was supposed to be available but wasn't ready. There was no parking so had to park with my hazards on and had asked the bartender if she could bring it out to since I had my dog in my car, she said yes. I guess she forgot cause I walked in 20mins later to ask and it was there. Got home to eat my food and it was okay. Honestly tasted better the next day, but probably wouldn't go again with so many other options available.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Came by on a Friday night to see a friend's band, the Lone Star Debonairs.  Also wanted dinner... and this is the second BBQ place I've been to in less than a week!  Smokin Beauty is in the Vietnamese area of North Austin, and is a Vietnamese/BBQ hybrid.  They're a small place but have good outdoor seating and parking, and the weather this Friday night was perfect for eating and dancing.  The food: I ordered their brisket and pork belly salad with a creamy cilantro dressing.  The brisket had nice smoke and a good bark, and the pork belly was soft without being mushy or all fat, and really lightly flavored, showing off the meat.  Fresh, crisp veggies made it perfect  They also have Banh Mi on the menu, and a Viet BBQ plate with Texas BBQ and Viet vegetables.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: I can't stop thinking about this meal. The brisket is perfectly smoky. The pork belly is perfectly crispy. All the flavors pair together perfectly. It was all just...PERFECT!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: My postal colleague and I stopped here on Mother's Day and I cannot even begin to explain the positive energy Tao had upon arrival. I told her we always carry mail past the pits and always wanted to try it. I ordered the brisket banh mi with potato salad as well as an happy hour cocktail. My friend got a two meat plate with slaw and potato salad. The salad was incredible, we both agreed. He loved the pork belly so much!  For the price point, it was absolutely worth it! Discussing the passion Matt and Tao have for opening this business during a pandemic is inspiring nonetheless. Stop on by!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Delicious joint serving a unique combo of Vietnamese and traditional BBQ. I loved my experience here, the food was absolutely delicious and lots of interesting drinks to choose from as well. It's also not often you see a bbq place serve brunch on the weekends as well, I will definitely be back to try that.   Some must tries are definitely the brisket and the sausage. The brisket was incredibly fatty and tender with tons of smoky flavor. I loved the sausage as well, the bites of melted cheese in the middle were to die for.   The bahn mi sandwich was pretty good too, the fatty pork belly goes super well with pickled veggies and cilantro. The sides were great as well, I would recommend the slaw for sure.   If you're looking for some drinks I would recommend one of the mimosa carafes. $20 and you get a full bottle of champagne mixed in. We got the guava one but I would love to try lychee next time.   I definitely think bbq and Vietnamese are a match made in heaven and would highly recommend everyone try Smokin Beauty!

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Vietnamese and BBQ fusion food - delicious. You can get either or a mixed combo. I got a brisket Banh Mi which was perfect. Great outdoor seating with live music on Friday nights. Make sure to bring a coat in the winter time!

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty perfects Vietnamese flavor meets Texas bbq fusion food! I loved the concept from the start and my belly was happy with the results. My boyfriend and I shared the brisket banh mi with slaw as a side, as well as the Viet king meat plate with potato salad and fries. Also ordered the Vietnamese coffee at the end.   Definitely recommend the banh mi - the bread used has the perfect texture - soft and bursting with flavor on the inside and crusty bite on the outside. The brisket was yummy and the pork belly was absolutely unctuous! Def getting the pork belly banh mi next time. Although neither of us are usually huge sausage fans at bbq spots, this sausage was amazing. So flavorful and stood its ground against the brisket and pork belly!  Sides - all were awesome accompaniments. The fries were nice and crispy, the slaw was a refreshing reprieve from the rich meat, and the potato salad had a delicious Asian twist to it.  If I had to provide any feedback, I will note that there was a frozen fry in the mix of the other fries and was quite jarring to bite into lol. But it happens. Also thought the Vietnamese coffee was pretty pricey at $7 even though the rest of the meal was fairly priced.  Overall, I would recommend this spot and will be back!

reviews.author: Michelle N.
reviews.description: We came here on their pop-up mini mart fundraiser for AMA and APA in March 2021. We were very excited to support a local vietnamese startup! All of their vendors were very sweet and they took pre-orders. Next time I go, I need to pre-order  everything was all gone by the time we got there. It starts at 12 and we got there at 130. If you want good parking, get there early!! I suggest taking a smaller car if you're a bad parker. Their parking lot situation is a nightmare for a horrible driver like me.   We ordered the Thai tea boba, Spinach dip, brisket banh mi, king burger, and double cheese brisket burger.   Boba: I know this isn't a boba shop, but I was quite disappointed in the size of the drink. It was basically half the size of a normal sweet tea drink. The drink was fresh. It was hot when it got to me. I had to stir it to make it cold. I usually get it served already mixed and cold. Their tapioca was cooked so well. Usually some places have dry and crunchy boba. Not here! Their boba is well cooked and is very gooey.  Spinach dip and fries: wowza! That tasted fresh. We looked at the spinach while eating and not all of the leaves were fully wilted. That's how you know that they didn't use frozen spinach! You can taste the spinach and the fries are very flavorful. I love the way that they seasoned everything. I might be completely wrong though   The food was amazing in general, but to call it fusion was a bit conflicting for us. We looked at the brisket banh mi and the coleslaw to need a little bit more tweaking. The coleslaw was quite runny and very liquidy. The banh mi needs more veggies. We weren't quite sure if it had the pate. If it did, it was easily overpowered by the brisket. We personally felt that it needed more vietnamese oomph. The french bread was on point though  We prefer the soft bread over the crunch. Other than the fusion part, that dish was DELICIOUS.   The other two meals were amazing. We loved everything about them. Burgers were cooked well and the buns were sooooo soft!   We are a vietnamese family and we love Smokin Beauty! We think you did a great job with the restaurant and are extremely excited about your future. We're definitely coming back in the future and becoming regulars. My brother has asked for us to come here on birthdays and introducing our parents to this place!

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Vietnamese BBQ? Sure, why not? I liked the idea - pickled vegetables, baguettes and smoky meat is hard not to like. Definitely feels fushiony as there's the drink menu but also boba and vietnamese coffee, side dishes that champion more so counterparts to texas bbq. It's a unique cultural mishmash that you just need to try for yourself.  I got a viet style king plate to split and overall it's pretty good. It's definitely a lot of food that I think can be pretty easily split between two people. Brisket, hefty chunks of pork belly and a whole cheddar sausage, baguette chunks and two sides. I would recommend getting an extra side of baguette if you're splitting because you are a bit bread light otherwise. Overall, while each meat was good and smoky, they were all a tad bit on the dry side today. Of the three, I think the pork belly was the best. The sausage has some kick but not that much, with a thoroughly emulsified texture. The brisket has the bark and smoke ring but even the moist was a little dry by the time we got it. Maybe just an off night but it's not disappointing with the sauce.  The sides I think are the best part - the creamed spinach is on point and the fries are crisp, with some extra crunch factor that I love and is great textural contrast to all the tender meat and the spinach. The sauces (jalepeno ranch and bbq sauce) are good too.

reviews.author: Kat L.
reviews.description: Stopped by for lunch, got 2 banh mi's, one is pork belly and the other brisket. I got fries and potatoes salad as sides.   Pork belly is 10/10  Brisket is sooooo good with the jalapeños 8/10 Fries 9/10 lowkey tastes like funnel cakes  Potato salad 10/10, best potato salad ever.   Will be back!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a Blood Bros equivalent and find yourself in Austin, you need to stop by and see Smokin Beauty. This is a marriage between Vietnamese and Texas BBQ that makes a lovely couple.  When we arrived we were really looking forward to trying the Banh Mi's, but after talking to the gal behind the counter we were definitely sold on getting the King plate. We reasoned it would be the same as getting a Banh mi, only it will be less bread yet virtually the same ingredients. That was fine with us since we were heading to a conference and didn't want to get weighed down. But this allowed us to get a real birds eye view of their style and taste, and also to sample all the meats- the brisket, cheese jalapeño sausage, and the pork belly. And oh my, when the King plate came out, we were quite impressed. The brisket is one of the moist and softest I've tasted. The pork belly was nicely charred,  yet amazingly soft and smoked so well. The jalapeño sausage was also good and had a great kick to it.   However the advantage of getting the king plate was the two sides, which included the smokin fries, where they put on generous helpings of brisket, cilantro, onion, and cheese. That was so incredibly good. Combine that with their bbq sauce and the creamy cilantro sauce, and both of these fuse together to really bring out the tastes or the meat. Would definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Henry L.
reviews.description: Smokin Beauty is a great example of combining two cuisines properly to make something fun and delicious.  We ordered pickup and the process was pretty smooth.  Online ordering is easy and you can see what orders are ahead of you and their status.  You tell them when you're at the restaurant, and they'll walk your order straight to your car.  Staff was great!  I ordered the King Banh Mi with a side of creamed spinach.  I also tried their Smokin Fries as well.  The meats are great, and while the King Banh Mi was a ton of meat, I felt that the sandwich it was a bit overloaded.  Eating it was messy and everything was falling apart.  Still would recommend it if you wanted to try all the meats at once.  Like most BBQ, the meats can get salty and heavy, but the sauces, carrots, and cucumbers offer a nice refreshing taste.  Between the meats, the brisket was my favorite.  It was very tender; the fibers easily separate as you pinch down on the meat.  It had a nice fattiness as well.  The Smokin fries come with the brisket, so I would definitely recommend those as well.  The fries didn't get soggy either, which was impressive.  The creamed spinach was also really good.  The spinach wasn't as pulverized as in normal creamed spinach, so you get a nice texture and slight bitterness from the leaves.  Would definitely get this again.  Smokin Beauty's menu has a wide variety of items, so can stop by a lot of times and still try new things.  Can't wait to be back.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: Really good experience for Brunch. Loved the Texas Brisket Hash and the Waffles and Belly. We washed it all down with a really fresh bloody mary and their Bourbon viet coffee.  Great new local place offering really good options. I'll be back for their amazing brisket burger.

reviews.author: Sandi G.
reviews.description: I rarely give 5 stars but this place deserves it!  It's a little bit out of the way up north but the food was definitely worth the drive.  There's an outdoor patio area with a smoker as well as an indoor area that's designed like a bar.  This place is self service so once you ordered your food, you'll need to get water and clean up after yourself.  Since it was my first time here, I got both the bellies and waffles for brunch as well as a brisket banh mi to save for dinner later.  The waffles is more like a funnel cake style dough and I love it!  My friend got the brisket hash and honestly, I wished I had gotten the brisket hash cause it was amazing!  The brisket banh mi was the best banh mi I've ever had.  I don't like traditional banh mi sandwiches cause they're normally cold and I don't like cold sandwiches.  The banh mis here are made with warm meat and toasted.  Even after I microwaved it later it still tasted amazing.  I can't wait to come back again and get another banh mi to go!

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: Went here with my family for dinner for the Thursday $15 special (Half-rack ribs or tri-tip steak + 2 sides + pizookie) around 7. It took around 30 minutes to get seated which was understandable since they were pretty understaffed. I got the house salad with blue cheese dressing and tomato bisque soup as my sides. Both were pretty tasty although nothing super special. Portion sizes were really great though and could've been enough for dinner for me without the steak. I would definitely recommend coming for the Thursday special if you're looking for a good deal!   My family only ate one of the pizookies and got the other three to go. Our server Elias was very thoughtful and packed the ice cream and the mousse in separate containers from the pizookies to prevent them from getting soggy. I appreciated Elias providing great service despite the restaurant being understaffed.

reviews.author: Josie J.
reviews.description: Ordered BJ's today through grub hub. My husband got deep dish ziti and at first glance it looked fine. Then he went in and there was a puddle of grease at the bottom. The pasta was so oily and tasted terrible. This is ridiculous considering the price of the dish was $16+.  I got a Buffalo pizza and it was okay.

reviews.author: Paco P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang with your media naranja or fam. Good choice of beer and great food, cant go wrong with BJ's specially with a Stone IPA on you lol

reviews.author: Ed L.
reviews.description: If you are going to eat at a chain restaurant in Austin, BJ's is a good choice. Food is good, sriracha Brussels sprouts are a fave. Great in house beers, especially the red.

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: I wanted to go tonight and have a drink and some appetizers. I wanted to call and make a reservation the recording directed me to an app. I installed the app and it tells me there are no restaurants near me when I live 2 1/2 miles from the nearest BJ's. I called the store to see if they would put me on the waitlist and they patently refused despite their app not working. Sorry BJ's, you don't get my money tonight!  That is shitty service!!

reviews.author: JoAnna F.
reviews.description: Our waitress Nicole was very friendly and although she was busy, she made sure to come and check on us frequently. She has a beautiful personality and great customer service skills. The food was all good (like usual). We ordered some pizza, wings, and fish n chips. Oh yeah and cannot forget about the chocolate chip cookie and ice cream (yum).

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: Ive dropped in a here a few times for brew and a bite. The last time I went (July 2021) they had indoor seating on a limited scale. The tables in the bat area were closed to open seating. Though I was able to sit at the bar proper and received very quick, courteous service from the bartender and food runners. The queso is pretty good and comes in a generous portion. They have good, in house beers, the Kolch style and Red are good. They also have a good domestic and international beer selection too. You might have a little more than usual delay being seated but thats the COVID after effects...

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: We like go to BJ's and love the one in Cedar park, when I saw low reviews for this one I was thinking, how this can be? Well, it was two times when we tried, and both times we had to leave because we were treated so bad, we could not beleive, starting from hostess (very rude). Horrible place.

reviews.author: Phuong C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service could have been better.  No straws, no checking up or refilling liquids.

reviews.author: Brooke H.
reviews.description: The calamari was amazing! Cooked perfectly! French fries were hot and crispy! Coleslaw was not good very bland. The Philly would of been better if the meat was seasoned! Lighting was very dark to read the menu. Will go back!

reviews.author: Lou Lou O.
reviews.description: So underwhelming. First the waitress had a "smart ass" attitude when asked about the size of portions. I did not appreciate this. The entrees were all barely warm and cool to the touch. Within a few minutes we were eating cold food. The $17 Alfredo bowl was dry and cold. The garlic knot was cold. The hamburger was tasteless despite having fried jalapeños and chipotle Mayo. The meat needed seasoning. The fries, although tasty, were cold. The tea had a strange bitterness to it. They probably need to clean out their machine. The only thing palatable were the avocado egg rolls as I love the tamarind sauce. They were piping hot. We got 2 orders for a total of 12 costing $26. We should've stopped there. In the end the manager did comp the Alfredo but for high prices and below par food and service I'd say go elsewhere. BTW we loved BJ's when we lived in McAllen (this location was epic!) so this experience was very disappointing.

reviews.author: Beverly S.
reviews.description: Never again! It's been years since I last ate at BJs and now I remember why smh. This meal was horrible, if negative stars were possible that would be my rating. Ordered the "slow roasted" tri-tip and it was the toughest cut of meat I've ever encountered so this piece must have been "rush roasted". The overall flavor of the meat would have been pretty decent if the meat were actually edible. Also ordered the fettuccine alfredo, comes with chicken and broccoli. Not bad but oddly tastes exactly like a Marie Callendar's TV dinner so at this point I'm convinced they purchased a family size dinner, warmed it, placed in their own packaging then sprinkled some Parmesan on top. Normally, I'd just take the loss but in this case I want my money back, this is just unacceptable.

reviews.author: Victoria B.
reviews.description: My first experience; ordered delivery through LunchDrop. Outstanding! I'm gobbling before my next class. Wonderful!

reviews.author: Matty L.
reviews.description: Amazing experience! The take out hostess was incredibly helpful with my order. I thought I placed an online order but mistakenly forgot to hit "submit" ; she helped me though the process without making me feel like i made a dumb mistake, and offered to place my order on the grill immediately! I only waited about 10 minutes and my food was ready. Also picked up a to-go 6 pack and the night we saved! Shout out to the other order runner for keeping me posted with updates on my order. A* customer service, I'll be back for sure! Thank you -Matty

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: I've always enjoyed BJ's until this past Christmas Eve. My mom and I decided to use BJs curbside for our Christmas Eve dinner, just some burgers and fries. Well, when we brought home our order we were without fries. Bad on us for not checking the order when it was delivered to our vehicle before we drove home. I called BJs to explain what happened. I fully realize that they were busy due to the Holiday. I understand the pressures restaurants face during these times. But, I was told to come back to get the fries, which by then our burgers would be cold. The gentleman on the phone, who I'm sure was just having a bad day because he wasn't to friendly or apologetic, then offered a refund. He took down my information but I've yet to be refunded. I basically spent $33 on two hamburgers from BJs. Very disappointing as this was our Christmas Eve dinner and I'm on such a tight budget as it is. Needless to say, I won't be dining or doing curbside with BJs any longer.

reviews.author: Perry T.
reviews.description: I used to love eating here. But now, since the pandemic has lifted, the wait time is 40 minutes to an hour! Why? The place is half full and they don't have the help to serve a whole restaurant. Some of y'all need to get off your lazy duffs and go back to work! Your year of socialism is NOT sustainable.. BJs is also still enforcing social distancing through table restrictions. In their bar the two end tables were restricted but all the ones in-between were occupied (go figure).

reviews.author: C M.
reviews.description: I'm already having a good time... Layne... took care of my family and myself. Service was on point all the while things picked up at the restaurant. But more importantly, Layne made me feel like I was Batman and he was Alfred... how did I come to this kind of service? It's one thing to have a million dollars but Layne made me feel like a million bucks. Layne... I hope you get a raise, hell, I hope you run a BJ's yourself. You know how to make people feel like they are the only ones in the restaurant where they feel like they are getting the best service. Again thank you for a wonderful experience my dear Alfred. Cheers to you and all your endeavors.

reviews.author: Jacqueline E.
reviews.description: We had a terrible and extremely frustrating experience here one day, and when I emailed them about the issues (because I didn't want anyone else to go through what we went through) I got a very kind response from the AGM apologizing and assuring us that she'd look into it.   Other than this one very weird time, we've had good experiences here :) love the avocado rolls and Brussel sprouts and beer!

reviews.author: Fatima A.
reviews.description: i come to bjs every tuesday for $3 pizookies. This week i decided to branch out and go to the round rock location opposed to the cedar park location...that was my first mistake. There was a long wait, no problem i understand and didn't mind. As soon as me and my acquaintance sat down, our waitress haley was there to serve us. My friend asked for a children's menu which the cedar park location always allows. Haley said no until we begged and told her the other location gives it to us no problem. She hesitantly gave in. i felt as though she did not respect my friend and i at all because of our age. Later at the time of payment my friend asked if they offer a military discount, normal question right? My friends father was in the navy, serving our country, fighting for our freedom, for 22 years. My friend has a valid military ID with her picture on it that she was ready to present. Instead our server haley, when presented with the question of weather or not they offer a military discount said in a very belittling tone "your not in the military" instead of saying that they don't offer the discount for family members. When i go out to eat anywhere i always leave a very large tip, well over 20% because i work in a restaurant and i know the servers depend on these tips for their livelihood. I feel as though haley was rude and didn't deserve a tip that was anymore than 20% though. The way she spoke to us was belittling and there was so much better ways she could have said these things to us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Service has really taken a dive.  I am not talking about speed of food.  The last couple of times I have been there the dinner has been "off ".  We went on Saturday and the waiter took our order (family of four).  The kids food came out first and my husband's and mine came out about five min later.   My husband's stake was rare.  The waiter had walked away right after dropping off food.  He didn't come back for several minutes.  When he did he took the stake.  He didn't come back w it for about ten min.  Our family had finished eating before the stake ever came back.   When it came back it was over done  They didn't take it off the bill.  No apologies.  We understand staffing may be an issue with all that is going on.  Until staffing is fixed?  I would avoid here.   This used to be one of my favorite places

reviews.author: Bailey I.
reviews.description: I felt a little uncomfortable tonight as there was a girl walking around and asking people to buy cookies for $10 and when I said no thank you she suggested I make a donation instead. I'm not sure if she was family of someone working there, but it was awkward that they let her ask for money and since she never left the table we felt pressured to donate money to her with no idea who she was or if she was actually using the money for the purpose she said. Other than that, everything was great!

reviews.author: jaimie L.
reviews.description: Ordered through doordash. Missing cheesecake.  Chicken fried steak had the breading completely separated from the steak and although the breading was good, the steak was tough!  Fries overly salty while Mac n cheese had 0 salt. Best thing was the fried hot Cheeto torpedos. Would not return or recommend.

reviews.author: Anastasia R.
reviews.description: The service here is definitely not the best, it was very slow and yet there were so many waitress walking around talking to other staff... The food was decent and space was comfy.

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: Being a veteran of the armed forces this place has just a cool connection with my vibes...being able to sit down and have decor to commemorate the Armed Forces is such a treat for me. I just love an establishment that recognizes the armed forces, it has special meaning to me.   The menu is filled with military jargon which is pretty cool when you order.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Waitress brang me the wrong beer, asked for Miller Lite and was brought Bud Lite. Proceeded to ask what our waitress recommended as an appetizer and she said she didn't recommend anything on the menu. Poor attitude, customer service was bad from the moment my waitress began interacting. Seemed like she didn't want to be there at all. Overall would not recommend this spot if you want a good environment while drinking your cold brew.

reviews.author: Elyssa C.
reviews.description: Service was not great :( it wasn't very busy but we were kept waiting a very long time for items even after asking a few times. The food was yummy though! The shrimp tacos were good, the accompanying sauce is great!!

reviews.author: Cashdoll C.
reviews.description: Would only recommend this location through the week and daytime . I went on Saturday at about 11:00 this place had about 10 girls 2 at the front talking while I'm waiting to get seated , which took (5 min) for the girls to even come back from where they were at . So I finally got to the both still not being serviced properly. I waited 30 minutes before I got up and went to the front and asked " So IS ANYBODY GOING TO SERVICE ME" ? Like why come to work if you're not going to work .  I usually come to this place every time I'm in town but tonight was my last .

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: I don't know what the problems people have with place this are. When I was there, the food was good, the help was friendly and helpful, the girls were scantily clad of course... But aside from feeling ambivalent about that soft-core strip-club feel, it was great!

reviews.author: Angel B.
reviews.description: I see why they only have 2 1/2 stars! We walked in at 3. 3 tables and 3 at the bar. We waited 5 minutes to be seated. (Waitresses having a conversation.) We we're seated finally. Then after about 10 min with no drink order taken from us, a waitress goes to a table where a gentleman was just seated, sat down with him and started taking his order. He wa seated righ next to us. We got up to leave and let the manager know why we were leaving and she acted like she could care less. Have never tried the restaurant out and I can assure you we never will. Good luck with business. You're gonna need it with the staff you have. Sorry I can't rate the food.

reviews.author: Kerri B.
reviews.description: Good food, good service and excellent DJ's. I love to come on the days that DJ Roger works and DJ Kavika are djing. They are the best DJ's ever.

reviews.author: Geraldo H.
reviews.description: It was a pretty pleasant Sunday evening for me. I got out of work after being positively complimented throughout the day, just feeling pretty damn fucking good today. I decided to take a nap, then of course decided to get food to celebrate my day. I went on to take a nice hot shower, freshened myself up, and went out for food.   Initially, I was planning on going to Cheddar's but that wait time there was way too long. We're talking 45 minutes. I haven't eaten all day by the way. You know what was close by though? Bombshells. What was the wait time? 5-10 minutes. I wondered why but I didn't question it. It's kind of like when you need to take a shit, and you're just hoping to go to a nice restroom. Anyway, I was pretty surprised.  There was a younger woman who was the waitress our table. First thing she asked was the drinks we wanted. "Three waters please." I was then asked for my card right away which was fucking weird as shit as I didn't receive any food yet, nor did I get an order placed for food. I just sat there and started to ponder a bit. We get the waters but no offering of a straw for our waters, which I also thought was odd. Not really working out the way I'd like for my first time actually dining in.   NASCAR was on for a bit on the TV monitor screen, and then it changed to Women's soccer for the Summer Series (GO USA!). We finally get an order in. I ordered the Grilled Tilapia entree with Alfredo sauce smothered on, steamed broccoli, and Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese. The thing was that the poor waitress didn't even know that there was an option to top the tilapia with Alfredo sauce and shrimp. She mistook it that I wanted to do two different dishes. I'm just like, "I can guarantee something will be wrong." I kept quiet for a bit because I was pretty annoyed.  The food comes out. No shrimp on my dish. Eh, fine. I proceeded to eat the food and it was pretty decent. I liked the Alfredo sauce a lot. The Spicy Mac 'n' Cheese was okay at best. The steamed broccoli was good. I noticed one thing the entire hour being there--I've never once was asked for a refill on my drink, nor were we properly catered to with the courtesy of asking how everything was during the feasting of the food. I'm now really annoyed and frustrated.   The more I noticed things, I observed other tables and waitresses actually having an interaction with each other. The waitress at my table could have given two fucks about my guests and I. Cold shoulder was given to us several times, with the same waitress kissing the asses of the table served behind me to patrons that came in after we did. She was also missing for extended periods of time.  Little did she know, I actually am a frequent high-tipping gentleman with a whole lot of damn money to blow. Sadly though, she dropped the ball highly. I guess it could have been the way I looked or the stereotype that I may not be worth the time to serve--who the hell knows? What I do know is that I was still nice enough to offer a 15% tip even after all of the shitty service provided. I was thinking about stiffing her but thought to myself, "I think she is new, and they've probably thrown her to the wolves." Mind you, we had to let her know that the ticket was wrong. That shouldn't be something on our end to do but we did because we knew something was already wrong to begin with. First impressions are EVERYTHING, baby.  I'll make it known that having a pretty face ain't going to cut it in a face-to-face customer service field. That has to be backed up with a great demeanor, capability, efficiency, eagerness to perform on the job, and always a solid first impression. This young lady needs to be trained more, and I think it's at the fault of the actual restaurant not properly training staff that I'm seeing all of these shit reviews about the service alone. My ass got to experience that instead of the positive side.   I'm extremely disappointed and just hope Bombshells fixes their BS quickly. This restaurant can be more than just the typical chain, especially if it was better ran with its employees. I don't fault the waitress for not knowing better because for all I know--this can be her first serving gig. However, this spot missed the mark highly. Easily, I'm a customer that can bring numerous guests with me, ordering items on tickets of several hundreds of dollars a sitting quite easily. Not going to happen now after all of the mishaps this evening. I'd rather drink bleach.  .5 stars/5 Stars: Absolute abomination. I certainly doubt that I would ever come back to this spot. I would rather serve life in prison in Angola than come back to this spot.

reviews.author: Bradley B.
reviews.description: Good food and service. A little pricey for a wing place, but very good. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Shana J.
reviews.description: This restaurant may have been the worst tasting food I've had all year. I don't know whose idea it was for the fried pickles to be spears but that's a terrible idea. Also the batter that the pickles were fried in was pretty gross. The chicken wings tasted like they were barely seasoned. Drea our server was awesome and had a lot of patience because I know the group I was with was definitely annoying. The bartender was also cool. The drinks snuck up on everyone because at first everybody thought they tasted watered down and then all of a sudden they felt it (lol). Overall we definitely would not go back it just wasn't worth it.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: This place is sooooo damn underwhelming it hurts.  First of all I guess they didn't get the memo that we are in a pandemic since the rent a cops weren't wearing mask or enforcing the rule to   customers coming in and out of the establishment.  They were to worried about flirting with the waitresses.  I get it..they are kind of cute but come on..do your job!  Also there were about 9 of them working last night and only three were wearing their mask correct or even at all.  The bartender had hers around her neck the whole time while breathing directly over your food...smh..very disappointing. The wings themselves were okay but nothing to go back for.  I will be going to a place that the employees know how to actually wear a damn mask.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Place has lost their way. Everything about it has slipped down to poor status. Cleanliness, staff, food everything. Shame too because I used to like it.

reviews.author: Markiesa B.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars I would .I'll start by saying we had to wait 5 minutes for a table remind you this was a Monday night around 950. Got seated and literally waited there for 15 minutes and still no server. I walked down to where the kitchen was, poked my head in and said hey can we get a server for our table. A girl came by afterwards and asked did she(the unknown server) come by yet we said no. Five more minutes went by and my brother had to yell at a server to come over and serve us. She was nice enough to do it considering she wasn't are Initial server. We order all our stuff drinks and food at the same time. Btw the drinks were very weak tasted like juice and syrup. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak which was nothing to brag about. My brother told the server it was my moms birthday so she offered to buy her a shot. When it was bill time my brother asked for the manager to come over to explain why we had to wait so long and to at least cut the bill down for waiting so long. She said the birthday shot was considered the "freebie" and that she talked to the server and that was it. No apology no nothing . I will never visit this place again. They didn't deserve my money or time !

reviews.author: Latoya G.
reviews.description: Had a horrible experience We Order 2 Orleans drinks They were watered down Talked to manager and she said that something was wrong with their mixers Took it off our check  Then order pasta It was dry so we asked for a little more sauce They said they have to charge us  Asked for manager again she showed up with security like we were belligerent Refused to take it off our bill cuz we were not happy with the orders!  She do not handle this situation in a customer service way.  Don't put a manager place that can't make things right! I will be calling corporate but don't expect them to do anything about it Chose a better place for date night Forced us to pay for Something that wasn't cooked right

reviews.author: Phuong L.
reviews.description: Do not come to this place. Poor service and serve you raw chicken wings . Do not come to this place !!

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Literally had the worst experience here on Friday evening. First of all the service was terrible, it took about 30 minutes after we sat down to get someone to take our order. We had to go to the front and ask for a server because no one was attending to us. After that, it took another 15 minutes to get our drinks. After we ordered our food, that took another 30 minutes to come out and when it did come out, my food was missing. The waitress didn't say anything so I figured that they were still making it. Only after 15 more minutes passed by and the waitress finally came back did she ask where my food was to which I responded that I had no idea. She then went back to the kitchen and after about 15 more minutes, my food came out. While everyone was eating, they found that my nephews chicken was raw and we had to bring up that issue as well.   The manager ended up coming out and taking my food and my nephews food off the ticket but it was still a very terrible experience. I wouldn't recommend going here to anyone.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: Awful service first and last time coming here. Waitresses should know how to make the drinks on the menu. I ordered two drinks and they were both bad I didn't bother ordering any food.

reviews.author: Char S.
reviews.description: This is my playground. My Disney Land. My basketball court. My football field... my... my.... home away from home. Idk why but this liquor store is just much more exciting than others lol. When you can't find what you want else where this place has it. So just come here first. Their options are fun to me.

reviews.author: Zachary M.
reviews.description: This posted elsewhere but I bought the final bottle of a new tequila held by the store clerk who was very friendly and I needed up paying cash for a bottle of scotch too. In all Paige was very helpful, thanks. "I'll be back"

reviews.author: Brad S.
reviews.description: I've lived in the area since 2001 and have been going to Moon Dance for my adult beverages for years. If you're looking for hard liquor, take a look a their selections. If you are looking for beer or wine, go somewhere else. They used to have a good stock of specialty, quality beer and wine. For example, they used to have a good selection of micro-brewery beers, but now storied brands like Pabst Blue Ribbon seem to be the taking up most of the shelf space. The quality of wines have slid as well. My last visit there a couple days ago for Rieslings resulted in looking through a selection of less than 10 choices, all of which I was unfamiliar. The recommendations by staff resulted in two bottles ... one of which had lovely hints of chemicals and gasoline (lots of TDN; obviously a late harvest grape that had decomposition of the veins within the grape) ... and the other bottle offered notes of cat pee ... absolutely disgusting cheap, creamy crap. MD 20/20 would be a step up. I'd like to support my local business, but I'm quite done ... no more ... I'll make the trip across town to Total Wine from now on.

reviews.author: teresa t.
reviews.description: 1st I don't drink, but other members of the house do. Very clean, super nice, and always really helpful.   The only bad thing is trying to find a parking spot. They have 1 spot reserve, otherwise your on your own. With a busy heb and restaurant near it, it can be hard to find some place to park

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I usually shop at Spec's. I realize small liquor stores' prices are going to be higher than Spec's, but this is a little ridiculous. The exact same bottle that always costs me $17.29 at Spec's cost me $25.97 here. That's $8.68 more...over 50% higher! How much are you willing to pay for convenience? Since my office is right near a Spec's, I will continue to plan ahead and enjoy the 33% savings. If you are willing to pay the "convenience fee," I will say this store was nice inside (like a Twin Liquors) and the guy at the counter was very friendly. My only complaint is the prices, but that determines where I shop. I'm a frugal person.

reviews.author: Mindy C.
reviews.description: Excellent selection of wine and beer. This isn't a huge chain so while it may be slightly higher in price on some things, the convenience, friendly staff and knowing I'm supporting a local make it totally worth it! If they don't have it, they'll get it for you. Highly recommend

reviews.author: JJ J.
reviews.description: Overpriced. One guy who didn't know what he was doing working by himself on a busy Saturday. Said my card wouldn't go through because it didn't have a chip in it. I took my business to Twin Liquors where my card worked just fine and saved myself some money! I will never shop here again.

reviews.author: Lyra C.
reviews.description: This local wine shop offers a very nice selection of wines, including my favorite Texas wine, and Argentinian Malbecs.  Many Liquors as well. They have a nice array of special gifts, or put together your own.  Linda is there to help with your questions and she's an awesome lady to know.  Always a pleasant experience, they really get to know their clients tastes and preferences.

reviews.author: Charlie M.
reviews.description: Visited this store on Christmas eve to pick up a few drinks.  I have never in my 20 years of living in the RR area been treated so poorly.  I went in, picked up what I wanted and headed to the counter.  Once there I was questioned about a bottle of peach ciroc.  I told the guy I never touch any ciroc, but he insisted I did over and over again.  A few minutes later a few other fellas walked up to the counter and he realized he had made a mistake.  I would have been ok with this if it were not for the way the clerk presented himself and kepting insisting it was me who picked up the bottle.  I was being accused of stealing a bottle of liquor wearing shorts and a pull over sweat shirt.  Where I could of concealed the bottle is a mystery to me.  Once he realized he was wrong he made a weak apology and continued on.  I will never visit this store again!  Just unacceptable...

reviews.author: Lacey B.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of this liquor store. The staff is helpful, I can find what I'm looking for and if I can't the staff can order it special for me. The prices aren't too bad and it is conveniently located near my home and near my neighborhood HEB.

reviews.author: Mike V.
reviews.description: Super nice, and friendly staff. Conveniently located super close to home. (Almost too close) This store has a nice selection of liquor, and a decent beer selection as well. If they don't have it, they'll order it for you. They are a few bucks higher, but worth it.

reviews.author: Jamie I.
reviews.description: This place rocks! Linda and Dave are so helpful and the manager Jake, is the best. So friendly and great advice!

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I walked in about a minute to close. The register shuts down after 9pm so it can't sell illegally. This wonderful cashier not only helped me find exactly what I was looking for, but also ran it to the register for me so I could buy it! This place was amazing!!! I strongly recommend this to everyone!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Always very helpful staff.  Tasting every Friday.  Ask for any type you want and they will try to get it for you.  The one problem is they are EXTREMELY over priced compare to other business in the Round Rock area.

reviews.author: Staci S.
reviews.description: This place has the nicest people and great selections at good prices!  The made some great suggestions and have never been wrong. They make buying booze fun!

reviews.author: JoAnn M.
reviews.description: Best place in Round Rock to get your pizza and/or wings. The food was awesome and customer service was incredible.

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: This place is hands down the best pizza spot in Austin I've been to thus far. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and quick/attentive. I've even had the pleasure of being served by the owners themselves. I always LOVE a good NY style pizza spot, and this is that and beyond. They have Gyros, calzones, wings, and an impressive line of draft beer.  P.S-- try the cannolis, they're bombski.  Thank you guys for being awesome!!!!! See yah soon.

reviews.author: T G.
reviews.description: I ordered two pizzas one being a taco the other being a combination. I was utterly amazed at the quality and taste and overall satisfaction of the service here.  It took 14 minutes from the time I ordered till the time it is ready even though they were very busy!  The quality of this pizza is amazing I was very very surprised they also have other items such as wings and whatnot.  I suggest if you're in the area it's a must have if you're in the mood for pizza.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: I have ordered food a few times from here, alfredo, Caesar salad, cannolis, gyro and my husband wings and a calzone... EVERYTHING is delicious you can't go wrong with anything! I have ordered delivery through Yelp! and never had an issue when I ordered to go for curbside it had an option to text when you are there and it never came out I had to go in to grab it that has been the only issue the few times I had ordered.

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: Pretty good pizza!!  I just got a couple of slices and would definitely go back. The mozzarella sticks are realllly good too!   The sauce has good flavor and it was delivered really fast. Very close to New York pizza but the crust is a little thicker! When it arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to see that it looked 10x better than the pizza in some of the other pictures. I think because my slices were jumbo, that they are a bit thinner than their other pizza (which I love)

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: We ordered pizza and mozzarella sticks from Pizza delight this is a New York-style pizza place. I ordered the Italian Pizza, mozzarella cheese sticks, and the Cherry Cheese Cake. The delivery was very fast and the Pizza was still hot. The Mozzarella cheese sticks were awesome, and of course, we love the cheesecake.

reviews.author: Stephanie Y.
reviews.description: I consider myself sort of a pizza connoisseur and could eat it several times a week. I like to make homemade pizza from time to time as well and always like trying new places. I told my husband I was tired of getting pizza from the same places and wanted something new. This restaurant has almost all good reviews and they tout being voted best pizza in Round Rock. I really don't understand why. We got two kinds of pizza and two appetizers. The pizza was undercooked and you could still see the shredded cheese which was not fully melted. Flavor and quality was not great either. Definitely not legit NY style pizza. The garlic knots have no noticeable taste of garlic due to all the other herbs they put on them. Service was fine, but disappointed based on how many people think this is the best pizza. Based on reading other reviews, I am Expecting a rebuttal from the owner in 3, 2, 1....

reviews.author: joshua r.
reviews.description: The (old) owner Eddie doesn't pay his test shifts  All the food is comes frozen (except the pizza dough)  Food safety is a joke and cross contamination is a huge issue with raw chicken wings all over a small kitchen near prep areas  The wait times are 100% guesswork from the Eddie's wife running the register  But by all means, overpay for mediocre pizza

reviews.author: Nellie J.
reviews.description: Meh.  I guess I need to give them another chance.  Went on a Monday for the first time and was hoping for a beer and some Monday special I'd heard about.  I guess they were busy and their air conditioning was out so I guess Monday specials and beer were out too.  The pizza was good, but I felt it was overpriced.  The wings were okay (not as crispy as I'd like), didn't care for the blue cheese much or warm celery/carrots.

reviews.author: Bijal P.
reviews.description: I wanted to order pizza from a different place and decided to give this place a try.  I ordered on a Friday and they were def busy cause my pizza arrived late.  Once the pizza arrived it was piping hot so hot that when we took one slice of pizza all the toppings started coming off.  So we let it cool down I love the crust I have to say it was very crunchy my kids enjoyed their pizza. The other thing I loved was the sauce yummy very fresh almost like home made.  The only thing I did not like about the philly cheese steak pizza was that it fell apart.  The pizza in general has a good amount of topping and ratio for each slice.  Overall not bad I may try something else next time but my kids pizza was good

reviews.author: Chanel M.
reviews.description: Ordered Pizza Delight via Door Dash last night. It was one of the more lengthier wait times, however, I decided to go with them to try out something new but it was delivered as estimated. I ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and extra cheese which was great. It was delicious. The marinara, pepperoni and cheese were all fresh and tasty.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Pizza Delight is as the name describes- delightful! I love the crust of the New York-style pizza. It is just the right amount of sauce and the lunch pizza and salad is great. I'd highly recommend this place in Round Rock right by HEB Plus. The owner and team are friendly. I'll be back for this affordable and delicious pizza!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: Had a major craving for some good pasta so I Ordered spaghetti with meatballs and instead of receiving actual spaghetti noodles, I received penne pasta.  the pasta had barely enough sauce to have flavor and meatballs seemed to be frozen but heated up. I do not think this dish was actually prepared fresh so that stinks.   They had a great deal for $5 off on DoorDash but most likely will not be ordering from here again unless it's pizza.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was looking for quick pizza takeout and this place did just that. I ordered a $20 specialty bundle that included one large pizza, one large salad, and 6 wings. For $20, I felt that was a great deal. I did feel it was a little pricey to add extra toppings on the pizza. I ordered it from my house which was about 15 minutes away and when I arrived everything was ready to go and bagged up waiting for me. A guy brought it out to my car curbside and made sure I had a mask on, which I appreciated for his health and mine. Everything was still hot when I got home and the pizza and wings were devoured quickly. I ate the chicken caesar salad the next day and it was tasty and fresh as well. Would recommend trying this local pizza shop!

reviews.author: Arlene M.
reviews.description: Food is good here. We've really  enjoyed the lemon pepper wings! Well, service here isn't consistent. One day my spouse and I walked in to dine in there and service was awesome. The polite, welcoming male told us to have a seat and they'd take our order. We came back days later(to dine in)  and the tables were dirty, it wasn't very busy btw. We sat down looked at the menu. 10 minutes pass and no one helped us AT ALL. they didn't talk to us, acknowledge us. So I went up to just order while everyone stood around. I'm not sure what the process is here ?? But they sure as heck weren't going to come to us.  Well, as I ordered I felt so uncomfortable and as if our presence was an inconvience. 2 other times during this SAME week ( separate days) i walked in to order pretty large orders for my kids final days of school. Similar service was given. No one bothers to greet you and one of the workers said he'd help us when he had a chance. Ok sure, yeah we waited. Lol no biggie I guess?   Long story short we enjoyed the food and spent a lot of money here in just one week but eh the service here convinced me not to come back. Good food, inconsistent rude staff simple as that.

reviews.author: Jill P.
reviews.description: I placed a catering order for my son's first birthday. I called and was told I'd be contacted by the owner. Samantha called me back the same day and I was able to place the order with her. My order was finalized with her via email.  I ordered a tray of salad, a tray of ziti, pizzas, wings and fries. On the day of the party, pick up went smoothly. Food was ready on time and they helped my husband bring the food out to the car. Of course the food was delicious and all the hot items were still hot. They even gifted my son a present for his birthday. A very thoughtful touch. Overall a great experience! Pizza Delight will continue to have my business.

reviews.author: Jacque S.
reviews.description: Delish. Our go to pizza place when we don't want to go out. Love the phill steak Meat on the pizza!

reviews.author: Stephen W.
reviews.description: Ordered a pizza from them today and they either dropped it or tossed it at my door like a newspaper. Then when contacted they said they were too busy to replace it and refused to refund me. Well this place has lost all future business from me. Try to help the local pizza place and they obviously don't care about their customers.  Goodbye pizza delight, never again!   Update: I find it amusing that this establishment tries to blame their own internal issues on others instead of taking responsibility for bad customer service (see Pizza  delight comment below) We had no problem contacting the vendor. Let me be clear. It was Pizza Delight that delivered the pizza, not a 3rd party. It was Pizza Delight that refused to replace the Pizza(within a 50.00 order) because they said they were too busy and it was Pizza Delight that refused to provide a refund for the broken Pizza. Any local business that cannot take responsibility for poor customer service, is not the local business I choose to help in these current times. As for 3rd party vendors, it was that vendor that stepped up with a credit to my account since the local establishment refused.

reviews.author: Rick V.
