reviews.description: Great pizza place. We've done pick up and dine in. The staff, including the owner were friendly and attentive. The owner was taking pictures of a new pizza developed by a staff member and offered a couple of big pieces while we waited for our dinner. Very good!

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: I wanted to try a local pizza spot and I really was feeling the pizza. Im glad I did a small pizza it wasn't bad and just right for me. It was pretty tasty and I will recommend it to anybody.. The wings wasn't fried enough for me but the pizza is clearly on point..

name: Shooters Billiards and Sports Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jip Z.
reviews.description: Came in on a Thursday, some aggressive lady with glasses and bun, answers the door with "Do y'all have ID's?" We said yea and showed ours, then she says "So then talk to this dude at the door"... I walk in and there's a table with some merchandise on it and this little man, asked if we were there for the event? I said "we didn't know there was an event" and then he said it was $25 per person... well we didn't know, we just came for a drink and some parents night out. So I said sorry and we excused ourselves and then this same lady at the front was smoking outside so I said "Sorry, we didn't know it was an event" and she snarkily says "Yeah! it's dwarf wrestling!" Like I should be ashamed of not knowing this. I feel stupid, my bad.... But maybe next time have a sign on the door! We read the entire door and no sign about this, a cover of $10-15 we would pay but we didn't want to do $25 per person, since we had not  arrived for the event. I think if you have an event, try being a bit nicer. Some people are not regulars and just want to come over and you could sell it a bit, instead of making us feel bad for not know about your poorly advertised event.  I still like this bar and I like that people can smoke in doors (although I'm not a smoker) we have enough bars we can go too and this one is for smokers, so I don't have an issue and I know what I'll smell like when I leave.

reviews.author: Connor A.
reviews.description: Don't expect covid protections here. It's a no frills pool hall in Texas. Nobody in the establishment is wearing a mask, including the bartenders and waiters. If that's not a problem for you, then you're in for a good time.   We came in on a Tuesday night and easily found a pool table to ourselves. We opened a tab and had no trouble getting drinks without having to leave our games. The mixed drinks are nothing to write home about, but we had an excellent time drinking and playing pool. We also easily played some table shuffle board. They have computer slots/keno games to gamble with in a shady corner is that's something you're into.   The place was acceptably clean and the staff were all very friendly. Just make sure you have a VALID drivers license regardless of your age! This was place was a good time and I'll definitely be back again in the future.

reviews.author: Kris R.
reviews.description: The music was great, the service was pretty good, I was kind of a put off and that's the reason I wrote this two star review is because of the BS of smoking indoors at this place. When I got home everything smelled like cigarettes. This is completely illegal and just downright nasty. Everybody knows secondhand cigarette smoke is really bad for you so open up a flipping window if you're gonna let people smoke. If you're too lazy to go outdoors to smoke then this place should be regulated by the health department better, this isn't your house, and no one saying you can't do something but it's just nasty and it's really bad for your health right now my throat is on fire because I've been breathing secondhand smoke I don't wanna sound like a whiner or entitled millennial but it secondhand smoke dude and it's nasty.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: Shooters been a great home for me for 14 years, it has been like my Cheers bar, after a stressful day of work, on my way home I stop in, staff is always friendly, I love the entertainment offered, Golden Tee, pool, sweepstakes, karaoke, bands on weekends. Staff has always been good to me over the years, and have been like family, met many current friends because of Shooters. Never a cover, and probably the best drink prices of any bar.  This place has great potential, but they need to make the best of some of its best assets, especially the use that beautiful patio more for events, music, etc. You should have a solo acoustic artist out there in spring/summer/fall and promote some games on the patio, it just seems as it's used as wasted space currently, and that's a shame.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Stopped by with others for a quick pop as we were beered out from Whitestone's delicious Oktoberfest beer. Bartender was patient with us as we pondered our last cocktail of the day. Notice I said day not evening. We settled on shots (why not??!!). We all received generous pours at a reasonable price.   Shooters is a great sports bar with multiple TVS (they do have the NFL ticket). There are plenty of pool tables and games to keep you occupied. I would definitely come here to watch games but the cigarette smoke stench is too much for me, and I'm a cigar smoker. We visited for about 10 minutes and my clothes stunk of smoke. I wish they would go smokeless like their other venue on 620 or at least add some additional smoke eaters. If you are a smoker it is a 5 star joint... for others 3 makes it AOK and a fair rating.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere, friendly bar tenders,  and good drink selections. Monika, Shelby, and the entire staff are the best

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Shooters is the worst bar I've ever been to. Service sucks and the staff was extremely rude and all their glasses were dirty.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Sunday pro football here is the best! $2 zeigenbach and $1.50 cheeseburgers and hotdogs off the grill. Can't beat it! Outdoor seating and smoking inside. Great place to watch football    * they don't have the cheeseburgers and hotdogs outside any longer but still a great place to watch any game you want. Please read reviews and understand it is a smoking bar and if that will make you mad don't come

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Two things about this bar. They allow smoking. Which I could have left, I know. Second, if you keep a tab open they automatically add 20% gratuity to your bill! There was only 2 of us. There's nothing posted about this. We were tipping the bartenders as we ordered. So on top of the $32 in tips we gave, we were forced to pay another $23 on our bill. They should have a notice if you plan on keeping your tab open, a gratuity is automatically added. Even for a party of 2. Ridiculous

reviews.author: Sean G.
reviews.description: Unable to show the Texas longhorn game in the ATX is sad.  Drinks where really good and the pool tables where nice.

reviews.author: John T.
reviews.description: Good pool hall in a good location. It's a bit divey, but the prices make it worth it. If you like to hook up with ugly fat chicks or wrinkly smokers, then this is the spot. The Best Western is walking distance, just in case you drank too much.  I don't know if they still do free pool on Monday nights. That's a good chance to work on your game and save a few bucks. But watch out for scumbags. The meth-heads tend to pour in on this night.  Every now and then there's a few tough guys, but every town has 'em.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Really disappointed at how this place has changed. New GM or manager or whatever has no clue on customer service and taking care of people that come in more times than others. And the waitress was rude to a friend after closing out and said "Have fun with your Slut Pants".... Whatever that means..... Really..... Keep it classy CP!!  Fast Eddie's is the place to go if you don't won't the Jerry Springer drama!!

reviews.author: Steven S.
reviews.description: It's a smelly filthy place.   Ridiculous low end pool tables I wouldn't think about playing on.  Go back in the kitchen and look for yourself how filthy it is.   The entire place smells like a wet old homeless person.

reviews.author: Young K.
reviews.description: This is nice and cool place to hang out with friends and family.. dates..cause live music and play pools..also friendly great services from bars and wait staff..i am enjoying and have a great time on my each visit...thanks for all great services to management!!!

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: We went on a friday night and the place was relatively busy. Drinks were good, but the way under staffed for a friday night. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is for the fact that our waitress was trying soooo hard. She was running drinks, bar backing, cooking food and bartending. Also not to mention she was the only waitress there. But all in all we had a great time!

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out but they have smoking and for me that is a HUGE minus because I believe that such places should keep the environment clean and focused on the pool players.

reviews.author: Manda L.
reviews.description: The bartender, an older gentleman, has been extremely rude on the 3 occasions we have visited this bar.  The bar set up is great, but with rude staff like this why would I want to come back.  Bad service lost you 4 ladies who spend a good amount and tip well....and earned you a bad review.  If your staff is so miserable they cannot give good service, maybe it's time to clean house.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: A-OK place, but be warned you WILL smell like smoke if you come here.  They offer a bar with ample seating, plenty of individual tables for seating, several pool tables, have a stage (that was empty when we visited), have an outdoor patio and an add collection of gambling machines in the back corner.  I am sure it is not real gambling, but the game players certainly looked like they were in Vegas.  Prices are reasonable.  Would not come out of my way to come here, but it is a decent dive bar.

reviews.author: Danny M.
reviews.description: Let me just place some facts here as a ex customer!!   1. Chris is the rudest person there!! He treats everyone really bad and makes you feel like crap! So you go pay to get horrible service from him.   2. If you go gamble be prepared to share the machines with the workers as they are on their shift and serving you drinks as they have their machine on auto play and by that I've only seen one person dong this by the name of Desiree or Mrs Des for short.  Last time I saw her was a few weeks ago when I went after work to enjoy myself for a few drinks and even tho I go alone I do have friends there and she was so occupied playing and asking around if her machine was paying her a lady was complaining about how she hadn't give her her change back. It took her a long time to pay that lady back. It's not the first time I've seen her playing specially when it's slow but busy days won't stop her. Chris and her make a fabulous team as far as proving the worst service!!   3. Misty and the rest of the girls are the best workers there.   Too bad they lost me as a customer and will never spend one cent on that place ever again. Seeing employees playing as they work while others risk their hard worked money was the end of that. I already had enough with Chris being rude when you bother him because it seems that way. Good luck Shooters! This place has gone down hill since the past 6 months or so!!

reviews.author: Amgad E.
reviews.description: this place is terrible. They are racist and horrible. I came here to have a beer and for no reason the bar tender decided I was to leave. I had no problem with leaving as long as he refunded the beer I didn't even take a sip off - except he wouldn't. In fact he called d the cops and lied to them that I was disturbing the peace. I never  been more humiliated and disappointed before... this place is a total trash can for trashy racists

name: Jack and Gingers
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Grace R.
reviews.description: Great happy hour spot with an awesome patio! Huge picnic tables that are great for groups  $12 for a pint of beer and huge pretzel? Sign me up! Service was good, food was good, drinks were good. Didn't try any entrees, but will definitely be back for happy hour!

reviews.author: Jaki T.
reviews.description: Stopped by for dinner as I always love a good Irish Pub.  The beer was good, food was good but the "Irish" was missing. I suppose for a younger crowd who cares nothing about actual Irish ambience , it's a great bar.  But personally I prefer a bit of Irish music as opposed to the rap that was being played .  So In short, it's just another bar, nothing Irish about it other than the decor.

reviews.author: Laure H.
reviews.description: Love their new little picnic tables by the street. It's usually sooo loud inside the bar area/on their patio so this is the happy middle ground and don't have to scream to hear your friend speak.  I've honestly never tried their food because I'm usually not in the mood for dive bar food, but can speak to how great their variety of beers is. My personal favorite is the victory sour monkey.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: I have come here several times and I've never been disappointed. The food is good and the drinks are good. My bartender was Shannon this day, and she was super chill and cool. She made me a the red head drink and I was not disappointed

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for a late lunch today and decided to eat on the patio. When we first arrived the misters were on and felt great. They turned off and it got a little warm.   Our server was part of a family of servers we learned from the youngest server. She was the older sister that helped with our order. She recommended a beer my wider really enjoyed.   Our food was very well prepared and was on point.   My wife was overheating after we ate and we were trying to find our server who seemed to be on a break. We literally waited 15 minutes before going inside to see if we could fine her. It appears like she had 2 tables inside and must of lost track of us outside.   All in all it was a great lunch and we would have loved to give it 5 stars but paying should not be the hardest part of going out to lunch.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: We really enjoy coming here. There's a terrific beer selection, a lot of different seating options, and a fun glass floor.   There are a lot good food choices here.  The pretzel is massive, fish and chips crispy and flaky, and classic burger always cooked to specification.  The fried pickles have a great batter and the Guinness brownie is thick and chewy and comes with creamy ice cream.  Service is generally spot on, and they have done well when I've come in with a group.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Cool Irish bar with ample amount of space to have some drinks, play games or watch games even.   Right from walking in it seems like this place gets really into soccer games, so I'm sure it'll be a hit when Austin FC starts playing.  Their draft selection is solid, even looking at their menu they have a good mix of several types of beers. Thought the bock type was a little funny, they also have sours, tripels, you name it. Got a Mcconaughaze, witty name, good ipa from Twisted X

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Great Sunday funday brunch at Jack and gingers. We enjoyed the sun out on the patio. Had a couple of drinks and split the black bean burger. It was actually really good! Sweet potato fries on the side were great as well! Very tasty!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: I've come to Jack and Gingers on multiple occasions, but JandG is a pass for me. I've tried the food AND drinks, and it's nothing out of the ballpark. Food tastes dry and overcooked (INCLUDING THE PRETZEL). Cocktail ingredients are not portioned correctly, so expect your cocktails to taste different from each other. Drinks can be compared to Dave and Busters, which is a yikes considering this is a pub/bar.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Starting with the positives, the beer selection was really excellent. I absolutely loved the Austin Eastciders cranberry cider, very refreshing and tart. My partner got the Sippin Pretty sour which was also delicious with some hints of guava. There were plenty of options for whatever kind of beer you like.   In terms of the food, that's were the stars got dropped. My shepherds pie was very ordinary, nothing special about it. The potatoes were pretty chunky and it felt pretty heavy with the cheese and sour cream. The salad was airplane quality, just some greens and tomatoes. This was also pretty overpriced even for the Domain, $16 for very average food.  The fish and chips was the superior entree. The fish was ginormous and crispy, albeit pretty greasy. Fries were sitting under the fish which made them go soft pretty quickly. The green beans were pretty crisp but it was so awkward to eat with the low quality plastic utensils. I understand it may be more sanitary to eat with during the pandemic, but they were those small, bendy, cheap utensils you get with takeout which made it pretty difficult to pick up the beans and fish.   Overall, go for the drinks and atmosphere. Plenty of TVs inside and in the patio and friendly servers. Skip the food!

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: I am so surprised I have never reviewed this place once since first coming to JandG's over 5 years ago. Tons of memories here with good friends, sitting outdoors drinking whiskey and smoking cigars, minus the cigars. The irish coffees to the wide selection of beers on tap, you'll never run out of new things to try. They've got a killer happy hour menu, if you catch them at the right time, you might be lucky enough to get the worlds biggest pretzel with cheese/honey mustard dip. It's like $5 and it's worth every cent. I love pretzels and this one ranks right up there at the top.   The outdoor section provides excellent seating for 'people watching', especially during the night when the Domain starts livening up with interesting sorts of people. Love Jack and Ginger's, one of the nicest bars in Austin.

reviews.author: Carter G.
reviews.description: So i left my phone there about a month ago. They confirmed they had it, even asking what the screen saver was, where cracks were, etc. Ok great! I do not live there though. They said they would mail it and I would send shipping. I said okay amazing I will even pay for the hours of the employee and tip etc. Then just crickets. Their phone number doesn't work first, no working voicemail. They respond every few weeks saying "still waiting on tracking" even though they claimed to have mailed it 3 weeks ago. So yea, someone stole it. I spoke with a Candace from their venture group and she assured me it was sent..but, never got it. Crazy. They blocked me from facebook even. Pretty wild.

reviews.author: Karen C.
reviews.description: Totally need more servers!  Felt bad for the only inside bartender manning the whole area.   Food came out ice cold. Very disappointed. First time there.  Im sure would taste better if had been at-least room temperature

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Improvement since was there couple years ago. No real service outside but found room inside at bar. Service from bar was great.and quick. Full Irish breakfast slightly missed the mark....charro beans?...really...no pork and beans. Sausage was OK but looked like Pre cooked with grill marks and reheated. Overall huge improvement...but Charro beans a big. No with breakfast and also with their great fish and chips.

reviews.author: Josh J.
reviews.description: Probably our favorite beer/chillin/sports spot. Quality patio. Wide selection of brews on tap. Their pretzel is one of the best I've had. French onion soup is not good but who really comes to a bar for soup, so that doesn't affect my rating. The rest of their apps are all pretty solid choices. Service is always good and the door man is a chiller.

reviews.author: K J.
reviews.description: We wanted to love this place but it just wasn't in the cards. Dropped by on a Saturday afternoon after TopGolf. It wasn't too busy at all. Waitress was quick and super friendly. But the drinks were basically water and the food was mediocre. Not worth the prices. Bathrooms were tiny but clean. They tried to achieve the Irish pub feeling but it feels more like a cheaper college version.

reviews.author: Pratiksha M.
reviews.description: I don't know what happened to the customer service here. A few night ago I ordered the Guinness brownie to go. Not only did it take nearly 30 minutes for it to be ready (while other patrons who ordered food after me got their food before me) but I finally got my food by the bartender rudely flinging it in front of me on the bar... and then walked away. No "here you are" or anything. In a hope to support a business during this time I would have expected a little courtesy. Let alone when you are operating at less capacity. Yikes, unfortunately next time I will be taking my late night orders from somewhere else.   I did add a star because there was a second bartender who was friendly to other patrons, but I had not interacted with her.

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Love Jack and Ginger's, great beer selection and they have hands down the best Fried Pickles in Austin. They are super dog friendly, and love their large patio space. Their Crispy Chicken Sandwich is also REALLY good. It was our go-to when we lived at the Domain, and stop by now anytime we're there shopping.

reviews.author: Cara C.
reviews.description: Ordered togo Bangers and Mash, so good!! Always wanted to try it but I've never found a nearby place that makes it. The meat was AMAZING and the potatoes were so good

reviews.author: Jeremy E.
reviews.description: I was pretty shocked at how awful one of the bartenders was towards me for absolutely no reason! I mean really... I'm not someone who's trying to play as a victim here. I literally never had an issue with her until I was closing out my tab for the night where she proceeded to ask me what my F**king problem was! ...no joke! I mean completely out of nowhere.   I was so surprised by it that my initial reaction was to say" its probably not the best time to to talk sh*t while I'm filling out the tip section"  She proceeded to tell me how she "doesn't want my tips " and "management would back her up on that! "  The other bartender was great so I didn't feel I should punish her for this woman's actions. I tipped my standard 20%  and left a not so mature message on the recipe. Not my proudest moment.   Funny thing is I still have zero clue why she was upset. Maybe she mistakenly thought I was someone else??  Either way, I'm now conflicted if I should give them another shot as this interaction was completely uncalled for.   NOTE- if the manager or owner cares to look into it, I'm sure you can find the interaction at the very end of the night on your camera system 11/28/2020

name: Mister Tramps
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This time I figured the best way to evaluate them would he to try one of their staples, so I got a burger. Specifically, I got the "Drunken Burger" covered in queso. Their queso has beer in it, hence the name, which I thought made it taste funky. The burger patty was cooked to perfection. The bun was ok, better than some, and at least it was toasted. The pickles on the side also tasted funky but I couldn't tell if that was a sign they're "higher end" or cheaper than standard dill spears. My side of onion rings was the best part of the meal. Portions were huge and service was good.

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: While we were charging our electric car in Austin, we were looking for a place that was close by to eat late at night on Monday. There were not a whole options in the specific area aside from burger joints and a Chili's. I stumbled upon this place on Yelp and I am glad I did. When you first walk in, it is very dark and gives you a dive bar feel, which is totally fine with me. After looking at the food menu, I wanted to try everything. We opted for the pear, fig and Brie pizza and the Ruben pizza. Both were probably some of the best pizzas we had had in a very long time. The bartender and the entire staff were very friendly, in fact a few people checked on us while we were sitting down. $5 doubles were a bonus. This place didn't disappoint.

reviews.author: Shaun C.
reviews.description: Just come here.  Awesome and safe  Food display is professional.  Legit. Taste is equal.  Atmosphere chill Friendly people every day.  Becoming a frequent for me for good reasons

reviews.author: Karissa A.
reviews.description: I love this place (and it's not just because I'm an eagles fan, well, okay, that might be a bit of an exaggeration). First off, their mimosas are fire and I haven't found anywhere in the area who can make them nearly as good! Definitely better than most of the brunch places I go to expecting a killer mimosa.   Their prices are great and the food is pretty good. I dig their queso fries because the queso isn't thick, but I have seen reviews where people aren't the biggest fans. Their sandwiches are good and it's always a good time on sundays.   Everyone there is welcoming, no matter the team they're rooting for. Also, the reason they get five stars is because the service is amazing. They all work together and truly pay attention to the customer.   I advise anyone (eagles fan or not!) to check it out.

reviews.author: Larry B.
reviews.description: me and my wife just came to austin texas yesterday (from the bay area) to run a spartan race. and i must say hands down this bar is amazingly fun  our bar tender dan (his birthday is in 3 days uall buy him a drink. he has a great personality great service and makes great drinks next time we are in austin texas and want a nice great bar to come to we will be here thank you for your service god bless yall

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Last years Super Bowl I almost got fought by a group of regulars because I was on the phone with my mom, who I hadn't seen in years, and left my girlfriend, whom I live with, at the bar (10 feet away). They all started talking mad shit to which I said who the fuck are all you people and then I got kicked out while the dumb bitch regular bar rat that fucks all the bartenders was able to stick around. Even tho I had frequented this joint during the football season with ZERO problems. Clown fucks.

reviews.author: Bruce B.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time to catch a game the other night and was surprised by both the service and the food. The place has very much a sports bar feel and a decent patio. We ordered a few things off the appetizer menu and was satisfied with every bit of it. The bartender Megan was super friendly and attentive, making us feel welcomed and keeping our drinks full. Will most likely be back for the next game if she is working.

reviews.author: Dario C.
reviews.description: Came here for my birthday a couple nights ago and this bars entire staff totally killed it. Welcomed and accommodated our whole party from beginning to end. Great selection of local beers on draft and awesome food. Definitely plan to come back soon. Can't thank the whole staff enough for such a great night. Cheers

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: This is a bar... a true BAR... that happens to have food options, but make no mistake the main thing here is drinks and sports.  However it is a pretty interesting food option... they have some cool pizzas like the one with green chili's on it, or the bacon and pesto, and some other interesting combinations.   We were here for a movie premier... my wife friend was in a 21 min shirt film and this is where it was premiered. It was a cool deal!!  The place has s back room with a projection tv on 3 of the 4 walls. We got have some light food, got a free drink and watched the premier... it was pretty good!  The location is loud, lots of bar people, large outdoor seating area... like I said it is a bar with some interesting food.  Bartenders were fun, quick and on top of their game!   The event was well done.. photo both set out outside, kids dressed up to open doors... it was pretty cool!  Nicely done!!

reviews.author: Raymond C.
reviews.description: Blown away by the quality of the food at Mr. Tramps.  Go there.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: My only regret is not taking advantage of this bar earlier in the football season. Excellent place for Watch parties! (I went to see my boys play the steelers). There is a group of hardcore cowboy fans that meet up on Sundays to watch the game organized by a guy named Dan (he's awesome).  The service was excellent. Room full of rowdy fans and our food/drinks were on point with flavor, price, and the time it took from ordering to receiving the food. Our waiter was great! Didn't catch his name, but he was fantastic.   I'm in love with Mister Tramps.

reviews.author: Don E.
reviews.description: This sports pub is really awesome. First time here and the staff is extremely nice and welcoming. I always get weird about going to new bars but we walked in and the atmosphere is inviting the and staff just makes it that much better. Drinks are priced reasonably and the food was great. I ordered a Brie pizza. Enough for two maybe three people.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: Love the events and bar staff is good too. Interesting characters there. I plan to go to more film meetings there.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Called in advance to make sure that had MLS package.  Drive 30 minutes to find it the dedicated stuffer bar in Austin doesn't have the game but streams it. They can only stream 2 games at once and even though I called before they couldn't do it.  So I still had to pay for a watered down drink that was made wrong and missed my game.    I also question whether or not their streaming is legal feeds for a bar.

reviews.author: Jen A.
reviews.description: The food is good and there's a great selection of beer, but $5 a beer is not going to make me hang out for very long.  I'll go to my regular spot where they have a great selection of $3 craft beer.  The food is priced well here, but not the beer.  I also wish it wasn't so sports bar like with the bad music. This area doesn't have any other bars that I know of, and I live nearby, but I don't like to visit this place much with the expensive beer and annoying music.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places to eat and drink. Amanda and all of the staff are fantastic. TBH was a little worried when the bar was sold. While I deeply miss the old crew, the new one is amazing. Personable, attentive, same quality food (I think the kitchen staff is the same).  Love this place.

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: I've recently started coming here regularly for trivia night with Geeks Who Drink (cue "Hello,... it's me") Anyway, my standard drink is a vodka sour and I was pleased with the cost, quality, and efficiency of the staff. My friends also got lots of drinks and I didn't hear any complaints coming from them so....I think it's safe to say that it lives up to its reputation as a good pub/bar.   The entire location appears to be dedicated to a soccer team, but as a non-watcher, I can't really comment on that other than to say that they play multiple kinds of sports on the many tv screens, and they are always open to requests as well from what I've observed.   The staff is absolutely lovely and very good about checking in with you, getting orders correct, and being extra friendly. (Don't forget to tip your waitress/waiter!)   I've only ever been for the trivia, but I know they also offer stand-up and I'm sure they offer more on other nights of the week. Anyways, this is a cool place and I will definitely be a frequent attendee!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: Dear Mister Tramps,   You are so cool!  I love you!  You have all the things I love in life!  You make me happy on a cloudy day.  You are the sunshine on the northside.  You serve me drinks that are perfectly made.  You have delicious bar food.  You make my world whole by giving me free pizza with my pitcher of beer.  You absolutely know the way to my heart.  Nope it's not the beer, liquor or shots ... it's all about the pizza!   You are the perfect way to end a day.  You are lovely on the inside and out.  You will continue to be my northside stop!   Love always,   Amanda S.

reviews.author: Ryn B.
reviews.description: I don't know that I'd choose to come here if trivia wasn't held here, but there is something charming about it. It's right off 183 in the middle of an Asian food strip mall paradise. It is somehow Coors Light good old boy divey without being gross - the staff and most of the clientele are Young People and friendly. It's a notch above your typical sports bar.   Why they choose to have a whole menu of spectacularly mediocre bar food (yeah some soups and salads, although you're better off ordering a burger) is beyond me. They have fish and chips - lots of breading, fish cooked well, soggy fries; a melty chocolate brownie (that was frozen before); thin pizzas laden with a shitload of toppings. It's not really that good. I almost made this review three stars just because of the food. Please note they also have "Italian Style Lasagna" on their menu and I am so perplexed; are there other kinds?  So, in close, go for the drinks and the atmosphere; it's all neon and cheap. There are TVs. There's also a good amount of indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: I'm not too sure about the "café" part; however, Mister Tramps is certainly a great place to watch sports (TVs everywhere, including the front outdoor patio where the smokers congregate AND even one in the lady's room!). They do offer some pretty decent standard bar fare: wings (they state they're "oven roasted, never fried" and I am totally perplexed at how they get that outer crispy goodness), burgers (not huge but good), pizza (especially after midnight - see tip below) would be in my top three. This dive-ish joint also has some of the friendliest staff around and a great beer selection with awesome prices - including some local craft selections: Infamous, Stash, Thirsty Goat and more - over a dozen different selections of craft on tap at any given time, plus all of their bottle selections and other libations. There is always a shot special board, so be sure to check that out if it's your thang.  And, if you Bleed Blue like me, you will be thrilled to know this is Cowboys country y'all!!! How 'bout them Cowboys?! Fans gather by the masses to Mister Tramps on game day...there's even an entire large viewing room with three HUGE projection screens that is curtained off by what else but Dallas Cowboys curtains (they support other teams as well; maybe more than one set of curtains?). If you want to partake in the fandemonium get there early to procure a seat at one of the many communal tables.    Overall: Yay, I'm a fan...I'll be divin' in again real soon! ;) Cheers!  Tip: Order a pitcher of beer after midnight and you can buy a pizza for a buck - yup, one dolla! Full menu available every day until 2am.

name: Lavaca Street Bar At Rock Rose
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Ate here awhile back but forgot to leave a review. The food here is decent. Giving it 4 stars since it can be a good venue to watch sports at and it is a nice venue overall.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Beers a little pricey but bartenders super nice. Fly rite popup is a nice addition, and seating is plentiful.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: No bad experience just wasn't impressed by the grunginess and casualness of the bartenders. The beers were also pricey for Austin and considering the place isn't anything special. I got boneless wings at Flyrite inside. It was fine.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: For flyrite only:  We stopped in here when they first converted over to fly rite and ordered the chicken quesadilla, buffalo chicken sandwich, kale slaw and tots. In my opinion the best things were the tots and the quesadilla. The quesadilla had A LOT of veggies, more than it had chicken. The kale slaw didn't have much flavor and the sandwich was average.   Overall, it is a little pricey for the quality and with so many options nearby, we probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: LAVACA STREET BAR YOU OFFICIALLY RUINED YOUR PLACE. The real reason we even came here was for the fantastic poboys, seafood sandwiches. We haven't been to your place in a while due to the pandemic. We walk in excited and salivating and walked out disgusted to learn it was like Fly chicken or something like that. Seriously? You had a perfect blend of affordable high-end food and now,,,, wow you offer such exiting fare as chicken sandwiches?! How is this something anyone looks forward to? Such typical bar food.  I told all my neighbors this and they were shocked. GET BACK THE OLD RESTAURANT. Guys, *that's what made you special and memorable. Your bar isn't that exciting or enticing without it.. think about your Rock Rose Street competition. We were sooo sad to see these food items go. I hate to say it, but we will NEVER be back. Why did you ruin a good thing?!?

reviews.author: Preston W.
reviews.description: I was visiting from out of town and stopped in with a friend of mine today. The bartender seemed annoyed with us because we were taking her away from her friends on the other side of the bar. I had to call her to come over after our one drink to close my tab. We would have stayed for more drinks but she wasn't in the least bit friendly. There are too many other places to choose from in this area. Save yourself the trouble

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After a long day walking around the Domain our last stop was to find a place to relax and have a drink before returning home so selected Lavaca Street Bar. From the outside it looked like a sports bar and it was. When you enter you can order food from a full menu of mostly seafood cuisine. We just skipped this and headed straight to the bar where located right in the middle of this establishment.  This place has lots of flat screens showing a wide variety of sports entertainment. The beer choices was excellent and enjoyed the one I had. Staff were nice and tended to our needs very well.  Fun atmosphere where there was an adult birthday party going on here. Another nice design is very open to the outside even if sitting inside unless way in the back. We enjoyed it and next time pick something off the menu.

reviews.author: Patrick P.
reviews.description: Stopped in here Sunday when visiting friends and walked around Domain for a bit. We decided to eat lunch and find a place that had some of the NFL games on. We ordered food through fly rite chicken, and I ordered a Bloody Mary from the bar. Pretty tasty food, Bloody Mary was tasty and enjoyed that on a warmer afternoon.   Lots of cool places to visit around this area. I suggest trying the Buffalo chicken sandwich with a side of tater tots.

reviews.author: Nathan B.
reviews.description: March 9th we walked in and zero safely protocols. Bartender not wearing a mask and not able to answer why she wasn't wearing one.  What a joke

reviews.author: Leland J.
reviews.description: Pay cash bar tender is thief and management sides with the crook.  Told me I had 10 drinks like I'm some super human now all of a sudden. If I did then they don't pour drink worth a $ht. Sad but pay cash everywhere thieves are scamming and trying to get an edge especially when u start a tab at some places.

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: Just reviewing the vibe bc we left in search of seafood. cool place with plenty of patio seating on busy rock rose, but we were bummed that they have done away with their variety of oysters.  We specifically went down there to get oysters bc we heard that they were full of flavor. Not sure if the limited menu is just during COVID or if it is to stay.

reviews.author: Casey L.
reviews.description: AVOID THIS PLACE AND DO NOT ORDER FOOD HERE! I came here expecting a restaurant, but it turns out that they added a food truck to avoid the COVID shutdown. Almost an hour and a half wait (88 minutes!!) for a set of wings and a sandwich, and it came out cold. Not worth the $20. The best part? When I asked the Lavaca Street Bar folks about how much longer it would be, they said that it wasn't their problem and offered no help. I also tried to go to the food truck, but there's no one at the window to help (you have to order through an app)!!   The beer was fine.

reviews.author: LaRon E.
reviews.description: As elite yelper I have to keep it 100% so let me start by saying that the spot itself is on point, alot of people friendly staff and the environment was relaxing....  Now my reason fornthe 3 stars is because of the food. I ordered the 12 oz Ribeye medium rare but it came out well done and the red beans and rice was drowned in grease.. Other than that I would come back and chill..

reviews.author: Carla C.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service! Great drinks!!!!!! Wings were awesome .  I can't say enough about the customer service it's really top notch

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: Was in the mood for a late night meal and decided to hit the Domain for Lavaca's 30th Anniversary Party to grab a bite to eat. An absolutely phenomenal decision as the food was delicious! Neither of us ordered drinks (I was a little disappointed - didn't see any special anniversary drinks available!) but the food was great.   There are several locations for Lavaca Street Bar, but we visited this one because it's closest to my house. As it is also a bar, you will need to bring along an ID because they do card to enter. This location, as with the others, features both indoor and outdoor seating. We opted for a closet table because I'm on crutches so mobility and accessibility were a main focus. Be advised, you order at the front and they will bring your food to you, but you cannot order anything from your table. Instead, when you place the order they give you a numbered placard to place on the table of your choice.   In perusing through the menu, there were several items that caught my eye, but when I went up to order I noticed a special on blacked tuna tacos for the month...of course this was what I ended up selecting based on the recommendation of the cashier. WOW! My tacos arrived to the table deconstructed as they do not have any suitable corn (gluten free!) tortillas so I couldn't actually eat them as tacos. (This was not the hill I wanted to die on with my celiac disease) It was a beautiful display and they were delivered by the nicest man (super friendly, very accommodating, etc.) but I was quite disappointed that I was unable to enjoy them as tacos because of the tortilla situation.   Despite my disappointment in this....they were amazing!!! The seasoning/rub used to blacken the tuna was probably the best I've ever had and I absolutely have to try it on other meats as well. My friend ordered the chicken quesadillas and also loved it, but I think mine was better.    We came at a pretty busy time (I mean there was a party going on for goodness sake!) and our food was still on the table in the blink of an eye. I will say that this isn't the place to go if you expect to be waited on hand and foot, because this is not that type of establishment, but the service was stellar and entirely met my expectations.   The only reason I'm unable to give a 5 star is because I was unable to enjoy my meal as it was intended and I honestly can't believe they didn't have corn tortillas I could use instead. They did get creative in deconstructing it a d it was still beautiful and delicious, but I really wanted those tacos and I'm sure the tortilla would have changed the flavor as well. Hopefully next time they'll have something suitable as I definitely intend for there to be a next time!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Great staff. Cute environment. Plenty of choices for everyone.  I attached photos: Shrimp tacos, rockafeller oysters and shrimp and grits

reviews.author: Alanna J.
reviews.description: FOR FLYRITE    I usually visit the location on 7th street bc my bf is obsessed with this place. We went to the location at the domain bc it's closer to his place and it was probably one of the worst meals I've had in a long time. I already took a risk going to the domain which is like a scene from Mad Max as it is (no one wears a mask and acts like they don't know what 6ft apart means)  We decided to redeem our free sandwich promo from the app. Both our meals were incorrect and the tater tots were soggy. No, it wasn't from waiting to get home. I snuck one out of the bag at the restaurant when my bf wasn't looking and already knew dinner was going to be a no go for me. But I gave it chance. I had a long day and waited to eat until I could have a nice dinner with my lovely partner. After a hangry drive home I popped open my little box of incorrect disappointment and was instantly sad that my food was wrong. I powered through about two bites to find a long overly dyed hair in my chicken sandwich :(. I was tired and ready to end my night that I just pounded down my tots which later gave me a stomach ache.   I felt a call to rectify my order was unwarranted since it was a free sandwich and I still wouldn't eat there again anyway. My bf loves this place and it's a shame that we won't share that experience again. Oh well, onto finding the next chicken sandwich.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: The food is delicious! However is super overpriced. We got a steak poboy, ceviche, and dozen Rockefeller oysters and it was well over $70 with tip... we haven't even ordered drinks yet which is a separate process. Bartenders are usually slow and talkative to people they know and who seem to also work there. The place itself is open, has tons of tvs, and dog friendly which is why we've continued to come back. I just wish we got better service for the prices we're paying.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: Y'all!!!! This is honestly my favorite place in all of Austin!! Everything I have tried is incredible, but my absolute favorite is the ribeye nachos and cajun fried corn. The ribeye is charred just right and the nachos are covered with a layer of black beans and cheese that just speaks to the heart. Instant fulfillment! The dirty rice is amazing as is the fried porkchops - and I am from the south so I know my fried y'all!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: I am a huge fan of Lavaca Street Bar food! However, I write this with the caveat that both times that I have eaten here I may or may not have been in a complete sober state of mind.  What I love are the HUGE portions! After a night (or day) of drinking, this place will satisfy! On our most recent outing, I got their chicken fried chicken special. It was definitely the best value on the menu. For $16, I got a huge piece of chicken, fries, side salad, and a side of gumbo. I was very happy. My friend spent $16 on boneless wings and all that he got was a pound of boneless wings. Probably equally filling, but I'm a girl who likes variety and they get you because to order a "side" of fries, which they claim is 1 lb of fries, costs $8. My husband got the shrimp po-boy, which also looked amazing and is big enough to share.  The downside is definitely the prices. Because normally their food doesn't come with sides, you'll pay $16 for an entree and then another $10+ for sides. I highly recommend taking a more family style approach when eating here so you can try a variety of foods without breaking the bank because honestly, their portions are very gigantic.

name: Jack Allen's Kitchen Anderson Lane
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: We were hoping for the most amazing brunch buffet in the city today, but due to Covid concerns, they have taken the responsible approach to temporarily put it on hold. In the meantime, the full menu is offered. Nonetheless, we were attended to by Alfonso whom we discovered was as knowledgeable about the menu and beverages as he is passionate about the company. Their version of pimiento cheese is phenomenal. My fried pork chop was incredibly juicy, and Edwyn's salad was well thought out.  The new GM Josh stopped by to make sure everything was as it was supposed to be, which they certainly were. In a nutshell, this is an absolutely amazing place.

reviews.author: Royal B.
reviews.description: Atmosphere 4 Cleanliness 4 Service 4 Food 4 Likelihood to return 5 Price/Portion 4 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.2  My first visit to Jack Allen's.  Our work group met for lunch today, there were 8 of us.  Most had not been.  Our server was on point.  Management was in the dining room backing the servers up.  The team worked together to take care of all guests.  The food was generous in portions, outstanding in quality, and delicious in taste.  I had the Fat Jack Burger.  It was perfect.  One of the best burgers I have had since coming to Texas.  It was not dry, prepared med rare, and had great flavor.  The bun was awesome.  Restrooms were spotless and smelled clean.  Good job, thank you.  I will be back.  Support local!!!

reviews.author: Hammond H.
reviews.description: *Update*.....Jack Allen's Kitchen on Anderson Ln is my go to eatery for fresh comfort food. They were doing farm to table before it was a foody phrase. Everything on their menu is excellent! Burgers and fries, fish tacos, salads and chicken fried steak are some of my favorites. These guys get it!!! They don't overthink their food and make the dishes something they're not. I often say, "Simplicity is best served warm with a side of sweet potato fries." If you feel this way, Jack's is for you. In short, they prepare recognizable dishes with fresh ingredients at a good price point. I highly recommend Jack Allen's Kitchen for your next comfort food.culinary excursion. You simply will not find better food for the money anywhere in Central Texas. Run, don't walk, to any of their locations for great food.

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: We had a lovely meal here. The margarita took a while to arrive but was delicious. We shared the Chunky Queso with guacamole. So good. I had the ribeye tacos. An enormous amount of food and tasty. The steak was prepared perfect and was tender and flavorful. We even had pie for dessert. All the food was great. Plenty of places still struggling to have enough servers but our guy tried very hard and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. Look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: We've been coming to Jack Allen's for their heavenly brunch for years now (hello, tomato basil pie!), and I'm beyond remiss to only be reviewing it now, when we're eating "linner" here for the first time! If my husband were a restaurant, he would be Jack Allen's. Classic. Stylish. Cool Cat Texan. 90's grunge rock comfortable. FYI that Jack also feeds Camp Mabry on the regular, so we're both definite fans! You'll never ever go wrong with their boozy Sunday brunch. Period.  But does that culinary wizardry extend to Sunday linner? Why, yes. Yes, it does!   Can I say straightaway that the Slow Braised Beef Barbacoa Enchiladas were slap yo mama yum? If you're in the market for southwestern comfort food, look no further! The slow braised beef was flawless, cheesy goodness! Diet food? No. Excellent food? Yes!  First things first, though! The House-Made Pimento Cheese with Flatbread Cracker amuse bouche was stupid good! If pimento cheese was on your childhood menu, like it absolutely was on mine, you'll find this starter profoundly soul-warming! We bought a mason jar full of the cheese to take home because como no?   The Crispy Chicken Lollipops appetizer was out of this world! Crispy sweet heat and the most tender chicken thighs on earth with a pile of Jack Slaw that we would buy by the pint! This would actually be a perfect entree size for me for next time! I'm filing this away!   The Chicken Fried Pork Chop is straight up Sunday dinner at Mom's! If your mom is a stellar chef, of course, which we all know that they all are, right? The masher and the gravy were a cashmere throw! Ridiculous! Just look at the picture, y'all! You. Will. Not. Be. Disappointed.   The drinks all go without saying! The chemists behind the bar are wicked good! My agave skinny cocktail was on point! I knocked back three. No judgement! Hubby's Moscow Mule was bracing and bright! He knocked back three! No judgement!   The Blondie pie? Best dessert ever! I really don't know what else to say about it! I'm without words, and my husband is currently apoplectic!   By the by, our server, Christian, was the pitch perfect Jack Allen guide! Jack Gilmore is lucky to have him! As were we!   p.s. We picked up the Jack Allen cookbook while we were there. Tomato Basil Pie, we shall bake you!

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: Always a good choice, especially if you have a few people and want a good variety of options. Service is usually great but only lost a star due to the drinks. They are not the best in flavor or strength and lean toward the more expensive side for price. Overall a solid pick for lunch or dinner.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: Absolute bombshell of a place!! Incredibly tasty everything I ordered (got crab stuffed chicken) and chicken nachos for appetizer. Waitstaff was fantastic and super knowledgeable!

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: Wow....I guess I forgot to check in here before because I've been here at least a couple times. It's always fabulous. They have one of the best happy hours in the area with all their appetizers half-price it was very easy but Bring a friend and you're set for life. A lot of options for a little bit of dollars!  Margaritas are fabulous I don't know about the rest but I see a lot of people drinking beer!

reviews.author: Joshua S.
reviews.description: I understand sometimes you have to wait, however, asking a family to wait 1.5 hours when tables and patio are empty seems like a mismanagement of a business.

reviews.author: Kati K.
reviews.description: Always consistently good dining in or taking out! Staff is very professional and friendly.

reviews.author: Kris T.
reviews.description: The food was okay, but nothing outstanding. Not a great sign when the appetizers were the highlight of the meal. We had the Barbacoa Stackers, guacamole, and catfish to start, and all of them were very tasty but not really great for splitting among a large group.  Didn't try dessert, and the drinks weren't bad just a little pricey to me. The entrees were lacking however, I split a plate of Chorizo Stuffed Pork Tenderloin, and Pesto-marinated Crab Stuffed Chicken. Both dishes were fine I guess, but both were light on flavor. There was barely any chorizo or crab in the respective dishes.  Short version, I'd recommend the appetizers, but that's about all.

reviews.author: Carlos R.
reviews.description: Incredible place! The best part about them is their service. Always accurate and never have to ask twice for anything. The food is reasonably priced too.  Definitely coming back!

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: The first time I ate at JAK was for a Sunday brunch buffet, and it was amazing!  Today I came in for happy hour for a light dinner. Happy Hour is a steal! Monday-Friday 3-7PM *Featuring 1/2 priced appetizers and $1 off all drinks.  BARBACOA STACKERS $9.99- [barbacoa, refried black beans, jack cheese, JAK slaw, cotija cheese]  Comes w/ 3 stackers (basically large nachos), and it was a small meal for me. Good but I expected a bit more flavor. I would get it again though for $5!

reviews.author: Mara M.
reviews.description: I like Jack Allen's. I didn't always, but I've come around.  First, I love the atmosphere. It's a fun place to be, but feels classier than a Chili's. The service is always good. The food is consistently good as well.  My only -1 is the food tends to be a little bland imo. Still good, just missing a kick, if that makes any sense. I've had many things off the menu now, chicken fried chicken, enchiladas, pasta, appetizers, etc. They're all good, but never my favorite. In fact part of the reason I've tried so many things is I'm looking for that ONE thing that makes me say "let's go to Jack Allen's for dinner." But again, the food is good. I wouldn't hate on someone if they suggested we come here for dinner.

reviews.author: Nan S.
reviews.description: Amazing food and service!!!! Great people make all the difference- Biff made our experience beyond expectations!!!! Cannot say enough good things about Biff and the food! We will be making this part of our regular family outings.

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: Good as always. Wish more places strived for this level.nice work. All the food was very good, no mistakes on service either. Price is a bargain for this level of food. I'm always getting charged a lot for so much less all over town.  You don't always get what you pay for.  This is one of those very few places that has tons of integrity.  Thank you JAK and everyone there to make great things.

reviews.author: Jeremy W.
reviews.description: Jack Allen's Kitchen...  TREAT YOSELF. Day or night. Cold or warm. Rain or shine. Jack Allen's delivers. Boyfriend took me out to dinner on a Friday night. We did have reservations so we were promptly seated in Phoebe's section. Phoebe is an awesome Lead Waitress. She was bubbly, fresh, and friendly from the start. She was ready to answer any questions we may have had. Being and avid yelper, I had already skinmed that menu on the app from the passenger seat. We ordered the seafood crab dip as an appetizer. It left us wanting more.. the Ruby Trout I had was absolutely marvelous. The glaze, the light but complimentary seasonings are out of this world. Okay I'm blending my experiences because the food is that good.The 13 spice Blackened chicken pasta was OMG.. the pasta.. made FRESH in house, you could taste the freshness. I don't remember the last time I had such fresh pasta. The seasonings on the blackened chicken was good enough to have me slap everyone's mama. The julienne serranos as a nice presentation an the hot sauce recommendations from Phoebe didn't go unnoticed either. Can you tell I'm pleased? NEW FAVE.

reviews.author: Kathy Z.
reviews.description: I've placed several curbside orders of the past year and I haven't been disappointed yet. Recently, my family and I dined on their covered patio area and we all enjoyed our food. I'm a big fan of their buttermilk fried chicken salad and their chicken fried chicken plate. Their portions are generous and priced accordingly. I also enjoy their cocktails, especially the Moscow mule. It's easy to place an order online for curbside, and parking is plentiful if you decide to dine-in. I've brought several out of town guests here, and even the pickiest of eaters has left satisfied.

reviews.author: Pete C.
reviews.description: Great Food  and good bartender.    HIghly recommend the Buttermilk fried chicken salad.

reviews.author: Skyler L.
reviews.description: Had a reservation so got to enjoy a booth. They started us off with a free little sample of the pimento cheese and crackers which was a nice touch. The drinks were very good, the green chile Queso and cheeseburger were delicious, the pork tacos were just ok by comparison but all in all a great meal.

reviews.author: matt p.
reviews.description: Good for a lite lunch, nice atmosphere - nice people helping us with our order. Good selection of brew, sandwiches are a nice change and soup was perfect for a cold day.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: With new management comes change  and reviews can change too, so the old sign that seemed a little pisdy towards dogs is gone.  I forgot pics, bit there's a dedicated dog area, not just at the seating just outside the front door but also across the parking lot with lots of shade, picnic tables, and a water station.  Our server, Luis, made our experience the best as he was willing to serve us across the way under the trees since things were slow.  His recommendation for salad dressing was cool too as we mixed 2 on our Southwest salad and that was awesome (cilantro and chipotle I think).  All in all, the pizza was good, and there is a dedicated brunch menu, which was unexpected as well.  We'll be back another time to try more things beyond pizza and to take pics.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Best place in town for a date with your pup!  The patio is cozy and the great oak embraces you as you gaze over the Austin skyline.  The Zilker Love pizza had become its own food group in our home, and there are many vegetarian delights to delight, as well as craft beer and a fabulous brunch! The staff is thoughtful and diners tend to be very pleasant as well!  If you see Miss Sophia while visiting, please drop by and say hello!

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood spot with a lot of outdoor dining.  New expanded seating area with picnic tables.  Great for groups or families (dogs included).  Burgers, salads, pizzas.  Interesting options.  Nothing will blow you away.  But all thoughtfully out together and tasty.  Wide range of beers on tap.  Decent cocktail selection.  Limited wine.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Austin Terrier is a low-key restaurant hidden in the hills-ish. Plenty of unique pizzas and burgers, Austin Terrier focuses on new American taste, mixed with the old.   Vegans rejoice, as there is a pizza and burger for you. The Greenbelt Pizza (sub for vegan cheese) and the Impossible Burger are going to be your go-tos. What makes the Greenbelt Pizza great is the truffle oil, the fresh and plentiful arugula, topped with red onions and mushrooms.  Add the Trio of Fries (sub the truffle parm fries), and you have a perfect meal for two.

reviews.author: Vinnie R.
reviews.description: Just moved into town, and definitely found a Gem! Had The Diablo burger with Truffle fries!!! I definitely won the clean plate award, everything was delicious  great lunch on the patio with my best  friend  Joe, service was perfect as well Thank you Danny and Kat we'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This was such a cool little gem!  We sat outside on the patio under the tree and it was a great time.  The waiter was super friendly and helpful. I had a pretty delicious sandwich with Brie and apples, and my boyfriend had a pizza.  The crust on the pizza was perfect and probably one of the best crusts I've had on a pizza in a long time.  My sandwich was just okay....I definitely ordered wrong.  I would love to go back and try some of their other menu items and enjoy a beverage from their extensive menu.

reviews.author: Vivien K.
reviews.description: Tory was fantastic. The restaurant was packed and she was a one woman show. Not only did she give us great recommendations but also dealt with a ridiculously demanding Karen/ Kevin with grace. We will DEFINITELY be coming back for the great food and impeccable service.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Nice and chill spot. Very clean, great draft beer selection and the bar staff are awesome and attentive.

reviews.author: Jane P.
reviews.description: I'm so grateful for this family friendly spot. It's gluten free and dairy free options were always a selling point for me. Our go to's are the Diablo burger (spicy) and green belt pizza (delicious) ... swap the cheese for goat and request both to be gluten free. PLUS they were quick to accommodate for my child's allergies. The server went to the back and snapped a photo of what goes into their crust/bun so that we didn't expose her to any tree nuts. We love this place so much!

reviews.author: Whitney R.
reviews.description: I live in south Austin and this place is more north so I hadn't been. Went last night with my doggo to meet a friend with her doggo, and we had the funnest and best waiter named Chad! I got the chipotle chicken sandwich and it was phenomenal. We also got a platter of 3 diff kinds of fries that were accidentally ordered for us and he told us to keep them lol. Then he covered our drinks for us because of a long wait time that wasn't even a long wait time! The dogs all played and got treats and tons of love from the staff. My enormous Bulldog couldn't get back into my car at the end because he was tired and my fiancé wasn't there to help me so Chad helped me lift him into my car lol. Anyways this place is awesome! 5/5 recommend!

reviews.author: Lou K.
reviews.description: This is slowly becoming my go-to lunch spot. The salad and sandwich combo is spot on. Add in a nice patio and it is a win.

reviews.author: Ari R.
reviews.description: A touch pricey for what you get, but the food is good, and the staff is consistently friendly. It's a nice little restaurant that really leans into the hipster vibe. Lots of beer, the TVs aren't loud, and cute Terrier art is on the walls. Dogs are welcome in the outside seating area.  There are a few vegetarian options, and I'm pretty sure they can be made vegan.  After coming here several times, I have to suggest ordering the Trio of Fries. Three different seasonings and three sauces let's you try a variety of flavors and fill up on carbs. That's absolutely my jam. It's great for sharing with 2-3 more people and gotta really well with a sandwich. The Toro is pretty good. It tastes fresh and is really satisfying.

reviews.author: Laurie P.
reviews.description: It was cold, rainy, we were hangry and in a rush.  We chose this place solely on location.  We walked in and were unimpressed.  But we really had no choice.    The menu had some fun interesting choices.  The waiter was friendly and accommodating.  We ordered and boy were we surprised.  We LOVED every bite.  This was 3 days ago and my daughter is asking for us to go back as the pizza was SO good.    My turkey burger was full of flavor thanks to the grilled apples and brie - hint - sub out the pesto mayo and bacon for garlic mayo and avocado.  Gadzooks my mouth is watering at the thought.   My husband's burger was perfectly cooked.  Bacon and fried egg on a burger? Yes please!  A 5 star win for all of us.  We will see you again soon Austin Terrier folks, thank you!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Went for brunch and took my dogs. Of course, one of my dogs is a Boston terrier so we had to go to this Boston terrier themed restaurant. We sat outside on a cool February Saturday. They had heaters, but not enough to keep us warm.  We still enjoyed our food and our dogs enjoyed the free treats.  The table started with the  trio of fries. The sweet potato fries were the best of the three.  I had the zilker pizza with the wheat crust. It wasn't crispy, but it was tasty. The crust was pretty flavorful too. The pizza was big enough to share with one other person and we even had a slice left over.  Parking was easy and the service was good.

reviews.author: X Y.
reviews.description: We had to wait for a half hour to get a menu which the server had promised immediately. Then, after another hour one of the sandwiches we had ordered had not arrived. The server had simply forgotten about it. This is no way to run a business.

reviews.author: Kevin V.
reviews.description: I was craving a high quality burger one day during the Coronavirus quarantine and had been wanting to try Austin Terrier for years.  Especially since it's right down the street.  So i ordered a Diablo Burger which was soooo good.  My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey at $11 (since it doesn't include fries), but i will definitely order more from there as a treat!  Btw, if the online ordering isn't working, just call them and they'll take your payment over the phone so you can do a contactless pickup.

reviews.author: Krunal J.
reviews.description: Austin Terrier is a great local restaurant that serves variety of food. It has good amount of vegetarian choices, salads as well as Trio fries are awesome. The service is quick and they full on follow COVID rules and restrictions which makes customer feel safe and it's appreciated. I am big fan of supporting local business and this tops my list. Thanks Austin Terrier for serving such amazing food to our community.

reviews.author: Vanessa Z.
reviews.description: This place has become one of our go-to places in Austin! The first time we came, we brought our pup and loved it. There was a jar of treats that were free for customers to grab; so nice!  The migas was my absolute favorite! The eggs, the beans, the potatoes were all seasoned and cooked to perfection! They also had a wide variety of beer.   Austin Terrier is very relaxed and a good place to catch up with friends.

reviews.author: Larry M.
reviews.description: Went in to a girl just looking at me saying yes. I had to ask for a menu. Then when I said I was ready she walked over to help someone else that was just walking in the door. Then she proceeded to go in the back and get a few drinks then as she made me move out of her way to take the drinks to someone outside I decided y'all don't want nor will ever get my business. Worse first impression ever!

reviews.author: Meday P.
reviews.description: I wish the Asian lady who works here quit, only her that makes me don't want to go back especially for pickup. She mostly at the pickup counter. She's not friendly, never smile and short in words, never say nice things like thank you, have a nice day .....after we made the payment/pickup. She's cold and means! She will ask you to show your order on the phone if match with the bag that you are grabbing but the way she did not so friendly.   Others staff is perfect, they're professional and friendly.   Food is good especially the fish dish. Fries as well. Love the new drinks that they are selling on the fridge. But if you use delivery service it won't taste the same.   3 stars because of that Asian waitress, otherwise 5. If manager or owner read this, please consider this waitress. She doesn't have a service mind!! She should find a new job that fit her style. I used to come here at least once every two weeks also order through DoorDash for pickup and sometime delivery, but I hate to see that waitress, so I might stop all.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Hadn't been to a BJ's in forever, but it was one of the few sit down spots open after 9pm in the area and we were hungry after a long day of work and travel. We had to wait just a couple of minutes because they were getting a big influx of guest - seems like some sort of dance show had just let out. Gary was our server and even though my favorite pasta has been discontinued (RIP blackened chicken pasta) and they were out of my second choice item (turkey burger) Gary had a great attitude and solid recommendations and solutions to keep the night on track. I ended up getting the half rack rib special with a beer that he recommended to pair and of course everyone was more than happy to share my pizooki. Give it a try, nice staff, quick service, solid food and open late.

reviews.author: Chris Lee O.
reviews.description: Keely is the best! I have been doing curbside service for years and she always gets my order right, calls me by my first name --and is super sweet! Thx you Keely for always taking care of my order. She is definitely detail oriented and customer service friendly!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: My son and had dinner here and we were both first timers at this location. We both ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich with extra pickles. I got mine with mustard, his was plain. I had a side of fries which were delicious and he had a side of the grilled honey sriracha brussel sprouts, which are awesome. Service was fair, and our server, Kelly, didn't split the check correctly, minus one star, and more than half the tables were closed despite having shields between them, minus one star. They have a great food and beer menu and we will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: Great customer service, they even sold us for $5 set of glasses with BJ's logo.

reviews.author: Tina A.
reviews.description: Had us wait on a table in a nearly empty restaurant.... But the bar was packed...  It's not about social distancing

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Wow I see a lot of politically motivated ratings here... how sad!  I like this chain and this was my 1st visit to this location.  We were seated after only a few minutes and I appreciated that they had half of the 2-top center section closed to reduce germ-spread!  Server was new but did a pretty great job getting food and drinks out. Bar was a little slow for how many tables were filled... but food was great and dessert was devoured!   I'll definitely be back!  I really wish the yelp app would stop truncating my photo gallery... I can't even get to my photos from this experience to post them!

reviews.author: Royal B.
reviews.description: Atmosphere 4 Cleanliness 4 Service 5 Food Quality 4 Likelihood to return 5 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.4  My first visit to a BJ's Restaurant.  My first restaurant meal since covid-19, in a dining room.  The service was incredible!  Some of the best I have had in ages.  The food quality was fresh, tasty, good portions.  I don't like the fries they use (good quality and hot, I just don't like "that" french fry.)  We may be moving close to this area, so it may be part of our routine out now and then.  Good job!

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: I've eaten here before and really enjoyed the product (all the BJs are really good really) but this location has turned into a joke honestly. We've tried to eat here on three occasions in the past month, every time we walk in, maybe 1 in 4 tables is seated. Then they tell us it's going to be a 1-2 hour wait. I'm all about social distancing and being safe during these times but that's ridiculous. It's either bad management unable to staff the location or just an EXTREME overabundance of social distancing. We gave them two chances and the third time we're done. We'll just go ahead and drive to the next nearest one and get seated sooner. Every single couple/group that came in during the 5 minutes we spent there had the same appalled look on their face when they saw the place practically empty and an hour wait.

reviews.author: Sean L.
reviews.description: BJ's was always one of my favorite restaurants, but not this location.  I ordered a family bundle meal directly from their website.  I got a call from the door dash driver a bit later and he said they had no record of my order.  I texted him a photo of my e-receipt and he showed the manager.  Apparently they didn't have the Shrimp Scampi -Tri-Tip Bundle I ordered at this particular restaurant so the order cancelled automatically and I got no notification from the restaurant.  The Door Dash driver had to cancel my order and he said someone from BJ's would be calling me.  They called and said they could have another bundle with a different item ready and cooked in about 15 minutes.  I said ok. that works.    30 minutes later I get a phone call asking when I was coming to pick up the order? I said I ordered delivery, not pick-up. He said, "you have to order on our website to get delivery."  I told him I did the first time.  He just, "Oh".  So I said, "So you are not going to deliver this?" he said he couldn't.  So I just said refund my money and this is the last time I will be going to this store.    You would think that maybe a manager would have called back to apologize or something, but nothing.  I just hope I get my refund.    Good luck with this store!

reviews.author: Lori H.
reviews.description: We have been here numerous times and have not had any problems.  Our arrival started with their webpage no longer accepting the online waitlist, wish I knew before?!  We arrived and then, found out that they had not taken that down reserve ahead of time option, so I reserved a seat for nothing, still waited about 40 minutes.  By the way, you have to be present to get on the waitlist like any other restaurant in town.  When it was time to be seated there probably 5 empty 2 top tables, and they were seating us next to a large party of 10!  Hello, can we move a few tables down?  So we picked another table and sat.  The host came and asked if we would like to move to a booth once it's cleaned as he pointed to the table, never were moved, and the original hostess that sat us brought our silverware and we assumed we were no longer moving.  Waited 15 minutes for our beer after waiting for our server.  Placed our order at 8:25 and got our food within 15-20 minutes, luckily!  By then, we were starving.  Be patient since all dining is lacking employees.  No pics to show since we woofed down our food!

reviews.author: Fatima A.
reviews.description: My favorite day of the week is tuesday. You may be thinking to yourself, "tuesday?? are you serious?? what could be so great about tuesdays and what does that have to do with Bj's?". Well tuesdays are the best day of the week because pizookies are only $3! The only thing that can make $3 pizookie tuesday better is our wonderful waitress Kyla! Kyla was kind, attentive, and accommodating. You can tell she is an extremely hard worker and earns every cent she makes. If you want to spice up your tuesdays, come to bjs and request kyla as your server.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Got a delivery via Uber eat. The pizza was smaller than a baby bite of pizza. Charged over $45 for  horrible hot Cesar salad and baby bite pizza. Beware.

reviews.author: Rashaka B.
reviews.description: COVID Superspreaders Restaurant  Stopped by to try $10 burger night.  They do NOT adhere to COVID19 guidelines  Waitresses walking around with masks covering their mouths only or only covering their faces when they approach a table.  They were sitting people at tables without being social distance (6 feet apart).  They had to be above the state limit for in-person dining inside.  As I was leaving, there were 30 people in the waiting area with ZERO social distancing.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: I have always had consistently good food and service here. We have eaten here many times, and although I didn't order it tonight, one of my favorites here is the Jambalaya. It is a little hot for my wimpy tastebuds, so I order it with light cayenne. And it comes out just right. We've always had consistently good food and service.
