I suspect some of the more negative reviews may be from those who come during peak hours (which we always avoid).

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: 2pm on a Sunday, and they don't have enough staff to seat people.  Literally half the restaurant is empty, all the tables in the bar are empty, and the hosts are telling the lobby full of people waiting that it's a 45min wait because they don't have waiters for the open areas of the restaurant.  Who ever created a schedule for a weekend afternoon to have this few people working is stupid as hell.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: Can you do less than one star?  We walked in on my BIRTHDAY,  we had a horrible day in Austin with trailer trouble.  Finally got our trailer fixed .  Found the nearest restaurant, BJ's Brewhouse.  The manager refused to serve us because of our appearance.  We are normal people who have been to the lake and had our trailer break down.  Not perfect,  not horrible.  She said we were drunk and would not serve us.?  How does a disheveled appearance equal "drunk"?  There were 5 people in our party.  We left went to Longhorn Steakhouse and had a lovely dinner.  Thank you Trevor.  I will never walk into another BJ's Butthouse EVER!

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Very very bad service, I'm so sad as my family is from Vegas and we spend a pretty penny at BJ's every week in Las Vegas unfortunately we stopped at this BJ's here in Cedar Park Texas and are very unhappy. The service was horrible and the hostess and waitress were very rude and the manager completely ignored everything.

reviews.author: Sarah V.
reviews.description: Just ate here tonight and I am so disappointed. It was just plain bad and there were multiple things incorrect on our meal. Kids pasta came out with no sauce at all. They brought out the alfredo sauce separately when I asked and it was awful, probably straight out of a jar. The croutons in the salad were all burned. Both of the steaks we got were very tough and chewy, although the flavor was not bad on this. The chicken Parmesan had no seasoning. I'm not even exaggerating, I don't think there was anything on it, same with the broccoli that came with it, but the white cheddar mashed potatoes were good. They also brought out another incorrect item, which I wouldn't normally mention because when I pointed it out they did correct it, but I mention it because it just shows more how much of a mess the kitchen is. My server was very friendly and attentive, did not have an issue with service, just quality of food. This meal cost $100 and I'm cringing over it. I wouldn't recommend going and I don't see myself coming back, personally. Which is a bummer because I liked this place! Definitely should have just gone to Longhorn!

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: Called to see what the wait time was on a Friday night and the woman on the line said there's no wait time but it was subject to change. Okay, understandable. My boyfriend (who has a darker skin tone and has dreads as well might I add) and I go in and still, there's no wait time and it was not busy.  The woman at the front says we can sit anywhere near the bar and a server will be right with us. We sit anywhere as she said we could and about 3 servers walk pass by us and we make eye contact with all of them, multiple times, and they still don't serve us and I feel it had to do with our skin tone. Again, it was NOT busy and the servers were tending to all of the other tables but ours. We just got up and left after about 10 minutes of not being acknowledged. Writing this review to give others a heads up that if you have a different skin complexion you may not get served either :) There are much better businesses to support and this establishment is not recommended.

reviews.author: Veggie L.
reviews.description: I live about an hour away from Coffee Shark but every single time I'm in North Austin I'm giddy because I get to go to Coffee Shark. My family has food allergies (celiac disease) and everyone is so kind and informative. The coffee is so smooth and absolutely divine. I actually bought a shirt awhile back because coffee from coffee Shark brings me so much stinking joy! I don't feel this way about any other local coffee shop! So grateful you are a part of Austin and I wish this business ongoing abundant success!!!

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Pretty nice for a hidden coffee shop in a large commercial complex. Would not notice it from the road or walking past unless you know what you're looking for, as it blends in with the rest of the modern building architecture. Not the warmest building from the exterior, but they've done a good job trying to make it welcoming indoors. A variety of seating with one high top table. Most of the seating is 6+ capacity tables, so if you don't like sharing, this is not the place for you to study/sit alone. There is bench window seating, but with two walls of windows I imagine those seats might get warm in the summer. Some outdoor seating as well, for those who prefer that.  I got the grilled cheese and apple sandwich. The flavor combination was well done, but I was a little disappointed by the ratio of filling to bread and felt the sandwich could have been fluffed out a little more in terms of filling. The chips were neither amazing nor terrible; pretty standard fare.   I also got two different hot chocolates. One regular with almond milk, one Mexican hot chocolate with oat milk. Of the two, I'd recommend the first one. Good flavor and nice quantity of whipped cream if you ask for it in a mug. The default seems to be to-go cups, so make sure you're clear if you want to sit and stay a while when ordering. My friend got the Mexican hot chocolate with regular milk and the spices smelled fantastic, but with oat milk they got overwhelmed and it was mostly an oaty flavor.   Welcoming and friendly staff. Would definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I ran into Coffee Shark for a quick pick me up during my lunch break and was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the place is huge. I don't think anyone would ever have trouble finding a seat and it seems like a nice quiet place to work for an afternoon. I appreciated the fact that they had a lot of flavor options. I decided to get a Vanilla Rose Iced Oat Milk Latte and it was so good. The flavor was subtle and it was perfectly brewed. The only reason I knock it down to 4 stars is because it's definitely on the pricier side. I would expect to pay minimum $7 for a latte when you go in. While it may not be an everyday stop, I would still go back for sure.   COVID Precautions: Masks required for employees and customers.

reviews.author: Ace L.
reviews.description: Clean and quiet local coffee stop with a great menu. Coffee's really great but a wait over ten mins for two cups ain't it!

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great little spot with a big menu full of coffee and treats - lots of outdoor seating. Covid precautions are the best I've seen in and around Austin! Check them out!

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: If you're not Indian or white you'll get bad service. Also they shut off reviews on google so there's that. There's better coffee out there.

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went late morning, it wasn't  crowded but for weekday and late morning, there were more people than I expected. We went to this place to try the steampunk coffee as other fellow yelpers have mentioned but I dint see option of steampunk coffee on their menu. There was only oNe person behind the counter for taking order and  making.  We ordered  blueberry scone, cranberry muffin, cappuccino  and house coffee. Muffin was huge, both muffin and scone wasn't  fresh at all, tasted like, when you leave them for couple of day on  top of the counter and take a bite. cappuccino  and coffee was good, service is ok, they  have ample seating. Recommend  cappuccino and cOffee not baked goods though.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Probably one of my worst coffee shops in Austin I've been to. It seemed so promising, but my friends and I ordered three different drinks, and each one was incredibly medicore. The chai latte was almost bland, vanilla latte tasted worse than an instant version I could buy at a grocery store, and even the normal latte lacked flavor.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: I miss pre COVID times because Coffee Shark was a great place to study and have some coffee and a light bite.   Coffee is good, food is even better. Most recently I ordered online - wanted a scone but got a muffin, but no bother, muffin was still good.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: We've come here several times now so we must like it.   I have ordered a breakfast sandwich that's good. There's a pretty well endowed breakfast menu, not huge full breakfasts, like pancakes, but for a coffee shop there's a lot of offerings.  Our coffees are consistent.  It's definitely not my favorite, but it's always good. Consistency is hard, which is why I don't have a favorite coffee shop.   The outdoor area is great bc we always have my kids in tow and sometimes there's another kiddo out there for them to mingle with.   The details: It's an older, white, crowd. The industrial decor is neat, but the chairs are really loud when you move them.  There's plenty of parking. Staff is friendly.   It's always relatively quiet. *the reason i noticed the loud chairs *

reviews.author: Steph R.
reviews.description: Nice spot close by that had really flavorful drinks. We got a flat white and chai latte. I love coffee but I'd honestly would get the chai next time - it was absolutely delightful. We also sampled our fair share of pastries including a blueberry muffin, pumpkin bread, and croissant. The muffin and bread were really moist and delicious, but the croissant was very bready and not a flaky, buttery croissant I was looking forward to. I think they get their pastries from a local bakery so that was cool and I would definitely try out their other pastries. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Judah J.
reviews.description: Coffee is good. I have nothing negative to say about that--just the absolute worst customer service I have ever encountered in a coffee shop to date. The owner, or whoever he was, was so terrified of people I wasn't even sure if I was supposed to be there. Pictures look great, I'm sure the place can be a lot of fun if it weren't for COVID-paranoia. Seriously, I went all over Austin that day and NO ONE was halfway as petrified as this guy.  My brother tried to take a sip of his coffee but was soundly rebuked for exposing his nose and mouth for 10 seconds. I understand we need to be careful, and we were, but if you go to a coffee shop you should at least be permitted to make sure the thing is edible before you leave!! BTW, we wore a mask and were very careful the entire time being there.  Won't be back. There are many other decent coffee stops in Austin.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Quaint little place, convenient if you live or work nearby. Good food, excellent desserts, and consistent coffee brewing skills exist here.  4 stars because while everything is good overall, the nitro cold brew coffee on the other-hand well to honest...sucks! Its just weak cold brewed coffee, it doesn't pack a punch of caffeine like other cafes that offer it on their menu. If you're gonna do something, do it right or do it better!  But great little place. Indoor and outdoor seating. Good lighting inside and fairly quiet environment if you're working out of the office.   The staff is friendly but not super helpful.

reviews.author: Lil P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing and the customer service is stellar except when the new tall thin guy with the backwards cap is working. He overcharges and fails to deliver. Literally....Doesn't make your drink. I've had this happen twice now. Not sure if he's a new manager but each time I walk in and see him, I want to walk out. Today was no different. Even the young kids working there have better customer service than he does. I'm a little peeved he's really screwed with the friendly vibe the others have mastered.

reviews.author: Juliana H.
reviews.description: Such a cute little location. Iced mocha coffee was amazing and the baked goods are great too. Patio is large too and you get a view of the mountains.

reviews.author: Carmen N.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop! Sitting area outside but they gave chairs spread out through the shop. (6 ft+ apart)

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Have been going here since moving to the area last spring. Service is always great and friendly, and enjoy the selection of pastries. Appreciate the COVID-19 mitigation measures in place--super prudent and considerate. It has become my go-to weekend stop for a takeout coffee and pastry.  Hoping to one day perform there (acoustic guitar and sing).

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: I've only been here once but absolutely loved it when I went in. Great beer selection, that's all we went there for, but their menu looks amazing for coffee and small plates. Very relaxing environment saw lots of people there working or just catching up with friends. The staff was incredibly sweet as well. They have a fun little outdoor area with games to play, and a few games inside too. If you're looking for a relaxing getaway with both amazing beer and coffee choices this is the place to go!

reviews.author: Bonnie T.
reviews.description: Occasionally I work nearby and I have always found Coffee Shark convenient any time of day. In the morning I can grab coffee, pastry or even a breakfast taco. For lunch they have a great selection of sandwiches, soups, salads and pizza. They even have bar service as well.  It's always clean and the service is nice. It's a great place to have in the plaza.

reviews.author: Jackie F.
reviews.description: Tried this place for the first time this morning. They have a fancy, space-age way of making coffee here called Steampunk that's fun to watch. They put it in these tubelike, clear canisters, and a science experiment occurs where coffee and water get sucked back and forth and eventually a really smooth coffee comes out. This was my first time trying Cuvée coffee and it was definitely tasty. Looking forward to trying lots of different coffees and teas here. I saw nitro cold brew, Mexi mocha, chai and dirty chai, and a full slate of espressos.  The hubs got a hazelnut frap, which was delicious but probably too sweet for me.   Interior here is modern-industrial-ish (aka hard wooden chairs), so it doesn't have the cozy, comfy vibe I look for in coffee shops. I couldn't envision myself working here for hours on end, but I will definitely stop by en route to other places.  Oh, they have a bar with wine and tap beers too. I saw yard games (giant jenga and cornhole) and I saw that they have trivia night here too (the geeks who drink thing.)

name: North Italia
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: While I'm not much for downtown locations. This is in a great spot!  Love the pizza!  The atmosphere os also very nice and chill for the location. Plenty of space so your not crowded up.  But beware of the windows. Or you'll have allot of people starting at you as you eat the delicious food.

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: Let me say start with how amazing the staff are! We were greeted immediately. Our waiter is a Rockstar! As busy as they were, she came and checked on us frequently.   As you can see in my pictures we ordered a lot, lol. We created our pizza. The pesto was perfect. The crust on the pizza was crispy and soft. Great flavor overall.  I ordered the squid Ink. It was great spice and delicious. Only negative was the shrimp and it needed some type of veggie. The shrimp didn't hold flavor well in the dish. I think Argentina shrimp would be a better pick for this dish rather than basic shrimp.  My little one of course with her sweet tooth ordered the glazed Italian donut french toast. It actually was really good. The wild blueberry, honey lemon ricotta, hazelnut and mint combination was actually a really good combination. This dish is super sweet so make sure you have some milk or water to drink.  My other child ordered the breakfast sandwich. She loved it. She really enjoyed the hint of spice it had in it. And my oldest child ordered the Pollo fritto and asked for over easy egg. We also ordered one too so we all could try. Let me say how they cooked the perfect cut of chicken. Normally you order chicken like this and they give you a dark meat cut thigh. Not here! It was a juicy white cut. The crust was perfect! The hash brown balls were yummmmmy! We all enjoyed those.  Overall, great atmosphere, great service, great food! We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: North Italia is such a gem.  The appetizers are amazing (see the bread with ricotta). This bread is such a wonderful portion for two...we had leftovers!   The pizza blew me away. I ordered thinking "eh, that doesn't sound good but I'll branch out" and WOW am I glad I did! The Pig was amazing. I was blown away by the meats! The sausage was incredible (this is coming from someone who HATES sausage on her pizza). The meats had so much flavor. Also, the service was incredible. The first time we came by, the wait after being seated was absolutely insane. We were so hungry! However, the waiter was so attentive to this and gave us a free dessert!   ....which leads me to how good the dessert is here! I am not a caramel fan, and this caramel ice cream was insanely good.   Please come to north italia. Trust me. It's our new fave!

reviews.author: Tom L.
reviews.description: An amazing experience with awesome tasty food. I may not be an Italian food expert but all I tasted was freshness, bold flavors, and great tasting meats.   The charcuterie board has figs, different types of meats such as salami and prosciutto. The char bread is awesome, nice char, mix of oils, and the crunch really helps break up the saltiness from the meats. The white looking sauce is actually cheese spread, I wasn't too much of a fan but it was ok. The best part of the board was the little Italian almonds, soft and firm yet nice crispy shell.   The beef carpaccio is yummy, tasty, and just look at the dish? You eat with your eyes and the dish appeals to your vision. Must try.   The zucchini chips are additive, nice crispy, salty, chips, a bit too oily but it's what is expected, very nice house chips.  The spaghetti and meatball dish is good but I wasn't blown away, I had a better elsewhere. The spaghetti tasted a bit too Al dente, too firm, just missing flavor. I would of spun the spaghetti in olive oil, salt, and black pepper then placed the sauce on top. Sprinkling parmesan cheese helps,

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Can't wait to do a second visit with someone special. I really enjoyed my time along with the flavors of food and kind service providers.   Happy Birthday to my wonderful son!  He loved this place.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this spot :) beware- it does get super crowded and sometimes, a reservation is a great idea! I've had quite a few of their dishes and I've only ever had one thing that I wasn't a huge fan of (strozzapreti). The salmon on pesto farro is amazingggg! And the Prosecco is a favorite of course.

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Wanted an Italian dinner the first night we were in Austin. Found this place about a mile from the hotel and take a chance. Pretty busy but it was Friday night around 6-7pm. Had about a 45 minute wait however we were able to sneak into a table around the bar (first come first serve).  Wife got the chicken parmigiana. Probably the best option on the menu. Crunchy chicken with great sauce and amazing noodles on the side. She also tried the bread as an app. Very crispy and fresh.  I got the Caesar salad because I wanted something lighter. Not bad but it's a salad. Also got the meatballs. Pretty delicious.  Server was very nice and we had a great time. The domain area was very fancy with plenty of shops and stores to roam around in. Worth the visit.

reviews.author: Madi M.
reviews.description: Food is great, service is prompt and location is perfect for hanging out with friends. I really liked their Funghi pizza. Just perfect!

reviews.author: Century S.
reviews.description: A brand name with mediocre food but great service (5*) I'm really not sure how the food ratings for this place is high. I've tried so many Italian restaurants including ones where they make fresh pasta and this place was truly a miss. We had a large table so we had a lot of food to be able to properly judge. Short rib hash had literally 2 pieces of chewy short ribs, deep fried potatoes soaked in oil, etc. overall hardly any taste. Truffle butter had no taste or smell of truffle. Pesto Pasta was good taste wise, but chewy. Veggie pizza was dry. We also ordered banana coffee cake for table. We asked the whip cream on side and the cake came soacked in caramel sauce. Honestly cake would have been good if it wasn't for additional overwhelming sugar added from caramel. Top of the cake was super dry and hard. Zucca chips were good. My friends also had market scramble and Avocado toast that they really liked.

reviews.author: Jaelin M.
reviews.description: Last night i visited North Italia for the first time. It was a decent experience, primarily because the service left quite a bit to be desired. Our server rarely came by, and we actually had to ask for him to remove dishes from the table.   The sicilian margarita was okay, but the ginger blossom marg was absolutely delicious. I ordered the grilled bread, which was also very good but came out borderline cold. For dinner, I had the short rib cavatelli which was quite good.   It was a bit pricey, for the portions - but it was filling. Overall, the food and drinks were enjoyable but the service could've been better.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: THE BIG: Located in the Domain with big seating area indoors and outdoors. Very nice wine selection.  THE BLACK AND WHITE: I came here for lunch with my team from work (since we're located in the Domain). It's nice having a great Italian restaurant closeby to get your pizza cravings in.  The waiter came by and announced the soup of the day (lentil pork soup) as well as the pizza of the day (pepperoni w/ corn). I also had the same reaction when they mentioned corn. So....I had to try it! Fortunately they are able to have half and half pizzas. I chose the Funghi and the pizza of the day.  The Funghi pizza was delicious! Rich and creamy with the white sauce. Corn on pizza on the otherhand...questionable. Love the fusion thoughts though.   THE FINAL BAMBOO: Overall, the damage done for a half/half pizza was around $20 which is not bad. Delicious pizza and I definitely want to come back to try out the pasta!

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: This is a great option for Italian, especially at the Domain.  North has something for everyone, whether you're wanting a more Italian-American red sauce option or a something a bit more authentically Italian.  To add to it, they provide these options with impeccable service and in a beautiful atmosphere.  Today's review of the dining options.  First, the appetizer of crusty bread and olive oil was good.  The sprinkled cheese on top of the bread and the olive oil and balsamic vinegar already applied to the bread were surprises, but not unwelcome ones. (I'm always a fan of a separate plate of olive oil for dipping.)  The Bolognese pasta was exceptionally hearty and meaty and not the usual red meat sauce over spaghetti.  The hearty, rustic, meaty sauce combined with the flat tagliatelli pasta was both sophisticated and satisfying -- and quite possibly my new favorite for dinner as the weather in Central Texas cools. My dining companion also enjoyed her Caesar salad and the margherita pizza.  I tried the pizza and found the ingredients to be high quality.  When you combine the taste and quality of the food with the superb service, it's little wonder that North will merit a return visit soon.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The food and service at North Italia is wonderful. I love that there are multiple seafood options, and that the spicy dishes have some real heat! We like North Italia and the variety of its menu so well, that this is where we ordered our very tiny wedding's meals from. However, the experience of dining in is a little rough - when the dining room is at full capacity (which it is mindbendingly at right now, omicron be damned?) the noise makes conversation difficult. All the surfaces in the restaurant reflect noise, which makes it more than just fun-bustling... it's ear splitting. It's got wonderful food, but don't expect this to be an intimate dinner or a place to quietly chat.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: I traveled to Austin for a work meeting, and the start up to that event was lunch at North. I've never been, and while I'm not a huge fan of dinning outdoors for a variety of reasons that include bugs and heat, the overall experience was lovely - until I was ruthlessly pursued by a bumble bee that appreciated my lemonade as much as I did and then by a fly that wanted it's share of my delicious meats and cheeses. Eventually, my coworkers helped rescue me as I was the only one the bee and fly targeted. While I didn't eat the Zucca chips, it was a favorite at the table. I could have ate the crispy calamari and arugula for days! For the seasonal salad, it had a great flavor, yet I felt the salmon was grilled to perfection. The texture was perfectly paired and was still juicy and flavorful. I can't wait to return to North, although I may opt for an indoor seat.

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: Sometimes it pays to ask for recommendations from your waiter. We did just that and he recommend the Funghi pizza but adding spicy sausage. It was probably one of the best pizza I had in my life.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: North Italia, appropriately or coincidentally located in the northern part of the domain, a spot that's been on my mind but just never got around to it. Glad though this past weekend I had the perfect excuse to go for a friend's birthday. So I thought, italian fusion to celebrate a birthday? Okay I'm in.  Atmosphere: Top notch for the atmosphere here. I will say again the location helps it a lot with a nice patio dining outside and modern vibe on the inside. The location is a perfect spot to people watch and/or enjoy a nice drink or two with friends in a shaded area. The theme overall has a modernized upper casual dinning experience.   Food: My party enjoyed a variety of food, stand outs for sure were any appetizers that have bread included. Cheesey Garlic or Shrimp with bread, you name it, all were so good and sharable too. As for myself as an entree I was caught between the bolognese or short ribs. The server was kind enough to suggest one, so the short ribs will do! Tender with just the right amount of potatoes and veggies made for a great combination of flavors when put all together.  Service: As stated above, our server was beyond friendly. Since it was a birthday our group may of been having too much fun, but the service gladly played along and still made us feel welcome and helped us with any questions.  Overall: With the impeccable service and variety of courses North Italia has to offer, I'd easily recommend it as another spot to take a few friends out and/or to explore some great Italian options. I look forward to return to explore the other pasta-bilities they have especially again the bolognese.

reviews.author: Sarina Z.
reviews.description: Highly recommend placing a reservation as this place is always busy! If not, you can always go shopping while you wait.   Solid Italian food that doesn't disappoint. They have something for everyone - salad, pizza, sandwiches, pasta, and also a big selection of starters, desserts, and drinks. I got the strozzapreti (chicken, roasted mushroom, spinach, toasted pine nut, parmesan cream) and it was delicious. The lunch portion was huge and lasted me 2 meals :)

reviews.author: Cindy W.
reviews.description: North Italia is always a great option for Italian food in Austin, definitely recommend this place! The atmosphere both inside and outside the restaurant is really nice and the staff are very friendly.  My go-to dishes are either the Chicken Pesto pasta (huge portion with a good amount of chicken and plenty of sauce to cover the pasta), the Funghi pizza (super flavorful and unique taste from the mushrooms), or the Cacio e Pepe pizza which is super creamy.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: It food it's amazing! I come here all of the time. Each dish is a wonderful surprise. Definitely worth the wait!

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: Worst thing out of my order the kids spaghetti which did not go over well with the kiddo or myself when tried. Extra sauce was requested and parmesan neither were added on side.   Noodles were chewy thick with absolutely no flavor. I don't blame the kid for not wanting to eat it.  Short rib brunch was wonderful, had to share since both were delivered.

reviews.author: Martina M.
reviews.description: New place in August 2020, Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable.  Table of 7 and not a morsel left on any plate!!  And we tried lots of items and not a bad one in the house!  Drinks are unique and taste yummy. Lots of variety for any tastebud. Everything was SO good!!!  Definitely a return trip in our future.

reviews.author: R C.
reviews.description: MY FAVORITE restaurant in Georgetown! If you come to Georgetown please make it a point to stop in you won't be disappointed! Cocktails are amazing and they're always coming up with some new tasty concoctions!  During the holidays they had eggnog to go, and it was hands down the best eggnog I have ever had!   Everything I have eaten here is a 10 out of 10! We have tried almost everything on the menu and I've enjoyed every dish!  Our favorite appetizer is the brussel sprouts and if you want to splurge get the steak dinner.....WOW!  It could be the best steak I have ever had!  The servers go above and beyond and are always cheerful and accommodating.  The ambiance is super cool and hip from the lounge chairs, to the wall accents, they did a great job designing it! The owners of this restaurant really put in the time and dedication to come up with such a great concept and a great addition to the downtown square. I just can't say enough good things about this place!

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with our bridesmaid party for a lunch break during dress shopping and we had the best time! We ordered a few shareables for the table, including the Cantonese Riblets, Salt and Pepper Calamari and Carne Asada Fries. All three were delicious, but my favorite was hands down the riblets. They slid right off the bone and tasted a lot more authentic than I was initially expecting. The fries were the next runner up because you can never go wrong with fries covered in queso. For lunch, I ordered the Italian Sausage Burger. I really enjoyed it and it came with more waffle fries! I thought I'd love the sausage patty, however, I think I would have enjoyed a different protein to fill it out a little more. It was worth a try though!  The service was great here and everyone was super friendly. Parking can get a little tricky, but there's plenty of spots if you're not going at peak hours. I'm excited to stop by for dinner, when they have a lot more choices! I don't mind shareables, but I felt like the lunch menu was a little limited and nothing really stuck out to me.

reviews.author: Lindsay L.
reviews.description: Really, really disappointing.  My husband and I have two kids 2 and under, so date night isn't the most common thing.  We were excited to get out of the house and try this place!  My husband ordered the fried chicken and it was fine.  I ordered the steak frite and it was somewhere between luke-warm and cold.  Waffle fries are NOT good cold!  I told the waiter and he said he would "warm it up."  ...But he left it at the table!  Then he proceeded to go help like 6 other tables and finally got back to me 15 min later (by now my husband was done with his chicken), and take my steak frite.  It was so confusing.  He said "sorry, I had to go check on other tables - I'll go heat it up now."  He came back with it literally 2 min later and it was EXACTLY the same - I swear, he didn't actually do anything.  I said "ummm...it's still cold." And he said "okay, I'll ask the manager if we can comp it."  WHAT?!?  Then he came back with a check and we paid and left.  I literally never ate!!!  I was so hungry!  I kept expecting him to bring something hot and it just never came!  He completely blew me off and didn't even try to make it right.  I don't care about something being comped or getting a free dessert or whatever, I just want to have dinner with my husband and actually eat (ha!)  when we arrange a babysitter and make it out!!!  We both commented we would have been better off at home cooking ourselves.  It was so bizarre!    Don't bother with this place!  The decor is super contrived - definitely trying to be something it's not.  The wine list is also very short and unimpressive - just a side note if you're looking for a nice glass.  So bummed.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: I've been at this place before and I have to say that their whiskey drinks are above and beyond!  I personally prefer the good old fashion but there is a drink there for everybody's taste and if you're into spicy alcoholic drinks they do some of those just right as well!  While drinking we tried out some of their deviled eggs and I was happily impressed each one of them is for a flavor and unique although the Sriracha was my favorite!  I've had dinner here before and I can say it's worth it but for our trip we just had a couple drinks and sat on the patio which if that's all you're looking to do is completely OK this is a great place to go!!

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: Awesome place to grab some delicious drinks and food! They have both indoor and outdoor patio. Our food came out in a reasonable time and the food was delicious! Really great atmosphere!  Finding parking wasn't hard, but if it's a busy night I can see how parking might be hard to find. We parked on the side street.

reviews.author: Christopher D.
reviews.description: Wow, I want to give this place 5 stars, and I hope they trend up but the food is a 3 star experience - at best.  Ambiance is perfect! Less than a block off the square in downtown Georgetown with plenty of free street parking [when Georgetown starts going to valets, I'm moving.] Lots of people walking around: this is a walking little town.  The place itself has a very expansive outside deck with even a few more street side tables - with the fans and heaters I'm betting you get 9-10 months of outside seating here.  Inside the bar is not large but it is gorgeous and there are some table tops as well as lounge seating - comfy old chairs, some Victorian love seats - its really charming and inviting. You will love the ambiance.  Service was fast, friendly and professional - I dealt with three different mixologists and not a surly one in the bunch [try finding that percentage of happy people in Austin...] and the make a wonderful drink. PS: wines on tap (they're not bad) and you have GOT to try a smoked Old Fashion (try the alder wood - its delicious smokiness in a perfect drink.]  PS: At least two rooms for private parties too if you need that holiday gathering!  Why no five stars then? Sounds great! It is great if you go for friends, drinks and good times. But unless we picked the worst entries - chicken and a burger - the food is underwhelming. My neighbor to one side also said her deviled eggs were just average. To be fair, the food was not bad, but it was not good and does not compare with other places around the square.  So; for drinks and maybe an appetizer and ambiance this has got to be on your short list. Think twice about this as a dining destination though - that may not be your best option.

reviews.author: JP N.
reviews.description: I'll start with what The Golden Rule (TGR) got right.  The service was awesome.  Our server was very efficient and personable with great attention to detail.    The food arrived quickly and was good.    The seasoning on the waffle fries was something new.  It reminded me of Old Bay, but with a hint of brown sugar?  It actually worked well.  What needs to improve - I'm glad the window looking out onto the street is gilded with the phrase "Always a Work in Progress.." (or words to this effect) since I have some suggestions/observations.  There are three areas to improve - Seating, Selection, and Atmosphere.  First, Seating - why am I sitting on a couch using a coffee table to eat?  I'm dropping nearly two bills on a meal for three people and I'm sitting on a couch using a coffee table?  Maybe if I was just there for a drink, it would be ok.  But not to actually eat a meal.  (I'm sorry about the queso which dripped on the floor. But again - it is tough to eat queso at a coffee table.)  Also, sitting by the huge glass window feels like being in a fish bowl.. People walking down the sidewalk can stop and watch you eat.  Actually, they DO stop and watch.  It happened at least twice while we were there.   It reminded me of an old "Twilight Zone" episode. In the episode, an astronaut crashes on Mars and ends up on display in a Martian zoo.  (After he crashes, the astronaut is scared at first, but the Martians are very kind to him and give him a house to stay in.  The Martians show the astronaut the house has all the conveniences and plenty of food.  When the Martians leave, the astronaut discovers the front door is locked and the window won't open.  Later, the astronaut wakes up to find the window open, with dozens of Martians staring inside the house.  The astronaut realizes he is actually the newest exhibit in a Martian zoo, not in a real house.)  There was a sign out front, "Earthling in his native habitat"  That's what this seating felt like.   Next, Selection - the beer selection is very slim.  The beer portion on the menu was (verbatim) as follows:     "Beers on Tap         Hazy IPA        Amber        Hefe        Lager  Ask your server for featured breweries..."  I asked the server about the vague beer list:  SERVER:  "And for you, sir?" ME:          "Yes, ma'am - Do y'all have Shiner?" SERVER:  "No, sir, we just have local beers." ME:          "Awesome.  What do you have from Barking Armadillo?"   SERVER:  "Nothing.  What kind of beer are you looking for?" ME:          "Something like a Shiner?" SERVER:   "We have Brooklyn Lager." ME:          "I'll just stick with water, ma'am..."  Brooklyn? Local? Similar to Shiner?  You say you have "local" beers but yet you have nothing from the local brewery just on the other side of I-35?  As far as Brooklyn - Every so often, I find a restaurant (usually around Dallas) which lists Shiner on the "Imported Beer" portion.  I guess geography - specifically Texas geography - is not their strong point.  TGR has the opposite perspective, since apparently Brooklyn is now local to Georgetown.  Finally - Atmosphere.  It is very loud.  It wants to be trendy.  I'm not sure how to fix that.   Maybe this is why I had to sit on a couch.

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: Love this place! It's got a speakeasy feel right off the square in Georgetown! They have exclusive membership options that provide you with a locker for your special stash, so you always have your favorite spirit on hand. I know this because my little bro is a member. He's got a cool locker with some great whiskey in there, and they have a great selection as well.   There is limited seating inside so all of the seating feels exclusive! It's also just a fantastic feel inside and out. The patio is big and adorable, complete with a picture wall the screams social media opp! If I lived in Georgetown, this is where I would hang out. I will definitely make it my spot when I make it over to Gtown!   All of the food we had was interesting and tasty! The pimento app was not your grandma's pimento. It was creamy and not abrasive at all. The Brussels sprouts were so good I could have eaten a couple helpings myself! The sauce is the same for the shrimp, so I was in sweet and spicy heaven! I want more right now just writing this review. The fam enjoyed the chorizo app.   I had moved on to the smoked old fashioned by then and was completely captivated! I added a video that you should check out or just go and order one. The smoke adds to the experience AND taste! Yum. They have a small, but very good, draft selection, creative cocktail menu, and the option to drink your own spirits if you're a member. I can't say enough that I love this place!  Hunter did an amazing job as our server. He was friendly, attentive, and showed his fantastic personality.

reviews.author: Ramimi T.
reviews.description: I went here for the first time last week. The host asked me if I had a reservation, I did not, but they were still able to quickly get me a table. The atmosphere is very elegant, yet chill. The low light in the building added to the overall relaxed vibe. I ordered from the morning menu; there weren't as much options as I would have liked for there to be, so I just settled for the Calamari and Waffle Fries. The food came out much faster than I expected, so I am not surprised that it was a little cold. The food was delicious though... especially the sauce that came with the Calamari! The Ranch was very good and paired well with the food! The sweet tea was average, yet still good. The price is a little much for the quality/amount of the food. I plan on going back in the evening and ordering off of the evening menu.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I was impressed with the entire evening. It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant where I loved everything I tried and had great service! It seemed like most people visiting sat out on the patio or at the bar. We were celebrating our anniversary so we made a reservation on a weeknight, but unless you want to secure a spot outside, I don't think you'd need one.   We ordered the glazed brussel sprouts app, the carne asada fries app, and the sea bass to split. Each dish was delicious for different reasons. The glaze on the brussels was addicting, the queso on the fries was delish, and the sea bass came out piping hot with a tasty chimichurri and sautéed vegetables. I would recommend every dish we tried, but my favorite was by far the brussels. We topped dinner off with the blonde brownie w/ ice cream - yyyuuummmm.   For cocktails: Our waiter suggested the Love is Blind with a spash of pineapple - tricky little drink. It tasted like candy but found out halfway in that there was definitely a good amount of liquor in it! The G'old fashioned was classic and strong.   Service was top notch. I wish I remembered his name, but he was super friendly and had great recommendations.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Only place in Georgetown that is a bit more like a lounge. Something different, more city like and either you'll love it or you'll wish it stays more country. Well I like it for it's modern atmosphere. We got drunken fried and all the cocktails seems good mixes just a bit more alcohol would be nice. One star knocked off because of that and the waitresses seems slightly uppity. No one extra welcoming and excited to converse with us aside from the smiling hostess.   Will still come back since I like the environment.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Very cool vibe and spot in the middle of downtown Georgetown! They have a great covered patio and the whole restaurant is very cute.   We got the following: -  Brussel sprouts - soo good, would get again! - shisito - pretty average tasting - pecan crusted chicken - very good  - steak frites - the steak was pretty bland for me but fries were delish  - my family loved the deviled eggs

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Date night for the wife and me. Stating off, the drinks were really good. Only downside was that we were looking forward to the cocktail flight but they don't allow on Saturday night (it's a major item on the menu - should be noted if it's only during the day).   For food, everything we had was really good. The Brussels sprouts and the fries (yes fries - you could actually taste the potato) were standouts. Lost of sauces to pair with things too. The only downer was the queso - good taste but the tostadas were a bit stale and the queso itself was a bit congealed by the time it reached the table.   Will be happy to come back - a great option for something a bit more upscale in Georgetown.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: Really cute little spot! Loved our drinks and the food was delicious as well. Hope to return soon!

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so impressed by The Golden Rule. From the decor to the atmosphere to the menu and creative bar offerings - this spot definitely takes it to the next level as far as dining in Georgetown goes. Everything on the appetizer menu was delicious - loved the deviled eggs and the steak against the grain. I really wish they offered the craft cocktail flight during dinner service as it looked really fun to try. I would absolutely recommend making a reservation to make sure you get a table. The only downside was the service could have been a little better. Several items that we ordered were forgotten and our waitress was not very friendly. However, overall I really enjoyed coming here and would love to come back to try brunch. Definitely a great option if you're looking to eat somewhere on the square.

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: I've been to The Golden Rule a couple of times and it is becoming one of my favorite Gtown spots for drinks and nosh. The drinks are largely bourbon based, which I love, but they have standard bar fare and beer as well.   The food is delicious and I think it's a testament to say that even the fried bologna sandwich is a winner!  The patio is lovely for this time of year and fairly generous in size. I really hope they can survive the upheaval of the dining industry during these crazy times.

reviews.author: Jacki B.
reviews.description: We came here because Monument cafe had a long wait. The menu seemed fine. The wait staff was super friendly and helpful. (Apparently COVID isn't here, no one wears masks!!)  We had the chorizo (not) hummus and the bluther. The hummus was good but the pita was fried and stale, pretty much inedible. The bluther should have been way  better but was premade, dry biscuits, mediocre chicken strips and water thin gravy. Cocktails were just ok. Cool place but sadly  the food is just not good.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like it. The vibe is good.  The hostess/waitress was nice, but the food: Waffle fries were old/not fresh.  Roast beef au jus was skimpy on meat and quality. Spouse compared it to Arby's.  Sausage burger was the only thing that was interesting. Although spouse didn't like it, I thought the flavors went well together.

reviews.author: Sky N.
reviews.description: My fiancé and I came here tonight for the first time and enjoyed our experience. Staff was good and we both got the chicken fried steak.  The fact that I was still thinking about it after I left proves to me that it was one of the best Chicken Fried Steaks I've ever had. We'll be back!

name: Hopdoddy Burger Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Sunday

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: We have loved coming to Hopdoddys for years.  Their burgers are the best. My  favorite is the Magic Shroom burger minus the tomatoes an lettuce.  The goat cheese makes it so creamy and the sharpness of it compliments well to the perfectly cooked burger patty.  The husband likes the Ahi Tuna burger. The ahi tuna is so fresh and all those ingredients meld together for a harmonious blend in your mouth.  Every one here is so nice and helpful and the place is always clean.  Good food, great staff keeps us coming back for more.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: Went here on Friday early evening and even though it was decently busy, there was no line. I didn't know how this place worked so I grabbed a table like normal but got kicked out by someone who was assigned that table lol now I know.   Got assigned another table and the service was fast and friendly. Got the bacon jam double and the big chuck with the bbq ranch fries. The fries were cold, unfortunately, but they were pretty decent so I assume it would have been good fresh. The burgers came out fresh though. Good taste without too much sodium. Even the sodas came out perfectly carbonated, not flat like at most restaurants.   I wouldn't call this place an infamous burger joint that I have to take my friends who visit, but I do appreciate the fresh, not overly salted burgers.

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: Don't know where our last review from here disappeared to but it's gone. So frustrating how that happens on Yelp because we distinctly remember leaving a review about how one of our burgers was insanely spicy. Anyway. We're not at this location very often since there's a HopDoddy by us in the Triangle, but we decided to pop in on Monday evening since it's close to our kid's daycare and on the way to our local library where we were getting her her first library card (awww, preK nerd alert!).  First of all, the guy taking our order was off--and it was a bit frustrating trying to review the items with him. We forget how the whole system works here sometimes--that you have to give them your table number in advance, which is just odd since you haven't sat yet.   Drinks came out quickly and the mega frozen margarita had a perfect consistency and a sweet amount of tequila. The Llano Poblano was solidly good, though a bit too overcooked for our taste, and we enjoyed the sweet potato fries. Our daughter got their kids hamburger option, which was a nice deal for the price. The sleeper surprise was the side car salad, which we added extra kale to. It was so good! We usually get the kale caesar, but will likely stick with this for next time. Strawberry shake was fine.  For some reason, this location felt a bit dumpy to us--maybe things aren't as brand spankin' new as they have been in past years. But we had a decent meal, and it wasn't *too* pricey for what you got, so we're rounding up to 4 stars from 3.5. It's crazy how HopDoddy has come to embody "old Austin" now given the proliferation of so many new, aggressively mediocre places. We'll be back at some point; hopefully *this* review will still be up by then...

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Love love love hoddoddys!   Their burgers are always juicy and flavorful. You have the option of regular buns, wheat buns or bun-less (they'll place the patty and toping in a salad bowl). Their sweet potato fries are probably my favorite sweet potato fries from anywhere.   Food is generally out pretty quick (I'd say within 15-20 minutes).   There isn't really a service to review since you order at the counter and someone brings your food out. If anything maybe they can have people checking in on tables?  They also have a full bar, so if you would like am adult beverage with your food you certainly can. I'd recommend their margarita. Or you can always get their milkshakes too!

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: A picnic table in the shade, a tuna burger and my pup... who could ask for more!  Well, yes, of course there's the margarita, truffle fries and the best service ever!  Miss Sophia was actually assisted with her therapy dog/ service dog training by the incredible staff here. Dogs are home here!  Love this gem!

reviews.author: Mara S.
reviews.description: They only reason they didn't get 5 stars is the issues that arise from their popularity. At times we have tried to get a delivery and can't because the restaurant is too busy and is not accepting new delivery order.  so now I try to remember to order by mid afternoon for a specific time 7pm or so. so far so good!!

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: Came on a Monday afternoon around 6pm and there was absolutely no line. By the time it hit 6:15, people kept flowing it! I heard hopdoddy was the best burger spot in Austin, so I had to try. Plus there was a special for $5 frozen margaritas.  Ahi Tuna Burger: Thick piece of tuna with beautiful flavor. the nori chips added a nice crunch to the mix and it was very filling.  El Bandito: I'm a mixed veggie, veggie patty type of girl and this burger was incredible. I loved the beans, corn, arugula and guacamole mix. The burger did fall apart very quickly, but still recommend this veggie option.  Hot Honey and Sage Sweet Potato Fries: A little bit on the salty end, but the hot honey with little pieces of sage was so delicious. Fries had a nice crisp to it and the portion size was decent.  Overall, hopdoddy had very quick service and good portion sizes. Will come back again!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: The chicken burger was not very good. It's basically 2 chicken strips stuffed between some buns. I didn't feel crazy about the truffle fries this time either.   The frozen strawberry lemonade was actually really strong! And delicious. But mostly strong hahah

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: Tried Hop Diddy for the second time. Decided to get the same order so that I could do an accurate review. I had the El Bandito Burger (made it vegan), Hot Honey and Sage fries and a Paloma cocktail.  Burger: Both times El Bandito Burger were very salty. My group's food was salty as well! So disappointing. The food was edible, but hours later and I still have the saltiness in my my mouth.  Fries: My Hot Honey and sage fries were delicious. It salty, the heat covered it.  Cocktail: Paloma was very good and the bartender (didn't get his name) was nice.  Customer Service: stop at the register for nice. This is definitely a restaurant where you get your food, sit down, and then you are forgot about. Both times a server did not come back to check on us + we had to find someone for a need. But they seems to be the concept so I get it. And when I did speak with staff they were friendly.   Overall....we like it but due to SALT are looking forward to trying the South Congress location.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Sadly, you're a restaurant chain in decline. We moved from Austin 4 years ago and were back in town for Xmas this year. Totally excited to go back to Hopdoddy and brought another Austin family with us for their 1st visit. Service was VERY slow as they had only 1 bartender on duty, and the poor guys was underwater all night, which slowed down ordering. When we finally got our $65 worth of burgers for four people, we simply wanted to have ketchup for the burger and fries. I went to the dispenser, pushed the handle, and because the dispenser was basically out of ketchup (who needs ketchup at a premium burger joint?) is shot ketchup all over me and my shirt. Frustrated, I sought help from an employee who left us standing there, with my expensive burger cooling and the ketchup drying on my shirt for over 5 minutes. I then went and asked for the manager. She was working in the kitchen and sternly told me she had no time for me, and I could return to the restaurant tomorrow to speak with the GM. Full stop, end of the conversation. No interest in me, my concerns, or my dining experience. Totally shocked and dismayed, we finished our meal and left. The family we introduced to Hopdoddy with us was equally appalled. We all vowed never to return and share this bad experience with everyone we could, including via social media. Whoever the female manager was at this location needs to be retrained. You literally get better service at any burger joint in Austin at 1/2 the cost. So sad.

reviews.author: Erasmo G.
reviews.description: Yes I know the one on Congress is probably the one considered the "cool" one. Hear me out tho same great food, fast service, very straight forward concept and NO wait time. Went after church with a few peeps great spot for anyone ages 7-31 . I heard about it through ordering lunch from work definitely coming back

reviews.author: Austin King Pi N.
reviews.description: I went in last week to get a burger.   First of all their burgers are normally great and I do not think they are over priced.  I got a regular burger and ordered it medium.  I made sure to tell them pink in the middle as they often serve it well done.   It came out and the bun was good, bacon was good, egg on top was perfect, but once again the patty was well done and dry.  Come on guys do it right!   I did not want to go back up to the counter and ask them to remake it.  Telling a cook they did it wrong is likely to get you a re made burger with a loogie on it.   Sorry but true.   I just wish after they brought it out that someone would have come by and asked how it was.  No one did.  They used to stop by and check on clients but no more I guess.    I'll be back and try again but please try to do it right next time.  Austin

reviews.author: Melanie R.
reviews.description: Pretty high-priced for their burgers. I honestly don't see anything special about them. They come off a bit dry and basic. Onions, lettuce and bread are fresh. Not a fan of the tomatoes. Beer is pretty implied so it's a good place to go and drink and eat dry burgers if you're a tourist. Otherwise, I'd pick another place. This was my third time being here in 5 years and the quality of food hasn't changed much. Pre-covid, the staff was pretty unattentive and I had called people over a couple of times. I would say they were more attentive this time than the last two but still kind of annoying to see a bunch of them in a corner when I've been ready to go.

reviews.author: H H.
reviews.description: Low quality and poor service. I tried it a couple of times but was not impressed by the food or the attitude of the servers.  Maybe another branch is doing a better job, but definitely this is not a place to go

reviews.author: James A.
reviews.description: I happened to be in the area and wanted to try a new restaurant so I hopped into Hopdoddy and ordered a burger and beer.  BOth items were tasty. I enjoyed the flavorful Llano Poblano and delicious Dogs Head beer.  Service was quick, friendly and professional.  Definitely a  keeper.

reviews.author: Chuck L.
reviews.description: Fun joint, great burger.  Due to COVID they have some odd things going on to ensure compliance with the rules, but they are making the best of this new world.  Burgers are good, beer is cold.

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Super tasty burgers and fries. Friendly, fast service. Food and ambiance is more upscale than your typical fast-casual restaurant, but has the convenience of ordering at the counter, seating yourself, and shamelessly loading up on as many condiments and house-made sauces as you like.   I got the Goodnight/Good Cause. It was cooked to perfection, medium and juicy. Their shoestring fries were a little overly crispy for my liking, but the hot honey and sage fries were a revelation. I'm a wimp with spice but I kept going back for more. Excited to try more of the menu.  P.S. am I the only one who has to stop myself from calling this place Hop Daddy?

reviews.author: Jack Bowower S.
reviews.description: Went to Hopdoddy for the first time in 6 months or so and noticing a pretty big decrease in quality.  The buns seems different, in a bad way.  They just seemed like much more poor quality brioche than they used to use.  Maybe it's just me...  The burger patty itself seemed smaller and just fell apart way too easily. It was a chore to eat.  What a shame. This was once one of my favorite places. For the price, it's not really worth it any more and there are far better options.

reviews.author: Jeff G.
reviews.description: This place is so overrated.  We have to keep it real.  They don't use quality meat in their burgers.  They are BLAND. Sure, they offer fancy toppings and I guess that can hide some cheap flavorless meat, so if that's you're thing. Go for it.  Much better burger options out there.  The burgers are really small. If you're going to over price your burgers the flavor should make up for the size and justify your prices. I am not sure what these people are thinking with this place.  I guess it's the fries that keep people coming back. I didn't have fries. The meat is supposed to be the litmus test. FAIL.  Chicken sandwich was a little better but not by much. The food is mediocre at best.   Sorry guys I wanted to be wrong about this place.  First visit and last visit.

reviews.author: Graziela J.
reviews.description: Hopdoddy never disappoints. The food is consistently good, and the service is always great.  We tried their delivery service for the first time recently and were very impressed with their delivery speed. In addition, the food arrived fresh and exactly as we ordered.

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: I cannot begin to tell you how amazing the staff is at this place. They truly take customer service to the next level! On Saturday night at around 8pm me, my boyfriend, and a close friend all decided to go to BJ's when the Cheesecake factory had over an hour and a half wait. We went in and were automatically blown away. We we greeted so pleasantly by the host who showed us to the cutest booth that was a semi circle which was perfect for our group, and we had the most lovely server. Her name was Tameika A, and she definitely deserves way more money than she's making, she was able to perfectly explain the menu and help us navigate when we couldn't decide on what to get.  We started our evening with Potato skins and Chips and Queso, which came out super quickly and tasted so fresh and like the kitchen staff poured their hearts into making it.  Once we started to order our entrées Miss Tameika again showed her knowledge of the menu and helped us by being able to go into detail with how the burgers were cooked, and how we could add/take off veggies as wanted. She truly took the cake in our eyes! Once our food was out she was prompt on ensuring we had any condiments or dipping sauces we needed, and keeping our glasses full. However my burger came out a little undercooked; but the manager and the server both apologized and offered to have the burger remade which I declined because I honestly filled up on chips and queso but I felt with 100% sincerity with them and he explained they did have new cooks in, but he ensured the behavior would be corrected. He gave our table a dessert and just went above and beyond with us. I cannot express how happy I was with everything they had to offer. We will definitely will be back for more dinner.  And to the manager and Miss Tameika Thank you so much for how kind you were, you definitely showed there are kind hearted people in this world

reviews.author: Tangela C.
reviews.description: This was my first time at this location. I didn't realize how expensive BJ's is. Customer service is good. It wasn't busy when I went on a Friday night. I was seated quickly and my server was nice and helpful. I ordered the ribs and chicken meal along with garlic knots bread. My meal came out fairly quickly. The ribs were tender and the chicken was well seasoned. I will return because I enjoyed my food!

reviews.author: Jarvis H.
reviews.description: The food is good and the atmosphere is nice. The waiters are all very helpful and patient! We had a party of 10 for a birthday and they took their time to make sure we are satisfied.

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: Wow... we just went there at 1pm on a Thursday. Their bar was halfway filled and there were two groups in the dinning. They said five minutes for them to clean a table. We waited 15 and left. They didn't check in or anything. And there were about 50 open tables.   The group of three behind us was given a 40 minute wait for seating... what in the world is going on with this establishment. Disappointing. Being under staff is one thing, being non attentive and rude is another.

reviews.author: Alfredo F.
reviews.description: We had a bad experience today. We seat down at a booth in the bar as usual since there were two open booths but we were walked out by an employee who I did not recognized. He was  stating it requires a reservation. We are regulars and we always tip well so we felt very offended and came to chillis were they made us feel welcome. We usually dont have a problem at bjs but this was not a good experience.

reviews.author: Lien N.
reviews.description: The service was excellent. We got seated right away and our waiter was very attentive! He got our drinks and food out fast on a Friday night. The ribeye was very juicy and tender, but the prime rib was too chewy and fatty. I highly recommend the couscous mac and cheese!

reviews.author: Cassie M.
reviews.description: All of our food was brought out at room temperature. The ingredients used were clearly not fresh. All of the veggies were past their prime. The drinks we ordered (mules) were terrible. We couldn't taste any ginger beer and we were given one wrong one. They were out of the majority of their appetizers. Lastly, it was freezing outside this day and also inside. Our poor child was shivering. We will not be returning.

reviews.author: General Z.
reviews.description: God seated down right instantly Chips and Guacamole are good sweet tea came out nice environments lovely lighting not too bright just right. Customer service is nice and good helpful

reviews.author: Jesse W.
reviews.description: The service here has gone way downhill lately. They constantly have a wait and yet there are only 5 or 6 tables seated in the entire place. What kind of policy is that? The servers can't possibly agree... More tables means more money, and they sure don't look busy.

reviews.author: Amber B.
reviews.description: Friendly staff on a busy night. Booked reservations through open table due to the fact that if they are at capacity the wait is usually long. Seated right away with paper menu for drinks and QR code for main menu. BJ's in general has changed some of the menu items after COVID (chicken chimichurri is no longer available, a go to) but still a lot to choose from. Pizookies is always a must get when dinning.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: You can never go wrong with a BJ's.  Stopped in here for a late lunch with some out of town guests.  We were looking for a cold beer and a good meal.  BJ's as always delivered on both.  Our waitress was very friendly and the restaurant was clean.  I had the chicken tacos, and they were very tasty.  Some of the other dishes at the table were parmesan encrusted chicken and broccoli and burgers.  The broccoli was super disappointing and had no flavor not even salt.  Overall it was  a good experience and a solid go to.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Okay so I came to this BJ's on the 29th of December after coming from the symphony with my little one and another party.   Act One: When we arrived, after being seated, we were greeted by our server. I ordered a glass of vino from the bar. When the vino arrived, it tasted like the glass that was poured was from a bottle that had already been corked and sitting out. While I understand that a restaurant is not a wine bar serving blends such as a 2007 Klein Constantia Vin de Constance, I do expect the mid-level glasses of Cabernet Sauvignon served to be palatable. Accordingly, I asked the wine be returned to the bartender as it tasted turned. When the waitress returned the glass to the bartender noting my comments about the glass coming from a bottle that seemed to have been opened/turned, he laughed as if I was being ridiculous.   Act Two:  Moving past this debacle, I ordered something else from the bar. My party and I also ordered nachos and mozzarella sticks.  The mozzarella sticks that were brought out to the table were COLD! The nachos were okay but clearly not traditional nachos, but that was not expected from this type of establishment.   The presentation of the check:  The turned wine was still on the check when it was presented to me. I asked that it be removed. When the waitress did come back with the revised check, it wasn't an itemized revision, thus I could not determine if the bill was indeed correct. I did not want to wait for the waitress to return again with an itemized bill as the rest of the visit here was less than stellar. Therefore, I paid the bill as it was and quickly left.

reviews.author: Yordan V.
reviews.description: I've been here before, after like the 3-4 visit I noticed the change in service. Came here with my wife to enjoy a nice meal. Sat there for 20+ minutes without anyone bothering to assist. Sadly you've lost a costumer.

reviews.author: Jerry B.
reviews.description: I placed an Online dinner order for 6 this evening from BJ's in Arbor Walk. I requested it to be delivered to my home and the delivery was done by Door Dash. Door Dash delivered the food 50 minutes after the delivery time BJ's texted me it would be delivered. The food showed up cold and I only live 5 minutes away!  I tried to call the Door Dash driver (Sorannys) twice after my food was 20 minutes late, but he wouldn't answer his phone. He did text me that he was waiting on the order (for 45 minutes?). When he finally showed up he wasn't wearing a mask and when I asked him why, he just laughed at me. I called BJ's and talked to the Online Orders Manager. I asked him if he could confirm they were running 45 minutes behind on their Online Orders. He told me they had been running 15-20 minutes behind, but not 45.  I then asked if he could tell me when the order was picked up by Door Dash and he said he could not find me in his computer, even when I offered to give him the Order Number. He told me if I wanted a refund, I needed to talk to Door Dash. When I went to Door Dash's website to call them, guess what? There is no way to contact them; no email, no phone number and no way to review their service. I have been a loyal BJ's customer for years, but after this experience I will be taking my business elsewhere, and avoiding any deliveries by Door Dash!

reviews.author: Craig C.
reviews.description: We went to lunch last week at BJs and it was great we arrived when it opened so plenty of seating. It was clean well lit and our servers were prompt friendly and helpful. We never had to ask for any. Two of us had the chicken lunch and it was great.  The perfect amount well seasoned and good presentation, I definitely recommend it.  The chicken was lemon thyme and it was wonderful I will get it again for sure. I know allot of people are apprehensive about going out to restaurants, support them even if you get it to go.

reviews.author: Salim P.
reviews.description: Our family in Austin for reason known to them like this restaurant. Huge location and plenty of seats and many screens with sports on the Saturday we went.   Out of the group of 10 of us 1 was vegans and 2 vegetarian. Decent Vegetarian choices but next to nothing vegan choice and the server also not confident out the vegetarian choices which are or can be made vegan.   Did get seated properly and food did arrive fairly soon. The service attentive. The food - the vegetarian pizza and baked Ziti pasta dish were good. The Peruvian Quinoa Bowl was classified as vegetarian but could not get a clear answer if it was vegan as all the questions we asked came as negative. So the menu is not perhaps classified correctly. Even the Guacamole and Chips were not classified as vegetarian!

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Disappointing service at this location. BJ's are a chain but are usually good at least the ones I've been to, but this one not so much. I walked-in and went to the bar area to sit myself. I sat at a table in the bar area and wasn't served. This guy working that area at completely ignored me and proceeded to serve everyone else who came in after me and sat themselves. I eventually had to get up and leave. I ended up at Yard House which had plenty of options and even a great steak. I was treated very well and promptly. I now know where to go and not go in my neighborhood in Austin. Again, who doesn't serve a customer?! I mean, I understand getting annoyed with your job but when you start denying service based on appearances maybe it's time to move on.   Maybe you'll have a better experience but be prepared to wait or even not be served.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I had been to a BJ's before in New York and found my experience here to be much more in line with a Cheesecake Factory type restaurant than before which was more like a sports bar. The menu here is long enough that you could stare at it for hours on end and not feel confident in your order. Most of the dishes have enormous portions, with one notable exceptions, and the desserts are over the top.   My group started with the honey sriracha Brussels sprouts and the nachos. Knowing a few pizookies were coming later, I passed on the nachos. The Brussels sprout were cooked to a nice consistency where there was slight crunch. The flavor was good, but it was much closer to buttery than honey sriracha.   For my entree I had the shrimp quinoa bowl, which was the only dish to come out where i wished the portion was a bit bigger. It ridiculously small, but it was smaller than you'd get at a fast casual bowl place for about 1.5x the price. Unfortunately it also paled in comparison to most fast casual bowl places in terms of flavor. Any bite I had that wasn't covered in the hot sauce I asked for on the side was a disappointment compared to the ones that were.   By far the best part of the meal were the pizookies. For those unfamiliar (including me before this meal) a pizookie is a warm cookie in a small deep dish pizza plate with a scoop or two of ice cream on top. It is as incredible as it sounds and they have upwards of 10 different kinds. If you're with a large group I recommend sharing a few and immediately slipping into a food coma.   Overall, nothing too special, but for 3$ pizookies on Tuesday you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: Brenda W.
reviews.description: Wow. So much for family friendly. We came in, took the hostess forever to ask us how many, since she had her back to the door... Told her we were 7. She went back and forth looking around. Finally came back and said she had no tables for 7 so we could wait 30 to 45 min for the nite servers to arrive.  WHAT?! NO offer to split the table, no offer to clean a table where 6 had just left. We said we'd have to go elsewhere and we were sorry, but they were losing 7 covers. Her response? YEAH, THAT'S FINE WITH ME, WHATEVER. Never looked up from her cell phone either. No wonder you need help. What you have there now doesn't qualify as help. Bad service, won't go back. Too many other places with decent front end staff that actually want the business.

reviews.author: Philip C.
reviews.description: So I am starting a whole new set of reviews based on TO GO services. This whole Covid19 thing has limited dining..but it should not limit quality.   I was grateful for BJs being open later than most other restaurants. However I was greatly disturbed by some of the I consistences. The most important problem I had was Frozen Chicken/super cold chicken. I ordered a chicken over rice pilaf dish, and the chicken was stone cold ( must have been ore frozen) after a long night I didn't feel like complaining since the other food was edible.  I specifically asked for no spicy items or spices on my sides , my veggies were laced with a spicy seasoning I can not identify.   The ribs were cooked well not great but he'll for this pandemic I'll take it.   I am giving this place a 3 (should be a two ) only because the person who helped me was so nice and accommodating, and everything was clean, and peaceful.   Support them but do complain if something is incorrect. I realized that as a supportive customer in a pandemic, the we shouldn't accept a lower quality of food.

name: Pluckers Wing Bar - Research
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great wing flavors. Service is a little slow but I'm just glad they are open.  I always get the maple chipotle and garlic parm wings with fries and I've never been disappointed

reviews.author: Tom M.
reviews.description: They ALWAYS forget the ranch on to-go orders. I mean ALWAYS. Even if you pay for an extra one or larger one. Doesn't matter if it's from a delivery service or if you pick it up yourself.   It's fucking hot wings - the ranch is important.   I know you're busy, but I'd rather you just refuse my order than leave out the ranch every time.

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: The wait  for the food was 30 minutes I thought I was in for a treat! Eeeeeextremely disappointing   Togo workers were super sweet , but the kitchen is in the back bull Corning around .   I'm going to call tomorrow because it's too late to call to try to get a refund but that's why I'm making this post because Im that disappointed

reviews.author: Johnathan E.
reviews.description: We waited for 20 minutes at a table and no one came to take our order, say hello, bring waters, or even check to see if we existed.   I love the Oak Hill location - the food is great and service fantastic but this location was a bad experience. I truly can't even rate the food or the service because we had none of the first and an absence of the second.   If you cannot handle the volume of customers from being short staffed I understand, but I do not understand operating at full capacity with half staff.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Waited on their app line for 2 hours... when we finally reached next in line we waited for another hour while we watched them seat walk-ins before us. There were empty tables sitting all over the restaurant most of this time.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: I love pluckers! I go there all the time, I really really really enjoy it and I love it too.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Service is REALLY SLOW and food has gone down at this location! Lincoln location is so much better...

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: I'm giving the second star just because the server was nice and the salad was decent. Other than that, not sure if I would recommend this place. We were quoted 30 min wait for a table. We waited over an hour and when we checked with the staff, a red haired hostess sarcastically offered us to remove us from the waitlist as the solution to our problem!!  The kid at the front door kept saying he didn't know which party was next on line. Very sad.
