I'm the mean time I witness how some staff members wear gloves but the majority didn't (including our server). The tables did get sanitized but not the chairs that everyone's has to touch to be able to sit ... the door handles were not wiped once in the hour, we were waiting outside for our table. Food was average. Came back to my hotel room sticking to grease, yikes.

reviews.author: Crystal L.
reviews.description: Got here at 6pm requested a table for a party of 11. We got the wait time of 90 minutes. We didn't get seated until 8 pm. It's now 9 pm and still no food. We spoke to management (Jerry) and all he could say was there's other parties that have waited just as long as you. Then once we were about to be seated we were told to hold our order in order to not crash the kitchen. We did our part and waited to order like they requested. We ended up leaving around 9:15 the food never came after they kept telling us it was plated and it would be 5 more minutes...5 more minutes. The service here has gone down hill. Highly recommend going to Lakeline or Rio grand location. I will say our server was very patient and organized he did what he could for us. Thank you Victor!!!

reviews.author: Ray M.
reviews.description: I was robbed. I paid $37.96  for 2 wing combos last night. I couldn't eat more than 2 of the 5 wings. There was almost NO flavor and they were dry and I didn't get the dry rub flavor. My son said the same thing about his wings and he got 2 sauces. Almost $40 for mediocre wings is UNACCEPTABLE. I am really upset and I do feel robbed. I want my money back. I realize that this place get busy, but that is no excuse for terrible food. Y'all should be ashamed.

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: Low-key atmosphere. Meaty wings with good sauce choices. I definitely recommend ordering "wet" for extra sauce. Oh! Fried pickles and/or mushroom too. Good for watching USA beat MEXICO at the Gold Cup and such.

reviews.author: Serena C.
reviews.description: I want to give zero stars but That's not an option.  I caught this on video of roaches crawling from my meal, I am so disgusted I have chills going throughout my body! When I spoke to Chelsea (manager) I assumed she would take the meals off because ROACHES.  No she told me she couldn't take anything off.  Well I didn't accept that, so I spoke with Matt and he was able to accommodate.  I don't think I ever want to come back, I think Chelsea was horrible and not trained correctly. I am so upset w the service we got.  I cannot believe this just happened.

reviews.author: Celeste R.
reviews.description: I've been coming here since 2015 with my husband so far there has been no disappointment with the food or customer service. We tried all of the other Pluckers in the area but this location has won by far. We now come every other weekend because Pluckers has become our favorite restaurant. We have the Pluckers membership and we love the perks it offers. This Pluckers location is now a special place for me and my husband some of our best memories together are from here.

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: We ordered dinner here online tonight. Holy mac, 10 pc wing plate and monster boneless basket thing. Pick up was kind of weird... boyfriend went in and was automatically told he had to go outside on a line (which is fine I know COVID has made some things different) but then the guy who told him he had to go on the line legit turned around grabbed his food and asked him to grab it from the same door a second later.  Highlight was this long hair that I found baked into the holy Mac ... halfway through eating it. Completely ruined my appetite and I had only had one wing. Sad cause I wish I could've enjoyed it all. Wonder how this could've gotten into the center of the stick when everyone has hairnets, gloves and hopefully masks on when preparing food.

reviews.author: Ian W.
reviews.description: Worst fucking restaurant I've ever been to! Almost all tables closed staff is rude while waiting sitting parties of 2 at tables for 6-8 people. Passed by multiple "online yelp reservations"

reviews.author: Amaris M.
reviews.description: Once again we received excellent service from Chase (get this guy a raise or promotion) !  It was little bit of a wait for our food but delicious as always. Thanks Chase for taking care of us while we were celebrating our son's 21st birthday.

reviews.author: Cecy P.
reviews.description: The worst place to eat very dirty and very unorganized had people waiting just to tell them they were closed. They do not have enough employees to attend tables and its super crowded.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: It's official... I'm no longer a Pluckers virgin! I had an awesome first experience with my waiter-- he was so gentle and nice, and very thoughtful! Customer Service A+! What I love and didn't know about Pluckers is you can actually get ANYTHING flavored with any of the Wing sauce flavors (like the fries)!!   I ordered the Spicy Lemon Pepper and the Spicy Garlic Parmesan Wings. I personally liked the Spicy Garlic Parmesan Wings better, solely because the Spicy Lemon Pepper is actually mixed with not only lemon pepper, but buffalo sauce as well, which just makes this flavor overwhelmingly salty.   I also ordered a side of the Tator Tots, which is an added bonus to the wings. Don't forget to order the Arnold Palmer!

reviews.author: Efrén H.
reviews.description: Service is always pretty quick for me. Food also feels like it tastes better than its Linc counterpart.

reviews.author: Valeria B.
reviews.description: Service is always 10/10 waiters are always nice and get the food out super quick, and there's never a line or long wait!

reviews.author: Lloyd J.
reviews.description: Total Wine and More has the best selection in the Austin area of every type of alcoholic beverage.   The liquor prices are better than those at other liquor stores/chain stores.  The beer selection is excellent.  The beer prices are competitive, and in most cases slightly lower than HEB and other grocery chains.  It is the best place for champagne, in both selection and price.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: The best place to get that special grown folks drink. The request of Hennessy VSOP came back with a successful win as we patiently waited to see if the kind staff had a bottle in stock!

reviews.author: Nicole F.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service during the COVID-19 pandemic!   I've never purchased alcohol here before, but we were running critically low on supplies during the stay-at-home orders. A friend told me they had curbside at Total Wine and More. I called to confirm there was the ability to have contactless curbside pick up and the person I spoke with was very nice on the phone (even though I assume they are getting an annoying amount of calls during this time).   Placing my order online was extremely easy. The UI was intuitive and was not confusing at all. There were a few points where they reminded you not to pick up your order until you received an email (or text if you opt in) to pick up your order. I appreciated the multiple points of clarity.   Both times we have ordered (once on a Saturday and once on a Thursday), our order was ready within the hour!  Pick up was easy. All you have to do is pull up to the marked, designated spots and send a text to the number on the sign. You have to provide your spot number and name. Once they come out, just hold your ID up to the window. Then they will place your order in your trunk. Easy peasy!   Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for contactless curbside!

reviews.author: Madison B.
reviews.description: They are always fully stocked! I got exactly what I needed and staff's friendly! Clean environment and good service.   Check out my OnlyFans  https://onlyfans.com/itsmattymay

reviews.author: J B.
reviews.description: The order was to come between 6pm and 7pm and there was a big storm. I called the driver and they said they would reattempt delivery because the storm had cleared. I called the store and they said they would reattempt delivery that night with another driver. At 8pm I called again to reconfirm so I didn't have to come in -- and again, I'd get it if they had to cancel, but I just needed heads up.  Minutes before closing, I got an automated email that said it was canceled and there was no call or additional note. I'm very disappointed. I know that they use a delivery service like Uber so it's not all within their control, but what poor customer service to not explain the situation, or to personalize the situation in any particular way beyond a click/cancel. It's wine, so it's not the end of the world, but next time I'll just pop into an H-E-B.

reviews.author: Marlon M.
reviews.description: Great savings on alcohol. Probably the best I've seen. The staff were friendly and assisted me in getting the Hennessy from the the locked glass case. They even provided tasteful suggestions that proved their knowledge of the selection in store. And when I couldn't find the 90 minute IPA I was buying for a friend, they were there to guide me to it.  The check out was painless also as the cashier Susanna was very personable and talked to my wife and I the whole time. She even made me toddler smile and feel a part of the conversation. Great people in this location. Will be back when I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Super store indeed !!! Wall to wall beer, wine, and spirits. Very friendly staff took me directly to the two areas I needed to visit to grab some of Mrs. Texas' favorites which will last her a year !!! It was funny as I was driving off, I told my son, I guess liquor stores are essential during this time of uncertainty.

reviews.author: Laurie P.
reviews.description: I was a huge Total Wine fan when I lived in NJ.  I drove an hour + to stock up.  When they opened the Austin store a day before my birthday I was thrilled.   Still the same HUGE selection.  Still Conte Priola Pinot Grigio.  Sadly no Kitchen Sink red blend, but HEB carries it here.  Still fun tastings on the weekends.    Annoying cashier girl who awkwardly scans bottles in my cart despite me wanting to put them on the checkout conveyor thingie.    Overall a 4-5 star experience every time.  But yesterday we had a 10 star experience.  OMGoodness, you just have to find Stephen in the wine area.  He'll ask a few questions and recommend wines based on your tastes.  You will love each of his suggestions.  You will love his stories.  This sparkling wine was named after the granddaughter of the vineyard owner....  yes please.    Best liquor store ever.

reviews.author: Monifa M.
reviews.description: I love Total Wine. When ever I go on a road trip, as was the case with this visit, I stop in and stock up! There was plenty of hand sanitizer available at the entrance. There was a tasting station near the entrance with a nice lady offering samples of Mezcal from behind a plexiglass. We were warmly greeted by every employee we passed and offered assistance. The employees are very knowledgeable about their wines, I just told them the taste I was looking for and they led me right over to the options that matched. There's also a large refrigerated beef room in the back. Checkout was a breeze and our associate was engaging and sweet.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: This store is always well stocked, clean and the staff is very helpful and courteous.  I was particularly impressed with the way they handled the  COVID mandates;  A sign was on the front door noting masks must be worn, ample hand sanitizers and wipes were readily at the entrance, and the carts are always clean.  From the very beginning of the pandemic, I was always comfortable shopping at Total Wine.  The store is arranged in such a way that although busy, there was plenty of room to social distance, including at check-out.

reviews.author: Rachelle M.
reviews.description: I went here with my brother for our birthday for the first time it's very overwhelming and awesome at the same time! We are not big drinkers but we wanted to celebrate our birthday drinking lol.We saw a $3300 bottle of cognac! The good stuff apparently!They have a huge selection of wines and also offers samples too! Plus they have snacks and cheeses and peanuts.We even bought shot glasses and a wine bottle opener! So far our favorite is the banana cream rum and limoncello! If you have t been here you gotta go! They have something for everyone.We found a California wine we really like from Napa also got a pineapple Rum from Barbados!The selection is unbelievable and I will be back!We didn't even make it to the beer section! They also sell glasses for wine and liquor!

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: My fiancé, along with our wedding planner, had a consultation yesterday with Tim for our wedding. It was phenomenal! Tim had several wines and spirits prepped for us to try. He gave us great info on every drink we tried and helped us build a menu that meets our needs, personality, and budget! Tim and Total Wine exceeded our expectations for sure.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: I love this place, the staff is knowledgeable and willing to help. They can be overly serious at times, not rude but not smiles or talkative. The samples are always plentiful and varied.  They have great deals and a huge wide varied selection as well as some high class expensive liquors for refined tastes. They also stock a ungodly amount of small sample, airplane sized bottles of liquor of famous and lesser known types.  They always have several check outside running and lots of neat extra items like gift sets, hangover cures, bottle openers, margarita machines and stuff to create your own bar.   For the holidays they have some unique items such as the moose cup from National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation.  Check it out. I promise you will find new and known drinks and much more besides.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: We just purchased a Keurig Drinkworks Machine.  You put a pod filled with mixer and alcohol and you can have mixed drinks anytime you want.  The problem is living in Texas you cannot buy the pods online from Keurig.  The only stores that carry them in Texas are Total Wine in Houston and Specs in Houston.  I called Specs and the person I talked to was friendly, she knew what I was talking about and said she would look into the distributor and how they could get them in Austin.  I called Total Wine and had to talk to 4 different people, none of whom seemed interested in doing what Specs offered to do.  We place monthly orders with Total Wine for wine and spend a significant amount of money.  Guess we will move our wine purchasing to Specs :(

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: Luv this store, (have shopped in this chain of stores in other states)Always friendly helpful staff - great selection of wines, spirits cigars and beers -party central, or if you are just looking for a nice bottle of wine for dinner or beer to watch sports with friends. A great concept everything under one roof

reviews.author: Scott M.
reviews.description: Saw them actively discriminating against one of society's most vulnerable groups today. Will not return.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: A shout-out to my friends for inviting me to this. I think they were trying to prove me wrong. Here's what I mean: I'm a wine drinker - a dry, red wine drinker. On occasion, I'll sip an appletini or two. During game night, we were talking about one of our favorite subjects, liquor, and I mentioned not liking cognac. Well, my girl, Nickie, told me I've got it wrong and not to knock it until I've tried it again at this event- hence an invitation to a Hennessy tasting event at Total Wine. Talk about a lovely time! They served food (thank goodness), Hennessy (oh, yeah!), and even gave us recipe cards to try at home - oh, and did I mention the stainless steel martini-shaker? I learned a lot about the origins of this drink and how it's made. It was quite interesting. Everyone was having a good time, and the samples were very yummy. Real yummy! I'm a convert and hate to admit it. I hope my friends don't read this review!

reviews.author: Tori R.
reviews.description: Awful place. Management is extremely rude and discriminatory. Won't get my business again.

reviews.author: John I.
reviews.description: Once again the staff drag a rating down. Is it so hard to be customer-oriented? Well, at this place it is. The employees act like they will run over you so you have to walk defensively. Seriously, it is like customers are invisible and they are running a warehouse because even when they cut you off, and they will, they don't say excuse me. If you are lucky enough to find what you are looking for you will get a great value but then you schlep to the checkout lane and that is hit or miss as well. Well, mostly miss in my experience. Good luck!

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: Great selection, nice sales associates thought the store... except for the cashiers and "managers".  Cashier refused to honor this coupon that was on a bottle. She then called over a manager (called her Julie, but her name tag said Megan).  The manager said we had to mail in the coupon and absolutely refused to help us any further.  She even pointed to the address on the coupon and walked off like we were illiterate.  But the coupon states it's for the retailer, not the consumer.  If your employees can't even be bothered to care, then I'd rather support a local shop, like Twin Liquors.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: I love Sunrise. It's a great source for any and all beverages. They have a great artisan soda selection, pretty much any ready-to-drink coffee you could want and some great snack options that are definitely a large step up from your typical convenience store.  But that's not really why you come here. Sunrise is THE neighborhood spot for craft beer. Walls of fridge cases full of beer on top of the tightly packed shelves displaying almost every beer you could want.They easily have one of the best selections of Jesterking in Austin (outside of the brewery). On top of that, Sam is the man! Become a regular and from time to time they'll hold something for you when it comes in (obviously within reason). It's nice to walk into a store and be instantly recognized. Not only that, if something just came in that fits the type of beer we are usually looking for, Sam remembers and lets us know.  LOVE this place.

reviews.author: Cassy R.
reviews.description: Friendly service and amazing wine selection. They even have some great chocolates. I even called in advance asking about a specific wine and they went and looked for me.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Amazing beer selection here. 2 walls of cold beers including singles and bombers. Friendly staff too. Once, the clerk swapped a newly released beer into my 6 pack so I could get a little sample. They carry standard corner store stuff too. Some of the snacks and ice cream are of the high end variety.

reviews.author: Marissa A.
reviews.description: I went out of my way to visit this store because I heard they have a pretty good wine selection, and I like supporting smaller businesses.   I was bummed to walk in and see neither man behind the counter wearing a mask.   If you don't respect your community and customers enough to simply wear a mask, I won't give you my money.

reviews.author: Wendy F.
reviews.description: They have a great selection of beer and wine including natural wines. The owner has included his own tasting notes as well. Awesome selection of artisan chocolates and confections as well as ice creams and non alcoholic drinks. This spot is a gem.

reviews.author: Meghan B.
reviews.description: Wow... what a great mini mart! If you need it, they got it. From organic fancy chocolate to a unique cooking ingredient and most importantly... BEER. I came here because of the raving reviews about their beer selection. I was visiting Texas and wanted to get some good beers to take home to Pittsburgh. I hit the jackpot with this place and scored some great finds. I also found some delicious local kombucha which I really enjoyed. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: I was up north the other night for New Year's Eve when my friend and I realized we were really going to need some essentials to get through the night.  She suggested that we go to Sunrise and I said ok, I know nothing about the northlands so lead me in that direction!   When we pulled up I was like ... ok this looks like your typical citgo gas station ... nothing special from the outside at all.  Then as I got closer to the door and could see a bit on the inside I quickly started realizing that I had pulled up to something pretty amazing.  The sun definitely had risen ... this was like the Live Oak of South Austin, but for the Austinites of the northlands.   Pretty much anything local you can get your hands on you can find in here, which makes it cool.  Craft beers out the wazoo, fancy special drinks of all kinds, specialty popcorn made in atx, lavender soap, or organic chocolate of all flavors for your liking.  This place was definitely a surprise to roll up on.    The other thing that I could tell makes this place so special was the staff.  My friend that took me here knew them by name and carried on a conversation with them about what they were doing for the holiday.  They also discussed the beer that he had recommended to her on her last visit.  I mean this was first class, friendly service.    When I am back in the northlands of Austin I will always remember this unassuming, hidden gem.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Clark Kent's disguise was a pair of nerdy glasses.  Sunrise bottle shop is disguised as a hole in the wall gas and service station. Yes, there is gas outside (at least I think the pumps work), but inside is everything BUT seven eleven goods.  That's how I have driven past this place a thousand times and never knew of it's existence until a Hopdoddy bartender recommended my husband stop here to get a hard to find beer.    You won't find the typical junk food or grease pit delights here.  Instead you will find organic, gluten free, all natural treats and snacks (from local Austin companies when possible).  Instead of Hershey Bars you will find boutique quality chocolate.   Most importantly you will find an amazing selection of beer, ciders, mead, and wine at decent prices.  Often you will find hard to find items here, that you can't find anywhere else.  Everywhere else had run out of Eastside Pineapple Cider, except for here. The owners are extremely knowledgeable and nice.  Sam is great.  They have such passion for their job and the store.  So excited that Sunrise is in my new hood.  This place is amazing!  They have an active twitter feed that keeps you posted on new items that come in and any tastings that they might be doing.  I don't often set up tweet notifications, but for this place I did!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: You would not know it from the outside, but this store has an OUTSTANDING, craft beer selection. Sam and his staff are very helpful.  There are a few other Sunrise markets in town, but none are anywhere close to this one.  If you are a craft beer lover, do yourself a favor, visit this place - if you are having trouble finding something new, ask - You will walk away with a something good to try -  An added bonus is that East Side pies is next door - great pizza by the slice.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Here you will find Beer-nirvana!  There are several refrigerated cases and two main aisles chock full of a variety of craft beer for sale, including some of the harder-to-find bombers and special releases.  What you won't find is the most competitive pricing, *if* you can find the same beer at Whole Foods, Central Market or Highland Market   Recent Pricing Comparisons (rounded up a penny): * Stone Xocoveza  6-pack: Sunrise - $17 / Central Market - $15 / Whole Foods - was on sale for $15, now $17 but with a case discount = $15.30 * Founders Backwards Bastard 6-Pack: Sunrise - $18 / Highland Market - $15.60 * Prairie Artisan Pirate Bomb 12 oz bottle: Sunrise - $13 / Whole Foods - $12 / Highland Market - $12 * Deschutes Dissident bomber: Sunrise - $18 / Whole Foods - $16 * Epic Double Barrel Big Bad Baptist bomber: Sunrise - $18 / Whole Foods - $16 (in the 'secret' section) / Highland Market - $17  Pro Tip: You should bring your own bag or cardboard carrier if you are planning to stock up.  Otherwise take your chances on the single ply plastic bag provided or hand carry your bottles out of the store.

reviews.author: Olivia Z.
reviews.description: Best selection of natural wines, craft beer and gourmet unique snacks. They've always got fun and new stuff to try!

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: If I could give these guys any additional stars, I totally would!   Called today while on my way to Austin, in search of a particularly high-demand beer. They didn't have it, but offered up the contact info for a competitor that did, noting that the other place had just posted on social media that they had the beer in stock.  Totally Miracle on 34th Street Beer Santa! THAT is service!  Thanks, Sunrise!!

reviews.author: Mary Ann K.
reviews.description: What a fantastic place! Such an extensive selection of wines, specifically natural wines. Lots of thoughtful and well written sticky note comments about many of the wines. Allow enough time here! Extremely helpful and informative staff, too! We'll be back.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: thrilled to have discovered this little gem via Bon Appétit/food and wine. The incredible beer selection aside.. wine in a city like atx should be more of a thing and this place is a brilliant start. You can get a crisp Portuguese white for under $10 or a beautiful $50++ biodynamic rosé from the south of France. All kinds of fantastic reds, too. How exciting to see the remnants of unpasteurised goodness at the bottom of a bottle when you pull it out. It's not just about drinking organically it's about knowing what you're drinking, where it's made, who's making it, how to enjoy it the way the maker would want you to, supporting these smaller family oriented, sustainable, traditional winemakers without all the aids/additives/headache inducing sulfites. These are actual living wines that the owner clearly has a mad passion for. Sam truly is the man, thank you sir and I'll be sending everyone I know to your shop

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: Insane natural wine variety. So exciting. I was truly floored and can't wait to spend all my money here. Also, Sam really is so lovely

reviews.author: Al Y.
reviews.description: Perhaps the most unique Artisan convenience store ever. They have a main root ginger beer and Mexican Cola fountain drink selection. Who does that?  Imagine a convenience store with chips and drinks and and beer and wine, but everything is unique different and definitely thought through. Stuff you could find at Whole foods.    Speaking with Sam the manager, he talks about passion versus business, and he makes a good point. Passion first, business will come  Why not create a convenience store like what they have built here, and also feature quality, unique Goods available with knowledgeable staff?  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Luci H.
reviews.description: Yes. This place is all the things.    There is so much packed in between the walls of Sunrise. Beer, wine, snacks - they've got it covered.   They even sell ice, but it's hard to find.

reviews.author: Jackie G.
reviews.description: Terrific experience. Great food and warm hospitality. A family atmosphere. Thank you!

reviews.author: Kyle M.
reviews.description: Simply put: this place is incredible. Funky, hard to find wines that will satisfy every type of wine drinker. Not to mention the incredible selection of beers. They have everything you need to make your night one that friends will remember

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: Sunrise remains a great place to find a huge selection of interesting craft and local beer. I am dropping a star from my previous review, because Sunrise is not a great place to find truly limited releases.  Those are held back and distributed to friends and insiders before normal customers have a chance. Other shops seem to be more transparent and fair about access to really sought-after beers. But, hey, if you are one of the guys that gets the hookup here, I'm sure life is good.  Sunrise probably deserves a better review, but I am disappointed in this business practice. I will probably be going elsewhere from now on.

name: Pluckers Wing Bar - Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Sunday

reviews.author: Dan K.
reviews.description: It's Pluckers y'all!  This might be my favorite location now because of the patio. (That includes pre-Covid too).  Get the Holy Mac and fried pickles. If you still have room get real food.  Everything on the menu is amazing and worth the calories you'll have to work off the next week.  Pro tip - if getting wings, get them with sauce on the side so they stay crispy.  At least that's what we do!

reviews.author: Voltaire L.
reviews.description: So I walk into the location and it's freezing as i am informing them they seem not to care at all. I am 281lbs and i had to walk out from the bar area because it was way to cold. I walk out shivering! Not one person or staff member cared. They just stated you can just get on a waiting list. Which i did! But where is the common sense l? Its 80 outside and it feels like 67 inside???   Why is this the culture?  Customer: it's freezing in here Lakeline Pluckers: Well do you want to wait for 45mins to an hour?  How is this your business motto? No, ok paying patron we can take your concern seriously and see what can be done. It was so cold the servers glass started to fog up!! What type of weather manipulation is this?   Imagine a cold beer  and its under 66 degrees!! Un comfortable!   I swear if I stayed in that section long enough it would have start snowing. They dont even have to put ice in the drinks for crying out loud.   I also informed staff to address the situation or i will write a review in regards. Just acknowledge its over kill! They literally ignored me! So Pluckers you have two issues at this location the temperature and the fact your staff provides customer service but no customer concerns is a oxy moronic!   They way they duck my concerns rebranding should change name to Duckers!!  Any way wear a sweater, jacket and or bear skin if you going to the bar for wings. If you have any concerns they will kill you with kindness and ignore you with repetition as if you didnt hear them and also voice a concern. Based on my bites rating (check other post)   They get *2 bites and nibble!  Food Beetle

reviews.author: Bobby G.
reviews.description: It's loud and messy (lots of kids) but a great selection of food. The waiter we had was really nice. The young woman greeting us was very welcoming.   Would be nice if they had a quieter area away from screaming kids, though.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Cool sports bar; it gets a little crowded but is part of the ambiance. Food is good, wings are depicted, and the beer is the best part, large size for the thirsty soul

reviews.author: Amy T.
reviews.description: We normally have great food when we come here. Last time I was here we had he blue cheese chicken cobb salad and it is always better here than at the RR location.  Drinks, well I am pregnant so no drinks here for the time being but last time we ordered a michelada she was very confused and was trying to give us the drink with the chicken wing on top. so we had to describe it to her and show her a pic from previous orders in the past and explain multiple time we just wanted the plain michelada no need for the frills - IMO i think it is just the area we were in.

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: Family has been coming to pluckers for a number of years now and we have never strayed from our order of spicy ranch wings- that's how much we love them. The spiciness of the wings vary a lot though, with sometimes being not spicy at all and others being a bit too spicy. But if you don't want to get too messy eating wings and want a good dry rub, then I highly recommend the spicy ranch. You can also never go wrong with their tater tots or Mac and cheese- tater tots are always fresh and crunchy and the Mac and cheese is nicely baked and cheesy.   Overall, service has always been pretty good and is a great place to come to if you're craving chicken wings and want to watch sports and drink at the same time!

reviews.author: Angel H.
reviews.description: I placed an online order for pickup and mistakenly inputted the wrong pickup time, scheduling it for 2 hours past when I wanted the order; when I called to fix issue, staff was not able to help me. They advised me to cancel the order and replace it on the app. Unfortunately, I did not place the order via an app, and do not have an account, so I was unable to access the order after it was placed. When I called back to let them know was unable to cancel the order on my end, staff were still unable to help me modify my pickup time and said that since the order had not yet been received by their restaurant, the only thing she could do was wait until it came in and cancel the order at that time. She ended the conversation with: you'll get a notification in a few days on your account... (did not listen to the fact that I did not have an account!). Lo and behold, order was never cancelled and I am being charged nearly $50 for an order I never received. Its inexcusable. Staff need better customer service training. I am filing a dispute with my credit card.

reviews.author: Josias C.
reviews.description: I enjoyed my experience. The wait was acceptable. The food well prepared and servers attentive. They came by often the see if I needed refills on drinks or chicken.  They also gave nice little kids package to keep my little one occupied. I could see any game comfortably.

reviews.author: Jay S.
reviews.description: Best service and best pluckers in the Austin area !!! Friendly service and awesome management

reviews.author: Mary A.
reviews.description: There's no doubt about it, Pluckers is my absolute favorite wing joint in the Austin area. Their wings are just the best and their different sauces always satisfy any craving I have - whether that be sweet, savory, spicy, or crying spicy (shout-out fire in the hole!) the wings are big and crunchy and they always have some good cold beer to pair them with! If you're a fan of Micheladas, you'll love them here too! Especially the pickled green beans they add!   Their rewards program is awesome if you're a frequent buyer. You pay $20 and earn 1 point per every $1 spent on food. Once you get to 100 points, you can redeem for $10 off your bill. They also have specials which you can get for free when buying two entrees so really, the membership pays for itself rather quickly!   There's room for improvement in the Service but other than that, I love some Pluckers!

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: Don't come here if you're LGBTQIA+. The hosts and servers will just make snide remarks, discriminate against you, gaslight you for even believing that you're being discriminated against, and will make you feel so uncomfortable. My girlfriend and I didn't even place an order at this Pluckers location after the servers and hosts threw slurs at us underneath their breath. We felt so unwelcome and embarrassed to even exist. If you're cishet, this is the establishment for you. All others outside the norm avoid this location, it'll spare you a traumatic experience. I'll include a picture of our waitlist notification, to prove that we were actually there that night and were in fact in the restaurant when all of this occurred.

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: Was sat at 4:35, ordered 2lbs of chicken thighs (and was charged for them) as did my fiance (again charged for 2lbs). We waited for an entire hour before telling the waitress we were going to just leave, and of course, the food arrives at that exact moment. Fine we'll eat, even left a good tip. We box our leftovers and come home to weigh the thighs (we track calories and macros). Each thigh was between 3.5 and 4oz each, and we each received 4 thighs. That means we got 1lb each when we were charged for 2 each. I never received a refill on drinks, and it was all around a bad experience. I never leave reviews  but this was horrible. They also mess up curbside orders every single time I've ordered here.

reviews.author: Alan R.
reviews.description: This Pluckers has horrible service.  Several months ago, just as COVID was starting to escalate, we sat in the bar area and I saw the waitress carry my glass by the top.  I complained.  Several times since, when we sat in the bar area the service was horrible. They took forever ttake and deliver our orders, messed up our orders etc...  We decided that the service in the bar area was so bad we didn't want to sit there again.   Tonight, I used the pluckers app to join the wait list. We waited for 10  or 12 minutes. Once we were there the text said we only had three minutes to checkin (way too short in my opinion).. You can wait longer than that in line.   When we got to the host stand they asked us if... we minded sitting in the bar!! ??  My wife, of course, said NO.   The hostess basically rolldd her eyes then told us that she could add us to the waitlist again... At the bottom! ... And it would be another 15 minutes!  We left.  We are now eating at Texas Roadhouse.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Good service, good wings, clean dining area, will come back again.  Only complaint is I checked in online but when we arrived they said I wasn't on the list, frustrating seeing other people get a table right away while our family sat outside waiting for 30mins.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: This place was really crowded on a Saturday. We had some time between basketball games and wanted to grab a bite to eat. I have not been to Pluckers in a while and I guess they have changed a few things.  We didnt have a lot if time so we sat outside, it was covered. They had the plastic rolled down and heaters going so it wasn't bad. We were seated close to a heater then they asked us to move because we were too close to an exit? We didn't understand. Either way we were moved away from the heater and closer to other patrons.   We ordered wings, both grilled and fried.  The dry rubs aren't as good to me so I had grilled wings with the buffalo hot sauce.  The staff was just fine, did a good job of refilling drinks, checking in with us, etc.   What they brought out were chicken strips, not wings. I was a little disappointed in this, they were tough and stringy as well. Maybe it is due to Covid, I dont know but I had prepared for wings. Along with these being chicken strips and not wings there was a substandard amount of buffalo sauce on my order.  Overall it was ok, edible and met a basic human need of food but I will wait awhile before going back and check if they have wings or strips before I order.

reviews.author: Clint R.
reviews.description: Total joke. Came in at 3 pm and the place was mostly empty. Get told it's a 30 minute wait for a party of 4. Go into the bar area and get told we can't sit and have a beer on the table tops because those go through the host stand. Can't sit at the bar because we have a kid. Ask the manager if we can just sit and get a beer that we order from the bar while we wait for a table inside and get told no. I have never seen a place that doesn't let people sit at an empty table to order a drink while they wait in a half empty restaurant. We left... I would avoid as the management is clueless and terrible.

reviews.author: Robby S.
reviews.description: Inconsistent at best is how I would describe this pluckers location.  Recent visit on 5/29 both adult "10 wing combos" came out with the wings over cooked   What this location consistently does is over fry the kids meal "chicken bites". They come out hard as a rock and you can't even cut them with a knife.   I really like pluckers but the lakeline location closest to my home has gotten to the point it's worth driving to another location or entirely different establishment.  On a trip to San Antonio recently, I stopped by the pluckers in selma the food was great and really highlighted how bad the lakeline location is in comparison. I guess they don't have to try anymore since there's typically a line out the door

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: It's great to be seated on the patio and no one come to check on you.   I should of looked at the reviews first.  Waited 15 minutes and no one came.  Horrible service.

reviews.author: Karen M.
reviews.description: We order from Plucker's Lakeline often.  Our last order on 11/28/21 was horrible.  The wings were not fresh and seemed like they were probably had been sitting there, sauce thrown on them and heated up.  For the price of $1.85/wing (before taxes) is highway robbery.  Even the fries were not fresh.  We WILL NOT EVER ORDER FROM YOU ALL AGAIN! Very over rated and over priced!!  I'd rather drive a little further and go to Wings N More!  Horrible horrible horrible!  And huge waste of money!!

reviews.author: Brent G.
reviews.description: Nothing changes. So slow and inefficient. Hour wait time only because they have slow workers. Meanwhile there are close to a dozen empty tables. They run around chaotically and can't handle anything. If you sit at the bar high top area you will wait 20+ minutes between food orders and drink refills. They do not bus the tables and bar top. It's a complete mess. Stuff stacks up. Why or how Plucker's corporate hasn't fixed this location yet is mind boggling.   Total incompetence. Food is cold. Food takes forever. Servers ring up extra charges. They forget drinks and napkins, they sneakily upcharge you for 2 wing dipping sauces when 1 is not enough for 10 wings.

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: Came to this little spot today hungry as hell.   MY GOD.  BREAKFAST BURRITOS. ONCE AGAIN, BREAKFAST BURRITOS.  As much as i love me a good breakfast taco, a breakfast burrito was a staple in San Francisco for me. These guys got it down. Same with there Carne Asada Burrito. My mouth was watering as I watched them make the delicious treat that I was about to consume. They are the gods among mexican food, the queen of sheeba, the conquestadors of cheese. I will be back, alot too.  Great spot to find today. BOOM.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: This is a nice grocery store right off Research. Carries mostly Mexican food items, but also a lot of things you would not expect in a store this size. Baked goods, produce, and assorted frozen items. The best part is that you don't have to pay extra for the convenience. Prices are the same that you would find at the bigger grocery stores.   The meat market here has almost everything you can get at Fiesta and at the same price as well.  I highly recccomend their carnitas and the green salsa you get with it. That was some of the freshest salsa I have had in Austin. If you're tired of the parking, long lines and the large crowds then come here.

reviews.author: Brandon L.
reviews.description: Good place. Definitely a must if you live in the area. Not something I would make a special trip across town bit it's fine. Usually good produce too. Avacados, lemons all that stuff.

reviews.author: Alicia J.
reviews.description: You'd never guess it from outside, but that was easily the cleanest gas station/market bathroom I've been in outside of a Bucees. (And I've seen more than my share of gas station bathrooms.)  Tacos smelled delicious but I walked in as they were shutting down. I'll be back on a lunch break soon.

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: That I've lived within walking distance of this place for 4 months and never set a foot inside is a great injustice.  What appears at first glance to be a medium-sized convenience store attached to a gas station is in fact a small grocery store, complete with produce, dairy, a meat market, basic staples and a decent beer selection. There's also an excellent and cheap short order taqueria within.  The offerings are overwhelmingly Mexican as the name implies (half of an aisle is dedicated to La Costeña products alone) but they have quite a bit beyond that too, just about anything you would need in a pinch in the way of canned vegetables.  Best of all, it's CHEAP. Grocery store prices rather than convenience store prices.

reviews.author: bob d.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a simple breakfast taco (as opposed the fancy stuff at taco deli), then you'd be hard pressed to beat la tierra linda. Basic, amazing, cooked to order, tacos. Burritos are also top notch. Don't forget to get some of the amazing salsa. That avocado fire stuff is awesome.

reviews.author: K M.
reviews.description: Cheap meat here! And it is not questionable. Some of the vegetables are so you should be careful sifting through them. They aren't always as fresh as one would hope. La Familia doesn't just have the typical gas station junk food (although they do have it). It's like a mini grocery store. They also have a taqueria inside - get tacos! Get migas! Don't forget to get an Alligator Ice on your way out. Man.... so sugary and delicious.   I would choose La Familia over any Walgreens just to pick up a few groceries because as the others mentioned - everything is reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Schylar D.
reviews.description: My favorite Taqueria  is located inside. Anytime you get pissed off and need good food for cheap, go here. Authentic Mexican food! Also their Gatorade selection is un matched. want soda? They've got everything glass and plastic. need to be beered? theyve got most of anything you'd want from a convenient store including local breweries.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: World market is an amazing magical store!!!!   All of their products are so creative and carefully curated! Very affordable unique beautiful products for your home and very unique gifts for anyone!  My husband also loves going to the store with me because everything is so unique unlike other stores. They have wine from all around the World and food items, their Christmas gift items are amazing. I can find some thing for everyone that I know in the store!

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: I came in for the first time to survey the place for a future purchase,and I was excited by what I saw! Great mix of knacks, decor, books, nonperishable foods, wines and furniture. The furniture was....not sure about the quality, so view and research before buying. The section that I loved the most was the kitchen wares. Wooo! I'm coming back for kitchen stuff for sure !

reviews.author: Quyen B.
reviews.description: This place is the death of my bank account! Love love love the selection here for everything home and wine.   I don't have any cabinet space left for plates and bowls but I can't help but pick up a few plates here and there when I go here. Ugh!! Why?  I have purchased very nice furniture amd beautiful bedding from here.   There are good deals on wine too!

reviews.author: Robin Q.
reviews.description: I've basically furnished my entire new apartment from this store...I love the style: unique, good quality, and fair price. Lots of discounts with a membership. The staff have been great and even let me return a pan that was ruined in the dishwasher.

reviews.author: Laura A.
reviews.description: I ordered a Super cool round bookshelf online Apr 22. Waited for weeks and have been charged for the piece of furniture. Today is May 14 and it still hasn't arrived. I have spoken with world market's customer service after spending over 2 hours on hold and filed two customer service tickets (never answered). They referred me to seko deliveries. I spoke to two different offices. The last person assured me that the bookshelf would be delivered this week and a delivery person would reach out to me to arrange a time. I haven't heard a word.  I will never buy furniture from a World market again.

reviews.author: Raquel H.
reviews.description: Great store !!!!!I didn't feel pressured to sign up for anything by the staff and everyone was willing to help out. Even walking out the door they asked me if I found everything ok and I told them since I'm not from the area that I really couldn't fit anything I wanted in my bag. They very friendly said thank you for coming and Hope next time I am in town I will visit. I felt it was very nice of them and didn't feel pressure to buy anything. Great selection, restrooms were very clean and overall the store is really nice. They have some really cute decor items but also some stuff for the kids. I will definitely try to find one closer to home so I can actually buy some of the stuff I liked.

reviews.author: Cris G.
reviews.description: Oh World Market.  Every time I walk in, I want something.  Fortunately I have the sense to give anything I'm interested in a thorough once over.  The furniture can either be fairly well made or rickety junk.  But burning $300 for something they have well made is a lot better than finding a similar piece elsewhere for $1000+. The food selection, while bizarre, has some interesting things you really can't find elsewhere.  We don't seem to buy wine there though.

reviews.author: Rob M.
reviews.description: There aren't too many places I can shop for this worldy type style. Great place to shop or even just get inspiration if you're naturally crafty, like me.

reviews.author: sionn a.
reviews.description: Service is getting worse if that's possible: Today 07/28/16 there was no person at the checkout. Had to ask someone to come over and serve. When the person comes over then more incompetence, was overcharged for one extra item. It was then corrected but still way too long.  -----    Wait line at the checkout is still too long.   -----   Still super slow at the checkouts, what's the excuse now Cost Plus ? It's holidays season and you don't have all the checkouts open ? I see lots of staff walking around the store. Very poor    Store and concept is fine, however there is always a serious management issue of the staff here.  Even when the store is quiet there is a wait line to pay for the goods.  They really need to improve in having staff at the cashiers.

reviews.author: Cathleen H.
reviews.description: I came to World Market for the first time today and I fell in love! They have all kinds of unique home decor items along with beautiful pieces of furniture. The back section has lots of different imported coffee, wine, and treats. The employees were very friendly from the moment I walked in the store. It's definitely not an inexpensive store but it is easy to tell that the items they sell are high quality. I can't wait to return to shop again!!

reviews.author: Kris K.
reviews.description: Came here a couple weeks back to find a new dinning room table, I saw one for $660 and I wasn't sure if I wanted to get it then as we are leaving I look online to if there was other option and see that is actually on sale for $249 so I call and inquire. The lady checks for me and says yes but we only have the floor model left and you can have it but we need to break it down. So we turn around go up there and we had some tools with us and the staff jumped into action and started to lay out cardboard and assisted my hubby in taking it apart. Then they scanned and saw that the match bench was on sale too and then tracked down another one for me in RR which was still in the box; SCORE! So I got a new dinning table and two matching benches at an amazing savings... BUT wait it gets better as I am checking out the associate asks me if I am an "Explorer Member" and asked if I would like to join and explains the amazing savings and perks. Needless to say I signed up right then and there AND I saved another 20% so I got all of that for $400 bucks.  Pros: great savings, AMAZING helpful staff, variety of products, quality of goods and they have a "member savings" program. Cons: Only issues I that when we went in there the table has the original pricing on there, had I not looked online I wouldn't have known to inquire... however this worked in my favor so I almost could count that as a pro lol

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: If CrateandBarrel and Trader Joe's had a baby, it would be World Market. Although it reminds me of those two stores, I believe that World Market offers their own unique products.  I was navigating the interwebs for the perfect relatively priced end table. Do you know how hard that is?! Yes I can get one from Amazon, but they look tacky. Yes I know Target sells some, but they look cheap. And no I'm not going to spend $300 at West Elm for one!   And then I found World Market. A good looking table...check! At a relatively fair price...check! After looking at their catalogue, it probably took me 3 minutes to make up my mind about buying one.   But before I went to the store to purchase the table, I made sure to sign up for their World Market Explorer program so I could get a 10% coupon. After printing out the coupon, I was out the door and on my way.  Although I only had one goal in mind, it's so easy to get distracted by all the modern furnitures and decorations in there. While I was waiting for an employee to get the table from the back, I unconsciously wandered over to the picnic bench area and before I knew it, it had been 5 minutes! Poor employee who was probably holding my table wondering where I had gone.   To anyone looking for interior decoration ideas, World Market is the place for you! I didn't browse their food and wine selections, but I bet they're just as interesting!

reviews.author: Mitch H.
reviews.description: We love World Market furniture, food and decor, but every department seems understaffed, the employees seem overworked, and the lines can get pretty long because of a lack of cashiers.  We purchased two of the Kendall chairs at World Market, and it took them 15 minutes to assist us, even after we told them we were about to spend $400 on furniture. We love the chairs, but didn't love the process at this location for making the purchase. We'll be back because it's the closest World Market, but there could be some improvement on the customer service front.

reviews.author: Kelly S.
reviews.description: I totally forgot about World Market. I've always gotten their emails but after I moved from the chain store wasteland of south Dallas, I never really thought to go here again until recently. I needed an umbrella for my patio STAT and it appeared WM was having a sale.   I had the best experience there. This girl who helped me out (beth??) was just amazing. Went to the back to look for the color I wanted, helped me figure out that one was cheaper than another and was basically my personal assistant through the whole process. She was fantastic.   I had to return one item (some umbrella lights) today and again, had a fantastic experience. I was *that* customer. You know the one. Didn't have a receipt, the original packaging or frankly any idea at all what the price was. In fact, I tried to return it with different packaging altogether from the set of lights I'd replaced it with. Yeah, real winner. Maxine got me all sorted with herculean patience and research on the interwebs. She went above and beyond to help me out.   Of course, there's a whole bunch of cool stuff, great jewelry, art, rugs, home stuff, wine, beer, snacks, toys but I was most impressed by how spot on the help was both times.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Crack. I come here thinking I need one thing and walk out with a basket full of decor/housewares/crazy foreign food/wine/rugs/etc.  I love World Market and avoid it because I know how hard it is to control myself with so many cute items that would be perfect in my house and YEAH! they're on sale!  Don't get me started on the European candy and cookies.   For me World Market's strong suit are the little things. The interesting items you set on a shelf or hang on the wall, hoping someone will ask "Where did you get that?" And you can ramble on about some amazing, life-changing trip to China/India/Africa where you saved the life of a small child and their family gave you this item as a token of thanks. Well, maybe not, but if you like these types of items, World Market has you covered. They also have cute curtains and glass ware.   Like I said, this place is crack. If you enter here, be prepared to leave with much more than you intended.

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Whenever I go in here, it becomes the Supermarket Sweep game show.  I throw everything I see into my cart.  World Market is a cash destroyer.  Let's sing along with The Kinks, shall we?  [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r9ObLGRq33o]  Saw a painting of violas and I took it back to my place. Feelin' guilty, feelin' scared,  For this desire, I am unprepared. Stop! Hold on. Stay in control.  Wine, I want you here with me, But I'm really not as rich as I'd like to be. But there's a red [wine], under my bed, And there's a little yellow pillow under my head, And there's a fon-due inside of me That keeps shoppin' me, touchin' ya, watchin' ya, lovin' ya.  Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer!  Well, I fell asleep, then I woke feelin' kinda queer. World Market looked at me and said, "Ooh you need my beer." She said, "Girl, there's really nothing wrong with you. One day your bank account will reconstruct. It's up, it's down, we can work it out. You got a good thing goin'; things you can't do without."  Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer!  Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer!  Silly girl, you got so much to buy for, So much to aim for, much to drive by for. You blowing it all at Consumer Spoiler. You're so insecure, you cash destroyer!  (And it goes like this, here it goes...) Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! (Here it goes again...) Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer!  Banker, Banker, help me please. I know you'll understand. There's an avid shopper inside of me, I'm a cash-destructin' woman. There's a red [wine] under my bed. And there's a little green pillow under my head. And you said, "You're not goin' crazy; you're just a bit poor. 'Cause there's a spender in ya, gnawin' ya, tearin' ya into two."  Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer!  Cash-destroyer, wreck your wealth, Destroy your funds, destroy yourself! The spending device of cash-destruction, Light the fuse and start deduction!  (Yea, it goes like this, here it goes...) Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! (Here's to Consumer Spoiler!) Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! (Hey hey, here it goes!) Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! (And it goes like this.)  Consumer Spoiler, cash destroyer! (And it goes like this.)  [Original song credit:  "Destroyer" by The Kinks]

reviews.author: Adam J.
reviews.description: First, there were no associates anywhere on the floor. There was no way to ask anyone for help with anything. Then as I was checking out with 7 bottles of wine, the mean cashier did not even care to get a wine box for it, then she told me she had no paper bags or cardboard bottle-holders even though I could CLEARLY see them both under the cash register. She was very rude from the start.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: New things I found at World Market:  A large red plastic Japanese umbrella for an outdoor table.  But it's PLASTIC. Beautiful handmade paper gift bags with ribbon handles. The textures and colors are dreamy.  I purchased several. Large assortment of greeting cards. Really, where I get my card fix for special occasions. A small glass front cooler at checkout filled with assorted cans and bottles of waters, juices, and colas.  Where's the beer and cans of wine? A more open space plan that seems to showcase their foods and kitchen wares better. Samples of their thin ginger cookies and Kettle potato chips. Bright summery pillows. Several styles of outdoor furniture. Battery operated strings of outdoor lights. I will probably go back for some of these. Nothing on sale in the beer and wine department.  Waiting for my next coupon and a sale in the B and W department.

reviews.author: Stephanie P.
reviews.description: WOW what amazing people! We came from a 3 day long trip from California and had a coupon that was about to expire, in the hastle of getting to our new hours, dropping off the Uhaul and unloading the car from the trailer, it was almost time for Cost Plus World Market to close! I called 15 minutes before they were going to close and begged them to let us buy a dining table that was on sale and use the coupon that was about to expire. Elisa answered the phone and was so kind! We came in 2 minutes before they were going to close, chose a table and some chairs. She was so helpful and cheerful! We know how crapy it is when you're about to close and people take their time shopping.... but I have never felt so comfortable! She reassured us that it was ok... they don't work on commission and she was still so kind! Definitely souther hospitality!  THANK YOU SO MUCH for your patience and knowledge on helping us get the best dining room table with a great discount!!!!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Wow I had a great experience here that you don't really get many other places. I was checking out a rug and Cathy was one of the most helpful people I've ever had at any store period. She even advocated for me all the way up to the register to make sure I was getting all the discounts that were applicable. Really was a pleasure. Thanks again Cathy!
